module Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.LoadBasedAutoScalingConfiguration

-- | Describes a layer's load-based auto scaling configuration.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newLoadBasedAutoScalingConfiguration</a> smart
--   constructor.
data LoadBasedAutoScalingConfiguration
LoadBasedAutoScalingConfiguration' :: Maybe AutoScalingThresholds -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe AutoScalingThresholds -> Maybe Text -> LoadBasedAutoScalingConfiguration

-- | An <tt>AutoScalingThresholds</tt> object that describes the upscaling
--   configuration, which defines how and when AWS OpsWorks Stacks
--   increases the number of instances.
[$sel:upScaling:LoadBasedAutoScalingConfiguration'] :: LoadBasedAutoScalingConfiguration -> Maybe AutoScalingThresholds

-- | Whether load-based auto scaling is enabled for the layer.
[$sel:enable:LoadBasedAutoScalingConfiguration'] :: LoadBasedAutoScalingConfiguration -> Maybe Bool

-- | An <tt>AutoScalingThresholds</tt> object that describes the
--   downscaling configuration, which defines how and when AWS OpsWorks
--   Stacks reduces the number of instances.
[$sel:downScaling:LoadBasedAutoScalingConfiguration'] :: LoadBasedAutoScalingConfiguration -> Maybe AutoScalingThresholds

-- | The layer ID.
[$sel:layerId:LoadBasedAutoScalingConfiguration'] :: LoadBasedAutoScalingConfiguration -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>LoadBasedAutoScalingConfiguration</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:upScaling:LoadBasedAutoScalingConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>loadBasedAutoScalingConfiguration_upScaling</a> - An
--   <tt>AutoScalingThresholds</tt> object that describes the upscaling
--   configuration, which defines how and when AWS OpsWorks Stacks
--   increases the number of instances.
--   
--   <a>$sel:enable:LoadBasedAutoScalingConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>loadBasedAutoScalingConfiguration_enable</a> - Whether load-based
--   auto scaling is enabled for the layer.
--   
--   <a>$sel:downScaling:LoadBasedAutoScalingConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>loadBasedAutoScalingConfiguration_downScaling</a> - An
--   <tt>AutoScalingThresholds</tt> object that describes the downscaling
--   configuration, which defines how and when AWS OpsWorks Stacks reduces
--   the number of instances.
--   
--   <a>$sel:layerId:LoadBasedAutoScalingConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>loadBasedAutoScalingConfiguration_layerId</a> - The layer ID.
newLoadBasedAutoScalingConfiguration :: LoadBasedAutoScalingConfiguration

-- | An <tt>AutoScalingThresholds</tt> object that describes the upscaling
--   configuration, which defines how and when AWS OpsWorks Stacks
--   increases the number of instances.
loadBasedAutoScalingConfiguration_upScaling :: Lens' LoadBasedAutoScalingConfiguration (Maybe AutoScalingThresholds)

-- | Whether load-based auto scaling is enabled for the layer.
loadBasedAutoScalingConfiguration_enable :: Lens' LoadBasedAutoScalingConfiguration (Maybe Bool)

-- | An <tt>AutoScalingThresholds</tt> object that describes the
--   downscaling configuration, which defines how and when AWS OpsWorks
--   Stacks reduces the number of instances.
loadBasedAutoScalingConfiguration_downScaling :: Lens' LoadBasedAutoScalingConfiguration (Maybe AutoScalingThresholds)

-- | The layer ID.
loadBasedAutoScalingConfiguration_layerId :: Lens' LoadBasedAutoScalingConfiguration (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.LoadBasedAutoScalingConfiguration.LoadBasedAutoScalingConfiguration
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.LoadBasedAutoScalingConfiguration.LoadBasedAutoScalingConfiguration
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.LoadBasedAutoScalingConfiguration.LoadBasedAutoScalingConfiguration
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.LoadBasedAutoScalingConfiguration.LoadBasedAutoScalingConfiguration
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.LoadBasedAutoScalingConfiguration.LoadBasedAutoScalingConfiguration
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.LoadBasedAutoScalingConfiguration.LoadBasedAutoScalingConfiguration
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.LoadBasedAutoScalingConfiguration.LoadBasedAutoScalingConfiguration


module Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.OperatingSystemConfigurationManager

-- | A block that contains information about the configuration manager
--   (Chef) and the versions of the configuration manager that are
--   supported for an operating system.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newOperatingSystemConfigurationManager</a> smart
--   constructor.
data OperatingSystemConfigurationManager
OperatingSystemConfigurationManager' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> OperatingSystemConfigurationManager

-- | The name of the configuration manager, which is Chef.
[$sel:name:OperatingSystemConfigurationManager'] :: OperatingSystemConfigurationManager -> Maybe Text

-- | The versions of the configuration manager that are supported by an
--   operating system.
[$sel:version:OperatingSystemConfigurationManager'] :: OperatingSystemConfigurationManager -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>OperatingSystemConfigurationManager</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:OperatingSystemConfigurationManager'</a>,
--   <a>operatingSystemConfigurationManager_name</a> - The name of the
--   configuration manager, which is Chef.
--   
--   <a>$sel:version:OperatingSystemConfigurationManager'</a>,
--   <a>operatingSystemConfigurationManager_version</a> - The versions of
--   the configuration manager that are supported by an operating system.
newOperatingSystemConfigurationManager :: OperatingSystemConfigurationManager

-- | The name of the configuration manager, which is Chef.
operatingSystemConfigurationManager_name :: Lens' OperatingSystemConfigurationManager (Maybe Text)

-- | The versions of the configuration manager that are supported by an
--   operating system.
operatingSystemConfigurationManager_version :: Lens' OperatingSystemConfigurationManager (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.OperatingSystemConfigurationManager.OperatingSystemConfigurationManager
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.OperatingSystemConfigurationManager.OperatingSystemConfigurationManager
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.OperatingSystemConfigurationManager.OperatingSystemConfigurationManager
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.OperatingSystemConfigurationManager.OperatingSystemConfigurationManager
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.OperatingSystemConfigurationManager.OperatingSystemConfigurationManager
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.OperatingSystemConfigurationManager.OperatingSystemConfigurationManager
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.OperatingSystemConfigurationManager.OperatingSystemConfigurationManager


module Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.OperatingSystem

-- | Describes supported operating systems in AWS OpsWorks Stacks.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newOperatingSystem</a> smart constructor.
data OperatingSystem
OperatingSystem' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [OperatingSystemConfigurationManager] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> OperatingSystem

-- | The version of the operating system, including the release and
--   edition, if applicable.
[$sel:reportedVersion:OperatingSystem'] :: OperatingSystem -> Maybe Text

-- | Indicates that an operating system is not supported for new instances.
[$sel:supported:OperatingSystem'] :: OperatingSystem -> Maybe Bool

-- | The name of the operating system, such as <tt>Amazon Linux
--   2018.03</tt>.
[$sel:name:OperatingSystem'] :: OperatingSystem -> Maybe Text

-- | The ID of a supported operating system, such as <tt>Amazon Linux
--   2018.03</tt>.
[$sel:id:OperatingSystem'] :: OperatingSystem -> Maybe Text

-- | Supported configuration manager name and versions for an AWS OpsWorks
--   Stacks operating system.
[$sel:configurationManagers:OperatingSystem'] :: OperatingSystem -> Maybe [OperatingSystemConfigurationManager]

-- | The type of a supported operating system, either <tt>Linux</tt> or
--   <tt>Windows</tt>.
[$sel:type':OperatingSystem'] :: OperatingSystem -> Maybe Text

-- | A short name for the operating system manufacturer.
[$sel:reportedName:OperatingSystem'] :: OperatingSystem -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>OperatingSystem</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:reportedVersion:OperatingSystem'</a>,
--   <a>operatingSystem_reportedVersion</a> - The version of the operating
--   system, including the release and edition, if applicable.
--   
--   <a>$sel:supported:OperatingSystem'</a>,
--   <a>operatingSystem_supported</a> - Indicates that an operating system
--   is not supported for new instances.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:OperatingSystem'</a>, <a>operatingSystem_name</a> - The
--   name of the operating system, such as <tt>Amazon Linux 2018.03</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:id:OperatingSystem'</a>, <a>operatingSystem_id</a> - The ID of
--   a supported operating system, such as <tt>Amazon Linux 2018.03</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:configurationManagers:OperatingSystem'</a>,
--   <a>operatingSystem_configurationManagers</a> - Supported configuration
--   manager name and versions for an AWS OpsWorks Stacks operating system.
--   
--   <a>$sel:type':OperatingSystem'</a>, <a>operatingSystem_type</a> - The
--   type of a supported operating system, either <tt>Linux</tt> or
--   <tt>Windows</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:reportedName:OperatingSystem'</a>,
--   <a>operatingSystem_reportedName</a> - A short name for the operating
--   system manufacturer.
newOperatingSystem :: OperatingSystem

-- | The version of the operating system, including the release and
--   edition, if applicable.
operatingSystem_reportedVersion :: Lens' OperatingSystem (Maybe Text)

-- | Indicates that an operating system is not supported for new instances.
operatingSystem_supported :: Lens' OperatingSystem (Maybe Bool)

-- | The name of the operating system, such as <tt>Amazon Linux
--   2018.03</tt>.
operatingSystem_name :: Lens' OperatingSystem (Maybe Text)

-- | The ID of a supported operating system, such as <tt>Amazon Linux
--   2018.03</tt>.
operatingSystem_id :: Lens' OperatingSystem (Maybe Text)

-- | Supported configuration manager name and versions for an AWS OpsWorks
--   Stacks operating system.
operatingSystem_configurationManagers :: Lens' OperatingSystem (Maybe [OperatingSystemConfigurationManager])

-- | The type of a supported operating system, either <tt>Linux</tt> or
--   <tt>Windows</tt>.
operatingSystem_type :: Lens' OperatingSystem (Maybe Text)

-- | A short name for the operating system manufacturer.
operatingSystem_reportedName :: Lens' OperatingSystem (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.OperatingSystem.OperatingSystem
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.OperatingSystem.OperatingSystem
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.OperatingSystem.OperatingSystem
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.OperatingSystem.OperatingSystem
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.OperatingSystem.OperatingSystem
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.OperatingSystem.OperatingSystem
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.OperatingSystem.OperatingSystem


module Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.Permission

-- | Describes stack or user permissions.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newPermission</a> smart constructor.
data Permission
Permission' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Permission

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for an AWS Identity and Access
--   Management (IAM) role. For more information about IAM ARNs, see
--   <a>Using Identifiers</a>.
[$sel:iamUserArn:Permission'] :: Permission -> Maybe Text

-- | Whether the user can use <b>sudo</b>.
[$sel:allowSudo:Permission'] :: Permission -> Maybe Bool

-- | A stack ID.
[$sel:stackId:Permission'] :: Permission -> Maybe Text

-- | The user's permission level, which must be the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><pre>deny</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>show</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>deploy</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>manage</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>iam_only</pre></li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   For more information on the permissions associated with these levels,
--   see <a>Managing User Permissions</a>
[$sel:level:Permission'] :: Permission -> Maybe Text

-- | Whether the user can use SSH.
[$sel:allowSsh:Permission'] :: Permission -> Maybe Bool

-- | Create a value of <a>Permission</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:iamUserArn:Permission'</a>, <a>permission_iamUserArn</a> - The
--   Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for an AWS Identity and Access Management
--   (IAM) role. For more information about IAM ARNs, see <a>Using
--   Identifiers</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:allowSudo:Permission'</a>, <a>permission_allowSudo</a> -
--   Whether the user can use <b>sudo</b>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:stackId:Permission'</a>, <a>permission_stackId</a> - A stack
--   ID.
--   
--   <a>$sel:level:Permission'</a>, <a>permission_level</a> - The user's
--   permission level, which must be the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><pre>deny</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>show</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>deploy</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>manage</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>iam_only</pre></li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   For more information on the permissions associated with these levels,
--   see <a>Managing User Permissions</a>
--   
--   <a>$sel:allowSsh:Permission'</a>, <a>permission_allowSsh</a> - Whether
--   the user can use SSH.
newPermission :: Permission

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for an AWS Identity and Access
--   Management (IAM) role. For more information about IAM ARNs, see
--   <a>Using Identifiers</a>.
permission_iamUserArn :: Lens' Permission (Maybe Text)

-- | Whether the user can use <b>sudo</b>.
permission_allowSudo :: Lens' Permission (Maybe Bool)

-- | A stack ID.
permission_stackId :: Lens' Permission (Maybe Text)

-- | The user's permission level, which must be the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><pre>deny</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>show</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>deploy</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>manage</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>iam_only</pre></li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   For more information on the permissions associated with these levels,
--   see <a>Managing User Permissions</a>
permission_level :: Lens' Permission (Maybe Text)

-- | Whether the user can use SSH.
permission_allowSsh :: Lens' Permission (Maybe Bool)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.Permission.Permission
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.Permission.Permission
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.Permission.Permission
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.Permission.Permission
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.Permission.Permission
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.Permission.Permission
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.Permission.Permission


module Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.RaidArray

-- | Describes an instance's RAID array.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newRaidArray</a> smart constructor.
data RaidArray
RaidArray' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> RaidArray

-- | The instance ID.
[$sel:instanceId:RaidArray'] :: RaidArray -> Maybe Text

-- | The array's size.
[$sel:size:RaidArray'] :: RaidArray -> Maybe Int

-- | For PIOPS volumes, the IOPS per disk.
[$sel:iops:RaidArray'] :: RaidArray -> Maybe Int

-- | When the RAID array was created.
[$sel:createdAt:RaidArray'] :: RaidArray -> Maybe Text

-- | The <a>RAID level</a>.
[$sel:raidLevel:RaidArray'] :: RaidArray -> Maybe Int

-- | The array's Linux device. For example /dev/mdadm0.
[$sel:device:RaidArray'] :: RaidArray -> Maybe Text

-- | The number of disks in the array.
[$sel:numberOfDisks:RaidArray'] :: RaidArray -> Maybe Int

-- | The array's Availability Zone. For more information, see <a>Regions
--   and Endpoints</a>.
[$sel:availabilityZone:RaidArray'] :: RaidArray -> Maybe Text

-- | The array name.
[$sel:name:RaidArray'] :: RaidArray -> Maybe Text

-- | The array ID.
[$sel:raidArrayId:RaidArray'] :: RaidArray -> Maybe Text

-- | The volume type, standard or PIOPS.
[$sel:volumeType:RaidArray'] :: RaidArray -> Maybe Text

-- | The stack ID.
[$sel:stackId:RaidArray'] :: RaidArray -> Maybe Text

-- | The array's mount point.
[$sel:mountPoint:RaidArray'] :: RaidArray -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>RaidArray</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:instanceId:RaidArray'</a>, <a>raidArray_instanceId</a> - The
--   instance ID.
--   
--   <a>$sel:size:RaidArray'</a>, <a>raidArray_size</a> - The array's size.
--   
--   <a>$sel:iops:RaidArray'</a>, <a>raidArray_iops</a> - For PIOPS
--   volumes, the IOPS per disk.
--   
--   <a>$sel:createdAt:RaidArray'</a>, <a>raidArray_createdAt</a> - When
--   the RAID array was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:raidLevel:RaidArray'</a>, <a>raidArray_raidLevel</a> - The
--   <a>RAID level</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:device:RaidArray'</a>, <a>raidArray_device</a> - The array's
--   Linux device. For example /dev/mdadm0.
--   
--   <a>$sel:numberOfDisks:RaidArray'</a>, <a>raidArray_numberOfDisks</a> -
--   The number of disks in the array.
--   
--   <a>$sel:availabilityZone:RaidArray'</a>,
--   <a>raidArray_availabilityZone</a> - The array's Availability Zone. For
--   more information, see <a>Regions and Endpoints</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:RaidArray'</a>, <a>raidArray_name</a> - The array name.
--   
--   <a>$sel:raidArrayId:RaidArray'</a>, <a>raidArray_raidArrayId</a> - The
--   array ID.
--   
--   <a>$sel:volumeType:RaidArray'</a>, <a>raidArray_volumeType</a> - The
--   volume type, standard or PIOPS.
--   
--   <a>$sel:stackId:RaidArray'</a>, <a>raidArray_stackId</a> - The stack
--   ID.
--   
--   <a>$sel:mountPoint:RaidArray'</a>, <a>raidArray_mountPoint</a> - The
--   array's mount point.
newRaidArray :: RaidArray

-- | The instance ID.
raidArray_instanceId :: Lens' RaidArray (Maybe Text)

-- | The array's size.
raidArray_size :: Lens' RaidArray (Maybe Int)

-- | For PIOPS volumes, the IOPS per disk.
raidArray_iops :: Lens' RaidArray (Maybe Int)

-- | When the RAID array was created.
raidArray_createdAt :: Lens' RaidArray (Maybe Text)

-- | The <a>RAID level</a>.
raidArray_raidLevel :: Lens' RaidArray (Maybe Int)

-- | The array's Linux device. For example /dev/mdadm0.
raidArray_device :: Lens' RaidArray (Maybe Text)

-- | The number of disks in the array.
raidArray_numberOfDisks :: Lens' RaidArray (Maybe Int)

-- | The array's Availability Zone. For more information, see <a>Regions
--   and Endpoints</a>.
raidArray_availabilityZone :: Lens' RaidArray (Maybe Text)

-- | The array name.
raidArray_name :: Lens' RaidArray (Maybe Text)

-- | The array ID.
raidArray_raidArrayId :: Lens' RaidArray (Maybe Text)

-- | The volume type, standard or PIOPS.
raidArray_volumeType :: Lens' RaidArray (Maybe Text)

-- | The stack ID.
raidArray_stackId :: Lens' RaidArray (Maybe Text)

-- | The array's mount point.
raidArray_mountPoint :: Lens' RaidArray (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.RaidArray.RaidArray
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.RaidArray.RaidArray
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.RaidArray.RaidArray
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.RaidArray.RaidArray
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.RaidArray.RaidArray
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.RaidArray.RaidArray
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.RaidArray.RaidArray


module Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.RdsDbInstance

-- | Describes an Amazon RDS instance.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newRdsDbInstance</a> smart constructor.
data RdsDbInstance
RdsDbInstance' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> RdsDbInstance

-- | The instance's ARN.
[$sel:rdsDbInstanceArn:RdsDbInstance'] :: RdsDbInstance -> Maybe Text

-- | The master user name.
[$sel:dbUser:RdsDbInstance'] :: RdsDbInstance -> Maybe Text

-- | Set to <tt>true</tt> if AWS OpsWorks Stacks is unable to discover the
--   Amazon RDS instance. AWS OpsWorks Stacks attempts to discover the
--   instance only once. If this value is set to <tt>true</tt>, you must
--   deregister the instance, and then register it again.
[$sel:missingOnRds:RdsDbInstance'] :: RdsDbInstance -> Maybe Bool

-- | The instance's database engine.
[$sel:engine:RdsDbInstance'] :: RdsDbInstance -> Maybe Text

-- | The instance's address.
[$sel:address:RdsDbInstance'] :: RdsDbInstance -> Maybe Text

-- | The DB instance identifier.
[$sel:dbInstanceIdentifier:RdsDbInstance'] :: RdsDbInstance -> Maybe Text

-- | The instance's AWS region.
[$sel:region:RdsDbInstance'] :: RdsDbInstance -> Maybe Text

-- | The ID of the stack with which the instance is registered.
[$sel:stackId:RdsDbInstance'] :: RdsDbInstance -> Maybe Text

-- | AWS OpsWorks Stacks returns <tt>*****FILTERED*****</tt> instead of the
--   actual value.
[$sel:dbPassword:RdsDbInstance'] :: RdsDbInstance -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>RdsDbInstance</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:rdsDbInstanceArn:RdsDbInstance'</a>,
--   <a>rdsDbInstance_rdsDbInstanceArn</a> - The instance's ARN.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dbUser:RdsDbInstance'</a>, <a>rdsDbInstance_dbUser</a> - The
--   master user name.
--   
--   <a>$sel:missingOnRds:RdsDbInstance'</a>,
--   <a>rdsDbInstance_missingOnRds</a> - Set to <tt>true</tt> if AWS
--   OpsWorks Stacks is unable to discover the Amazon RDS instance. AWS
--   OpsWorks Stacks attempts to discover the instance only once. If this
--   value is set to <tt>true</tt>, you must deregister the instance, and
--   then register it again.
--   
--   <a>$sel:engine:RdsDbInstance'</a>, <a>rdsDbInstance_engine</a> - The
--   instance's database engine.
--   
--   <a>$sel:address:RdsDbInstance'</a>, <a>rdsDbInstance_address</a> - The
--   instance's address.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dbInstanceIdentifier:RdsDbInstance'</a>,
--   <a>rdsDbInstance_dbInstanceIdentifier</a> - The DB instance
--   identifier.
--   
--   <a>$sel:region:RdsDbInstance'</a>, <a>rdsDbInstance_region</a> - The
--   instance's AWS region.
--   
--   <a>$sel:stackId:RdsDbInstance'</a>, <a>rdsDbInstance_stackId</a> - The
--   ID of the stack with which the instance is registered.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dbPassword:RdsDbInstance'</a>, <a>rdsDbInstance_dbPassword</a>
--   - AWS OpsWorks Stacks returns <tt>*****FILTERED*****</tt> instead of
--   the actual value.
newRdsDbInstance :: RdsDbInstance

-- | The instance's ARN.
rdsDbInstance_rdsDbInstanceArn :: Lens' RdsDbInstance (Maybe Text)

-- | The master user name.
rdsDbInstance_dbUser :: Lens' RdsDbInstance (Maybe Text)

-- | Set to <tt>true</tt> if AWS OpsWorks Stacks is unable to discover the
--   Amazon RDS instance. AWS OpsWorks Stacks attempts to discover the
--   instance only once. If this value is set to <tt>true</tt>, you must
--   deregister the instance, and then register it again.
rdsDbInstance_missingOnRds :: Lens' RdsDbInstance (Maybe Bool)

-- | The instance's database engine.
rdsDbInstance_engine :: Lens' RdsDbInstance (Maybe Text)

-- | The instance's address.
rdsDbInstance_address :: Lens' RdsDbInstance (Maybe Text)

-- | The DB instance identifier.
rdsDbInstance_dbInstanceIdentifier :: Lens' RdsDbInstance (Maybe Text)

-- | The instance's AWS region.
rdsDbInstance_region :: Lens' RdsDbInstance (Maybe Text)

-- | The ID of the stack with which the instance is registered.
rdsDbInstance_stackId :: Lens' RdsDbInstance (Maybe Text)

-- | AWS OpsWorks Stacks returns <tt>*****FILTERED*****</tt> instead of the
--   actual value.
rdsDbInstance_dbPassword :: Lens' RdsDbInstance (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.RdsDbInstance.RdsDbInstance
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.RdsDbInstance.RdsDbInstance
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.RdsDbInstance.RdsDbInstance
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.RdsDbInstance.RdsDbInstance

instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.RdsDbInstance.RdsDbInstance


module Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.Recipes

-- | AWS OpsWorks Stacks supports five lifecycle events: <b>setup</b>,
--   <b>configuration</b>, <b>deploy</b>, <b>undeploy</b>, and
--   <b>shutdown</b>. For each layer, AWS OpsWorks Stacks runs a set of
--   standard recipes for each event. In addition, you can provide custom
--   recipes for any or all layers and events. AWS OpsWorks Stacks runs
--   custom event recipes after the standard recipes.
--   <tt>LayerCustomRecipes</tt> specifies the custom recipes for a
--   particular layer to be run in response to each of the five events.
--   
--   To specify a recipe, use the cookbook's directory name in the
--   repository followed by two colons and the recipe name, which is the
--   recipe's file name without the .rb extension. For example:
--   phpapp2::dbsetup specifies the dbsetup.rb recipe in the repository's
--   phpapp2 folder.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newRecipes</a> smart constructor.
data Recipes
Recipes' :: Maybe [Text] -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe [Text] -> Recipes

-- | An array of custom recipe names to be run following a <tt>setup</tt>
--   event.
[$sel:setup:Recipes'] :: Recipes -> Maybe [Text]

-- | An array of custom recipe names to be run following a
--   <tt>shutdown</tt> event.
[$sel:shutdown:Recipes'] :: Recipes -> Maybe [Text]

-- | An array of custom recipe names to be run following a
--   <tt>undeploy</tt> event.
[$sel:undeploy:Recipes'] :: Recipes -> Maybe [Text]

-- | An array of custom recipe names to be run following a
--   <tt>configure</tt> event.
[$sel:configure:Recipes'] :: Recipes -> Maybe [Text]

-- | An array of custom recipe names to be run following a <tt>deploy</tt>
--   event.
[$sel:deploy:Recipes'] :: Recipes -> Maybe [Text]

-- | Create a value of <a>Recipes</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:setup:Recipes'</a>, <a>recipes_setup</a> - An array of custom
--   recipe names to be run following a <tt>setup</tt> event.
--   
--   <a>$sel:shutdown:Recipes'</a>, <a>recipes_shutdown</a> - An array of
--   custom recipe names to be run following a <tt>shutdown</tt> event.
--   
--   <a>$sel:undeploy:Recipes'</a>, <a>recipes_undeploy</a> - An array of
--   custom recipe names to be run following a <tt>undeploy</tt> event.
--   
--   <a>$sel:configure:Recipes'</a>, <a>recipes_configure</a> - An array of
--   custom recipe names to be run following a <tt>configure</tt> event.
--   
--   <a>$sel:deploy:Recipes'</a>, <a>recipes_deploy</a> - An array of
--   custom recipe names to be run following a <tt>deploy</tt> event.
newRecipes :: Recipes

-- | An array of custom recipe names to be run following a <tt>setup</tt>
--   event.
recipes_setup :: Lens' Recipes (Maybe [Text])

-- | An array of custom recipe names to be run following a
--   <tt>shutdown</tt> event.
recipes_shutdown :: Lens' Recipes (Maybe [Text])

-- | An array of custom recipe names to be run following a
--   <tt>undeploy</tt> event.
recipes_undeploy :: Lens' Recipes (Maybe [Text])

-- | An array of custom recipe names to be run following a
--   <tt>configure</tt> event.
recipes_configure :: Lens' Recipes (Maybe [Text])

-- | An array of custom recipe names to be run following a <tt>deploy</tt>
--   event.
recipes_deploy :: Lens' Recipes (Maybe [Text])
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.Recipes.Recipes
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.Recipes.Recipes
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.Recipes.Recipes
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.Recipes.Recipes
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.Recipes.Recipes
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.Recipes.Recipes
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.Recipes.Recipes
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.Recipes.Recipes

--

--   type.

--   stack ID.

module Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.ShutdownEventConfiguration

-- | The Shutdown event configuration.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newShutdownEventConfiguration</a> smart constructor.
data ShutdownEventConfiguration
ShutdownEventConfiguration' :: Maybe Int -> Maybe Bool -> ShutdownEventConfiguration

-- | The time, in seconds, that AWS OpsWorks Stacks will wait after
--   triggering a Shutdown event before shutting down an instance.
[$sel:executionTimeout:ShutdownEventConfiguration'] :: ShutdownEventConfiguration -> Maybe Int

-- | Whether to enable Elastic Load Balancing connection draining. For more
--   information, see <a>Connection Draining</a>
[$sel:delayUntilElbConnectionsDrained:ShutdownEventConfiguration'] :: ShutdownEventConfiguration -> Maybe Bool

-- | Create a value of <a>ShutdownEventConfiguration</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:executionTimeout:ShutdownEventConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>shutdownEventConfiguration_executionTimeout</a> - The time, in
--   seconds, that AWS OpsWorks Stacks will wait after triggering a
--   Shutdown event before shutting down an instance.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:delayUntilElbConnectionsDrained:ShutdownEventConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>shutdownEventConfiguration_delayUntilElbConnectionsDrained</a> -
--   Whether to enable Elastic Load Balancing connection draining. For more
--   information, see <a>Connection Draining</a>
newShutdownEventConfiguration :: ShutdownEventConfiguration

-- | The time, in seconds, that AWS OpsWorks Stacks will wait after
--   triggering a Shutdown event before shutting down an instance.
shutdownEventConfiguration_executionTimeout :: Lens' ShutdownEventConfiguration (Maybe Int)

-- | Whether to enable Elastic Load Balancing connection draining. For more
--   information, see <a>Connection Draining</a>
shutdownEventConfiguration_delayUntilElbConnectionsDrained :: Lens' ShutdownEventConfiguration (Maybe Bool)

instance Network.AWS.Data.Text.FromText Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.SourceType.SourceType
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.SourceType.SourceType
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.SourceType.SourceType
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.SourceType.SourceType
instance GHC.Classes.Ord Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.SourceType.SourceType
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.SourceType.SourceType
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.SourceType.SourceType
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.SourceType.SourceType


module Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.Source

-- | Contains the information required to retrieve an app or cookbook from
--   a repository. For more information, see <a>Creating Apps</a> or
--   <a>Custom Recipes and Cookbooks</a>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSource</a> smart constructor.
data Source
Source' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe SourceType -> Maybe Text -> Source

-- | The source URL. The following is an example of an Amazon S3 source
--   URL:
--   <tt>https://s3.amazonaws.com/opsworks-demo-bucket/opsworks_cookbook_demo.tar.gz</tt>.
[$sel:url:Source'] :: Source -> Maybe Text

-- | This parameter depends on the repository type.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>For Amazon S3 bundles, set <tt>Username</tt> to the appropriate
--   IAM access key ID.</li>
--   <li>For HTTP bundles, Git repositories, and Subversion repositories,
--   set <tt>Username</tt> to the user name.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:username:Source'] :: Source -> Maybe Text

-- | In requests, the repository's SSH key.
--   
--   In responses, AWS OpsWorks Stacks returns <tt>*****FILTERED*****</tt>
--   instead of the actual value.
[$sel:sshKey:Source'] :: Source -> Maybe Text

-- | When included in a request, the parameter depends on the repository
--   type.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>For Amazon S3 bundles, set <tt>Password</tt> to the appropriate
--   IAM secret access key.</li>
--   <li>For HTTP bundles and Subversion repositories, set
--   <tt>Password</tt> to the password.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   For more information on how to safely handle IAM credentials, see
--   <a>https://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/aws-access-keys-best-practices.html</a>.
--   
--   In responses, AWS OpsWorks Stacks returns <tt>*****FILTERED*****</tt>
--   instead of the actual value.
[$sel:password:Source'] :: Source -> Maybe Text

-- | The repository type.
[$sel:type':Source'] :: Source -> Maybe SourceType

-- | The application's version. AWS OpsWorks Stacks enables you to easily
--   deploy new versions of an application. One of the simplest approaches
--   is to have branches or revisions in your repository that represent
--   different versions that can potentially be deployed.
[$sel:revision:Source'] :: Source -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>Source</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:url:Source'</a>, <a>source_url</a> - The source URL. The
--   following is an example of an Amazon S3 source URL:
--   <tt>https://s3.amazonaws.com/opsworks-demo-bucket/opsworks_cookbook_demo.tar.gz</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:username:Source'</a>, <a>source_username</a> - This parameter
--   depends on the repository type.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>For Amazon S3 bundles, set <tt>Username</tt> to the appropriate
--   IAM access key ID.</li>
--   <li>For HTTP bundles, Git repositories, and Subversion repositories,
--   set <tt>Username</tt> to the user name.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:sshKey:Source'</a>, <a>source_sshKey</a> - In requests, the
--   repository's SSH key.
--   
--   In responses, AWS OpsWorks Stacks returns <tt>*****FILTERED*****</tt>
--   instead of the actual value.
--   
--   <a>$sel:password:Source'</a>, <a>source_password</a> - When included
--   in a request, the parameter depends on the repository type.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>For Amazon S3 bundles, set <tt>Password</tt> to the appropriate
--   IAM secret access key.</li>
--   <li>For HTTP bundles and Subversion repositories, set
--   <tt>Password</tt> to the password.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   For more information on how to safely handle IAM credentials, see
--   <a>https://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/aws-access-keys-best-practices.html</a>.
--   
--   In responses, AWS OpsWorks Stacks returns <tt>*****FILTERED*****</tt>
--   instead of the actual value.
--   
--   <a>$sel:type':Source'</a>, <a>source_type</a> - The repository type.
--   
--   <a>$sel:revision:Source'</a>, <a>source_revision</a> - The
--   application's version. AWS OpsWorks Stacks enables you to easily
--   deploy new versions of an application. One of the simplest approaches
--   is to have branches or revisions in your repository that represent
--   different versions that can potentially be deployed.
newSource :: Source

-- | The source URL. The following is an example of an Amazon S3 source
--   URL:
--   <tt>https://s3.amazonaws.com/opsworks-demo-bucket/opsworks_cookbook_demo.tar.gz</tt>.
source_url :: Lens' Source (Maybe Text)

-- | This parameter depends on the repository type.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>For Amazon S3 bundles, set <tt>Username</tt> to the appropriate
--   IAM access key ID.</li>
--   <li>For HTTP bundles, Git repositories, and Subversion repositories,
--   set <tt>Username</tt> to the user name.</li>
--   </ul>
source_username :: Lens' Source (Maybe Text)

-- | In requests, the repository's SSH key.
--   
--   In responses, AWS OpsWorks Stacks returns <tt>*****FILTERED*****</tt>
--   instead of the actual value.
source_sshKey :: Lens' Source (Maybe Text)

-- | When included in a request, the parameter depends on the repository
--   type.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>For Amazon S3 bundles, set <tt>Password</tt> to the appropriate
--   IAM secret access key.</li>
--   <li>For HTTP bundles and Subversion repositories, set
--   <tt>Password</tt> to the password.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   For more information on how to safely handle IAM credentials, see
--   <a>https://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/aws-access-keys-best-practices.html</a>.
--   
--   In responses, AWS OpsWorks Stacks returns <tt>*****FILTERED*****</tt>
--   instead of the actual value.
source_password :: Lens' Source (Maybe Text)

-- | The repository type.
source_type :: Lens' Source (Maybe SourceType)

-- | The application's version. AWS OpsWorks Stacks enables you to easily
--   deploy new versions of an application. One of the simplest approaches
--   is to have branches or revisions in your repository that represent
--   different versions that can potentially be deployed.
source_revision :: Lens' Source (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.Source.Source
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.Source.Source
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.Source.Source
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.Source.Source
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.Source.Source
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.Source.Source
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.Source.Source
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.Source.Source


module Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.SslConfiguration

-- | Describes an app's SSL configuration.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSslConfiguration</a> smart constructor.
data SslConfiguration
SslConfiguration' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> SslConfiguration

-- | The private key; the contents of the certificate's domain.kex file.
[$sel:privateKey:SslConfiguration'] :: SslConfiguration -> Maybe Text

-- | The contents of the certificate's domain.crt file.
[$sel:certificate:SslConfiguration'] :: SslConfiguration -> Maybe Text

-- | Optional. Can be used to specify an intermediate certificate authority
--   key or client authentication.
[$sel:chain:SslConfiguration'] :: SslConfiguration -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>SslConfiguration</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:privateKey:SslConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>sslConfiguration_privateKey</a> - The private key; the contents of
--   the certificate's domain.kex file.
--   
--   <a>$sel:certificate:SslConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>sslConfiguration_certificate</a> - The contents of the
--   certificate's domain.crt file.
--   
--   <a>$sel:chain:SslConfiguration'</a>, <a>sslConfiguration_chain</a> -
--   Optional. Can be used to specify an intermediate certificate authority
--   key or client authentication.
newSslConfiguration :: SslConfiguration

-- | The private key; the contents of the certificate's domain.kex file.
sslConfiguration_privateKey :: Lens' SslConfiguration (Maybe Text)

-- | The contents of the certificate's domain.crt file.
sslConfiguration_certificate :: Lens' SslConfiguration (Maybe Text)

-- | Optional. Can be used to specify an intermediate certificate authority
--   key or client authentication.
sslConfiguration_chain :: Lens' SslConfiguration (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.SslConfiguration.SslConfiguration
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.SslConfiguration.SslConfiguration
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.SslConfiguration.SslConfiguration
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.SslConfiguration.SslConfiguration
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.SslConfiguration.SslConfiguration
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.SslConfiguration.SslConfiguration
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.SslConfiguration.SslConfiguration
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.SslConfiguration.SslConfiguration


module Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.App

-- | A description of the app.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newApp</a> smart constructor.
data App
App' :: Maybe SslConfiguration -> Maybe [EnvironmentVariable] -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [DataSource] -> Maybe Source -> Maybe Text -> Maybe (HashMap AppAttributesKeys Text) -> Maybe Text -> Maybe AppType -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Text -> App

-- | An <tt>SslConfiguration</tt> object with the SSL configuration.
[$sel:sslConfiguration:App'] :: App -> Maybe SslConfiguration

-- | An array of <tt>EnvironmentVariable</tt> objects that specify
--   environment variables to be associated with the app. After you deploy
--   the app, these variables are defined on the associated app server
--   instances. For more information, see <a>Environment Variables</a>.
--   
--   There is no specific limit on the number of environment variables.
--   However, the size of the associated data structure - which includes
--   the variable names, values, and protected flag values - cannot exceed
--   20 KB. This limit should accommodate most if not all use cases, but if
--   you do exceed it, you will cause an exception (API) with an
--   "Environment: is too large (maximum is 20 KB)" message.
[$sel:environment:App'] :: App -> Maybe [EnvironmentVariable]

-- | Whether to enable SSL for the app.
[$sel:enableSsl:App'] :: App -> Maybe Bool

-- | When the app was created.
[$sel:createdAt:App'] :: App -> Maybe Text

-- | The app's short name.
[$sel:shortname:App'] :: App -> Maybe Text

-- | The app's data sources.
[$sel:dataSources:App'] :: App -> Maybe [DataSource]

-- | A <tt>Source</tt> object that describes the app repository.
[$sel:appSource:App'] :: App -> Maybe Source

-- | The app ID.
[$sel:appId:App'] :: App -> Maybe Text

-- | The stack attributes.
[$sel:attributes:App'] :: App -> Maybe (HashMap AppAttributesKeys Text)

-- | The app name.
[$sel:name:App'] :: App -> Maybe Text

-- | The app type.
[$sel:type':App'] :: App -> Maybe AppType

-- | The app stack ID.
[$sel:stackId:App'] :: App -> Maybe Text

-- | The app vhost settings with multiple domains separated by commas. For
--   example: <tt>'www.example.com, example.com'</tt>
[$sel:domains:App'] :: App -> Maybe [Text]

-- | A description of the app.
[$sel:description:App'] :: App -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>App</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:sslConfiguration:App'</a>, <a>app_sslConfiguration</a> - An
--   <tt>SslConfiguration</tt> object with the SSL configuration.
--   
--   <a>$sel:environment:App'</a>, <a>app_environment</a> - An array of
--   <tt>EnvironmentVariable</tt> objects that specify environment
--   variables to be associated with the app. After you deploy the app,
--   these variables are defined on the associated app server instances.
--   For more information, see <a>Environment Variables</a>.
--   
--   There is no specific limit on the number of environment variables.
--   However, the size of the associated data structure - which includes
--   the variable names, values, and protected flag values - cannot exceed
--   20 KB. This limit should accommodate most if not all use cases, but if
--   you do exceed it, you will cause an exception (API) with an
--   "Environment: is too large (maximum is 20 KB)" message.
--   
--   <a>$sel:enableSsl:App'</a>, <a>app_enableSsl</a> - Whether to enable
--   SSL for the app.
--   
--   <a>$sel:createdAt:App'</a>, <a>app_createdAt</a> - When the app was
--   created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:shortname:App'</a>, <a>app_shortname</a> - The app's short
--   name.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dataSources:App'</a>, <a>app_dataSources</a> - The app's data
--   sources.
--   
--   <a>$sel:appSource:App'</a>, <a>app_appSource</a> - A <tt>Source</tt>
--   object that describes the app repository.
--   
--   <a>$sel:appId:App'</a>, <a>app_appId</a> - The app ID.
--   
--   <a>$sel:attributes:App'</a>, <a>app_attributes</a> - The stack
--   attributes.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:App'</a>, <a>app_name</a> - The app name.
--   
--   <a>$sel:type':App'</a>, <a>app_type</a> - The app type.
--   
--   <a>$sel:stackId:App'</a>, <a>app_stackId</a> - The app stack ID.
--   
--   <a>$sel:domains:App'</a>, <a>app_domains</a> - The app vhost settings
--   with multiple domains separated by commas. For example:
--   <tt>'www.example.com, example.com'</tt>
--   
--   <a>$sel:description:App'</a>, <a>app_description</a> - A description
--   of the app.
newApp :: App

-- | An <tt>SslConfiguration</tt> object with the SSL configuration.
app_sslConfiguration :: Lens' App (Maybe SslConfiguration)

-- | An array of <tt>EnvironmentVariable</tt> objects that specify
--   environment variables to be associated with the app. After you deploy
--   the app, these variables are defined on the associated app server
--   instances. For more information, see <a>Environment Variables</a>.
--   
--   There is no specific limit on the number of environment variables.
--   However, the size of the associated data structure - which includes
--   the variable names, values, and protected flag values - cannot exceed
--   20 KB. This limit should accommodate most if not all use cases, but if
--   you do exceed it, you will cause an exception (API) with an
--   "Environment: is too large (maximum is 20 KB)" message.
app_environment :: Lens' App (Maybe [EnvironmentVariable])

-- | Whether to enable SSL for the app.
app_enableSsl :: Lens' App (Maybe Bool)

-- | When the app was created.
app_createdAt :: Lens' App (Maybe Text)

-- | The app's short name.
app_shortname :: Lens' App (Maybe Text)

-- | The app's data sources.
app_dataSources :: Lens' App (Maybe [DataSource])

-- | A <tt>Source</tt> object that describes the app repository.
app_appSource :: Lens' App (Maybe Source)

-- | The app ID.
app_appId :: Lens' App (Maybe Text)

-- | The stack attributes.
app_attributes :: Lens' App (Maybe (HashMap AppAttributesKeys Text))

-- | The app name.
app_name :: Lens' App (Maybe Text)

-- | The app type.
app_type :: Lens' App (Maybe AppType)

-- | The app stack ID.
app_stackId :: Lens' App (Maybe Text)

-- | The app vhost settings with multiple domains separated by commas. For
--   example: <tt>'www.example.com, example.com'</tt>
app_domains :: Lens' App (Maybe [Text])

-- | A description of the app.
app_description :: Lens' App (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.App.App
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.App.App
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.App.App
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.App.App
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.App.App
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.App.App
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.App.App


module Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.StackAttributesKeys
newtype StackAttributesKeys
StackAttributesKeys' :: Text -> StackAttributesKeys
[fromStackAttributesKeys] :: StackAttributesKeys -> Text
pattern StackAttributesKeys_Color :: StackAttributesKeys
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.ToXML Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.StackAttributesKeys.StackAttributesKeys
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.StackAttributesKeys.StackAttributesKeys
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSONKey Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.StackAttributesKeys.StackAttributesKeys
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.StackAttributesKeys.StackAttributesKeys
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSONKey Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.StackAttributesKeys.StackAttributesKeys
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.StackAttributesKeys.StackAttributesKeys
instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.StackAttributesKeys.StackAttributesKeys
instance Network.AWS.Data.Headers.ToHeader Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.StackAttributesKeys.StackAttributesKeys
instance Network.AWS.Data.Log.ToLog Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.StackAttributesKeys.StackAttributesKeys
instance Network.AWS.Data.ByteString.ToByteString Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.StackAttributesKeys.StackAttributesKeys
instance Network.AWS.Data.Text.ToText Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.StackAttributesKeys.StackAttributesKeys
instance Network.AWS.Data.Text.FromText Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.StackAttributesKeys.StackAttributesKeys
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.StackAttributesKeys.StackAttributesKeys
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.StackAttributesKeys.StackAttributesKeys
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.StackAttributesKeys.StackAttributesKeys
instance GHC.Classes.Ord Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.StackAttributesKeys.StackAttributesKeys
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.StackAttributesKeys.StackAttributesKeys
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.StackAttributesKeys.StackAttributesKeys
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.StackAttributesKeys.StackAttributesKeys


module Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.StackConfigurationManager

-- | Describes the configuration manager.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newStackConfigurationManager</a> smart constructor.
data StackConfigurationManager
StackConfigurationManager' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> StackConfigurationManager

-- | The name. This parameter must be set to "Chef".
[$sel:name:StackConfigurationManager'] :: StackConfigurationManager -> Maybe Text

-- | The Chef version. This parameter must be set to 12, 11.10, or 11.4 for
--   Linux stacks, and to 12.2 for Windows stacks. The default value for
--   Linux stacks is 11.4.
[$sel:version:StackConfigurationManager'] :: StackConfigurationManager -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>StackConfigurationManager</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:StackConfigurationManager'</a>,
--   <a>stackConfigurationManager_name</a> - The name. This parameter must
--   be set to "Chef".
--   
--   <a>$sel:version:StackConfigurationManager'</a>,
--   <a>stackConfigurationManager_version</a> - The Chef version. This
--   parameter must be set to 12, 11.10, or 11.4 for Linux stacks, and to
--   12.2 for Windows stacks. The default value for Linux stacks is 11.4.
newStackConfigurationManager :: StackConfigurationManager

-- | The name. This parameter must be set to "Chef".
stackConfigurationManager_name :: Lens' StackConfigurationManager (Maybe Text)

-- | The Chef version. This parameter must be set to 12, 11.10, or 11.4 for
--   Linux stacks, and to 12.2 for Windows stacks. The default value for
--   Linux stacks is 11.4.
stackConfigurationManager_version :: Lens' StackConfigurationManager (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.StackConfigurationManager.StackConfigurationManager
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.StackConfigurationManager.StackConfigurationManager
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.StackConfigurationManager.StackConfigurationManager
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.StackConfigurationManager.StackConfigurationManager
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.StackConfigurationManager.StackConfigurationManager
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.StackConfigurationManager.StackConfigurationManager
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.StackConfigurationManager.StackConfigurationManager
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.StackConfigurationManager.StackConfigurationManager


module Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.Stack

-- | Describes a stack.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newStack</a> smart constructor.
data Stack
Stack' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe RootDeviceType -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ChefConfiguration -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Source -> Maybe Text -> Maybe (HashMap StackAttributesKeys (Maybe Text)) -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe StackConfigurationManager -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Stack

-- | The ARN of an IAM profile that is the default profile for all of the
--   stack's EC2 instances. For more information about IAM ARNs, see
--   <a>Using Identifiers</a>.
[$sel:defaultInstanceProfileArn:Stack'] :: Stack -> Maybe Text

-- | The stack AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) role.
[$sel:serviceRoleArn:Stack'] :: Stack -> Maybe Text

-- | The default root device type. This value is used by default for all
--   instances in the stack, but you can override it when you create an
--   instance. For more information, see <a>Storage for the Root
--   Device</a>.
[$sel:defaultRootDeviceType:Stack'] :: Stack -> Maybe RootDeviceType

-- | The stack's ARN.
[$sel:arn:Stack'] :: Stack -> Maybe Text

-- | The date when the stack was created.
[$sel:createdAt:Stack'] :: Stack -> Maybe Text

-- | The VPC ID; applicable only if the stack is running in a VPC.
[$sel:vpcId:Stack'] :: Stack -> Maybe Text

-- | A <tt>ChefConfiguration</tt> object that specifies whether to enable
--   Berkshelf and the Berkshelf version. For more information, see
--   <a>Create a New Stack</a>.
[$sel:chefConfiguration:Stack'] :: Stack -> Maybe ChefConfiguration

-- | The agent version. This parameter is set to <tt>LATEST</tt> for
--   auto-update. or a version number for a fixed agent version.
[$sel:agentVersion:Stack'] :: Stack -> Maybe Text

-- | A default Amazon EC2 key pair for the stack's instances. You can
--   override this value when you create or update an instance.
[$sel:defaultSshKeyName:Stack'] :: Stack -> Maybe Text

-- | A JSON object that contains user-defined attributes to be added to the
--   stack configuration and deployment attributes. You can use custom JSON
--   to override the corresponding default stack configuration attribute
--   values or to pass data to recipes. The string should be in the
--   following format:
--   
--   <pre>
--   "{\"key1\": \"value1\", \"key2\": \"value2\",...}"
--   </pre>
--   
--   For more information on custom JSON, see <a>Use Custom JSON to Modify
--   the Stack Configuration Attributes</a>.
[$sel:customJson:Stack'] :: Stack -> Maybe Text

-- | Contains the information required to retrieve an app or cookbook from
--   a repository. For more information, see <a>Adding Apps</a> or
--   <a>Cookbooks and Recipes</a>.
[$sel:customCookbooksSource:Stack'] :: Stack -> Maybe Source

-- | The stack's default Availability Zone. For more information, see
--   <a>Regions and Endpoints</a>.
[$sel:defaultAvailabilityZone:Stack'] :: Stack -> Maybe Text

-- | The stack's attributes.
[$sel:attributes:Stack'] :: Stack -> Maybe (HashMap StackAttributesKeys (Maybe Text))

-- | The stack name.
[$sel:name:Stack'] :: Stack -> Maybe Text

-- | The stack's default operating system.
[$sel:defaultOs:Stack'] :: Stack -> Maybe Text

-- | Whether the stack automatically associates the AWS OpsWorks Stacks
--   built-in security groups with the stack's layers.
[$sel:useOpsworksSecurityGroups:Stack'] :: Stack -> Maybe Bool

-- | Whether the stack uses custom cookbooks.
[$sel:useCustomCookbooks:Stack'] :: Stack -> Maybe Bool

-- | The default subnet ID; applicable only if the stack is running in a
--   VPC.
[$sel:defaultSubnetId:Stack'] :: Stack -> Maybe Text

-- | The stack AWS region, such as "ap-northeast-2". For more information
--   about AWS regions, see <a>Regions and Endpoints</a>.
[$sel:region:Stack'] :: Stack -> Maybe Text

-- | The configuration manager.
[$sel:configurationManager:Stack'] :: Stack -> Maybe StackConfigurationManager

-- | The stack ID.
[$sel:stackId:Stack'] :: Stack -> Maybe Text

-- | The stack host name theme, with spaces replaced by underscores.
[$sel:hostnameTheme:Stack'] :: Stack -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>Stack</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:defaultInstanceProfileArn:Stack'</a>,
--   <a>stack_defaultInstanceProfileArn</a> - The ARN of an IAM profile
--   that is the default profile for all of the stack's EC2 instances. For
--   more information about IAM ARNs, see <a>Using Identifiers</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:serviceRoleArn:Stack'</a>, <a>stack_serviceRoleArn</a> - The
--   stack AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) role.
--   
--   <a>$sel:defaultRootDeviceType:Stack'</a>,
--   <a>stack_defaultRootDeviceType</a> - The default root device type.
--   This value is used by default for all instances in the stack, but you
--   can override it when you create an instance. For more information, see
--   <a>Storage for the Root Device</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:Stack'</a>, <a>stack_arn</a> - The stack's ARN.
--   
--   <a>$sel:createdAt:Stack'</a>, <a>stack_createdAt</a> - The date when
--   the stack was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:vpcId:Stack'</a>, <a>stack_vpcId</a> - The VPC ID; applicable
--   only if the stack is running in a VPC.
--   
--   <a>$sel:chefConfiguration:Stack'</a>, <a>stack_chefConfiguration</a> -
--   A <tt>ChefConfiguration</tt> object that specifies whether to enable
--   Berkshelf and the Berkshelf version. For more information, see
--   <a>Create a New Stack</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:agentVersion:Stack'</a>, <a>stack_agentVersion</a> - The agent
--   version. This parameter is set to <tt>LATEST</tt> for auto-update. or
--   a version number for a fixed agent version.
--   
--   <a>$sel:defaultSshKeyName:Stack'</a>, <a>stack_defaultSshKeyName</a> -
--   A default Amazon EC2 key pair for the stack's instances. You can
--   override this value when you create or update an instance.
--   
--   <a>$sel:customJson:Stack'</a>, <a>stack_customJson</a> - A JSON object
--   that contains user-defined attributes to be added to the stack
--   configuration and deployment attributes. You can use custom JSON to
--   override the corresponding default stack configuration attribute
--   values or to pass data to recipes. The string should be in the
--   following format:
--   
--   <pre>
--   "{\"key1\": \"value1\", \"key2\": \"value2\",...}"
--   </pre>
--   
--   For more information on custom JSON, see <a>Use Custom JSON to Modify
--   the Stack Configuration Attributes</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:customCookbooksSource:Stack'</a>,
--   <a>stack_customCookbooksSource</a> - Contains the information required
--   to retrieve an app or cookbook from a repository. For more
--   information, see <a>Adding Apps</a> or <a>Cookbooks and Recipes</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:defaultAvailabilityZone:Stack'</a>,
--   <a>stack_defaultAvailabilityZone</a> - The stack's default
--   Availability Zone. For more information, see <a>Regions and
--   Endpoints</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:attributes:Stack'</a>, <a>stack_attributes</a> - The stack's
--   attributes.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:Stack'</a>, <a>stack_name</a> - The stack name.
--   
--   <a>$sel:defaultOs:Stack'</a>, <a>stack_defaultOs</a> - The stack's
--   default operating system.
--   
--   <a>$sel:useOpsworksSecurityGroups:Stack'</a>,
--   <a>stack_useOpsworksSecurityGroups</a> - Whether the stack
--   automatically associates the AWS OpsWorks Stacks built-in security
--   groups with the stack's layers.
--   
--   <a>$sel:useCustomCookbooks:Stack'</a>, <a>stack_useCustomCookbooks</a>
--   - Whether the stack uses custom cookbooks.
--   
--   <a>$sel:defaultSubnetId:Stack'</a>, <a>stack_defaultSubnetId</a> - The
--   default subnet ID; applicable only if the stack is running in a VPC.
--   
--   <a>$sel:region:Stack'</a>, <a>stack_region</a> - The stack AWS region,
--   such as "ap-northeast-2". For more information about AWS regions, see
--   <a>Regions and Endpoints</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:configurationManager:Stack'</a>,
--   <a>stack_configurationManager</a> - The configuration manager.
--   
--   <a>$sel:stackId:Stack'</a>, <a>stack_stackId</a> - The stack ID.
--   
--   <a>$sel:hostnameTheme:Stack'</a>, <a>stack_hostnameTheme</a> - The
--   stack host name theme, with spaces replaced by underscores.
newStack :: Stack

-- | The ARN of an IAM profile that is the default profile for all of the
--   stack's EC2 instances. For more information about IAM ARNs, see
--   <a>Using Identifiers</a>.
stack_defaultInstanceProfileArn :: Lens' Stack (Maybe Text)

-- | The stack AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) role.
stack_serviceRoleArn :: Lens' Stack (Maybe Text)

-- | The default root device type. This value is used by default for all
--   instances in the stack, but you can override it when you create an
--   instance. For more information, see <a>Storage for the Root
--   Device</a>.
stack_defaultRootDeviceType :: Lens' Stack (Maybe RootDeviceType)

-- | The stack's ARN.
stack_arn :: Lens' Stack (Maybe Text)

-- | The date when the stack was created.
stack_createdAt :: Lens' Stack (Maybe Text)

-- | The VPC ID; applicable only if the stack is running in a VPC.
stack_vpcId :: Lens' Stack (Maybe Text)

-- | A <tt>ChefConfiguration</tt> object that specifies whether to enable
--   Berkshelf and the Berkshelf version. For more information, see
--   <a>Create a New Stack</a>.
stack_chefConfiguration :: Lens' Stack (Maybe ChefConfiguration)

-- | The agent version. This parameter is set to <tt>LATEST</tt> for
--   auto-update. or a version number for a fixed agent version.
stack_agentVersion :: Lens' Stack (Maybe Text)

-- | A default Amazon EC2 key pair for the stack's instances. You can
--   override this value when you create or update an instance.
stack_defaultSshKeyName :: Lens' Stack (Maybe Text)

-- | A JSON object that contains user-defined attributes to be added to the
--   stack configuration and deployment attributes. You can use custom JSON
--   to override the corresponding default stack configuration attribute
--   values or to pass data to recipes. The string should be in the
--   following format:
--   
--   <pre>
--   "{\"key1\": \"value1\", \"key2\": \"value2\",...}"
--   </pre>
--   
--   For more information on custom JSON, see <a>Use Custom JSON to Modify
--   the Stack Configuration Attributes</a>.
stack_customJson :: Lens' Stack (Maybe Text)

-- | Contains the information required to retrieve an app or cookbook from
--   a repository. For more information, see <a>Adding Apps</a> or
--   <a>Cookbooks and Recipes</a>.
stack_customCookbooksSource :: Lens' Stack (Maybe Source)

-- | The stack's default Availability Zone. For more information, see
--   <a>Regions and Endpoints</a>.
stack_defaultAvailabilityZone :: Lens' Stack (Maybe Text)

-- | The stack's attributes.
stack_attributes :: Lens' Stack (Maybe (HashMap StackAttributesKeys (Maybe Text)))

-- | The stack name.
stack_name :: Lens' Stack (Maybe Text)

-- | The stack's default operating system.
stack_defaultOs :: Lens' Stack (Maybe Text)

-- | Whether the stack automatically associates the AWS OpsWorks Stacks
--   built-in security groups with the stack's layers.
stack_useOpsworksSecurityGroups :: Lens' Stack (Maybe Bool)

-- | Whether the stack uses custom cookbooks.
stack_useCustomCookbooks :: Lens' Stack (Maybe Bool)

-- | The default subnet ID; applicable only if the stack is running in a
--   VPC.
stack_defaultSubnetId :: Lens' Stack (Maybe Text)

-- | The stack AWS region, such as "ap-northeast-2". For more information
--   about AWS regions, see <a>Regions and Endpoints</a>.
stack_region :: Lens' Stack (Maybe Text)

-- | The configuration manager.
stack_configurationManager :: Lens' Stack (Maybe StackConfigurationManager)

-- | The stack ID.
stack_stackId :: Lens' Stack (Maybe Text)

-- | The stack host name theme, with spaces replaced by underscores.
stack_hostnameTheme :: Lens' Stack (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.Stack.Stack
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.Stack.Stack
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.Stack.Stack
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.Stack.Stack
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.Stack.Stack
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.Stack.Stack
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.Stack.Stack

module Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.StackSummary

-- | Summarizes the number of layers, instances, and apps in a stack.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newStackSummary</a> smart constructor.
data StackSummary
StackSummary' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe InstancesCount -> StackSummary

-- | The stack's ARN.
[$sel:arn:StackSummary'] :: StackSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | The number of apps.
[$sel:appsCount:StackSummary'] :: StackSummary -> Maybe Int

-- | The stack name.
[$sel:name:StackSummary'] :: StackSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | The stack ID.
[$sel:stackId:StackSummary'] :: StackSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | The number of layers.
[$sel:layersCount:StackSummary'] :: StackSummary -> Maybe Int

-- | An <tt>InstancesCount</tt> object with the number of instances in each
--   status.
[$sel:instancesCount:StackSummary'] :: StackSummary -> Maybe InstancesCount

-- | Create a value of <a>StackSummary</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:StackSummary'</a>, <a>stackSummary_arn</a> - The stack's
--   ARN.
--   
--   <a>$sel:appsCount:StackSummary'</a>, <a>stackSummary_appsCount</a> -
--   The number of apps.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:StackSummary'</a>, <a>stackSummary_name</a> - The stack
--   name.
--   
--   <a>$sel:stackId:StackSummary'</a>, <a>stackSummary_stackId</a> - The
--   stack ID.
--   
--   <a>$sel:layersCount:StackSummary'</a>, <a>stackSummary_layersCount</a>
--   - The number of layers.
--   
--   <a>$sel:instancesCount:StackSummary'</a>,
--   <a>stackSummary_instancesCount</a> - An <tt>InstancesCount</tt> object
--   with the number of instances in each status.
newStackSummary :: StackSummary

-- | The stack's ARN.
stackSummary_arn :: Lens' StackSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | The number of apps.
stackSummary_appsCount :: Lens' StackSummary (Maybe Int)

-- | The stack name.
stackSummary_name :: Lens' StackSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | The stack ID.
stackSummary_stackId :: Lens' StackSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | The number of layers.
stackSummary_layersCount :: Lens' StackSummary (Maybe Int)

-- | An <tt>InstancesCount</tt> object with the number of instances in each
--   status.
stackSummary_instancesCount :: Lens' StackSummary (Maybe InstancesCount)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.StackSummary.StackSummary
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.StackSummary.StackSummary
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.StackSummary.StackSummary
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.StackSummary.StackSummary
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.StackSummary.StackSummary
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.StackSummary.StackSummary
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.StackSummary.StackSummary


module Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.TemporaryCredential

-- | Contains the data needed by RDP clients such as the Microsoft Remote
--   Desktop Connection to log in to the instance.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTemporaryCredential</a> smart constructor.
data TemporaryCredential
TemporaryCredential' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> TemporaryCredential

-- | The instance's AWS OpsWorks Stacks ID.
[$sel:instanceId:TemporaryCredential'] :: TemporaryCredential -> Maybe Text

-- | The user name.
[$sel:username:TemporaryCredential'] :: TemporaryCredential -> Maybe Text

-- | The password.
[$sel:password:TemporaryCredential'] :: TemporaryCredential -> Maybe Text

-- | The length of time (in minutes) that the grant is valid. When the
--   grant expires, at the end of this period, the user will no longer be
--   able to use the credentials to log in. If they are logged in at the
--   time, they will be automatically logged out.
[$sel:validForInMinutes:TemporaryCredential'] :: TemporaryCredential -> Maybe Int

-- | Create a value of <a>TemporaryCredential</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:instanceId:TemporaryCredential'</a>,
--   <a>temporaryCredential_instanceId</a> - The instance's AWS OpsWorks
--   Stacks ID.
--   
--   <a>$sel:username:TemporaryCredential'</a>,
--   <a>temporaryCredential_username</a> - The user name.
--   
--   <a>$sel:password:TemporaryCredential'</a>,
--   <a>temporaryCredential_password</a> - The password.
--   
--   <a>$sel:validForInMinutes:TemporaryCredential'</a>,
--   <a>temporaryCredential_validForInMinutes</a> - The length of time (in
--   minutes) that the grant is valid. When the grant expires, at the end
--   of this period, the user will no longer be able to use the credentials
--   to log in. If they are logged in at the time, they will be
--   automatically logged out.
newTemporaryCredential :: TemporaryCredential

-- | The instance's AWS OpsWorks Stacks ID.
temporaryCredential_instanceId :: Lens' TemporaryCredential (Maybe Text)

-- | The user name.
temporaryCredential_username :: Lens' TemporaryCredential (Maybe Text)

-- | The password.
temporaryCredential_password :: Lens' TemporaryCredential (Maybe Text)

-- | The length of time (in minutes) that the grant is valid. When the
--   grant expires, at the end of this period, the user will no longer be
--   able to use the credentials to log in. If they are logged in at the
--   time, they will be automatically logged out.
temporaryCredential_validForInMinutes :: Lens' TemporaryCredential (Maybe Int)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.TemporaryCredential.TemporaryCredential
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.TemporaryCredential.TemporaryCredential
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.TemporaryCredential.TemporaryCredential
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.TemporaryCredential.TemporaryCredential
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.TemporaryCredential.TemporaryCredential
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.TemporaryCredential.TemporaryCredential
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.TemporaryCredential.TemporaryCredential


module Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.UserProfile

-- | Describes a user's SSH information.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newUserProfile</a> smart constructor.
data UserProfile
UserProfile' :: Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> UserProfile

-- | Whether users can specify their own SSH public key through the My
--   Settings page. For more information, see <a>Managing User
--   Permissions</a>.
[$sel:allowSelfManagement:UserProfile'] :: UserProfile -> Maybe Bool

-- | The user's SSH public key.
[$sel:sshPublicKey:UserProfile'] :: UserProfile -> Maybe Text

-- | The user's SSH user name.
[$sel:sshUsername:UserProfile'] :: UserProfile -> Maybe Text

-- | The user's IAM ARN.
[$sel:iamUserArn:UserProfile'] :: UserProfile -> Maybe Text

-- | The user's name.
[$sel:name:UserProfile'] :: UserProfile -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>UserProfile</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:allowSelfManagement:UserProfile'</a>,
--   <a>userProfile_allowSelfManagement</a> - Whether users can specify
--   their own SSH public key through the My Settings page. For more
--   information, see <a>Managing User Permissions</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sshPublicKey:UserProfile'</a>, <a>userProfile_sshPublicKey</a>
--   - The user's SSH public key.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sshUsername:UserProfile'</a>, <a>userProfile_sshUsername</a> -
--   The user's SSH user name.
--   
--   <a>$sel:iamUserArn:UserProfile'</a>, <a>userProfile_iamUserArn</a> -
--   The user's IAM ARN.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:UserProfile'</a>, <a>userProfile_name</a> - The user's
--   name.
newUserProfile :: UserProfile

-- | Whether users can specify their own SSH public key through the My
--   Settings page. For more information, see <a>Managing User
--   Permissions</a>.
userProfile_allowSelfManagement :: Lens' UserProfile (Maybe Bool)

-- | The user's SSH public key.
userProfile_sshPublicKey :: Lens' UserProfile (Maybe Text)

-- | The user's SSH user name.
userProfile_sshUsername :: Lens' UserProfile (Maybe Text)

-- | The user's IAM ARN.
userProfile_iamUserArn :: Lens' UserProfile (Maybe Text)

-- | The user's name.
userProfile_name :: Lens' UserProfile (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.UserProfile.UserProfile
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.UserProfile.UserProfile
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.UserProfile.UserProfile
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.UserProfile.UserProfile
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.UserProfile.UserProfile
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.UserProfile.UserProfile
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.UserProfile.UserProfile
