module Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.Volume

-- | Describes an instance's Amazon EBS volume.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newVolume</a> smart constructor.
data Volume
Volume' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Volume

-- | The instance ID.
[$sel:instanceId:Volume'] :: Volume -> Maybe Text

-- | The value returned by <a>DescribeVolumes</a>.
[$sel:status:Volume'] :: Volume -> Maybe Text

-- | The volume size.
[$sel:size:Volume'] :: Volume -> Maybe Int

-- | For PIOPS volumes, the IOPS per disk.
[$sel:iops:Volume'] :: Volume -> Maybe Int

-- | The device name.
[$sel:device:Volume'] :: Volume -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies whether an Amazon EBS volume is encrypted. For more
--   information, see <a>Amazon EBS Encryption</a>.
[$sel:encrypted:Volume'] :: Volume -> Maybe Bool

-- | The volume Availability Zone. For more information, see <a>Regions and
--   Endpoints</a>.
[$sel:availabilityZone:Volume'] :: Volume -> Maybe Text

-- | The volume name.
[$sel:name:Volume'] :: Volume -> Maybe Text

-- | The RAID array ID.
[$sel:raidArrayId:Volume'] :: Volume -> Maybe Text

-- | The volume ID.
[$sel:volumeId:Volume'] :: Volume -> Maybe Text

-- | The AWS region. For more information about AWS regions, see <a>Regions
--   and Endpoints</a>.
[$sel:region:Volume'] :: Volume -> Maybe Text

-- | The volume type. For more information, see <a>Amazon EBS Volume
--   Types</a>.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>standard</tt> - Magnetic. Magnetic volumes must have a minimum
--   size of 1 GiB and a maximum size of 1024 GiB.</li>
--   <li><tt>io1</tt> - Provisioned IOPS (SSD). PIOPS volumes must have a
--   minimum size of 4 GiB and a maximum size of 16384 GiB.</li>
--   <li><tt>gp2</tt> - General Purpose (SSD). General purpose volumes must
--   have a minimum size of 1 GiB and a maximum size of 16384 GiB.</li>
--   <li><tt>st1</tt> - Throughput Optimized hard disk drive (HDD).
--   Throughput optimized HDD volumes must have a minimum size of 500 GiB
--   and a maximum size of 16384 GiB.</li>
--   <li><tt>sc1</tt> - Cold HDD. Cold HDD volumes must have a minimum size
--   of 500 GiB and a maximum size of 16384 GiB.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:volumeType:Volume'] :: Volume -> Maybe Text

-- | The Amazon EC2 volume ID.
[$sel:ec2VolumeId:Volume'] :: Volume -> Maybe Text

-- | The volume mount point. For example, "/mnt/disk1".
[$sel:mountPoint:Volume'] :: Volume -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>Volume</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:instanceId:Volume'</a>, <a>volume_instanceId</a> - The
--   instance ID.
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:Volume'</a>, <a>volume_status</a> - The value returned
--   by <a>DescribeVolumes</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:size:Volume'</a>, <a>volume_size</a> - The volume size.
--   
--   <a>$sel:iops:Volume'</a>, <a>volume_iops</a> - For PIOPS volumes, the
--   IOPS per disk.
--   
--   <a>$sel:device:Volume'</a>, <a>volume_device</a> - The device name.
--   
--   <a>$sel:encrypted:Volume'</a>, <a>volume_encrypted</a> - Specifies
--   whether an Amazon EBS volume is encrypted. For more information, see
--   <a>Amazon EBS Encryption</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:availabilityZone:Volume'</a>, <a>volume_availabilityZone</a> -
--   The volume Availability Zone. For more information, see <a>Regions and
--   Endpoints</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:Volume'</a>, <a>volume_name</a> - The volume name.
--   
--   <a>$sel:raidArrayId:Volume'</a>, <a>volume_raidArrayId</a> - The RAID
--   array ID.
--   
--   <a>$sel:volumeId:Volume'</a>, <a>volume_volumeId</a> - The volume ID.
--   
--   <a>$sel:region:Volume'</a>, <a>volume_region</a> - The AWS region. For
--   more information about AWS regions, see <a>Regions and Endpoints</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:volumeType:Volume'</a>, <a>volume_volumeType</a> - The volume
--   type. For more information, see <a>Amazon EBS Volume Types</a>.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>standard</tt> - Magnetic. Magnetic volumes must have a minimum
--   size of 1 GiB and a maximum size of 1024 GiB.</li>
--   <li><tt>io1</tt> - Provisioned IOPS (SSD). PIOPS volumes must have a
--   minimum size of 4 GiB and a maximum size of 16384 GiB.</li>
--   <li><tt>gp2</tt> - General Purpose (SSD). General purpose volumes must
--   have a minimum size of 1 GiB and a maximum size of 16384 GiB.</li>
--   <li><tt>st1</tt> - Throughput Optimized hard disk drive (HDD).
--   Throughput optimized HDD volumes must have a minimum size of 500 GiB
--   and a maximum size of 16384 GiB.</li>
--   <li><tt>sc1</tt> - Cold HDD. Cold HDD volumes must have a minimum size
--   of 500 GiB and a maximum size of 16384 GiB.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:ec2VolumeId:Volume'</a>, <a>volume_ec2VolumeId</a> - The
--   Amazon EC2 volume ID.
--   
--   <a>$sel:mountPoint:Volume'</a>, <a>volume_mountPoint</a> - The volume
--   mount point. For example, "/mnt/disk1".
newVolume :: Volume

-- | The instance ID.
volume_instanceId :: Lens' Volume (Maybe Text)

-- | The value returned by <a>DescribeVolumes</a>.
volume_status :: Lens' Volume (Maybe Text)

-- | The volume size.
volume_size :: Lens' Volume (Maybe Int)

-- | For PIOPS volumes, the IOPS per disk.
volume_iops :: Lens' Volume (Maybe Int)

-- | The device name.
volume_device :: Lens' Volume (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies whether an Amazon EBS volume is encrypted. For more
--   information, see <a>Amazon EBS Encryption</a>.
volume_encrypted :: Lens' Volume (Maybe Bool)

-- | The volume Availability Zone. For more information, see <a>Regions and
--   Endpoints</a>.
volume_availabilityZone :: Lens' Volume (Maybe Text)

-- | The volume name.
volume_name :: Lens' Volume (Maybe Text)

-- | The RAID array ID.
volume_raidArrayId :: Lens' Volume (Maybe Text)

-- | The volume ID.
volume_volumeId :: Lens' Volume (Maybe Text)

-- | The AWS region. For more information about AWS regions, see <a>Regions
--   and Endpoints</a>.
volume_region :: Lens' Volume (Maybe Text)

-- | The volume type. For more information, see <a>Amazon EBS Volume
--   Types</a>.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>standard</tt> - Magnetic. Magnetic volumes must have a minimum
--   size of 1 GiB and a maximum size of 1024 GiB.</li>
--   <li><tt>io1</tt> - Provisioned IOPS (SSD). PIOPS volumes must have a
--   minimum size of 4 GiB and a maximum size of 16384 GiB.</li>
--   <li><tt>gp2</tt> - General Purpose (SSD). General purpose volumes must
--   have a minimum size of 1 GiB and a maximum size of 16384 GiB.</li>
--   <li><tt>st1</tt> - Throughput Optimized hard disk drive (HDD).
--   Throughput optimized HDD volumes must have a minimum size of 500 GiB
--   and a maximum size of 16384 GiB.</li>
--   <li><tt>sc1</tt> - Cold HDD. Cold HDD volumes must have a minimum size
--   of 500 GiB and a maximum size of 16384 GiB.</li>
--   </ul>
volume_volumeType :: Lens' Volume (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon EC2 volume ID.
volume_ec2VolumeId :: Lens' Volume (Maybe Text)

-- | The volume mount point. For example, "/mnt/disk1".
volume_mountPoint :: Lens' Volume (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.Volume.Volume
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.Volume.Volume
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.Volume.Volume
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.Volume.Volume
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.Volume.Volume
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.Volume.Volume
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.Volume.Volume


module Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.VolumeConfiguration

-- | Describes an Amazon EBS volume configuration.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newVolumeConfiguration</a> smart constructor.
data VolumeConfiguration
VolumeConfiguration' :: Maybe Int -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Text -> Int -> Int -> VolumeConfiguration

-- | For PIOPS volumes, the IOPS per disk.
[$sel:iops:VolumeConfiguration'] :: VolumeConfiguration -> Maybe Int

-- | The volume <a>RAID level</a>.
[$sel:raidLevel:VolumeConfiguration'] :: VolumeConfiguration -> Maybe Int

-- | Specifies whether an Amazon EBS volume is encrypted. For more
--   information, see <a>Amazon EBS Encryption</a>.
[$sel:encrypted:VolumeConfiguration'] :: VolumeConfiguration -> Maybe Bool

-- | The volume type. For more information, see <a>Amazon EBS Volume
--   Types</a>.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>standard</tt> - Magnetic. Magnetic volumes must have a minimum
--   size of 1 GiB and a maximum size of 1024 GiB.</li>
--   <li><tt>io1</tt> - Provisioned IOPS (SSD). PIOPS volumes must have a
--   minimum size of 4 GiB and a maximum size of 16384 GiB.</li>
--   <li><tt>gp2</tt> - General Purpose (SSD). General purpose volumes must
--   have a minimum size of 1 GiB and a maximum size of 16384 GiB.</li>
--   <li><tt>st1</tt> - Throughput Optimized hard disk drive (HDD).
--   Throughput optimized HDD volumes must have a minimum size of 500 GiB
--   and a maximum size of 16384 GiB.</li>
--   <li><tt>sc1</tt> - Cold HDD. Cold HDD volumes must have a minimum size
--   of 500 GiB and a maximum size of 16384 GiB.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:volumeType:VolumeConfiguration'] :: VolumeConfiguration -> Maybe Text

-- | The volume mount point. For example "/dev/sdh".
[$sel:mountPoint:VolumeConfiguration'] :: VolumeConfiguration -> Text

-- | The number of disks in the volume.
[$sel:numberOfDisks:VolumeConfiguration'] :: VolumeConfiguration -> Int

-- | The volume size.
[$sel:size:VolumeConfiguration'] :: VolumeConfiguration -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>VolumeConfiguration</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:iops:VolumeConfiguration'</a>, <a>volumeConfiguration_iops</a>
--   - For PIOPS volumes, the IOPS per disk.
--   
--   <a>$sel:raidLevel:VolumeConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>volumeConfiguration_raidLevel</a> - The volume <a>RAID level</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:encrypted:VolumeConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>volumeConfiguration_encrypted</a> - Specifies whether an Amazon EBS
--   volume is encrypted. For more information, see <a>Amazon EBS
--   Encryption</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:volumeType:VolumeConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>volumeConfiguration_volumeType</a> - The volume type. For more
--   information, see <a>Amazon EBS Volume Types</a>.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>standard</tt> - Magnetic. Magnetic volumes must have a minimum
--   size of 1 GiB and a maximum size of 1024 GiB.</li>
--   <li><tt>io1</tt> - Provisioned IOPS (SSD). PIOPS volumes must have a
--   minimum size of 4 GiB and a maximum size of 16384 GiB.</li>
--   <li><tt>gp2</tt> - General Purpose (SSD). General purpose volumes must
--   have a minimum size of 1 GiB and a maximum size of 16384 GiB.</li>
--   <li><tt>st1</tt> - Throughput Optimized hard disk drive (HDD).
--   Throughput optimized HDD volumes must have a minimum size of 500 GiB
--   and a maximum size of 16384 GiB.</li>
--   <li><tt>sc1</tt> - Cold HDD. Cold HDD volumes must have a minimum size
--   of 500 GiB and a maximum size of 16384 GiB.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:mountPoint:VolumeConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>volumeConfiguration_mountPoint</a> - The volume mount point. For
--   example "/dev/sdh".
--   
--   <a>$sel:numberOfDisks:VolumeConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>volumeConfiguration_numberOfDisks</a> - The number of disks in the
--   volume.
--   
--   <a>$sel:size:VolumeConfiguration'</a>, <a>volumeConfiguration_size</a>
--   - The volume size.
newVolumeConfiguration :: Text -> Int -> Int -> VolumeConfiguration

-- | For PIOPS volumes, the IOPS per disk.
volumeConfiguration_iops :: Lens' VolumeConfiguration (Maybe Int)

-- | The volume <a>RAID level</a>.
volumeConfiguration_raidLevel :: Lens' VolumeConfiguration (Maybe Int)

-- | Specifies whether an Amazon EBS volume is encrypted. For more
--   information, see <a>Amazon EBS Encryption</a>.
volumeConfiguration_encrypted :: Lens' VolumeConfiguration (Maybe Bool)

-- | The volume type. For more information, see <a>Amazon EBS Volume
--   Types</a>.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>standard</tt> - Magnetic. Magnetic volumes must have a minimum
--   size of 1 GiB and a maximum size of 1024 GiB.</li>
--   <li><tt>io1</tt> - Provisioned IOPS (SSD). PIOPS volumes must have a
--   minimum size of 4 GiB and a maximum size of 16384 GiB.</li>
--   <li><tt>gp2</tt> - General Purpose (SSD). General purpose volumes must
--   have a minimum size of 1 GiB and a maximum size of 16384 GiB.</li>
--   <li><tt>st1</tt> - Throughput Optimized hard disk drive (HDD).
--   Throughput optimized HDD volumes must have a minimum size of 500 GiB
--   and a maximum size of 16384 GiB.</li>
--   <li><tt>sc1</tt> - Cold HDD. Cold HDD volumes must have a minimum size
--   of 500 GiB and a maximum size of 16384 GiB.</li>
--   </ul>
volumeConfiguration_volumeType :: Lens' VolumeConfiguration (Maybe Text)

-- | The volume mount point. For example "/dev/sdh".
volumeConfiguration_mountPoint :: Lens' VolumeConfiguration Text

-- | The number of disks in the volume.
volumeConfiguration_numberOfDisks :: Lens' VolumeConfiguration Int

-- | The volume size.
volumeConfiguration_size :: Lens' VolumeConfiguration Int
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.VolumeConfiguration.VolumeConfiguration
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.VolumeConfiguration.VolumeConfiguration
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.VolumeConfiguration.VolumeConfiguration
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.VolumeConfiguration.VolumeConfiguration
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.VolumeConfiguration.VolumeConfiguration
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.VolumeConfiguration.VolumeConfiguration
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.VolumeConfiguration.VolumeConfiguration
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.VolumeConfiguration.VolumeConfiguration


module Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.Layer

-- | Describes a layer.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newLayer</a> smart constructor.
data Layer
Layer' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe CloudWatchLogsConfiguration -> Maybe LifecycleEventConfiguration -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Recipes -> Maybe Recipes -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [VolumeConfiguration] -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe (HashMap LayerAttributesKeys (Maybe Text)) -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe LayerType -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Bool -> Layer

-- | The ARN of the default IAM profile to be used for the layer's EC2
--   instances. For more information about IAM ARNs, see <a>Using
--   Identifiers</a>.
[$sel:customInstanceProfileArn:Layer'] :: Layer -> Maybe Text

-- | An array containing the layer's custom security group IDs.
[$sel:customSecurityGroupIds:Layer'] :: Layer -> Maybe [Text]

-- | Whether to install operating system and package updates when the
--   instance boots. The default value is <tt>true</tt>. If this value is
--   set to <tt>false</tt>, you must then update your instances manually by
--   using CreateDeployment to run the <tt>update_dependencies</tt> stack
--   command or manually running <tt>yum</tt> (Amazon Linux) or
--   <tt>apt-get</tt> (Ubuntu) on the instances.
--   
--   We strongly recommend using the default value of <tt>true</tt>, to
--   ensure that your instances have the latest security updates.
[$sel:installUpdatesOnBoot:Layer'] :: Layer -> Maybe Bool

-- | The Amazon CloudWatch Logs configuration settings for the layer.
[$sel:cloudWatchLogsConfiguration:Layer'] :: Layer -> Maybe CloudWatchLogsConfiguration

-- | A <tt>LifeCycleEventConfiguration</tt> object that specifies the
--   Shutdown event configuration.
[$sel:lifecycleEventConfiguration:Layer'] :: Layer -> Maybe LifecycleEventConfiguration

-- | The Amazon Resource Number (ARN) of a layer.
[$sel:arn:Layer'] :: Layer -> Maybe Text

-- | Date when the layer was created.
[$sel:createdAt:Layer'] :: Layer -> Maybe Text

-- | The layer short name.
[$sel:shortname:Layer'] :: Layer -> Maybe Text

-- | AWS OpsWorks Stacks supports five lifecycle events: <b>setup</b>,
--   <b>configuration</b>, <b>deploy</b>, <b>undeploy</b>, and
--   <b>shutdown</b>. For each layer, AWS OpsWorks Stacks runs a set of
--   standard recipes for each event. You can also provide custom recipes
--   for any or all layers and events. AWS OpsWorks Stacks runs custom
--   event recipes after the standard recipes. <tt>LayerCustomRecipes</tt>
--   specifies the custom recipes for a particular layer to be run in
--   response to each of the five events.
--   
--   To specify a recipe, use the cookbook's directory name in the
--   repository followed by two colons and the recipe name, which is the
--   recipe's file name without the <tt>.rb</tt> extension. For example:
--   <tt>phpapp2::dbsetup</tt> specifies the <tt>dbsetup.rb</tt> recipe in
--   the repository's <tt>phpapp2</tt> folder.
[$sel:defaultRecipes:Layer'] :: Layer -> Maybe Recipes

-- | A <tt>LayerCustomRecipes</tt> object that specifies the layer's custom
--   recipes.
[$sel:customRecipes:Layer'] :: Layer -> Maybe Recipes

-- | A JSON formatted string containing the layer's custom stack
--   configuration and deployment attributes.
[$sel:customJson:Layer'] :: Layer -> Maybe Text

-- | A <tt>VolumeConfigurations</tt> object that describes the layer's
--   Amazon EBS volumes.
[$sel:volumeConfigurations:Layer'] :: Layer -> Maybe [VolumeConfiguration]

-- | Whether auto healing is disabled for the layer.
[$sel:enableAutoHealing:Layer'] :: Layer -> Maybe Bool

-- | An array of <tt>Package</tt> objects that describe the layer's
--   packages.
[$sel:packages:Layer'] :: Layer -> Maybe [Text]

-- | The layer attributes.
--   
--   For the <tt>HaproxyStatsPassword</tt>, <tt>MysqlRootPassword</tt>, and
--   <tt>GangliaPassword</tt> attributes, AWS OpsWorks Stacks returns
--   <tt>*****FILTERED*****</tt> instead of the actual value
--   
--   For an ECS Cluster layer, AWS OpsWorks Stacks the
--   <tt>EcsClusterArn</tt> attribute is set to the cluster's ARN.
[$sel:attributes:Layer'] :: Layer -> Maybe (HashMap LayerAttributesKeys (Maybe Text))

-- | The layer name.
[$sel:name:Layer'] :: Layer -> Maybe Text

-- | For stacks that are running in a VPC, whether to automatically assign
--   a public IP address to the layer's instances. For more information,
--   see <a>How to Edit a Layer</a>.
[$sel:autoAssignPublicIps:Layer'] :: Layer -> Maybe Bool

-- | The layer type.
[$sel:type':Layer'] :: Layer -> Maybe LayerType

-- | Whether the layer uses Amazon EBS-optimized instances.
[$sel:useEbsOptimizedInstances:Layer'] :: Layer -> Maybe Bool

-- | The layer stack ID.
[$sel:stackId:Layer'] :: Layer -> Maybe Text

-- | The layer ID.
[$sel:layerId:Layer'] :: Layer -> Maybe Text

-- | An array containing the layer's security group names.
[$sel:defaultSecurityGroupNames:Layer'] :: Layer -> Maybe [Text]

-- | Whether to automatically assign an <a>Elastic IP address</a> to the
--   layer's instances. For more information, see <a>How to Edit a
--   Layer</a>.
[$sel:autoAssignElasticIps:Layer'] :: Layer -> Maybe Bool

-- | Create a value of <a>Layer</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:customInstanceProfileArn:Layer'</a>,
--   <a>layer_customInstanceProfileArn</a> - The ARN of the default IAM
--   profile to be used for the layer's EC2 instances. For more information
--   about IAM ARNs, see <a>Using Identifiers</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:customSecurityGroupIds:Layer'</a>,
--   <a>layer_customSecurityGroupIds</a> - An array containing the layer's
--   custom security group IDs.
--   
--   <a>$sel:installUpdatesOnBoot:Layer'</a>,
--   <a>layer_installUpdatesOnBoot</a> - Whether to install operating
--   system and package updates when the instance boots. The default value
--   is <tt>true</tt>. If this value is set to <tt>false</tt>, you must
--   then update your instances manually by using CreateDeployment to run
--   the <tt>update_dependencies</tt> stack command or manually running
--   <tt>yum</tt> (Amazon Linux) or <tt>apt-get</tt> (Ubuntu) on the
--   instances.
--   
--   We strongly recommend using the default value of <tt>true</tt>, to
--   ensure that your instances have the latest security updates.
--   
--   <a>$sel:cloudWatchLogsConfiguration:Layer'</a>,
--   <a>layer_cloudWatchLogsConfiguration</a> - The Amazon CloudWatch Logs
--   configuration settings for the layer.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lifecycleEventConfiguration:Layer'</a>,
--   <a>layer_lifecycleEventConfiguration</a> - A
--   <tt>LifeCycleEventConfiguration</tt> object that specifies the
--   Shutdown event configuration.
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:Layer'</a>, <a>layer_arn</a> - The Amazon Resource Number
--   (ARN) of a layer.
--   
--   <a>$sel:createdAt:Layer'</a>, <a>layer_createdAt</a> - Date when the
--   layer was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:shortname:Layer'</a>, <a>layer_shortname</a> - The layer short
--   name.
--   
--   <a>$sel:defaultRecipes:Layer'</a>, <a>layer_defaultRecipes</a> - AWS
--   OpsWorks Stacks supports five lifecycle events: <b>setup</b>,
--   <b>configuration</b>, <b>deploy</b>, <b>undeploy</b>, and
--   <b>shutdown</b>. For each layer, AWS OpsWorks Stacks runs a set of
--   standard recipes for each event. You can also provide custom recipes
--   for any or all layers and events. AWS OpsWorks Stacks runs custom
--   event recipes after the standard recipes. <tt>LayerCustomRecipes</tt>
--   specifies the custom recipes for a particular layer to be run in
--   response to each of the five events.
--   
--   To specify a recipe, use the cookbook's directory name in the
--   repository followed by two colons and the recipe name, which is the
--   recipe's file name without the <tt>.rb</tt> extension. For example:
--   <tt>phpapp2::dbsetup</tt> specifies the <tt>dbsetup.rb</tt> recipe in
--   the repository's <tt>phpapp2</tt> folder.
--   
--   <a>$sel:customRecipes:Layer'</a>, <a>layer_customRecipes</a> - A
--   <tt>LayerCustomRecipes</tt> object that specifies the layer's custom
--   recipes.
--   
--   <a>$sel:customJson:Layer'</a>, <a>layer_customJson</a> - A JSON
--   formatted string containing the layer's custom stack configuration and
--   deployment attributes.
--   
--   <a>$sel:volumeConfigurations:Layer'</a>,
--   <a>layer_volumeConfigurations</a> - A <tt>VolumeConfigurations</tt>
--   object that describes the layer's Amazon EBS volumes.
--   
--   <a>$sel:enableAutoHealing:Layer'</a>, <a>layer_enableAutoHealing</a> -
--   Whether auto healing is disabled for the layer.
--   
--   <a>$sel:packages:Layer'</a>, <a>layer_packages</a> - An array of
--   <tt>Package</tt> objects that describe the layer's packages.
--   
--   <a>$sel:attributes:Layer'</a>, <a>layer_attributes</a> - The layer
--   attributes.
--   
--   For the <tt>HaproxyStatsPassword</tt>, <tt>MysqlRootPassword</tt>, and
--   <tt>GangliaPassword</tt> attributes, AWS OpsWorks Stacks returns
--   <tt>*****FILTERED*****</tt> instead of the actual value
--   
--   For an ECS Cluster layer, AWS OpsWorks Stacks the
--   <tt>EcsClusterArn</tt> attribute is set to the cluster's ARN.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:Layer'</a>, <a>layer_name</a> - The layer name.
--   
--   <a>$sel:autoAssignPublicIps:Layer'</a>,
--   <a>layer_autoAssignPublicIps</a> - For stacks that are running in a
--   VPC, whether to automatically assign a public IP address to the
--   layer's instances. For more information, see <a>How to Edit a
--   Layer</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:type':Layer'</a>, <a>layer_type</a> - The layer type.
--   
--   <a>$sel:useEbsOptimizedInstances:Layer'</a>,
--   <a>layer_useEbsOptimizedInstances</a> - Whether the layer uses Amazon
--   EBS-optimized instances.
--   
--   <a>$sel:stackId:Layer'</a>, <a>layer_stackId</a> - The layer stack ID.
--   
--   <a>$sel:layerId:Layer'</a>, <a>layer_layerId</a> - The layer ID.
--   
--   <a>$sel:defaultSecurityGroupNames:Layer'</a>,
--   <a>layer_defaultSecurityGroupNames</a> - An array containing the
--   layer's security group names.
--   
--   <a>$sel:autoAssignElasticIps:Layer'</a>,
--   <a>layer_autoAssignElasticIps</a> - Whether to automatically assign an
--   <a>Elastic IP address</a> to the layer's instances. For more
--   information, see <a>How to Edit a Layer</a>.
newLayer :: Layer

-- | The ARN of the default IAM profile to be used for the layer's EC2
--   instances. For more information about IAM ARNs, see <a>Using
--   Identifiers</a>.
layer_customInstanceProfileArn :: Lens' Layer (Maybe Text)

-- | An array containing the layer's custom security group IDs.
layer_customSecurityGroupIds :: Lens' Layer (Maybe [Text])

-- | Whether to install operating system and package updates when the
--   instance boots. The default value is <tt>true</tt>. If this value is
--   set to <tt>false</tt>, you must then update your instances manually by
--   using CreateDeployment to run the <tt>update_dependencies</tt> stack
--   command or manually running <tt>yum</tt> (Amazon Linux) or
--   <tt>apt-get</tt> (Ubuntu) on the instances.
--   
--   We strongly recommend using the default value of <tt>true</tt>, to
--   ensure that your instances have the latest security updates.
layer_installUpdatesOnBoot :: Lens' Layer (Maybe Bool)

-- | The Amazon CloudWatch Logs configuration settings for the layer.
layer_cloudWatchLogsConfiguration :: Lens' Layer (Maybe CloudWatchLogsConfiguration)

-- | A <tt>LifeCycleEventConfiguration</tt> object that specifies the
--   Shutdown event configuration.
layer_lifecycleEventConfiguration :: Lens' Layer (Maybe LifecycleEventConfiguration)

-- | The Amazon Resource Number (ARN) of a layer.
layer_arn :: Lens' Layer (Maybe Text)

-- | Date when the layer was created.
layer_createdAt :: Lens' Layer (Maybe Text)

-- | The layer short name.
layer_shortname :: Lens' Layer (Maybe Text)

-- | AWS OpsWorks Stacks supports five lifecycle events: <b>setup</b>,
--   <b>configuration</b>, <b>deploy</b>, <b>undeploy</b>, and
--   <b>shutdown</b>. For each layer, AWS OpsWorks Stacks runs a set of
--   standard recipes for each event. You can also provide custom recipes
--   for any or all layers and events. AWS OpsWorks Stacks runs custom
--   event recipes after the standard recipes. <tt>LayerCustomRecipes</tt>
--   specifies the custom recipes for a particular layer to be run in
--   response to each of the five events.
--   
--   To specify a recipe, use the cookbook's directory name in the
--   repository followed by two colons and the recipe name, which is the
--   recipe's file name without the <tt>.rb</tt> extension. For example:
--   <tt>phpapp2::dbsetup</tt> specifies the <tt>dbsetup.rb</tt> recipe in
--   the repository's <tt>phpapp2</tt> folder.
layer_defaultRecipes :: Lens' Layer (Maybe Recipes)

-- | A <tt>LayerCustomRecipes</tt> object that specifies the layer's custom
--   recipes.
layer_customRecipes :: Lens' Layer (Maybe Recipes)

-- | A JSON formatted string containing the layer's custom stack
--   configuration and deployment attributes.
layer_customJson :: Lens' Layer (Maybe Text)

-- | A <tt>VolumeConfigurations</tt> object that describes the layer's
--   Amazon EBS volumes.
layer_volumeConfigurations :: Lens' Layer (Maybe [VolumeConfiguration])

-- | Whether auto healing is disabled for the layer.
layer_enableAutoHealing :: Lens' Layer (Maybe Bool)

-- | An array of <tt>Package</tt> objects that describe the layer's
--   packages.
layer_packages :: Lens' Layer (Maybe [Text])

-- | The layer attributes.
--   
--   For the <tt>HaproxyStatsPassword</tt>, <tt>MysqlRootPassword</tt>, and
--   <tt>GangliaPassword</tt> attributes, AWS OpsWorks Stacks returns
--   <tt>*****FILTERED*****</tt> instead of the actual value
--   
--   For an ECS Cluster layer, AWS OpsWorks Stacks the
--   <tt>EcsClusterArn</tt> attribute is set to the cluster's ARN.
layer_attributes :: Lens' Layer (Maybe (HashMap LayerAttributesKeys (Maybe Text)))

-- | The layer name.
layer_name :: Lens' Layer (Maybe Text)

-- | For stacks that are running in a VPC, whether to automatically assign
--   a public IP address to the layer's instances. For more information,
--   see <a>How to Edit a Layer</a>.
layer_autoAssignPublicIps :: Lens' Layer (Maybe Bool)

-- | The layer type.
layer_type :: Lens' Layer (Maybe LayerType)

-- | Whether the layer uses Amazon EBS-optimized instances.
layer_useEbsOptimizedInstances :: Lens' Layer (Maybe Bool)

-- | The layer stack ID.
layer_stackId :: Lens' Layer (Maybe Text)

-- | The layer ID.
layer_layerId :: Lens' Layer (Maybe Text)

-- | An array containing the layer's security group names.
layer_defaultSecurityGroupNames :: Lens' Layer (Maybe [Text])

-- | Whether to automatically assign an <a>Elastic IP address</a> to the
--   layer's instances. For more information, see <a>How to Edit a
--   Layer</a>.
layer_autoAssignElasticIps :: Lens' Layer (Maybe Bool)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.Layer.Layer
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.Layer.Layer
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.Layer.Layer
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.Layer.Layer
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.Layer.Layer
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.Layer.Layer
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.Layer.Layer


module Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.VolumeType
newtype VolumeType
VolumeType' :: Text -> VolumeType
[fromVolumeType] :: VolumeType -> Text
pattern VolumeType_Gp2 :: VolumeType
pattern VolumeType_Io1 :: VolumeType
pattern VolumeType_Standard :: VolumeType
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.ToXML Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.VolumeType.VolumeType
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.VolumeType.VolumeType
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSONKey Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.VolumeType.VolumeType
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.VolumeType.VolumeType

instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.VolumeType.VolumeType
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.VolumeType.VolumeType


module Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.EbsBlockDevice

-- | Describes an Amazon EBS volume. This data type maps directly to the
--   Amazon EC2 <a>EbsBlockDevice</a> data type.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEbsBlockDevice</a> smart constructor.
data EbsBlockDevice
EbsBlockDevice' :: Maybe Bool -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Int -> Maybe VolumeType -> Maybe Text -> EbsBlockDevice

-- | Whether the volume is deleted on instance termination.
[$sel:deleteOnTermination:EbsBlockDevice'] :: EbsBlockDevice -> Maybe Bool

-- | The volume size, in GiB. For more information, see
--   <a>EbsBlockDevice</a>.
[$sel:volumeSize:EbsBlockDevice'] :: EbsBlockDevice -> Maybe Int

-- | The number of I/O operations per second (IOPS) that the volume
--   supports. For more information, see <a>EbsBlockDevice</a>.
[$sel:iops:EbsBlockDevice'] :: EbsBlockDevice -> Maybe Int

-- | The volume type. <tt>gp2</tt> for General Purpose (SSD) volumes,
--   <tt>io1</tt> for Provisioned IOPS (SSD) volumes, <tt>st1</tt> for
--   Throughput Optimized hard disk drives (HDD), <tt>sc1</tt> for Cold
--   HDD,and <tt>standard</tt> for Magnetic volumes.
--   
--   If you specify the <tt>io1</tt> volume type, you must also specify a
--   value for the <tt>Iops</tt> attribute. The maximum ratio of
--   provisioned IOPS to requested volume size (in GiB) is 50:1. AWS uses
--   the default volume size (in GiB) specified in the AMI attributes to
--   set IOPS to 50 x (volume size).
[$sel:volumeType:EbsBlockDevice'] :: EbsBlockDevice -> Maybe VolumeType

-- | The snapshot ID.
[$sel:snapshotId:EbsBlockDevice'] :: EbsBlockDevice -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>EbsBlockDevice</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:deleteOnTermination:EbsBlockDevice'</a>,
--   <a>ebsBlockDevice_deleteOnTermination</a> - Whether the volume is
--   deleted on instance termination.
--   
--   <a>$sel:volumeSize:EbsBlockDevice'</a>,
--   <a>ebsBlockDevice_volumeSize</a> - The volume size, in GiB. For more
--   information, see <a>EbsBlockDevice</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:iops:EbsBlockDevice'</a>, <a>ebsBlockDevice_iops</a> - The
--   number of I/O operations per second (IOPS) that the volume supports.
--   For more information, see <a>EbsBlockDevice</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:volumeType:EbsBlockDevice'</a>,
--   <a>ebsBlockDevice_volumeType</a> - The volume type. <tt>gp2</tt> for
--   General Purpose (SSD) volumes, <tt>io1</tt> for Provisioned IOPS (SSD)
--   volumes, <tt>st1</tt> for Throughput Optimized hard disk drives (HDD),
--   <tt>sc1</tt> for Cold HDD,and <tt>standard</tt> for Magnetic volumes.
--   
--   If you specify the <tt>io1</tt> volume type, you must also specify a
--   value for the <tt>Iops</tt> attribute. The maximum ratio of
--   provisioned IOPS to requested volume size (in GiB) is 50:1. AWS uses
--   the default volume size (in GiB) specified in the AMI attributes to
--   set IOPS to 50 x (volume size).
--   
--   <a>$sel:snapshotId:EbsBlockDevice'</a>,
--   <a>ebsBlockDevice_snapshotId</a> - The snapshot ID.
newEbsBlockDevice :: EbsBlockDevice

-- | Whether the volume is deleted on instance termination.
ebsBlockDevice_deleteOnTermination :: Lens' EbsBlockDevice (Maybe Bool)

-- | The volume size, in GiB. For more information, see
--   <a>EbsBlockDevice</a>.
ebsBlockDevice_volumeSize :: Lens' EbsBlockDevice (Maybe Int)

-- | The number of I/O operations per second (IOPS) that the volume
--   supports. For more information, see <a>EbsBlockDevice</a>.
ebsBlockDevice_iops :: Lens' EbsBlockDevice (Maybe Int)

-- | The volume type. <tt>gp2</tt> for General Purpose (SSD) volumes,
--   <tt>io1</tt> for Provisioned IOPS (SSD) volumes, <tt>st1</tt> for
--   Throughput Optimized hard disk drives (HDD), <tt>sc1</tt> for Cold
--   HDD,and <tt>standard</tt> for Magnetic volumes.
--   
--   If you specify the <tt>io1</tt> volume type, you must also specify a
--   value for the <tt>Iops</tt> attribute. The maximum ratio of
--   provisioned IOPS to requested volume size (in GiB) is 50:1. AWS uses
--   the default volume size (in GiB) specified in the AMI attributes to
--   set IOPS to 50 x (volume size).
ebsBlockDevice_volumeType :: Lens' EbsBlockDevice (Maybe VolumeType)

-- | The snapshot ID.
ebsBlockDevice_snapshotId :: Lens' EbsBlockDevice (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.EbsBlockDevice.EbsBlockDevice
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.EbsBlockDevice.EbsBlockDevice
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.EbsBlockDevice.EbsBlockDevice
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.EbsBlockDevice.EbsBlockDevice
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.EbsBlockDevice.EbsBlockDevice
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.EbsBlockDevice.EbsBlockDevice
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.EbsBlockDevice.EbsBlockDevice
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.EbsBlockDevice.EbsBlockDevice


module Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.BlockDeviceMapping

-- | Describes a block device mapping. This data type maps directly to the
--   Amazon EC2 <a>BlockDeviceMapping</a> data type.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newBlockDeviceMapping</a> smart constructor.
data BlockDeviceMapping
BlockDeviceMapping' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe EbsBlockDevice -> Maybe Text -> BlockDeviceMapping

-- | The virtual device name. For more information, see
--   <a>BlockDeviceMapping</a>.
[$sel:virtualName:BlockDeviceMapping'] :: BlockDeviceMapping -> Maybe Text

-- | Suppresses the specified device included in the AMI's block device
--   mapping.
[$sel:noDevice:BlockDeviceMapping'] :: BlockDeviceMapping -> Maybe Text

-- | An <tt>EBSBlockDevice</tt> that defines how to configure an Amazon EBS
--   volume when the instance is launched.
[$sel:ebs:BlockDeviceMapping'] :: BlockDeviceMapping -> Maybe EbsBlockDevice

-- | The device name that is exposed to the instance, such as
--   <tt>/dev/sdh</tt>. For the root device, you can use the explicit
--   device name or you can set this parameter to <tt>ROOT_DEVICE</tt> and
--   AWS OpsWorks Stacks will provide the correct device name.
[$sel:deviceName:BlockDeviceMapping'] :: BlockDeviceMapping -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>BlockDeviceMapping</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:virtualName:BlockDeviceMapping'</a>,
--   <a>blockDeviceMapping_virtualName</a> - The virtual device name. For
--   more information, see <a>BlockDeviceMapping</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:noDevice:BlockDeviceMapping'</a>,
--   <a>blockDeviceMapping_noDevice</a> - Suppresses the specified device
--   included in the AMI's block device mapping.
--   
--   <a>$sel:ebs:BlockDeviceMapping'</a>, <a>blockDeviceMapping_ebs</a> -
--   An <tt>EBSBlockDevice</tt> that defines how to configure an Amazon EBS
--   volume when the instance is launched.
--   
--   <a>$sel:deviceName:BlockDeviceMapping'</a>,
--   <a>blockDeviceMapping_deviceName</a> - The device name that is exposed
--   to the instance, such as <tt>/dev/sdh</tt>. For the root device, you
--   can use the explicit device name or you can set this parameter to
--   <tt>ROOT_DEVICE</tt> and AWS OpsWorks Stacks will provide the correct
--   device name.
newBlockDeviceMapping :: BlockDeviceMapping

-- | The virtual device name. For more information, see
--   <a>BlockDeviceMapping</a>.
blockDeviceMapping_virtualName :: Lens' BlockDeviceMapping (Maybe Text)

-- | Suppresses the specified device included in the AMI's block device
--   mapping.
blockDeviceMapping_noDevice :: Lens' BlockDeviceMapping (Maybe Text)

-- | An <tt>EBSBlockDevice</tt> that defines how to configure an Amazon EBS
--   volume when the instance is launched.
blockDeviceMapping_ebs :: Lens' BlockDeviceMapping (Maybe EbsBlockDevice)

-- | The device name that is exposed to the instance, such as
--   <tt>/dev/sdh</tt>. For the root device, you can use the explicit
--   device name or you can set this parameter to <tt>ROOT_DEVICE</tt> and
--   AWS OpsWorks Stacks will provide the correct device name.
blockDeviceMapping_deviceName :: Lens' BlockDeviceMapping (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.BlockDeviceMapping.BlockDeviceMapping
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.BlockDeviceMapping.BlockDeviceMapping
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.BlockDeviceMapping.BlockDeviceMapping
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.BlockDeviceMapping.BlockDeviceMapping
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.BlockDeviceMapping.BlockDeviceMapping
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.BlockDeviceMapping.BlockDeviceMapping
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.BlockDeviceMapping.BlockDeviceMapping
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.BlockDeviceMapping.BlockDeviceMapping


module Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.Instance

-- | Describes an instance.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newInstance</a> smart constructor.
data Instance
Instance' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe VirtualizationType -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe AutoScalingType -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Architecture -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ReportedOs -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe RootDeviceType -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [BlockDeviceMapping] -> Instance

-- | The instance's private DNS name.
[$sel:privateDns:Instance'] :: Instance -> Maybe Text

-- | The instance's reported AWS OpsWorks Stacks agent version.
[$sel:reportedAgentVersion:Instance'] :: Instance -> Maybe Text

-- | The instance ID.
[$sel:instanceId:Instance'] :: Instance -> Maybe Text

-- | The instance status:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><pre>booting</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>connection_lost</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>online</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>pending</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>rebooting</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>requested</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>running_setup</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>setup_failed</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>shutting_down</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>start_failed</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>stop_failed</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>stopped</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>stopping</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>terminated</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>terminating</pre></li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:status:Instance'] :: Instance -> Maybe Text

-- | The instance's private IP address.
[$sel:privateIp:Instance'] :: Instance -> Maybe Text

-- | Whether to install operating system and package updates when the
--   instance boots. The default value is <tt>true</tt>. If this value is
--   set to <tt>false</tt>, you must then update your instances manually by
--   using CreateDeployment to run the <tt>update_dependencies</tt> stack
--   command or by manually running <tt>yum</tt> (Amazon Linux) or
--   <tt>apt-get</tt> (Ubuntu) on the instances.
--   
--   We strongly recommend using the default value of <tt>true</tt>, to
--   ensure that your instances have the latest security updates.
[$sel:installUpdatesOnBoot:Instance'] :: Instance -> Maybe Bool

-- | The instance's virtualization type: <tt>paravirtual</tt> or
--   <tt>hvm</tt>.
[$sel:virtualizationType:Instance'] :: Instance -> Maybe VirtualizationType

-- | The ARN of the instance's IAM profile. For more information about IAM
--   ARNs, see <a>Using Identifiers</a>.
[$sel:instanceProfileArn:Instance'] :: Instance -> Maybe Text

-- | The instance's platform.
[$sel:platform:Instance'] :: Instance -> Maybe Text

-- | The instance host name.
[$sel:hostname:Instance'] :: Instance -> Maybe Text

-- | The SSH key's RSA fingerprint.
[$sel:sshHostRsaKeyFingerprint:Instance'] :: Instance -> Maybe Text

-- | An array containing the instance security group IDs.
[$sel:securityGroupIds:Instance'] :: Instance -> Maybe [Text]

-- | For container instances, the Amazon ECS cluster's ARN.
[$sel:ecsClusterArn:Instance'] :: Instance -> Maybe Text

-- | The instance's Amazon Resource Number (ARN).
[$sel:arn:Instance'] :: Instance -> Maybe Text

-- | The time that the instance was created.
[$sel:createdAt:Instance'] :: Instance -> Maybe Text

-- | The ID of the associated Amazon EC2 instance.
[$sel:ec2InstanceId:Instance'] :: Instance -> Maybe Text

-- | The instance's Amazon EC2 key-pair name.
[$sel:sshKeyName:Instance'] :: Instance -> Maybe Text

-- | The agent version. This parameter is set to <tt>INHERIT</tt> if the
--   instance inherits the default stack setting or to a a version number
--   for a fixed agent version.
[$sel:agentVersion:Instance'] :: Instance -> Maybe Text

-- | The root device volume ID.
[$sel:rootDeviceVolumeId:Instance'] :: Instance -> Maybe Text

-- | The instance's subnet ID; applicable only if the stack is running in a
--   VPC.
[$sel:subnetId:Instance'] :: Instance -> Maybe Text

-- | For registered instances, the infrastructure class: <tt>ec2</tt> or
--   <tt>on-premises</tt>.
[$sel:infrastructureClass:Instance'] :: Instance -> Maybe Text

-- | The SSH key's Deep Security Agent (DSA) fingerprint.
[$sel:sshHostDsaKeyFingerprint:Instance'] :: Instance -> Maybe Text

-- | The instance type, such as <tt>t2.micro</tt>.
[$sel:instanceType:Instance'] :: Instance -> Maybe Text

-- | Whether this is an Amazon EBS-optimized instance.
[$sel:ebsOptimized:Instance'] :: Instance -> Maybe Bool

-- | The instance <a>Elastic IP address</a> .
[$sel:elasticIp:Instance'] :: Instance -> Maybe Text

-- | The instance's operating system.
[$sel:os:Instance'] :: Instance -> Maybe Text

-- | The instance Availability Zone. For more information, see <a>Regions
--   and Endpoints</a>.
[$sel:availabilityZone:Instance'] :: Instance -> Maybe Text

-- | The ID of the last service error. For more information, call
--   DescribeServiceErrors.
[$sel:lastServiceErrorId:Instance'] :: Instance -> Maybe Text

-- | The instance's tenancy option, such as <tt>dedicated</tt> or
--   <tt>host</tt>.
[$sel:tenancy:Instance'] :: Instance -> Maybe Text

-- | For load-based or time-based instances, the type.
[$sel:autoScalingType:Instance'] :: Instance -> Maybe AutoScalingType

-- | An array containing the instance layer IDs.
[$sel:layerIds:Instance'] :: Instance -> Maybe [Text]

-- | The instance architecture: "i386" or "x86_64".
[$sel:architecture:Instance'] :: Instance -> Maybe Architecture

-- | The instance public DNS name.
[$sel:publicDns:Instance'] :: Instance -> Maybe Text

-- | A custom AMI ID to be used to create the instance. For more
--   information, see <a>Instances</a>
[$sel:amiId:Instance'] :: Instance -> Maybe Text

-- | The instance public IP address.
[$sel:publicIp:Instance'] :: Instance -> Maybe Text

-- | For registered instances, the reported operating system.
[$sel:reportedOs:Instance'] :: Instance -> Maybe ReportedOs

-- | For registered instances, who performed the registration.
[$sel:registeredBy:Instance'] :: Instance -> Maybe Text

-- | The stack ID.
[$sel:stackId:Instance'] :: Instance -> Maybe Text

-- | The instance's root device type. For more information, see <a>Storage
--   for the Root Device</a>.
[$sel:rootDeviceType:Instance'] :: Instance -> Maybe RootDeviceType

-- | For container instances, the instance's ARN.
[$sel:ecsContainerInstanceArn:Instance'] :: Instance -> Maybe Text

-- | An array of <tt>BlockDeviceMapping</tt> objects that specify the
--   instance's block device mappings.
[$sel:blockDeviceMappings:Instance'] :: Instance -> Maybe [BlockDeviceMapping]

-- | Create a value of <a>Instance</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:privateDns:Instance'</a>, <a>instance_privateDns</a> - The
--   instance's private DNS name.
--   
--   <a>$sel:reportedAgentVersion:Instance'</a>,
--   <a>instance_reportedAgentVersion</a> - The instance's reported AWS
--   OpsWorks Stacks agent version.
--   
--   <a>$sel:instanceId:Instance'</a>, <a>instance_instanceId</a> - The
--   instance ID.
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:Instance'</a>, <a>instance_status</a> - The instance
--   status:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><pre>booting</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>connection_lost</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>online</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>pending</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>rebooting</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>requested</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>running_setup</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>setup_failed</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>shutting_down</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>start_failed</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>stop_failed</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>stopped</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>stopping</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>terminated</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>terminating</pre></li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:privateIp:Instance'</a>, <a>instance_privateIp</a> - The
--   instance's private IP address.
--   
--   <a>$sel:installUpdatesOnBoot:Instance'</a>,
--   <a>instance_installUpdatesOnBoot</a> - Whether to install operating
--   system and package updates when the instance boots. The default value
--   is <tt>true</tt>. If this value is set to <tt>false</tt>, you must
--   then update your instances manually by using CreateDeployment to run
--   the <tt>update_dependencies</tt> stack command or by manually running
--   <tt>yum</tt> (Amazon Linux) or <tt>apt-get</tt> (Ubuntu) on the
--   instances.
--   
--   We strongly recommend using the default value of <tt>true</tt>, to
--   ensure that your instances have the latest security updates.
--   
--   <a>$sel:virtualizationType:Instance'</a>,
--   <a>instance_virtualizationType</a> - The instance's virtualization
--   type: <tt>paravirtual</tt> or <tt>hvm</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:instanceProfileArn:Instance'</a>,
--   <a>instance_instanceProfileArn</a> - The ARN of the instance's IAM
--   profile. For more information about IAM ARNs, see <a>Using
--   Identifiers</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:platform:Instance'</a>, <a>instance_platform</a> - The
--   instance's platform.
--   
--   <a>$sel:hostname:Instance'</a>, <a>instance_hostname</a> - The
--   instance host name.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sshHostRsaKeyFingerprint:Instance'</a>,
--   <a>instance_sshHostRsaKeyFingerprint</a> - The SSH key's RSA
--   fingerprint.
--   
--   <a>$sel:securityGroupIds:Instance'</a>,
--   <a>instance_securityGroupIds</a> - An array containing the instance
--   security group IDs.
--   
--   <a>$sel:ecsClusterArn:Instance'</a>, <a>instance_ecsClusterArn</a> -
--   For container instances, the Amazon ECS cluster's ARN.
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:Instance'</a>, <a>instance_arn</a> - The instance's Amazon
--   Resource Number (ARN).
--   
--   <a>$sel:createdAt:Instance'</a>, <a>instance_createdAt</a> - The time
--   that the instance was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:ec2InstanceId:Instance'</a>, <a>instance_ec2InstanceId</a> -
--   The ID of the associated Amazon EC2 instance.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sshKeyName:Instance'</a>, <a>instance_sshKeyName</a> - The
--   instance's Amazon EC2 key-pair name.
--   
--   <a>$sel:agentVersion:Instance'</a>, <a>instance_agentVersion</a> - The
--   agent version. This parameter is set to <tt>INHERIT</tt> if the
--   instance inherits the default stack setting or to a a version number
--   for a fixed agent version.
--   
--   <a>$sel:rootDeviceVolumeId:Instance'</a>,
--   <a>instance_rootDeviceVolumeId</a> - The root device volume ID.
--   
--   <a>$sel:subnetId:Instance'</a>, <a>instance_subnetId</a> - The
--   instance's subnet ID; applicable only if the stack is running in a
--   VPC.
--   
--   <a>$sel:infrastructureClass:Instance'</a>,
--   <a>instance_infrastructureClass</a> - For registered instances, the
--   infrastructure class: <tt>ec2</tt> or <tt>on-premises</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sshHostDsaKeyFingerprint:Instance'</a>,
--   <a>instance_sshHostDsaKeyFingerprint</a> - The SSH key's Deep Security
--   Agent (DSA) fingerprint.
--   
--   <a>$sel:instanceType:Instance'</a>, <a>instance_instanceType</a> - The
--   instance type, such as <tt>t2.micro</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:ebsOptimized:Instance'</a>, <a>instance_ebsOptimized</a> -
--   Whether this is an Amazon EBS-optimized instance.
--   
--   <a>$sel:elasticIp:Instance'</a>, <a>instance_elasticIp</a> - The
--   instance <a>Elastic IP address</a> .
--   
--   <a>$sel:os:Instance'</a>, <a>instance_os</a> - The instance's
--   operating system.
--   
--   <a>$sel:availabilityZone:Instance'</a>,
--   <a>instance_availabilityZone</a> - The instance Availability Zone. For
--   more information, see <a>Regions and Endpoints</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastServiceErrorId:Instance'</a>,
--   <a>instance_lastServiceErrorId</a> - The ID of the last service error.
--   For more information, call DescribeServiceErrors.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tenancy:Instance'</a>, <a>instance_tenancy</a> - The
--   instance's tenancy option, such as <tt>dedicated</tt> or
--   <tt>host</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:autoScalingType:Instance'</a>, <a>instance_autoScalingType</a>
--   - For load-based or time-based instances, the type.
--   
--   <a>$sel:layerIds:Instance'</a>, <a>instance_layerIds</a> - An array
--   containing the instance layer IDs.
--   
--   <a>$sel:architecture:Instance'</a>, <a>instance_architecture</a> - The
--   instance architecture: "i386" or "x86_64".
--   
--   <a>$sel:publicDns:Instance'</a>, <a>instance_publicDns</a> - The
--   instance public DNS name.
--   
--   <a>$sel:amiId:Instance'</a>, <a>instance_amiId</a> - A custom AMI ID
--   to be used to create the instance. For more information, see
--   <a>Instances</a>
--   
--   <a>$sel:publicIp:Instance'</a>, <a>instance_publicIp</a> - The
--   instance public IP address.
--   
--   <a>$sel:reportedOs:Instance'</a>, <a>instance_reportedOs</a> - For
--   registered instances, the reported operating system.
--   
--   <a>$sel:registeredBy:Instance'</a>, <a>instance_registeredBy</a> - For
--   registered instances, who performed the registration.
--   
--   <a>$sel:stackId:Instance'</a>, <a>instance_stackId</a> - The stack ID.
--   
--   <a>$sel:rootDeviceType:Instance'</a>, <a>instance_rootDeviceType</a> -
--   The instance's root device type. For more information, see <a>Storage
--   for the Root Device</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:ecsContainerInstanceArn:Instance'</a>,
--   <a>instance_ecsContainerInstanceArn</a> - For container instances, the
--   instance's ARN.
--   
--   <a>$sel:blockDeviceMappings:Instance'</a>,
--   <a>instance_blockDeviceMappings</a> - An array of
--   <tt>BlockDeviceMapping</tt> objects that specify the instance's block
--   device mappings.
newInstance :: Instance

-- | The instance's private DNS name.
instance_privateDns :: Lens' Instance (Maybe Text)

-- | The instance's reported AWS OpsWorks Stacks agent version.
instance_reportedAgentVersion :: Lens' Instance (Maybe Text)

-- | The instance ID.
instance_instanceId :: Lens' Instance (Maybe Text)

-- | The instance status:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><pre>booting</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>connection_lost</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>online</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>pending</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>rebooting</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>requested</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>running_setup</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>setup_failed</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>shutting_down</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>start_failed</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>stop_failed</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>stopped</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>stopping</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>terminated</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>terminating</pre></li>
--   </ul>
instance_status :: Lens' Instance (Maybe Text)

-- | The instance's private IP address.
instance_privateIp :: Lens' Instance (Maybe Text)

-- | Whether to install operating system and package updates when the
--   instance boots. The default value is <tt>true</tt>. If this value is
--   set to <tt>false</tt>, you must then update your instances manually by
--   using CreateDeployment to run the <tt>update_dependencies</tt> stack
--   command or by manually running <tt>yum</tt> (Amazon Linux) or
--   <tt>apt-get</tt> (Ubuntu) on the instances.
--   
--   We strongly recommend using the default value of <tt>true</tt>, to
--   ensure that your instances have the latest security updates.
instance_installUpdatesOnBoot :: Lens' Instance (Maybe Bool)

-- | The instance's virtualization type: <tt>paravirtual</tt> or
--   <tt>hvm</tt>.
instance_virtualizationType :: Lens' Instance (Maybe VirtualizationType)

-- | The ARN of the instance's IAM profile. For more information about IAM
--   ARNs, see <a>Using Identifiers</a>.
instance_instanceProfileArn :: Lens' Instance (Maybe Text)

-- | The instance's platform.
instance_platform :: Lens' Instance (Maybe Text)

-- | The instance host name.
instance_hostname :: Lens' Instance (Maybe Text)

-- | The SSH key's RSA fingerprint.
instance_sshHostRsaKeyFingerprint :: Lens' Instance (Maybe Text)

-- | An array containing the instance security group IDs.
instance_securityGroupIds :: Lens' Instance (Maybe [Text])

-- | For container instances, the Amazon ECS cluster's ARN.
instance_ecsClusterArn :: Lens' Instance (Maybe Text)

-- | The instance's Amazon Resource Number (ARN).
instance_arn :: Lens' Instance (Maybe Text)

-- | The time that the instance was created.
instance_createdAt :: Lens' Instance (Maybe Text)

-- | The ID of the associated Amazon EC2 instance.
instance_ec2InstanceId :: Lens' Instance (Maybe Text)

-- | The instance's Amazon EC2 key-pair name.
instance_sshKeyName :: Lens' Instance (Maybe Text)

-- | The agent version. This parameter is set to <tt>INHERIT</tt> if the
--   instance inherits the default stack setting or to a a version number
--   for a fixed agent version.
instance_agentVersion :: Lens' Instance (Maybe Text)

-- | The root device volume ID.
instance_rootDeviceVolumeId :: Lens' Instance (Maybe Text)

-- | The instance's subnet ID; applicable only if the stack is running in a
--   VPC.
instance_subnetId :: Lens' Instance (Maybe Text)

-- | For registered instances, the infrastructure class: <tt>ec2</tt> or
--   <tt>on-premises</tt>.
instance_infrastructureClass :: Lens' Instance (Maybe Text)

-- | The SSH key's Deep Security Agent (DSA) fingerprint.
instance_sshHostDsaKeyFingerprint :: Lens' Instance (Maybe Text)

-- | The instance type, such as <tt>t2.micro</tt>.
instance_instanceType :: Lens' Instance (Maybe Text)

-- | Whether this is an Amazon EBS-optimized instance.
instance_ebsOptimized :: Lens' Instance (Maybe Bool)

-- | The instance <a>Elastic IP address</a> .
instance_elasticIp :: Lens' Instance (Maybe Text)

-- | The instance's operating system.
instance_os :: Lens' Instance (Maybe Text)

-- | The instance Availability Zone. For more information, see <a>Regions
--   and Endpoints</a>.
instance_availabilityZone :: Lens' Instance (Maybe Text)

-- | The ID of the last service error. For more information, call
--   DescribeServiceErrors.
instance_lastServiceErrorId :: Lens' Instance (Maybe Text)

-- | The instance's tenancy option, such as <tt>dedicated</tt> or
--   <tt>host</tt>.
instance_tenancy :: Lens' Instance (Maybe Text)

-- | For load-based or time-based instances, the type.
instance_autoScalingType :: Lens' Instance (Maybe AutoScalingType)

-- | An array containing the instance layer IDs.
instance_layerIds :: Lens' Instance (Maybe [Text])

-- | The instance architecture: "i386" or "x86_64".
instance_architecture :: Lens' Instance (Maybe Architecture)

-- | The instance public DNS name.
instance_publicDns :: Lens' Instance (Maybe Text)

-- | A custom AMI ID to be used to create the instance. For more
--   information, see <a>Instances</a>
instance_amiId :: Lens' Instance (Maybe Text)

-- | The instance public IP address.
instance_publicIp :: Lens' Instance (Maybe Text)

-- | For registered instances, the reported operating system.
instance_reportedOs :: Lens' Instance (Maybe ReportedOs)

-- | For registered instances, who performed the registration.
instance_registeredBy :: Lens' Instance (Maybe Text)

-- | The stack ID.
instance_stackId :: Lens' Instance (Maybe Text)

-- | The instance's root device type. For more information, see <a>Storage
--   for the Root Device</a>.
instance_rootDeviceType :: Lens' Instance (Maybe RootDeviceType)

-- | For container instances, the instance's ARN.
instance_ecsContainerInstanceArn :: Lens' Instance (Maybe Text)

-- | An array of <tt>BlockDeviceMapping</tt> objects that specify the
--   instance's block device mappings.
instance_blockDeviceMappings :: Lens' Instance (Maybe [BlockDeviceMapping])
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.Instance.Instance
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.Instance.Instance
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.Instance.Instance
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.Instance.Instance
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.Instance.Instance
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.Instance.Instance
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.Instance.Instance


module Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.WeeklyAutoScalingSchedule

-- | Describes a time-based instance's auto scaling schedule. The schedule
--   consists of a set of key-value pairs.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>The key is the time period (a UTC hour) and must be an integer
--   from 0 - 23.</li>
--   <li>The value indicates whether the instance should be online or
--   offline for the specified period, and must be set to "on" or
--   "off"</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   The default setting for all time periods is off, so you use the
--   following parameters primarily to specify the online periods. You
--   don't have to explicitly specify offline periods unless you want to
--   change an online period to an offline period.
--   
--   The following example specifies that the instance should be online for
--   four hours, from UTC 1200 - 1600. It will be off for the remainder of
--   the day.
--   
--   <pre>
--   { "12":"on", "13":"on", "14":"on", "15":"on" }
--   </pre>
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newWeeklyAutoScalingSchedule</a> smart constructor.
data WeeklyAutoScalingSchedule
WeeklyAutoScalingSchedule' :: Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> WeeklyAutoScalingSchedule

-- | The schedule for Thursday.
[$sel:thursday:WeeklyAutoScalingSchedule'] :: WeeklyAutoScalingSchedule -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text)

-- | The schedule for Wednesday.
[$sel:wednesday:WeeklyAutoScalingSchedule'] :: WeeklyAutoScalingSchedule -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text)

-- | The schedule for Saturday.
[$sel:saturday:WeeklyAutoScalingSchedule'] :: WeeklyAutoScalingSchedule -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text)

-- | The schedule for Monday.
[$sel:monday:WeeklyAutoScalingSchedule'] :: WeeklyAutoScalingSchedule -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text)

-- | The schedule for Friday.
[$sel:friday:WeeklyAutoScalingSchedule'] :: WeeklyAutoScalingSchedule -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text)

-- | The schedule for Sunday.
[$sel:sunday:WeeklyAutoScalingSchedule'] :: WeeklyAutoScalingSchedule -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text)

-- | The schedule for Tuesday.
[$sel:tuesday:WeeklyAutoScalingSchedule'] :: WeeklyAutoScalingSchedule -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text)

-- | Create a value of <a>WeeklyAutoScalingSchedule</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:thursday:WeeklyAutoScalingSchedule'</a>,
--   <a>weeklyAutoScalingSchedule_thursday</a> - The schedule for Thursday.
--   
--   <a>$sel:wednesday:WeeklyAutoScalingSchedule'</a>,
--   <a>weeklyAutoScalingSchedule_wednesday</a> - The schedule for
--   Wednesday.
--   
--   <a>$sel:saturday:WeeklyAutoScalingSchedule'</a>,
--   <a>weeklyAutoScalingSchedule_saturday</a> - The schedule for Saturday.
--   
--   <a>$sel:monday:WeeklyAutoScalingSchedule'</a>,
--   <a>weeklyAutoScalingSchedule_monday</a> - The schedule for Monday.
--   
--   <a>$sel:friday:WeeklyAutoScalingSchedule'</a>,
--   <a>weeklyAutoScalingSchedule_friday</a> - The schedule for Friday.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sunday:WeeklyAutoScalingSchedule'</a>,
--   <a>weeklyAutoScalingSchedule_sunday</a> - The schedule for Sunday.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tuesday:WeeklyAutoScalingSchedule'</a>,
--   <a>weeklyAutoScalingSchedule_tuesday</a> - The schedule for Tuesday.
newWeeklyAutoScalingSchedule :: WeeklyAutoScalingSchedule

-- | The schedule for Thursday.
weeklyAutoScalingSchedule_thursday :: Lens' WeeklyAutoScalingSchedule (Maybe (HashMap Text Text))

-- | The schedule for Wednesday.
weeklyAutoScalingSchedule_wednesday :: Lens' WeeklyAutoScalingSchedule (Maybe (HashMap Text Text))

-- | The schedule for Saturday.
weeklyAutoScalingSchedule_saturday :: Lens' WeeklyAutoScalingSchedule (Maybe (HashMap Text Text))

-- | The schedule for Monday.
weeklyAutoScalingSchedule_monday :: Lens' WeeklyAutoScalingSchedule (Maybe (HashMap Text Text))

-- | The schedule for Friday.
weeklyAutoScalingSchedule_friday :: Lens' WeeklyAutoScalingSchedule (Maybe (HashMap Text Text))

-- | The schedule for Sunday.
weeklyAutoScalingSchedule_sunday :: Lens' WeeklyAutoScalingSchedule (Maybe (HashMap Text Text))

-- | The schedule for Tuesday.
weeklyAutoScalingSchedule_tuesday :: Lens' WeeklyAutoScalingSchedule (Maybe (HashMap Text Text))
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.WeeklyAutoScalingSchedule.WeeklyAutoScalingSchedule
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.WeeklyAutoScalingSchedule.WeeklyAutoScalingSchedule
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.WeeklyAutoScalingSchedule.WeeklyAutoScalingSchedule
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.WeeklyAutoScalingSchedule.WeeklyAutoScalingSchedule
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.WeeklyAutoScalingSchedule.WeeklyAutoScalingSchedule
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.WeeklyAutoScalingSchedule.WeeklyAutoScalingSchedule
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.WeeklyAutoScalingSchedule.WeeklyAutoScalingSchedule
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.WeeklyAutoScalingSchedule.WeeklyAutoScalingSchedule


module Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.TimeBasedAutoScalingConfiguration

-- | Describes an instance's time-based auto scaling configuration.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTimeBasedAutoScalingConfiguration</a> smart
--   constructor.
data TimeBasedAutoScalingConfiguration
TimeBasedAutoScalingConfiguration' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe WeeklyAutoScalingSchedule -> TimeBasedAutoScalingConfiguration

-- | The instance ID.
[$sel:instanceId:TimeBasedAutoScalingConfiguration'] :: TimeBasedAutoScalingConfiguration -> Maybe Text

-- | A <tt>WeeklyAutoScalingSchedule</tt> object with the instance
--   schedule.
[$sel:autoScalingSchedule:TimeBasedAutoScalingConfiguration'] :: TimeBasedAutoScalingConfiguration -> Maybe WeeklyAutoScalingSchedule

-- | Create a value of <a>TimeBasedAutoScalingConfiguration</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:instanceId:TimeBasedAutoScalingConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>timeBasedAutoScalingConfiguration_instanceId</a> - The instance ID.
--   
--   <a>$sel:autoScalingSchedule:TimeBasedAutoScalingConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>timeBasedAutoScalingConfiguration_autoScalingSchedule</a> - A
--   <tt>WeeklyAutoScalingSchedule</tt> object with the instance schedule.
newTimeBasedAutoScalingConfiguration :: TimeBasedAutoScalingConfiguration

-- | The instance ID.
timeBasedAutoScalingConfiguration_instanceId :: Lens' TimeBasedAutoScalingConfiguration (Maybe Text)

-- | A <tt>WeeklyAutoScalingSchedule</tt> object with the instance
--   schedule.
timeBasedAutoScalingConfiguration_autoScalingSchedule :: Lens' TimeBasedAutoScalingConfiguration (Maybe WeeklyAutoScalingSchedule)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.TimeBasedAutoScalingConfiguration.TimeBasedAutoScalingConfiguration
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.TimeBasedAutoScalingConfiguration.TimeBasedAutoScalingConfiguration
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.TimeBasedAutoScalingConfiguration.TimeBasedAutoScalingConfiguration
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.TimeBasedAutoScalingConfiguration.TimeBasedAutoScalingConfiguration
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.TimeBasedAutoScalingConfiguration.TimeBasedAutoScalingConfiguration
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.TimeBasedAutoScalingConfiguration.TimeBasedAutoScalingConfiguration
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Types.TimeBasedAutoScalingConfiguration.TimeBasedAutoScalingConfiguration

--   configuration.
defaultService :: Service

_ResourceNotFoundException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | Specifies the encoding of the log file so that the file can be read
--   correctly. The default is <tt>utf_8</tt>. Encodings supported by
--   Python <tt>codecs.decode()</tt> can be used here.

-- | Specifies where to start to read data (start_of_file or end_of_file).
--   The default is start_of_file. It's only used if there is no state
--   persisted for that log stream.
newtype CloudWatchLogsInitialPosition
CloudWatchLogsInitialPosition' :: Text -> CloudWatchLogsInitialPosition
[fromCloudWatchLogsInitialPosition] :: CloudWatchLogsInitialPosition -> Text
pattern CloudWatchLogsInitialPosition_End_of_file :: CloudWatchLogsInitialPosition
pattern CloudWatchLogsInitialPosition_Start_of_file :: CloudWatchLogsInitialPosition

-- | The preferred time zone for logs streamed to CloudWatch Logs. Valid
--   values are <tt>LOCAL</tt> and <tt>UTC</tt>, for Coordinated Universal
--   Time.
newtype CloudWatchLogsTimeZone
CloudWatchLogsTimeZone' :: Text -> CloudWatchLogsTimeZone
[fromCloudWatchLogsTimeZone] :: CloudWatchLogsTimeZone -> Text
pattern CloudWatchLogsTimeZone_LOCAL :: CloudWatchLogsTimeZone
pattern CloudWatchLogsTimeZone_UTC :: CloudWatchLogsTimeZone
