-- | Describes an agent version.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAgentVersion</a> smart constructor.
data AgentVersion
AgentVersion' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe StackConfigurationManager -> AgentVersion

-- | The agent version.
[$sel:version:AgentVersion'] :: AgentVersion -> Maybe Text

-- | The configuration manager.
[$sel:configurationManager:AgentVersion'] :: AgentVersion -> Maybe StackConfigurationManager

-- | Create a value of <a>AgentVersion</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:version:AgentVersion'</a>, <a>agentVersion_version</a> - The
--   agent version.
--   
--   <a>$sel:configurationManager:AgentVersion'</a>,
--   <a>agentVersion_configurationManager</a> - The configuration manager.
newAgentVersion :: AgentVersion

-- | The agent version.
agentVersion_version :: Lens' AgentVersion (Maybe Text)

-- | The configuration manager.
agentVersion_configurationManager :: Lens' AgentVersion (Maybe StackConfigurationManager)

-- | A description of the app.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newApp</a> smart constructor.
data App
App' :: Maybe SslConfiguration -> Maybe [EnvironmentVariable] -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [DataSource] -> Maybe Source -> Maybe Text -> Maybe (HashMap AppAttributesKeys Text) -> Maybe Text -> Maybe AppType -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Text -> App

-- | An <tt>SslConfiguration</tt> object with the SSL configuration.
[$sel:sslConfiguration:App'] :: App -> Maybe SslConfiguration

-- | An array of <tt>EnvironmentVariable</tt> objects that specify
--   environment variables to be associated with the app. After you deploy
--   the app, these variables are defined on the associated app server
--   instances. For more information, see <a>Environment Variables</a>.
--   
--   There is no specific limit on the number of environment variables.
--   However, the size of the associated data structure - which includes
--   the variable names, values, and protected flag values - cannot exceed
--   20 KB. This limit should accommodate most if not all use cases, but if
--   you do exceed it, you will cause an exception (API) with an
--   "Environment: is too large (maximum is 20 KB)" message.
[$sel:environment:App'] :: App -> Maybe [EnvironmentVariable]

-- | Whether to enable SSL for the app.
[$sel:enableSsl:App'] :: App -> Maybe Bool

-- | When the app was created.
[$sel:createdAt:App'] :: App -> Maybe Text

-- | The app's short name.
[$sel:shortname:App'] :: App -> Maybe Text

-- | The app's data sources.
[$sel:dataSources:App'] :: App -> Maybe [DataSource]

-- | A <tt>Source</tt> object that describes the app repository.
[$sel:appSource:App'] :: App -> Maybe Source

-- | The app ID.
[$sel:appId:App'] :: App -> Maybe Text

-- | The stack attributes.
[$sel:attributes:App'] :: App -> Maybe (HashMap AppAttributesKeys Text)

-- | The app name.
[$sel:name:App'] :: App -> Maybe Text

-- | The app type.
[$sel:type':App'] :: App -> Maybe AppType

-- | The app stack ID.
[$sel:stackId:App'] :: App -> Maybe Text

-- | The app vhost settings with multiple domains separated by commas. For
--   example: <tt>'www.example.com, example.com'</tt>
[$sel:domains:App'] :: App -> Maybe [Text]

-- | A description of the app.
[$sel:description:App'] :: App -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>App</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:sslConfiguration:App'</a>, <a>app_sslConfiguration</a> - An
--   <tt>SslConfiguration</tt> object with the SSL configuration.
--   
--   <a>$sel:environment:App'</a>, <a>app_environment</a> - An array of
--   <tt>EnvironmentVariable</tt> objects that specify environment
--   variables to be associated with the app. After you deploy the app,
--   these variables are defined on the associated app server instances.
--   For more information, see <a>Environment Variables</a>.
--   
--   There is no specific limit on the number of environment variables.
--   However, the size of the associated data structure - which includes
--   the variable names, values, and protected flag values - cannot exceed
--   20 KB. This limit should accommodate most if not all use cases, but if
--   you do exceed it, you will cause an exception (API) with an
--   "Environment: is too large (maximum is 20 KB)" message.
--   
--   <a>$sel:enableSsl:App'</a>, <a>app_enableSsl</a> - Whether to enable
--   SSL for the app.
--   
--   <a>$sel:createdAt:App'</a>, <a>app_createdAt</a> - When the app was
--   created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:shortname:App'</a>, <a>app_shortname</a> - The app's short
--   name.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dataSources:App'</a>, <a>app_dataSources</a> - The app's data
--   sources.
--   
--   <a>$sel:appSource:App'</a>, <a>app_appSource</a> - A <tt>Source</tt>
--   object that describes the app repository.
--   
--   <a>$sel:appId:App'</a>, <a>app_appId</a> - The app ID.
--   
--   <a>$sel:attributes:App'</a>, <a>app_attributes</a> - The stack
--   attributes.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:App'</a>, <a>app_name</a> - The app name.
--   
--   <a>$sel:type':App'</a>, <a>app_type</a> - The app type.
--   
--   <a>$sel:stackId:App'</a>, <a>app_stackId</a> - The app stack ID.
--   
--   <a>$sel:domains:App'</a>, <a>app_domains</a> - The app vhost settings
--   with multiple domains separated by commas. For example:
--   <tt>'www.example.com, example.com'</tt>
--   
--   <a>$sel:description:App'</a>, <a>app_description</a> - A description
--   of the app.
newApp :: App

-- | An <tt>SslConfiguration</tt> object with the SSL configuration.
app_sslConfiguration :: Lens' App (Maybe SslConfiguration)

-- | An array of <tt>EnvironmentVariable</tt> objects that specify
--   environment variables to be associated with the app. After you deploy
--   the app, these variables are defined on the associated app server
--   instances. For more information, see <a>Environment Variables</a>.
--   
--   There is no specific limit on the number of environment variables.
--   However, the size of the associated data structure - which includes
--   the variable names, values, and protected flag values - cannot exceed
--   20 KB. This limit should accommodate most if not all use cases, but if
--   you do exceed it, you will cause an exception (API) with an
--   "Environment: is too large (maximum is 20 KB)" message.
app_environment :: Lens' App (Maybe [EnvironmentVariable])

-- | Whether to enable SSL for the app.
app_enableSsl :: Lens' App (Maybe Bool)

-- | When the app was created.
app_createdAt :: Lens' App (Maybe Text)

-- | The app's short name.
app_shortname :: Lens' App (Maybe Text)

-- | The app's data sources.
app_dataSources :: Lens' App (Maybe [DataSource])

-- | A <tt>Source</tt> object that describes the app repository.
app_appSource :: Lens' App (Maybe Source)

-- | The app ID.
app_appId :: Lens' App (Maybe Text)

-- | The stack attributes.
app_attributes :: Lens' App (Maybe (HashMap AppAttributesKeys Text))

-- | The app name.
app_name :: Lens' App (Maybe Text)

-- | The app type.
app_type :: Lens' App (Maybe AppType)

-- | The app stack ID.
app_stackId :: Lens' App (Maybe Text)

-- | The app vhost settings with multiple domains separated by commas. For
--   example: <tt>'www.example.com, example.com'</tt>
app_domains :: Lens' App (Maybe [Text])

-- | A description of the app.
app_description :: Lens' App (Maybe Text)

-- | Describes a load-based auto scaling upscaling or downscaling threshold
--   configuration, which specifies when AWS OpsWorks Stacks starts or
--   stops load-based instances.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAutoScalingThresholds</a> smart constructor.
data AutoScalingThresholds
AutoScalingThresholds' :: Maybe Int -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Double -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Double -> Maybe Double -> AutoScalingThresholds

-- | The number of instances to add or remove when the load exceeds a
--   threshold.
[$sel:instanceCount:AutoScalingThresholds'] :: AutoScalingThresholds -> Maybe Int

-- | The amount of time (in minutes) after a scaling event occurs that AWS
--   OpsWorks Stacks should ignore metrics and suppress additional scaling
--   events. For example, AWS OpsWorks Stacks adds new instances following
--   an upscaling event but the instances won't start reducing the load
--   until they have been booted and configured. There is no point in
--   raising additional scaling events during that operation, which
--   typically takes several minutes. <tt>IgnoreMetricsTime</tt> allows you
--   to direct AWS OpsWorks Stacks to suppress scaling events long enough
--   to get the new instances online.
[$sel:ignoreMetricsTime:AutoScalingThresholds'] :: AutoScalingThresholds -> Maybe Natural

-- | The load threshold. A value of -1 disables the threshold. For more
--   information about how load is computed, see <a>Load (computing)</a>.
[$sel:loadThreshold:AutoScalingThresholds'] :: AutoScalingThresholds -> Maybe Double

-- | The amount of time, in minutes, that the load must exceed a threshold
--   before more instances are added or removed.
[$sel:thresholdsWaitTime:AutoScalingThresholds'] :: AutoScalingThresholds -> Maybe Natural

-- | Custom Cloudwatch auto scaling alarms, to be used as thresholds. This
--   parameter takes a list of up to five alarm names, which are case
--   sensitive and must be in the same region as the stack.
--   
--   To use custom alarms, you must update your service role to allow
--   <tt>cloudwatch:DescribeAlarms</tt>. You can either have AWS OpsWorks
--   Stacks update the role for you when you first use this feature or you
--   can edit the role manually. For more information, see <a>Allowing AWS
--   OpsWorks Stacks to Act on Your Behalf</a>.
[$sel:alarms:AutoScalingThresholds'] :: AutoScalingThresholds -> Maybe [Text]

-- | The memory utilization threshold, as a percent of the available
--   memory. A value of -1 disables the threshold.
[$sel:memoryThreshold:AutoScalingThresholds'] :: AutoScalingThresholds -> Maybe Double

-- | The CPU utilization threshold, as a percent of the available CPU. A
--   value of -1 disables the threshold.
[$sel:cpuThreshold:AutoScalingThresholds'] :: AutoScalingThresholds -> Maybe Double

-- | Create a value of <a>AutoScalingThresholds</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:instanceCount:AutoScalingThresholds'</a>,
--   <a>autoScalingThresholds_instanceCount</a> - The number of instances
--   to add or remove when the load exceeds a threshold.
--   
--   <a>$sel:ignoreMetricsTime:AutoScalingThresholds'</a>,
--   <a>autoScalingThresholds_ignoreMetricsTime</a> - The amount of time
--   (in minutes) after a scaling event occurs that AWS OpsWorks Stacks
--   should ignore metrics and suppress additional scaling events. For
--   example, AWS OpsWorks Stacks adds new instances following an upscaling
--   event but the instances won't start reducing the load until they have
--   been booted and configured. There is no point in raising additional
--   scaling events during that operation, which typically takes several
--   minutes. <tt>IgnoreMetricsTime</tt> allows you to direct AWS OpsWorks
--   Stacks to suppress scaling events long enough to get the new instances
--   online.
--   
--   <a>$sel:loadThreshold:AutoScalingThresholds'</a>,
--   <a>autoScalingThresholds_loadThreshold</a> - The load threshold. A
--   value of -1 disables the threshold. For more information about how
--   load is computed, see <a>Load (computing)</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:thresholdsWaitTime:AutoScalingThresholds'</a>,
--   <a>autoScalingThresholds_thresholdsWaitTime</a> - The amount of time,
--   in minutes, that the load must exceed a threshold before more
--   instances are added or removed.
--   
--   <a>$sel:alarms:AutoScalingThresholds'</a>,
--   <a>autoScalingThresholds_alarms</a> - Custom Cloudwatch auto scaling
--   alarms, to be used as thresholds. This parameter takes a list of up to
--   five alarm names, which are case sensitive and must be in the same
--   region as the stack.
--   
--   To use custom alarms, you must update your service role to allow
--   <tt>cloudwatch:DescribeAlarms</tt>. You can either have AWS OpsWorks
--   Stacks update the role for you when you first use this feature or you
--   can edit the role manually. For more information, see <a>Allowing AWS
--   OpsWorks Stacks to Act on Your Behalf</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:memoryThreshold:AutoScalingThresholds'</a>,
--   <a>autoScalingThresholds_memoryThreshold</a> - The memory utilization
--   threshold, as a percent of the available memory. A value of -1
--   disables the threshold.
--   
--   <a>$sel:cpuThreshold:AutoScalingThresholds'</a>,
--   <a>autoScalingThresholds_cpuThreshold</a> - The CPU utilization
--   threshold, as a percent of the available CPU. A value of -1 disables
--   the threshold.
newAutoScalingThresholds :: AutoScalingThresholds

-- | The number of instances to add or remove when the load exceeds a
--   threshold.
autoScalingThresholds_instanceCount :: Lens' AutoScalingThresholds (Maybe Int)

-- | The amount of time (in minutes) after a scaling event occurs that AWS
--   OpsWorks Stacks should ignore metrics and suppress additional scaling
--   events. For example, AWS OpsWorks Stacks adds new instances following
--   an upscaling event but the instances won't start reducing the load
--   until they have been booted and configured. There is no point in
--   raising additional scaling events during that operation, which
--   typically takes several minutes. <tt>IgnoreMetricsTime</tt> allows you
--   to direct AWS OpsWorks Stacks to suppress scaling events long enough
--   to get the new instances online.
autoScalingThresholds_ignoreMetricsTime :: Lens' AutoScalingThresholds (Maybe Natural)

-- | The load threshold. A value of -1 disables the threshold. For more
--   information about how load is computed, see <a>Load (computing)</a>.
autoScalingThresholds_loadThreshold :: Lens' AutoScalingThresholds (Maybe Double)

-- | The amount of time, in minutes, that the load must exceed a threshold
--   before more instances are added or removed.
autoScalingThresholds_thresholdsWaitTime :: Lens' AutoScalingThresholds (Maybe Natural)

-- | Custom Cloudwatch auto scaling alarms, to be used as thresholds. This
--   parameter takes a list of up to five alarm names, which are case
--   sensitive and must be in the same region as the stack.
--   
--   To use custom alarms, you must update your service role to allow
--   <tt>cloudwatch:DescribeAlarms</tt>. You can either have AWS OpsWorks
--   Stacks update the role for you when you first use this feature or you
--   can edit the role manually. For more information, see <a>Allowing AWS
--   OpsWorks Stacks to Act on Your Behalf</a>.
autoScalingThresholds_alarms :: Lens' AutoScalingThresholds (Maybe [Text])

-- | The memory utilization threshold, as a percent of the available
--   memory. A value of -1 disables the threshold.
autoScalingThresholds_memoryThreshold :: Lens' AutoScalingThresholds (Maybe Double)

-- | The CPU utilization threshold, as a percent of the available CPU. A
--   value of -1 disables the threshold.
autoScalingThresholds_cpuThreshold :: Lens' AutoScalingThresholds (Maybe Double)

-- | Describes a block device mapping. This data type maps directly to the
--   Amazon EC2 <a>BlockDeviceMapping</a> data type.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newBlockDeviceMapping</a> smart constructor.
data BlockDeviceMapping
BlockDeviceMapping' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe EbsBlockDevice -> Maybe Text -> BlockDeviceMapping

-- | The virtual device name. For more information, see
--   <a>BlockDeviceMapping</a>.
[$sel:virtualName:BlockDeviceMapping'] :: BlockDeviceMapping -> Maybe Text

-- | Suppresses the specified device included in the AMI's block device
--   mapping.
[$sel:noDevice:BlockDeviceMapping'] :: BlockDeviceMapping -> Maybe Text

-- | An <tt>EBSBlockDevice</tt> that defines how to configure an Amazon EBS
--   volume when the instance is launched.
[$sel:ebs:BlockDeviceMapping'] :: BlockDeviceMapping -> Maybe EbsBlockDevice

-- | The device name that is exposed to the instance, such as
--   <tt>/dev/sdh</tt>. For the root device, you can use the explicit
--   device name or you can set this parameter to <tt>ROOT_DEVICE</tt> and
--   AWS OpsWorks Stacks will provide the correct device name.
[$sel:deviceName:BlockDeviceMapping'] :: BlockDeviceMapping -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>BlockDeviceMapping</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:virtualName:BlockDeviceMapping'</a>,
--   <a>blockDeviceMapping_virtualName</a> - The virtual device name. For
--   more information, see <a>BlockDeviceMapping</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:noDevice:BlockDeviceMapping'</a>,
--   <a>blockDeviceMapping_noDevice</a> - Suppresses the specified device
--   included in the AMI's block device mapping.
--   
--   <a>$sel:ebs:BlockDeviceMapping'</a>, <a>blockDeviceMapping_ebs</a> -
--   An <tt>EBSBlockDevice</tt> that defines how to configure an Amazon EBS
--   volume when the instance is launched.
--   
--   <a>$sel:deviceName:BlockDeviceMapping'</a>,
--   <a>blockDeviceMapping_deviceName</a> - The device name that is exposed
--   to the instance, such as <tt>/dev/sdh</tt>. For the root device, you
--   can use the explicit device name or you can set this parameter to
--   <tt>ROOT_DEVICE</tt> and AWS OpsWorks Stacks will provide the correct
--   device name.
newBlockDeviceMapping :: BlockDeviceMapping

-- | The virtual device name. For more information, see
--   <a>BlockDeviceMapping</a>.
blockDeviceMapping_virtualName :: Lens' BlockDeviceMapping (Maybe Text)

-- | Suppresses the specified device included in the AMI's block device
--   mapping.
blockDeviceMapping_noDevice :: Lens' BlockDeviceMapping (Maybe Text)

-- | An <tt>EBSBlockDevice</tt> that defines how to configure an Amazon EBS
--   volume when the instance is launched.
blockDeviceMapping_ebs :: Lens' BlockDeviceMapping (Maybe EbsBlockDevice)

-- | The device name that is exposed to the instance, such as
--   <tt>/dev/sdh</tt>. For the root device, you can use the explicit
--   device name or you can set this parameter to <tt>ROOT_DEVICE</tt> and
--   AWS OpsWorks Stacks will provide the correct device name.
blockDeviceMapping_deviceName :: Lens' BlockDeviceMapping (Maybe Text)

data ChefConfiguration

-- | Describes the Amazon CloudWatch logs configuration for a layer.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCloudWatchLogsConfiguration</a> smart constructor.
data CloudWatchLogsConfiguration
CloudWatchLogsConfiguration' :: Maybe Bool -> Maybe [CloudWatchLogsLogStream] -> CloudWatchLogsConfiguration

-- | Whether CloudWatch Logs is enabled for a layer.
[$sel:enabled:CloudWatchLogsConfiguration'] :: CloudWatchLogsConfiguration -> Maybe Bool

-- | A list of configuration options for CloudWatch Logs.
[$sel:logStreams:CloudWatchLogsConfiguration'] :: CloudWatchLogsConfiguration -> Maybe [CloudWatchLogsLogStream]

-- | Create a value of <a>CloudWatchLogsConfiguration</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:enabled:CloudWatchLogsConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>cloudWatchLogsConfiguration_enabled</a> - Whether CloudWatch Logs
--   is enabled for a layer.
--   
--   <a>$sel:logStreams:CloudWatchLogsConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>cloudWatchLogsConfiguration_logStreams</a> - A list of
--   configuration options for CloudWatch Logs.
newCloudWatchLogsConfiguration :: CloudWatchLogsConfiguration

-- | Whether CloudWatch Logs is enabled for a layer.
cloudWatchLogsConfiguration_enabled :: Lens' CloudWatchLogsConfiguration (Maybe Bool)

-- | A list of configuration options for CloudWatch Logs.
cloudWatchLogsConfiguration_logStreams :: Lens' CloudWatchLogsConfiguration (Maybe [CloudWatchLogsLogStream])

-- | Describes the Amazon CloudWatch logs configuration for a layer. For
--   detailed information about members of this data type, see the
--   <a>CloudWatch Logs Agent Reference</a>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCloudWatchLogsLogStream</a> smart constructor.
data CloudWatchLogsLogStream
CloudWatchLogsLogStream' :: Maybe Int -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe CloudWatchLogsInitialPosition -> Maybe Text -> Maybe CloudWatchLogsEncoding -> Maybe CloudWatchLogsTimeZone -> Maybe Text -> CloudWatchLogsLogStream

-- | Specifies the max number of log events in a batch, up to 10000. The
--   default value is 1000.
[$sel:batchCount:CloudWatchLogsLogStream'] :: CloudWatchLogsLogStream -> Maybe Int

-- | Specifies the range of lines for identifying a file. The valid values
--   are one number, or two dash-delimited numbers, such as '1', '2-5'. The
--   default value is '1', meaning the first line is used to calculate the
--   fingerprint. Fingerprint lines are not sent to CloudWatch Logs unless
--   all specified lines are available.
[$sel:fileFingerprintLines:CloudWatchLogsLogStream'] :: CloudWatchLogsLogStream -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies the time duration for the batching of log events. The
--   minimum value is 5000ms and default value is 5000ms.
[$sel:bufferDuration:CloudWatchLogsLogStream'] :: CloudWatchLogsLogStream -> Maybe Int

-- | Specifies the maximum size of log events in a batch, in bytes, up to
--   1048576 bytes. The default value is 32768 bytes. This size is
--   calculated as the sum of all event messages in UTF-8, plus 26 bytes
--   for each log event.
[$sel:batchSize:CloudWatchLogsLogStream'] :: CloudWatchLogsLogStream -> Maybe Int

-- | Specifies the destination log group. A log group is created
--   automatically if it doesn't already exist. Log group names can be
--   between 1 and 512 characters long. Allowed characters include a-z,
--   A-Z, 0-9, '_' (underscore), '-' (hyphen), '/' (forward slash), and '.'
--   (period).
[$sel:logGroupName:CloudWatchLogsLogStream'] :: CloudWatchLogsLogStream -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies the pattern for identifying the start of a log message.
[$sel:multiLineStartPattern:CloudWatchLogsLogStream'] :: CloudWatchLogsLogStream -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies where to start to read data (start_of_file or end_of_file).
--   The default is start_of_file. This setting is only used if there is no
--   state persisted for that log stream.
[$sel:initialPosition:CloudWatchLogsLogStream'] :: CloudWatchLogsLogStream -> Maybe CloudWatchLogsInitialPosition

-- | Specifies how the time stamp is extracted from logs. For more
--   information, see the <a>CloudWatch Logs Agent Reference</a>.
[$sel:datetimeFormat:CloudWatchLogsLogStream'] :: CloudWatchLogsLogStream -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies the encoding of the log file so that the file can be read
--   correctly. The default is <tt>utf_8</tt>. Encodings supported by
--   Python <tt>codecs.decode()</tt> can be used here.
[$sel:encoding:CloudWatchLogsLogStream'] :: CloudWatchLogsLogStream -> Maybe CloudWatchLogsEncoding

-- | Specifies the time zone of log event time stamps.
[$sel:timeZone:CloudWatchLogsLogStream'] :: CloudWatchLogsLogStream -> Maybe CloudWatchLogsTimeZone

-- | Specifies log files that you want to push to CloudWatch Logs.
--   
--   <tt>File</tt> can point to a specific file or multiple files (by using
--   wild card characters such as <tt>/var/log/system.log*</tt>). Only the
--   latest file is pushed to CloudWatch Logs, based on file modification
--   time. We recommend that you use wild card characters to specify a
--   series of files of the same type, such as
--   <tt>access_log.2014-06-01-01</tt>, <tt>access_log.2014-06-01-02</tt>,
--   and so on by using a pattern like <tt>access_log.*</tt>. Don't use a
--   wildcard to match multiple file types, such as <tt>access_log_80</tt>
--   and <tt>access_log_443</tt>. To specify multiple, different file
--   types, add another log stream entry to the configuration file, so that
--   each log file type is stored in a different log group.
--   
--   Zipped files are not supported.
[$sel:file:CloudWatchLogsLogStream'] :: CloudWatchLogsLogStream -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>CloudWatchLogsLogStream</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:batchCount:CloudWatchLogsLogStream'</a>,
--   <a>cloudWatchLogsLogStream_batchCount</a> - Specifies the max number
--   of log events in a batch, up to 10000. The default value is 1000.
--   
--   <a>$sel:fileFingerprintLines:CloudWatchLogsLogStream'</a>,
--   <a>cloudWatchLogsLogStream_fileFingerprintLines</a> - Specifies the
--   range of lines for identifying a file. The valid values are one
--   number, or two dash-delimited numbers, such as '1', '2-5'. The default
--   value is '1', meaning the first line is used to calculate the
--   fingerprint. Fingerprint lines are not sent to CloudWatch Logs unless
--   all specified lines are available.
--   
--   <a>$sel:bufferDuration:CloudWatchLogsLogStream'</a>,
--   <a>cloudWatchLogsLogStream_bufferDuration</a> - Specifies the time
--   duration for the batching of log events. The minimum value is 5000ms
--   and default value is 5000ms.
--   
--   <a>$sel:batchSize:CloudWatchLogsLogStream'</a>,
--   <a>cloudWatchLogsLogStream_batchSize</a> - Specifies the maximum size
--   of log events in a batch, in bytes, up to 1048576 bytes. The default
--   value is 32768 bytes. This size is calculated as the sum of all event
--   messages in UTF-8, plus 26 bytes for each log event.
--   
--   <a>$sel:logGroupName:CloudWatchLogsLogStream'</a>,
--   <a>cloudWatchLogsLogStream_logGroupName</a> - Specifies the
--   destination log group. A log group is created automatically if it
--   doesn't already exist. Log group names can be between 1 and 512
--   characters long. Allowed characters include a-z, A-Z, 0-9, '_'
--   (underscore), '-' (hyphen), '/' (forward slash), and '.' (period).
--   
--   <a>$sel:multiLineStartPattern:CloudWatchLogsLogStream'</a>,
--   <a>cloudWatchLogsLogStream_multiLineStartPattern</a> - Specifies the
--   pattern for identifying the start of a log message.
--   
--   <a>$sel:initialPosition:CloudWatchLogsLogStream'</a>,
--   <a>cloudWatchLogsLogStream_initialPosition</a> - Specifies where to
--   start to read data (start_of_file or end_of_file). The default is
--   start_of_file. This setting is only used if there is no state
--   persisted for that log stream.
--   
--   <a>$sel:datetimeFormat:CloudWatchLogsLogStream'</a>,
--   <a>cloudWatchLogsLogStream_datetimeFormat</a> - Specifies how the time
--   stamp is extracted from logs. For more information, see the
--   <a>CloudWatch Logs Agent Reference</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:encoding:CloudWatchLogsLogStream'</a>,
--   <a>cloudWatchLogsLogStream_encoding</a> - Specifies the encoding of
--   the log file so that the file can be read correctly. The default is
--   <tt>utf_8</tt>. Encodings supported by Python <tt>codecs.decode()</tt>
--   can be used here.
--   
--   <a>$sel:timeZone:CloudWatchLogsLogStream'</a>,
--   <a>cloudWatchLogsLogStream_timeZone</a> - Specifies the time zone of
--   log event time stamps.
--   
--   <a>$sel:file:CloudWatchLogsLogStream'</a>,
--   <a>cloudWatchLogsLogStream_file</a> - Specifies log files that you
--   want to push to CloudWatch Logs.
--   
--   <tt>File</tt> can point to a specific file or multiple files (by using
--   wild card characters such as <tt>/var/log/system.log*</tt>). Only the
--   latest file is pushed to CloudWatch Logs, based on file modification
--   time. We recommend that you use wild card characters to specify a
--   series of files of the same type, such as
--   <tt>access_log.2014-06-01-01</tt>, <tt>access_log.2014-06-01-02</tt>,
--   and so on by using a pattern like <tt>access_log.*</tt>. Don't use a
--   wildcard to match multiple file types, such as <tt>access_log_80</tt>
--   and <tt>access_log_443</tt>. To specify multiple, different file
--   types, add another log stream entry to the configuration file, so that
--   each log file type is stored in a different log group.
--   
--   Zipped files are not supported.
newCloudWatchLogsLogStream :: CloudWatchLogsLogStream

-- | Specifies the max number of log events in a batch, up to 10000. The
--   default value is 1000.
cloudWatchLogsLogStream_batchCount :: Lens' CloudWatchLogsLogStream (Maybe Int)

-- | Specifies the range of lines for identifying a file. The valid values
--   are one number, or two dash-delimited numbers, such as '1', '2-5'. The
--   default value is '1', meaning the first line is used to calculate the
--   fingerprint. Fingerprint lines are not sent to CloudWatch Logs unless
--   all specified lines are available.
cloudWatchLogsLogStream_fileFingerprintLines :: Lens' CloudWatchLogsLogStream (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies the time duration for the batching of log events. The
--   minimum value is 5000ms and default value is 5000ms.
cloudWatchLogsLogStream_bufferDuration :: Lens' CloudWatchLogsLogStream (Maybe Int)

-- | Specifies the maximum size of log events in a batch, in bytes, up to
--   1048576 bytes. The default value is 32768 bytes. This size is
--   calculated as the sum of all event messages in UTF-8, plus 26 bytes
--   for each log event.
cloudWatchLogsLogStream_batchSize :: Lens' CloudWatchLogsLogStream (Maybe Int)

-- | Specifies the destination log group. A log group is created
--   automatically if it doesn't already exist. Log group names can be
--   between 1 and 512 characters long. Allowed characters include a-z,
--   A-Z, 0-9, '_' (underscore), '-' (hyphen), '/' (forward slash), and '.'
--   (period).
cloudWatchLogsLogStream_logGroupName :: Lens' CloudWatchLogsLogStream (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies the pattern for identifying the start of a log message.
cloudWatchLogsLogStream_multiLineStartPattern :: Lens' CloudWatchLogsLogStream (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies where to start to read data (start_of_file or end_of_file).
--   The default is start_of_file. This setting is only used if there is no
--   state persisted for that log stream.
cloudWatchLogsLogStream_initialPosition :: Lens' CloudWatchLogsLogStream (Maybe CloudWatchLogsInitialPosition)

-- | Specifies how the time stamp is extracted from logs. For more
--   information, see the <a>CloudWatch Logs Agent Reference</a>.
cloudWatchLogsLogStream_datetimeFormat :: Lens' CloudWatchLogsLogStream (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies the encoding of the log file so that the file can be read
--   correctly. The default is <tt>utf_8</tt>. Encodings supported by
--   Python <tt>codecs.decode()</tt> can be used here.
cloudWatchLogsLogStream_encoding :: Lens' CloudWatchLogsLogStream (Maybe CloudWatchLogsEncoding)

-- | Specifies the time zone of log event time stamps.
cloudWatchLogsLogStream_timeZone :: Lens' CloudWatchLogsLogStream (Maybe CloudWatchLogsTimeZone)

-- | Specifies log files that you want to push to CloudWatch Logs.
--   
--   <tt>File</tt> can point to a specific file or multiple files (by using
--   wild card characters such as <tt>/var/log/system.log*</tt>). Only the
--   latest file is pushed to CloudWatch Logs, based on file modification
--   time. We recommend that you use wild card characters to specify a
--   series of files of the same type, such as
--   <tt>access_log.2014-06-01-01</tt>, <tt>access_log.2014-06-01-02</tt>,
--   and so on by using a pattern like <tt>access_log.*</tt>. Don't use a
--   wildcard to match multiple file types, such as <tt>access_log_80</tt>
--   and <tt>access_log_443</tt>. To specify multiple, different file
--   types, add another log stream entry to the configuration file, so that
--   each log file type is stored in a different log group.
--   
--   Zipped files are not supported.
cloudWatchLogsLogStream_file :: Lens' CloudWatchLogsLogStream (Maybe Text)

-- | Describes a command.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCommand</a> smart constructor.
data Command
Command' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Command

-- | The command deployment ID.
[$sel:deploymentId:Command'] :: Command -> Maybe Text

-- | The ID of the instance where the command was executed.
[$sel:instanceId:Command'] :: Command -> Maybe Text

-- | The command status:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>failed</li>
--   <li>successful</li>
--   <li>skipped</li>
--   <li>pending</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:status:Command'] :: Command -> Maybe Text

-- | The URL of the command log.
[$sel:logUrl:Command'] :: Command -> Maybe Text

-- | Date and time when the command was run.
[$sel:createdAt:Command'] :: Command -> Maybe Text

-- | The command ID.
[$sel:commandId:Command'] :: Command -> Maybe Text

-- | The command exit code.
[$sel:exitCode:Command'] :: Command -> Maybe Int

-- | The command type:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><pre>configure</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>deploy</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>execute_recipes</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>install_dependencies</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>restart</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>rollback</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>setup</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>start</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>stop</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>undeploy</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>update_custom_cookbooks</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>update_dependencies</pre></li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:type':Command'] :: Command -> Maybe Text

-- | Date when the command completed.
[$sel:completedAt:Command'] :: Command -> Maybe Text

-- | Date and time when the command was acknowledged.
[$sel:acknowledgedAt:Command'] :: Command -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>Command</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:deploymentId:Command'</a>, <a>command_deploymentId</a> - The
--   command deployment ID.
--   
--   <a>$sel:instanceId:Command'</a>, <a>command_instanceId</a> - The ID of
--   the instance where the command was executed.
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:Command'</a>, <a>command_status</a> - The command
--   status:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>failed</li>
--   <li>successful</li>
--   <li>skipped</li>
--   <li>pending</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:logUrl:Command'</a>, <a>command_logUrl</a> - The URL of the
--   command log.
--   
--   <a>$sel:createdAt:Command'</a>, <a>command_createdAt</a> - Date and
--   time when the command was run.
--   
--   <a>$sel:commandId:Command'</a>, <a>command_commandId</a> - The command
--   ID.
--   
--   <a>$sel:exitCode:Command'</a>, <a>command_exitCode</a> - The command
--   exit code.
--   
--   <a>$sel:type':Command'</a>, <a>command_type</a> - The command type:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><pre>configure</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>deploy</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>execute_recipes</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>install_dependencies</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>restart</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>rollback</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>setup</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>start</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>stop</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>undeploy</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>update_custom_cookbooks</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>update_dependencies</pre></li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:completedAt:Command'</a>, <a>command_completedAt</a> - Date
--   when the command completed.
--   
--   <a>$sel:acknowledgedAt:Command'</a>, <a>command_acknowledgedAt</a> -
--   Date and time when the command was acknowledged.
newCommand :: Command

-- | The command deployment ID.
command_deploymentId :: Lens' Command (Maybe Text)

-- | The ID of the instance where the command was executed.
command_instanceId :: Lens' Command (Maybe Text)

-- | The command status:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>failed</li>
--   <li>successful</li>
--   <li>skipped</li>
--   <li>pending</li>
--   </ul>
command_status :: Lens' Command (Maybe Text)

-- | The URL of the command log.
command_logUrl :: Lens' Command (Maybe Text)

-- | Date and time when the command was run.
command_createdAt :: Lens' Command (Maybe Text)

-- | The command ID.
command_commandId :: Lens' Command (Maybe Text)

-- | The command exit code.
command_exitCode :: Lens' Command (Maybe Int)

-- | The command type:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><pre>configure</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>deploy</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>execute_recipes</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>install_dependencies</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>restart</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>rollback</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>setup</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>start</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>stop</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>undeploy</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>update_custom_cookbooks</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>update_dependencies</pre></li>
--   </ul>
command_type :: Lens' Command (Maybe Text)

-- | Date when the command completed.
command_completedAt :: Lens' Command (Maybe Text)

-- | Date and time when the command was acknowledged.
command_acknowledgedAt :: Lens' Command (Maybe Text)

-- | Describes an app's data source.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDataSource</a> smart constructor.
data DataSource
DataSource' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> DataSource

-- | The data source's ARN.
[$sel:arn:DataSource'] :: DataSource -> Maybe Text

-- | The database name.
[$sel:databaseName:DataSource'] :: DataSource -> Maybe Text

-- | The data source's type, <tt>AutoSelectOpsworksMysqlInstance</tt>,
--   <tt>OpsworksMysqlInstance</tt>, <tt>RdsDbInstance</tt>, or
--   <tt>None</tt>.
[$sel:type':DataSource'] :: DataSource -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>DataSource</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:DataSource'</a>, <a>dataSource_arn</a> - The data source's
--   ARN.
--   
--   <a>$sel:databaseName:DataSource'</a>, <a>dataSource_databaseName</a> -
--   The database name.
--   
--   <a>$sel:type':DataSource'</a>, <a>dataSource_type</a> - The data
--   source's type, <tt>AutoSelectOpsworksMysqlInstance</tt>,
--   <tt>OpsworksMysqlInstance</tt>, <tt>RdsDbInstance</tt>, or
--   <tt>None</tt>.
newDataSource :: DataSource

-- | The data source's ARN.
dataSource_arn :: Lens' DataSource (Maybe Text)

-- | The database name.
dataSource_databaseName :: Lens' DataSource (Maybe Text)

-- | The data source's type, <tt>AutoSelectOpsworksMysqlInstance</tt>,
--   <tt>OpsworksMysqlInstance</tt>, <tt>RdsDbInstance</tt>, or
--   <tt>None</tt>.
dataSource_type :: Lens' DataSource (Maybe Text)

-- | Describes a deployment of a stack or app.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDeployment</a> smart constructor.
data Deployment
Deployment' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe DeploymentCommand -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Deployment

-- | The deployment ID.
[$sel:deploymentId:Deployment'] :: Deployment -> Maybe Text

-- | The deployment status:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>running</li>
--   <li>successful</li>
--   <li>failed</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:status:Deployment'] :: Deployment -> Maybe Text

-- | Used to specify a stack or deployment command.
[$sel:command:Deployment'] :: Deployment -> Maybe DeploymentCommand

-- | Date when the deployment was created.
[$sel:createdAt:Deployment'] :: Deployment -> Maybe Text

-- | A string that contains user-defined custom JSON. It can be used to
--   override the corresponding default stack configuration attribute
--   values for stack or to pass data to recipes. The string should be in
--   the following format:
--   
--   <pre>
--   "{\"key1\": \"value1\", \"key2\": \"value2\",...}"
--   </pre>
--   
--   For more information on custom JSON, see <a>Use Custom JSON to Modify
--   the Stack Configuration Attributes</a>.
[$sel:customJson:Deployment'] :: Deployment -> Maybe Text

-- | The user's IAM ARN.
[$sel:iamUserArn:Deployment'] :: Deployment -> Maybe Text

-- | The app ID.
[$sel:appId:Deployment'] :: Deployment -> Maybe Text

-- | The IDs of the target instances.
[$sel:instanceIds:Deployment'] :: Deployment -> Maybe [Text]

-- | Date when the deployment completed.
[$sel:completedAt:Deployment'] :: Deployment -> Maybe Text

-- | The stack ID.
[$sel:stackId:Deployment'] :: Deployment -> Maybe Text

-- | A user-defined comment.
[$sel:comment:Deployment'] :: Deployment -> Maybe Text

-- | The deployment duration.
[$sel:duration:Deployment'] :: Deployment -> Maybe Int

-- | Create a value of <a>Deployment</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:deploymentId:Deployment'</a>, <a>deployment_deploymentId</a> -
--   The deployment ID.
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:Deployment'</a>, <a>deployment_status</a> - The
--   deployment status:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>running</li>
--   <li>successful</li>
--   <li>failed</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:command:Deployment'</a>, <a>deployment_command</a> - Used to
--   specify a stack or deployment command.
--   
--   <a>$sel:createdAt:Deployment'</a>, <a>deployment_createdAt</a> - Date
--   when the deployment was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:customJson:Deployment'</a>, <a>deployment_customJson</a> - A
--   string that contains user-defined custom JSON. It can be used to
--   override the corresponding default stack configuration attribute
--   values for stack or to pass data to recipes. The string should be in
--   the following format:
--   
--   <pre>
--   "{\"key1\": \"value1\", \"key2\": \"value2\",...}"
--   </pre>
--   
--   For more information on custom JSON, see <a>Use Custom JSON to Modify
--   the Stack Configuration Attributes</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:iamUserArn:Deployment'</a>, <a>deployment_iamUserArn</a> - The
--   user's IAM ARN.
--   
--   <a>$sel:appId:Deployment'</a>, <a>deployment_appId</a> - The app ID.
--   
--   <a>$sel:instanceIds:Deployment'</a>, <a>deployment_instanceIds</a> -
--   The IDs of the target instances.
--   
--   <a>$sel:completedAt:Deployment'</a>, <a>deployment_completedAt</a> -
--   Date when the deployment completed.
--   
--   <a>$sel:stackId:Deployment'</a>, <a>deployment_stackId</a> - The stack
--   ID.
--   
--   <a>$sel:comment:Deployment'</a>, <a>deployment_comment</a> - A
--   user-defined comment.
--   
--   <a>$sel:duration:Deployment'</a>, <a>deployment_duration</a> - The
--   deployment duration.
newDeployment :: Deployment

-- | The deployment ID.
deployment_deploymentId :: Lens' Deployment (Maybe Text)

-- | The deployment status:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>running</li>
--   <li>successful</li>
--   <li>failed</li>
--   </ul>
deployment_status :: Lens' Deployment (Maybe Text)

-- | Used to specify a stack or deployment command.
deployment_command :: Lens' Deployment (Maybe DeploymentCommand)

-- | Date when the deployment was created.
deployment_createdAt :: Lens' Deployment (Maybe Text)

-- | A string that contains user-defined custom JSON. It can be used to
--   override the corresponding default stack configuration attribute
--   values for stack or to pass data to recipes. The string should be in
--   the following format:
--   
--   <pre>
--   "{\"key1\": \"value1\", \"key2\": \"value2\",...}"
--   </pre>
--   
--   For more information on custom JSON, see <a>Use Custom JSON to Modify
--   the Stack Configuration Attributes</a>.
deployment_customJson :: Lens' Deployment (Maybe Text)

-- | The user's IAM ARN.
deployment_iamUserArn :: Lens' Deployment (Maybe Text)

-- | The app ID.
deployment_appId :: Lens' Deployment (Maybe Text)

-- | The IDs of the target instances.
deployment_instanceIds :: Lens' Deployment (Maybe [Text])

-- | Date when the deployment completed.
deployment_completedAt :: Lens' Deployment (Maybe Text)

-- | The stack ID.
deployment_stackId :: Lens' Deployment (Maybe Text)

-- | A user-defined comment.
deployment_comment :: Lens' Deployment (Maybe Text)

-- | The deployment duration.
deployment_duration :: Lens' Deployment (Maybe Int)

-- | Used to specify a stack or deployment command.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDeploymentCommand</a> smart constructor.
data DeploymentCommand
DeploymentCommand' :: Maybe (HashMap Text [Text]) -> DeploymentCommandName -> DeploymentCommand

-- | The arguments of those commands that take arguments. It should be set
--   to a JSON object with the following format:
--   
--   <pre>
--   {"arg_name1" : ["value1", "value2", ...], "arg_name2" : ["value1", "value2", ...], ...}
--   </pre>
--   
--   The <tt>update_dependencies</tt> command takes two arguments:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>upgrade_os_to</tt> - Specifies the desired Amazon Linux
--   version for instances whose OS you want to upgrade, such as <tt>Amazon
--   Linux 2016.09</tt>. You must also set the <tt>allow_reboot</tt>
--   argument to true.</li>
--   <li><tt>allow_reboot</tt> - Specifies whether to allow AWS OpsWorks
--   Stacks to reboot the instances if necessary, after installing the
--   updates. This argument can be set to either <tt>true</tt> or
--   <tt>false</tt>. The default value is <tt>false</tt>.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   For example, to upgrade an instance to Amazon Linux 2016.09, set
--   <tt>Args</tt> to the following.
--   
--   <pre>
--   { "upgrade_os_to":["Amazon Linux 2016.09"], "allow_reboot":["true"] }
--   </pre>
[$sel:args:DeploymentCommand'] :: DeploymentCommand -> Maybe (HashMap Text [Text])

-- | Specifies the operation. You can specify only one command.
--   
--   For stacks, the following commands are available:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>execute_recipes</tt>: Execute one or more recipes. To specify
--   the recipes, set an <tt>Args</tt> parameter named <tt>recipes</tt> to
--   the list of recipes to be executed. For example, to execute
--   <tt>phpapp::appsetup</tt>, set <tt>Args</tt> to
--   <tt>{"recipes":["phpapp::appsetup"]}</tt>.</li>
--   <li><tt>install_dependencies</tt>: Install the stack's
--   dependencies.</li>
--   <li><tt>update_custom_cookbooks</tt>: Update the stack's custom
--   cookbooks.</li>
--   <li><tt>update_dependencies</tt>: Update the stack's
--   dependencies.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   The update_dependencies and install_dependencies commands are
--   supported only for Linux instances. You can run the commands
--   successfully on Windows instances, but they do nothing.
--   
--   For apps, the following commands are available:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>deploy</tt>: Deploy an app. Ruby on Rails apps have an
--   optional <tt>Args</tt> parameter named <tt>migrate</tt>. Set
--   <tt>Args</tt> to {"migrate":["true"]} to migrate the database. The
--   default setting is {"migrate":["false"]}.</li>
--   <li><tt>rollback</tt> Roll the app back to the previous version. When
--   you update an app, AWS OpsWorks Stacks stores the previous version, up
--   to a maximum of five versions. You can use this command to roll an app
--   back as many as four versions.</li>
--   <li><tt>start</tt>: Start the app's web or application server.</li>
--   <li><tt>stop</tt>: Stop the app's web or application server.</li>
--   <li><tt>restart</tt>: Restart the app's web or application
--   server.</li>
--   <li><tt>undeploy</tt>: Undeploy the app.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:name:DeploymentCommand'] :: DeploymentCommand -> DeploymentCommandName

-- | Create a value of <a>DeploymentCommand</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:args:DeploymentCommand'</a>, <a>deploymentCommand_args</a> -
--   The arguments of those commands that take arguments. It should be set
--   to a JSON object with the following format:
--   
--   <pre>
--   {"arg_name1" : ["value1", "value2", ...], "arg_name2" : ["value1", "value2", ...], ...}
--   </pre>
--   
--   The <tt>update_dependencies</tt> command takes two arguments:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>upgrade_os_to</tt> - Specifies the desired Amazon Linux
--   version for instances whose OS you want to upgrade, such as <tt>Amazon
--   Linux 2016.09</tt>. You must also set the <tt>allow_reboot</tt>
--   argument to true.</li>
--   <li><tt>allow_reboot</tt> - Specifies whether to allow AWS OpsWorks
--   Stacks to reboot the instances if necessary, after installing the
--   updates. This argument can be set to either <tt>true</tt> or
--   <tt>false</tt>. The default value is <tt>false</tt>.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   For example, to upgrade an instance to Amazon Linux 2016.09, set
--   <tt>Args</tt> to the following.
--   
--   <pre>
--   { "upgrade_os_to":["Amazon Linux 2016.09"], "allow_reboot":["true"] }
--   </pre>
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:DeploymentCommand'</a>, <a>deploymentCommand_name</a> -
--   Specifies the operation. You can specify only one command.
--   
--   For stacks, the following commands are available:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>execute_recipes</tt>: Execute one or more recipes. To specify
--   the recipes, set an <tt>Args</tt> parameter named <tt>recipes</tt> to
--   the list of recipes to be executed. For example, to execute
--   <tt>phpapp::appsetup</tt>, set <tt>Args</tt> to
--   <tt>{"recipes":["phpapp::appsetup"]}</tt>.</li>
--   <li><tt>install_dependencies</tt>: Install the stack's
--   dependencies.</li>
--   <li><tt>update_custom_cookbooks</tt>: Update the stack's custom
--   cookbooks.</li>
--   <li><tt>update_dependencies</tt>: Update the stack's
--   dependencies.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   The update_dependencies and install_dependencies commands are
--   supported only for Linux instances. You can run the commands
--   successfully on Windows instances, but they do nothing.
--   
--   For apps, the following commands are available:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>deploy</tt>: Deploy an app. Ruby on Rails apps have an
--   optional <tt>Args</tt> parameter named <tt>migrate</tt>. Set
--   <tt>Args</tt> to {"migrate":["true"]} to migrate the database. The
--   default setting is {"migrate":["false"]}.</li>
--   <li><tt>rollback</tt> Roll the app back to the previous version. When
--   you update an app, AWS OpsWorks Stacks stores the previous version, up
--   to a maximum of five versions. You can use this command to roll an app
--   back as many as four versions.</li>
--   <li><tt>start</tt>: Start the app's web or application server.</li>
--   <li><tt>stop</tt>: Stop the app's web or application server.</li>
--   <li><tt>restart</tt>: Restart the app's web or application
--   server.</li>
--   <li><tt>undeploy</tt>: Undeploy the app.</li>
--   </ul>
newDeploymentCommand :: DeploymentCommandName -> DeploymentCommand

-- | The arguments of those commands that take arguments. It should be set
--   to a JSON object with the following format:
--   
--   <pre>
--   {"arg_name1" : ["value1", "value2", ...], "arg_name2" : ["value1", "value2", ...], ...}
--   </pre>
--   
--   The <tt>update_dependencies</tt> command takes two arguments:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>upgrade_os_to</tt> - Specifies the desired Amazon Linux
--   version for instances whose OS you want to upgrade, such as <tt>Amazon
--   Linux 2016.09</tt>. You must also set the <tt>allow_reboot</tt>
--   argument to true.</li>
--   <li><tt>allow_reboot</tt> - Specifies whether to allow AWS OpsWorks
--   Stacks to reboot the instances if necessary, after installing the
--   updates. This argument can be set to either <tt>true</tt> or
--   <tt>false</tt>. The default value is <tt>false</tt>.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   For example, to upgrade an instance to Amazon Linux 2016.09, set
--   <tt>Args</tt> to the following.
--   
--   <pre>
--   { "upgrade_os_to":["Amazon Linux 2016.09"], "allow_reboot":["true"] }
--   </pre>
deploymentCommand_args :: Lens' DeploymentCommand (Maybe (HashMap Text [Text]))

-- | Specifies the operation. You can specify only one command.
--   
--   For stacks, the following commands are available:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>execute_recipes</tt>: Execute one or more recipes. To specify
--   the recipes, set an <tt>Args</tt> parameter named <tt>recipes</tt> to
--   the list of recipes to be executed. For example, to execute
--   <tt>phpapp::appsetup</tt>, set <tt>Args</tt> to
--   <tt>{"recipes":["phpapp::appsetup"]}</tt>.</li>
--   <li><tt>install_dependencies</tt>: Install the stack's
--   dependencies.</li>
--   <li><tt>update_custom_cookbooks</tt>: Update the stack's custom
--   cookbooks.</li>
--   <li><tt>update_dependencies</tt>: Update the stack's
--   dependencies.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   The update_dependencies and install_dependencies commands are
--   supported only for Linux instances. You can run the commands
--   successfully on Windows instances, but they do nothing.
--   
--   For apps, the following commands are available:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>deploy</tt>: Deploy an app. Ruby on Rails apps have an
--   optional <tt>Args</tt> parameter named <tt>migrate</tt>. Set
--   <tt>Args</tt> to {"migrate":["true"]} to migrate the database. The
--   default setting is {"migrate":["false"]}.</li>
--   <li><tt>rollback</tt> Roll the app back to the previous version. When
--   you update an app, AWS OpsWorks Stacks stores the previous version, up
--   to a maximum of five versions. You can use this command to roll an app
--   back as many as four versions.</li>
--   <li><tt>start</tt>: Start the app's web or application server.</li>
--   <li><tt>stop</tt>: Stop the app's web or application server.</li>
--   <li><tt>restart</tt>: Restart the app's web or application
--   server.</li>
--   <li><tt>undeploy</tt>: Undeploy the app.</li>
--   </ul>
deploymentCommand_name :: Lens' DeploymentCommand DeploymentCommandName

-- | Describes an Amazon EBS volume. This data type maps directly to the
--   Amazon EC2 <a>EbsBlockDevice</a> data type.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEbsBlockDevice</a> smart constructor.
data EbsBlockDevice
EbsBlockDevice' :: Maybe Bool -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Int -> Maybe VolumeType -> Maybe Text -> EbsBlockDevice

-- | Whether the volume is deleted on instance termination.
[$sel:deleteOnTermination:EbsBlockDevice'] :: EbsBlockDevice -> Maybe Bool

-- | The volume size, in GiB. For more information, see
--   <a>EbsBlockDevice</a>.
[$sel:volumeSize:EbsBlockDevice'] :: EbsBlockDevice -> Maybe Int

-- | The number of I/O operations per second (IOPS) that the volume
--   supports. For more information, see <a>EbsBlockDevice</a>.
[$sel:iops:EbsBlockDevice'] :: EbsBlockDevice -> Maybe Int

-- | The volume type. <tt>gp2</tt> for General Purpose (SSD) volumes,
--   <tt>io1</tt> for Provisioned IOPS (SSD) volumes, <tt>st1</tt> for
--   Throughput Optimized hard disk drives (HDD), <tt>sc1</tt> for Cold
--   HDD,and <tt>standard</tt> for Magnetic volumes.
--   
--   If you specify the <tt>io1</tt> volume type, you must also specify a
--   value for the <tt>Iops</tt> attribute. The maximum ratio of
--   provisioned IOPS to requested volume size (in GiB) is 50:1. AWS uses
--   the default volume size (in GiB) specified in the AMI attributes to
--   set IOPS to 50 x (volume size).
[$sel:volumeType:EbsBlockDevice'] :: EbsBlockDevice -> Maybe VolumeType

-- | The snapshot ID.
[$sel:snapshotId:EbsBlockDevice'] :: EbsBlockDevice -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>EbsBlockDevice</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:deleteOnTermination:EbsBlockDevice'</a>,
--   <a>ebsBlockDevice_deleteOnTermination</a> - Whether the volume is
--   deleted on instance termination.
--   
--   <a>$sel:volumeSize:EbsBlockDevice'</a>,
--   <a>ebsBlockDevice_volumeSize</a> - The volume size, in GiB. For more
--   information, see <a>EbsBlockDevice</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:iops:EbsBlockDevice'</a>, <a>ebsBlockDevice_iops</a> - The
--   number of I/O operations per second (IOPS) that the volume supports.
--   For more information, see <a>EbsBlockDevice</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:volumeType:EbsBlockDevice'</a>,
--   <a>ebsBlockDevice_volumeType</a> - The volume type. <tt>gp2</tt> for
--   General Purpose (SSD) volumes, <tt>io1</tt> for Provisioned IOPS (SSD)
--   volumes, <tt>st1</tt> for Throughput Optimized hard disk drives (HDD),
--   <tt>sc1</tt> for Cold HDD,and <tt>standard</tt> for Magnetic volumes.
--   
--   If you specify the <tt>io1</tt> volume type, you must also specify a
--   value for the <tt>Iops</tt> attribute. The maximum ratio of
--   provisioned IOPS to requested volume size (in GiB) is 50:1. AWS uses
--   the default volume size (in GiB) specified in the AMI attributes to
--   set IOPS to 50 x (volume size).
--   
--   <a>$sel:snapshotId:EbsBlockDevice'</a>,
--   <a>ebsBlockDevice_snapshotId</a> - The snapshot ID.
newEbsBlockDevice :: EbsBlockDevice

-- | Whether the volume is deleted on instance termination.
ebsBlockDevice_deleteOnTermination :: Lens' EbsBlockDevice (Maybe Bool)

-- | The volume size, in GiB. For more information, see
--   <a>EbsBlockDevice</a>.
ebsBlockDevice_volumeSize :: Lens' EbsBlockDevice (Maybe Int)

-- | The number of I/O operations per second (IOPS) that the volume
--   supports. For more information, see <a>EbsBlockDevice</a>.
ebsBlockDevice_iops :: Lens' EbsBlockDevice (Maybe Int)

-- | The volume type. <tt>gp2</tt> for General Purpose (SSD) volumes,
--   <tt>io1</tt> for Provisioned IOPS (SSD) volumes, <tt>st1</tt> for
--   Throughput Optimized hard disk drives (HDD), <tt>sc1</tt> for Cold
--   HDD,and <tt>standard</tt> for Magnetic volumes.
--   
--   If you specify the <tt>io1</tt> volume type, you must also specify a
--   value for the <tt>Iops</tt> attribute. The maximum ratio of
--   provisioned IOPS to requested volume size (in GiB) is 50:1. AWS uses
--   the default volume size (in GiB) specified in the AMI attributes to
--   set IOPS to 50 x (volume size).
ebsBlockDevice_volumeType :: Lens' EbsBlockDevice (Maybe VolumeType)

-- | The snapshot ID.
ebsBlockDevice_snapshotId :: Lens' EbsBlockDevice (Maybe Text)

-- | Describes a registered Amazon ECS cluster.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEcsCluster</a> smart constructor.
data EcsCluster
EcsCluster' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> EcsCluster

-- | The cluster's ARN.
[$sel:ecsClusterArn:EcsCluster'] :: EcsCluster -> Maybe Text

-- | The cluster name.
[$sel:ecsClusterName:EcsCluster'] :: EcsCluster -> Maybe Text

-- | The time and date that the cluster was registered with the stack.
[$sel:registeredAt:EcsCluster'] :: EcsCluster -> Maybe Text

-- | The stack ID.
[$sel:stackId:EcsCluster'] :: EcsCluster -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>EcsCluster</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--

--   <a>ecsCluster_ecsClusterName</a> - The cluster name.
--

--   The time and date that the cluster was registered with the stack.

ecsCluster_stackId :: Lens' EcsCluster (Maybe Text)

-- | Describes an Elastic IP address.

[$sel:domain:ElasticIp'] :: ElasticIp -> Maybe Text

[$sel:ip:ElasticIp'] :: ElasticIp -> Maybe Text

--   Endpoints</a>.
[$sel:region:ElasticIp'] :: ElasticIp -> Maybe Text

--   
--   <a>$sel:ip:ElasticIp'</a>, <a>elasticIp_ip</a> - The IP address.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:ElasticIp'</a>, <a>elasticIp_name</a> - The name.

-- | Describes an Elastic Load Balancing instance.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newElasticLoadBalancer</a> smart constructor.
data ElasticLoadBalancer
ElasticLoadBalancer' :: Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> ElasticLoadBalancer

-- | A list of subnet IDs, if the stack is running in a VPC.
[$sel:subnetIds:ElasticLoadBalancer'] :: ElasticLoadBalancer -> Maybe [Text]

-- | The VPC ID.
[$sel:vpcId:ElasticLoadBalancer'] :: ElasticLoadBalancer -> Maybe Text

-- | A list of Availability Zones.
[$sel:availabilityZones:ElasticLoadBalancer'] :: ElasticLoadBalancer -> Maybe [Text]

-- | The instance's AWS region.
[$sel:region:ElasticLoadBalancer'] :: ElasticLoadBalancer -> Maybe Text

-- | The Elastic Load Balancing instance's name.
[$sel:elasticLoadBalancerName:ElasticLoadBalancer'] :: ElasticLoadBalancer -> Maybe Text

-- | The ID of the stack that the instance is associated with.
[$sel:stackId:ElasticLoadBalancer'] :: ElasticLoadBalancer -> Maybe Text

-- | A list of the EC2 instances that the Elastic Load Balancing instance
--   is managing traffic for.
[$sel:ec2InstanceIds:ElasticLoadBalancer'] :: ElasticLoadBalancer -> Maybe [Text]

-- | The ID of the layer that the instance is attached to.
[$sel:layerId:ElasticLoadBalancer'] :: ElasticLoadBalancer -> Maybe Text

-- | The instance's public DNS name.
[$sel:dnsName:ElasticLoadBalancer'] :: ElasticLoadBalancer -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ElasticLoadBalancer</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:subnetIds:ElasticLoadBalancer'</a>,
--   <a>elasticLoadBalancer_subnetIds</a> - A list of subnet IDs, if the
--   stack is running in a VPC.
--   
--   <a>$sel:vpcId:ElasticLoadBalancer'</a>,
--   <a>elasticLoadBalancer_vpcId</a> - The VPC ID.
--   
--   <a>$sel:availabilityZones:ElasticLoadBalancer'</a>,
--   <a>elasticLoadBalancer_availabilityZones</a> - A list of Availability
--   Zones.
--   
--   <a>$sel:region:ElasticLoadBalancer'</a>,
--   <a>elasticLoadBalancer_region</a> - The instance's AWS region.
--   
--   <a>$sel:elasticLoadBalancerName:ElasticLoadBalancer'</a>,
--   <a>elasticLoadBalancer_elasticLoadBalancerName</a> - The Elastic Load
--   Balancing instance's name.
--   
--   <a>$sel:stackId:ElasticLoadBalancer'</a>,
--   <a>elasticLoadBalancer_stackId</a> - The ID of the stack that the
--   instance is associated with.
--   
--   <a>$sel:ec2InstanceIds:ElasticLoadBalancer'</a>,
--   <a>elasticLoadBalancer_ec2InstanceIds</a> - A list of the EC2
--   instances that the Elastic Load Balancing instance is managing traffic
--   for.
--   
--   <a>$sel:layerId:ElasticLoadBalancer'</a>,
--   <a>elasticLoadBalancer_layerId</a> - The ID of the layer that the
--   instance is attached to.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dnsName:ElasticLoadBalancer'</a>,
--   <a>elasticLoadBalancer_dnsName</a> - The instance's public DNS name.
newElasticLoadBalancer :: ElasticLoadBalancer

-- | A list of subnet IDs, if the stack is running in a VPC.
elasticLoadBalancer_subnetIds :: Lens' ElasticLoadBalancer (Maybe [Text])

-- | The VPC ID.
elasticLoadBalancer_vpcId :: Lens' ElasticLoadBalancer (Maybe Text)

-- | A list of Availability Zones.
elasticLoadBalancer_availabilityZones :: Lens' ElasticLoadBalancer (Maybe [Text])

-- | The instance's AWS region.
elasticLoadBalancer_region :: Lens' ElasticLoadBalancer (Maybe Text)

-- | The Elastic Load Balancing instance's name.
elasticLoadBalancer_elasticLoadBalancerName :: Lens' ElasticLoadBalancer (Maybe Text)

-- | The ID of the stack that the instance is associated with.
elasticLoadBalancer_stackId :: Lens' ElasticLoadBalancer (Maybe Text)

-- | A list of the EC2 instances that the Elastic Load Balancing instance
--   is managing traffic for.
elasticLoadBalancer_ec2InstanceIds :: Lens' ElasticLoadBalancer (Maybe [Text])

-- | The ID of the layer that the instance is attached to.
elasticLoadBalancer_layerId :: Lens' ElasticLoadBalancer (Maybe Text)

-- | The instance's public DNS name.
elasticLoadBalancer_dnsName :: Lens' ElasticLoadBalancer (Maybe Text)

-- | Represents an app's environment variable.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEnvironmentVariable</a> smart constructor.
data EnvironmentVariable
EnvironmentVariable' :: Maybe Bool -> Text -> Text -> EnvironmentVariable

-- | (Optional) Whether the variable's value will be returned by the
--   DescribeApps action. To conceal an environment variable's value, set
--   <tt>Secure</tt> to <tt>true</tt>. <tt>DescribeApps</tt> then returns
--   <tt>*****FILTERED*****</tt> instead of the actual value. The default
--   value for <tt>Secure</tt> is <tt>false</tt>.
[$sel:secure:EnvironmentVariable'] :: EnvironmentVariable -> Maybe Bool

-- | (Required) The environment variable's name, which can consist of up to
--   64 characters and must be specified. The name can contain upper- and
--   lowercase letters, numbers, and underscores (_), but it must start
--   with a letter or underscore.
[$sel:key:EnvironmentVariable'] :: EnvironmentVariable -> Text

-- | (Optional) The environment variable's value, which can be left empty.
--   If you specify a value, it can contain up to 256 characters, which
--   must all be printable.
[$sel:value:EnvironmentVariable'] :: EnvironmentVariable -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>EnvironmentVariable</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:secure:EnvironmentVariable'</a>,
--   <a>environmentVariable_secure</a> - (Optional) Whether the variable's
--   value will be returned by the DescribeApps action. To conceal an
--   environment variable's value, set <tt>Secure</tt> to <tt>true</tt>.
--   <tt>DescribeApps</tt> then returns <tt>*****FILTERED*****</tt> instead
--   of the actual value. The default value for <tt>Secure</tt> is
--   <tt>false</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:key:EnvironmentVariable'</a>, <a>environmentVariable_key</a> -
--   (Required) The environment variable's name, which can consist of up to
--   64 characters and must be specified. The name can contain upper- and
--   lowercase letters, numbers, and underscores (_), but it must start
--   with a letter or underscore.
--   
--   <a>$sel:value:EnvironmentVariable'</a>,
--   <a>environmentVariable_value</a> - (Optional) The environment
--   variable's value, which can be left empty. If you specify a value, it
--   can contain up to 256 characters, which must all be printable.
newEnvironmentVariable :: Text -> Text -> EnvironmentVariable

-- | (Optional) Whether the variable's value will be returned by the
--   DescribeApps action. To conceal an environment variable's value, set
--   <tt>Secure</tt> to <tt>true</tt>. <tt>DescribeApps</tt> then returns
--   <tt>*****FILTERED*****</tt> instead of the actual value. The default
--   value for <tt>Secure</tt> is <tt>false</tt>.
environmentVariable_secure :: Lens' EnvironmentVariable (Maybe Bool)

-- | (Required) The environment variable's name, which can consist of up to
--   64 characters and must be specified. The name can contain upper- and
--   lowercase letters, numbers, and underscores (_), but it must start
--   with a letter or underscore.
environmentVariable_key :: Lens' EnvironmentVariable Text

-- | (Optional) The environment variable's value, which can be left empty.
--   If you specify a value, it can contain up to 256 characters, which
--   must all be printable.
environmentVariable_value :: Lens' EnvironmentVariable Text

-- | Describes an instance.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newInstance</a> smart constructor.
data Instance
Instance' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe VirtualizationType -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe AutoScalingType -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Architecture -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ReportedOs -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe RootDeviceType -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [BlockDeviceMapping] -> Instance

-- | The instance's private DNS name.
[$sel:privateDns:Instance'] :: Instance -> Maybe Text

-- | The instance's reported AWS OpsWorks Stacks agent version.
[$sel:reportedAgentVersion:Instance'] :: Instance -> Maybe Text

-- | The instance ID.
[$sel:instanceId:Instance'] :: Instance -> Maybe Text

-- | The instance status:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><pre>booting</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>connection_lost</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>online</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>pending</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>rebooting</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>requested</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>running_setup</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>setup_failed</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>shutting_down</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>start_failed</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>stop_failed</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>stopped</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>stopping</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>terminated</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>terminating</pre></li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:status:Instance'] :: Instance -> Maybe Text

-- | The instance's private IP address.
[$sel:privateIp:Instance'] :: Instance -> Maybe Text

-- | Whether to install operating system and package updates when the
--   instance boots. The default value is <tt>true</tt>. If this value is
--   set to <tt>false</tt>, you must then update your instances manually by
--   using CreateDeployment to run the <tt>update_dependencies</tt> stack
--   command or by manually running <tt>yum</tt> (Amazon Linux) or
--   <tt>apt-get</tt> (Ubuntu) on the instances.
--   
--   We strongly recommend using the default value of <tt>true</tt>, to
--   ensure that your instances have the latest security updates.
[$sel:installUpdatesOnBoot:Instance'] :: Instance -> Maybe Bool

-- | The instance's virtualization type: <tt>paravirtual</tt> or
--   <tt>hvm</tt>.
[$sel:virtualizationType:Instance'] :: Instance -> Maybe VirtualizationType

-- | The ARN of the instance's IAM profile. For more information about IAM
--   ARNs, see <a>Using Identifiers</a>.
[$sel:instanceProfileArn:Instance'] :: Instance -> Maybe Text

-- | The instance's platform.
[$sel:platform:Instance'] :: Instance -> Maybe Text

-- | The instance host name.
[$sel:hostname:Instance'] :: Instance -> Maybe Text

-- | The SSH key's RSA fingerprint.
[$sel:sshHostRsaKeyFingerprint:Instance'] :: Instance -> Maybe Text

-- | An array containing the instance security group IDs.
[$sel:securityGroupIds:Instance'] :: Instance -> Maybe [Text]

-- | For container instances, the Amazon ECS cluster's ARN.
[$sel:ecsClusterArn:Instance'] :: Instance -> Maybe Text

-- | The instance's Amazon Resource Number (ARN).
[$sel:arn:Instance'] :: Instance -> Maybe Text

-- | The time that the instance was created.
[$sel:createdAt:Instance'] :: Instance -> Maybe Text

-- | The ID of the associated Amazon EC2 instance.
[$sel:ec2InstanceId:Instance'] :: Instance -> Maybe Text

-- | The instance's Amazon EC2 key-pair name.
[$sel:sshKeyName:Instance'] :: Instance -> Maybe Text

-- | The agent version. This parameter is set to <tt>INHERIT</tt> if the
--   instance inherits the default stack setting or to a a version number
--   for a fixed agent version.
[$sel:agentVersion:Instance'] :: Instance -> Maybe Text

-- | The root device volume ID.
[$sel:rootDeviceVolumeId:Instance'] :: Instance -> Maybe Text

-- | The instance's subnet ID; applicable only if the stack is running in a
--   VPC.
[$sel:subnetId:Instance'] :: Instance -> Maybe Text

-- | For registered instances, the infrastructure class: <tt>ec2</tt> or
--   <tt>on-premises</tt>.
[$sel:infrastructureClass:Instance'] :: Instance -> Maybe Text

-- | The SSH key's Deep Security Agent (DSA) fingerprint.
[$sel:sshHostDsaKeyFingerprint:Instance'] :: Instance -> Maybe Text

-- | The instance type, such as <tt>t2.micro</tt>.
[$sel:instanceType:Instance'] :: Instance -> Maybe Text

-- | Whether this is an Amazon EBS-optimized instance.
[$sel:ebsOptimized:Instance'] :: Instance -> Maybe Bool

-- | The instance <a>Elastic IP address</a> .
[$sel:elasticIp:Instance'] :: Instance -> Maybe Text

-- | The instance's operating system.
[$sel:os:Instance'] :: Instance -> Maybe Text

-- | The instance Availability Zone. For more information, see <a>Regions
--   and Endpoints</a>.
[$sel:availabilityZone:Instance'] :: Instance -> Maybe Text

-- | The ID of the last service error. For more information, call
--   DescribeServiceErrors.
[$sel:lastServiceErrorId:Instance'] :: Instance -> Maybe Text

-- | The instance's tenancy option, such as <tt>dedicated</tt> or
--   <tt>host</tt>.
[$sel:tenancy:Instance'] :: Instance -> Maybe Text

-- | For load-based or time-based instances, the type.
[$sel:autoScalingType:Instance'] :: Instance -> Maybe AutoScalingType

-- | An array containing the instance layer IDs.
[$sel:layerIds:Instance'] :: Instance -> Maybe [Text]

-- | The instance architecture: "i386" or "x86_64".
[$sel:architecture:Instance'] :: Instance -> Maybe Architecture

-- | The instance public DNS name.
[$sel:publicDns:Instance'] :: Instance -> Maybe Text

-- | A custom AMI ID to be used to create the instance. For more
--   information, see <a>Instances</a>
[$sel:amiId:Instance'] :: Instance -> Maybe Text

-- | The instance public IP address.
[$sel:publicIp:Instance'] :: Instance -> Maybe Text

-- | For registered instances, the reported operating system.
[$sel:reportedOs:Instance'] :: Instance -> Maybe ReportedOs

-- | For registered instances, who performed the registration.
[$sel:registeredBy:Instance'] :: Instance -> Maybe Text

-- | The stack ID.
[$sel:stackId:Instance'] :: Instance -> Maybe Text

-- | The instance's root device type. For more information, see <a>Storage
--   for the Root Device</a>.
[$sel:rootDeviceType:Instance'] :: Instance -> Maybe RootDeviceType

-- | For container instances, the instance's ARN.
[$sel:ecsContainerInstanceArn:Instance'] :: Instance -> Maybe Text

-- | An array of <tt>BlockDeviceMapping</tt> objects that specify the
--   instance's block device mappings.
[$sel:blockDeviceMappings:Instance'] :: Instance -> Maybe [BlockDeviceMapping]

-- | Create a value of <a>Instance</a> with all optional fields omitted.
