-- | Contains a description of an Amazon EC2 instance from the Amazon EC2
--   metadata service. For more information, see <a>Instance Metadata and
--   User Data</a>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newInstanceIdentity</a> smart constructor.
data InstanceIdentity
InstanceIdentity' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> InstanceIdentity

-- | A signature that can be used to verify the document's accuracy and
--   authenticity.
[$sel:signature:InstanceIdentity'] :: InstanceIdentity -> Maybe Text

-- | A JSON document that contains the metadata.
[$sel:document:InstanceIdentity'] :: InstanceIdentity -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>InstanceIdentity</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:signature:InstanceIdentity'</a>,
--   <a>instanceIdentity_signature</a> - A signature that can be used to
--   verify the document's accuracy and authenticity.
--   
--   <a>$sel:document:InstanceIdentity'</a>,
--   <a>instanceIdentity_document</a> - A JSON document that contains the
--   metadata.
newInstanceIdentity :: InstanceIdentity

-- | A signature that can be used to verify the document's accuracy and
--   authenticity.
instanceIdentity_signature :: Lens' InstanceIdentity (Maybe Text)

-- | A JSON document that contains the metadata.
instanceIdentity_document :: Lens' InstanceIdentity (Maybe Text)

-- | Describes how many instances a stack has for each status.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newInstancesCount</a> smart constructor.
data InstancesCount
InstancesCount' :: Maybe Int -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Int -> InstancesCount

-- | The number of instances with <tt>terminating</tt> status.
[$sel:terminating:InstancesCount'] :: InstancesCount -> Maybe Int

-- | The number of instances with <tt>pending</tt> status.
[$sel:pending:InstancesCount'] :: InstancesCount -> Maybe Int

-- | The number of instances with <tt>online</tt> status.
[$sel:online:InstancesCount'] :: InstancesCount -> Maybe Int

-- | The number of instances in the Unassigning state.
[$sel:unassigning:InstancesCount'] :: InstancesCount -> Maybe Int

-- | The number of instances in the Deregistering state.
[$sel:deregistering:InstancesCount'] :: InstancesCount -> Maybe Int

-- | The number of instances with <tt>running_setup</tt> status.
[$sel:runningSetup:InstancesCount'] :: InstancesCount -> Maybe Int

-- | The number of instances with <tt>requested</tt> status.
[$sel:requested:InstancesCount'] :: InstancesCount -> Maybe Int

-- | The number of instances with <tt>stop_failed</tt> status.
[$sel:stopFailed:InstancesCount'] :: InstancesCount -> Maybe Int

-- | The number of instances with <tt>booting</tt> status.
[$sel:booting:InstancesCount'] :: InstancesCount -> Maybe Int

-- | The number of instances with <tt>stopped</tt> status.
[$sel:stopped:InstancesCount'] :: InstancesCount -> Maybe Int

-- | The number of instances with <tt>rebooting</tt> status.
[$sel:rebooting:InstancesCount'] :: InstancesCount -> Maybe Int

-- | The number of instances in the Assigning state.
[$sel:assigning:InstancesCount'] :: InstancesCount -> Maybe Int

-- | The number of instances with <tt>shutting_down</tt> status.
[$sel:shuttingDown:InstancesCount'] :: InstancesCount -> Maybe Int

-- | The number of instances with <tt>setup_failed</tt> status.
[$sel:setupFailed:InstancesCount'] :: InstancesCount -> Maybe Int

-- | The number of instances with <tt>connection_lost</tt> status.
[$sel:connectionLost:InstancesCount'] :: InstancesCount -> Maybe Int

-- | The number of instances with <tt>terminated</tt> status.
[$sel:terminated:InstancesCount'] :: InstancesCount -> Maybe Int

-- | The number of instances with <tt>stopping</tt> status.
[$sel:stopping:InstancesCount'] :: InstancesCount -> Maybe Int

-- | The number of instances in the Registered state.
[$sel:registered:InstancesCount'] :: InstancesCount -> Maybe Int

-- | The number of instances with <tt>start_failed</tt> status.
[$sel:startFailed:InstancesCount'] :: InstancesCount -> Maybe Int

-- | The number of instances in the Registering state.
[$sel:registering:InstancesCount'] :: InstancesCount -> Maybe Int

-- | Create a value of <a>InstancesCount</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:terminating:InstancesCount'</a>,
--   <a>instancesCount_terminating</a> - The number of instances with
--   <tt>terminating</tt> status.
--   
--   <a>$sel:pending:InstancesCount'</a>, <a>instancesCount_pending</a> -
--   The number of instances with <tt>pending</tt> status.
--   
--   <a>$sel:online:InstancesCount'</a>, <a>instancesCount_online</a> - The
--   number of instances with <tt>online</tt> status.
--   
--   <a>$sel:unassigning:InstancesCount'</a>,
--   <a>instancesCount_unassigning</a> - The number of instances in the
--   Unassigning state.
--   
--   <a>$sel:deregistering:InstancesCount'</a>,
--   <a>instancesCount_deregistering</a> - The number of instances in the
--   Deregistering state.
--   
--   <a>$sel:runningSetup:InstancesCount'</a>,
--   <a>instancesCount_runningSetup</a> - The number of instances with
--   <tt>running_setup</tt> status.
--   
--   <a>$sel:requested:InstancesCount'</a>, <a>instancesCount_requested</a>
--   - The number of instances with <tt>requested</tt> status.
--   
--   <a>$sel:stopFailed:InstancesCount'</a>,
--   <a>instancesCount_stopFailed</a> - The number of instances with
--   <tt>stop_failed</tt> status.
--   
--   <a>$sel:booting:InstancesCount'</a>, <a>instancesCount_booting</a> -
--   The number of instances with <tt>booting</tt> status.
--   
--   <a>$sel:stopped:InstancesCount'</a>, <a>instancesCount_stopped</a> -
--   The number of instances with <tt>stopped</tt> status.
--   
--   <a>$sel:rebooting:InstancesCount'</a>, <a>instancesCount_rebooting</a>
--   - The number of instances with <tt>rebooting</tt> status.
--   
--   <a>$sel:assigning:InstancesCount'</a>, <a>instancesCount_assigning</a>
--   - The number of instances in the Assigning state.
--   
--   <a>$sel:shuttingDown:InstancesCount'</a>,
--   <a>instancesCount_shuttingDown</a> - The number of instances with
--   <tt>shutting_down</tt> status.
--   
--   <a>$sel:setupFailed:InstancesCount'</a>,
--   <a>instancesCount_setupFailed</a> - The number of instances with
--   <tt>setup_failed</tt> status.
--   
--   <a>$sel:connectionLost:InstancesCount'</a>,
--   <a>instancesCount_connectionLost</a> - The number of instances with
--   <tt>connection_lost</tt> status.
--   
--   <a>$sel:terminated:InstancesCount'</a>,
--   <a>instancesCount_terminated</a> - The number of instances with
--   <tt>terminated</tt> status.
--   
--   <a>$sel:stopping:InstancesCount'</a>, <a>instancesCount_stopping</a> -
--   The number of instances with <tt>stopping</tt> status.
--   
--   <a>$sel:registered:InstancesCount'</a>,
--   <a>instancesCount_registered</a> - The number of instances in the
--   Registered state.
--   
--   <a>$sel:startFailed:InstancesCount'</a>,
--   <a>instancesCount_startFailed</a> - The number of instances with
--   <tt>start_failed</tt> status.
--   
--   <a>$sel:registering:InstancesCount'</a>,
--   <a>instancesCount_registering</a> - The number of instances in the
--   Registering state.
newInstancesCount :: InstancesCount

-- | The number of instances with <tt>terminating</tt> status.
instancesCount_terminating :: Lens' InstancesCount (Maybe Int)

-- | The number of instances with <tt>pending</tt> status.
instancesCount_pending :: Lens' InstancesCount (Maybe Int)

-- | The number of instances with <tt>online</tt> status.
instancesCount_online :: Lens' InstancesCount (Maybe Int)

-- | The number of instances in the Unassigning state.
instancesCount_unassigning :: Lens' InstancesCount (Maybe Int)

-- | The number of instances in the Deregistering state.
instancesCount_deregistering :: Lens' InstancesCount (Maybe Int)

-- | The number of instances with <tt>running_setup</tt> status.
instancesCount_runningSetup :: Lens' InstancesCount (Maybe Int)

-- | The number of instances with <tt>requested</tt> status.
instancesCount_requested :: Lens' InstancesCount (Maybe Int)

-- | The number of instances with <tt>stop_failed</tt> status.
instancesCount_stopFailed :: Lens' InstancesCount (Maybe Int)

-- | The number of instances with <tt>booting</tt> status.
instancesCount_booting :: Lens' InstancesCount (Maybe Int)

-- | The number of instances with <tt>stopped</tt> status.
instancesCount_stopped :: Lens' InstancesCount (Maybe Int)

-- | The number of instances with <tt>rebooting</tt> status.
instancesCount_rebooting :: Lens' InstancesCount (Maybe Int)

-- | The number of instances in the Assigning state.
instancesCount_assigning :: Lens' InstancesCount (Maybe Int)

-- | The number of instances with <tt>shutting_down</tt> status.
instancesCount_shuttingDown :: Lens' InstancesCount (Maybe Int)

-- | The number of instances with <tt>setup_failed</tt> status.
instancesCount_setupFailed :: Lens' InstancesCount (Maybe Int)

-- | The number of instances with <tt>connection_lost</tt> status.
instancesCount_connectionLost :: Lens' InstancesCount (Maybe Int)

-- | The number of instances with <tt>terminated</tt> status.
instancesCount_terminated :: Lens' InstancesCount (Maybe Int)

-- | The number of instances with <tt>stopping</tt> status.
instancesCount_stopping :: Lens' InstancesCount (Maybe Int)

-- | The number of instances in the Registered state.
instancesCount_registered :: Lens' InstancesCount (Maybe Int)

-- | The number of instances with <tt>start_failed</tt> status.
instancesCount_startFailed :: Lens' InstancesCount (Maybe Int)

-- | The number of instances in the Registering state.
instancesCount_registering :: Lens' InstancesCount (Maybe Int)

-- | Describes a layer.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newLayer</a> smart constructor.
data Layer
Layer' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe CloudWatchLogsConfiguration -> Maybe LifecycleEventConfiguration -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Recipes -> Maybe Recipes -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [VolumeConfiguration] -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe (HashMap LayerAttributesKeys (Maybe Text)) -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe LayerType -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Bool -> Layer

-- | The ARN of the default IAM profile to be used for the layer's EC2
--   instances. For more information about IAM ARNs, see <a>Using
--   Identifiers</a>.
[$sel:customInstanceProfileArn:Layer'] :: Layer -> Maybe Text

-- | An array containing the layer's custom security group IDs.
[$sel:customSecurityGroupIds:Layer'] :: Layer -> Maybe [Text]

-- | Whether to install operating system and package updates when the
--   instance boots. The default value is <tt>true</tt>. If this value is
--   set to <tt>false</tt>, you must then update your instances manually by
--   using CreateDeployment to run the <tt>update_dependencies</tt> stack
--   command or manually running <tt>yum</tt> (Amazon Linux) or
--   <tt>apt-get</tt> (Ubuntu) on the instances.
--   
--   We strongly recommend using the default value of <tt>true</tt>, to
--   ensure that your instances have the latest security updates.
[$sel:installUpdatesOnBoot:Layer'] :: Layer -> Maybe Bool

-- | The Amazon CloudWatch Logs configuration settings for the layer.
[$sel:cloudWatchLogsConfiguration:Layer'] :: Layer -> Maybe CloudWatchLogsConfiguration

-- | A <tt>LifeCycleEventConfiguration</tt> object that specifies the
--   Shutdown event configuration.
[$sel:lifecycleEventConfiguration:Layer'] :: Layer -> Maybe LifecycleEventConfiguration

-- | The Amazon Resource Number (ARN) of a layer.
[$sel:arn:Layer'] :: Layer -> Maybe Text

-- | Date when the layer was created.
[$sel:createdAt:Layer'] :: Layer -> Maybe Text

-- | The layer short name.
[$sel:shortname:Layer'] :: Layer -> Maybe Text

-- | AWS OpsWorks Stacks supports five lifecycle events: <b>setup</b>,
--   <b>configuration</b>, <b>deploy</b>, <b>undeploy</b>, and
--   <b>shutdown</b>. For each layer, AWS OpsWorks Stacks runs a set of
--   standard recipes for each event. You can also provide custom recipes
--   for any or all layers and events. AWS OpsWorks Stacks runs custom
--   event recipes after the standard recipes. <tt>LayerCustomRecipes</tt>
--   specifies the custom recipes for a particular layer to be run in
--   response to each of the five events.
--   
--   To specify a recipe, use the cookbook's directory name in the
--   repository followed by two colons and the recipe name, which is the
--   recipe's file name without the <tt>.rb</tt> extension. For example:
--   <tt>phpapp2::dbsetup</tt> specifies the <tt>dbsetup.rb</tt> recipe in
--   the repository's <tt>phpapp2</tt> folder.
[$sel:defaultRecipes:Layer'] :: Layer -> Maybe Recipes

-- | A <tt>LayerCustomRecipes</tt> object that specifies the layer's custom
--   recipes.
[$sel:customRecipes:Layer'] :: Layer -> Maybe Recipes

-- | A JSON formatted string containing the layer's custom stack
--   configuration and deployment attributes.
[$sel:customJson:Layer'] :: Layer -> Maybe Text

-- | A <tt>VolumeConfigurations</tt> object that describes the layer's
--   Amazon EBS volumes.
[$sel:volumeConfigurations:Layer'] :: Layer -> Maybe [VolumeConfiguration]

-- | Whether auto healing is disabled for the layer.
[$sel:enableAutoHealing:Layer'] :: Layer -> Maybe Bool

-- | An array of <tt>Package</tt> objects that describe the layer's
--   packages.
[$sel:packages:Layer'] :: Layer -> Maybe [Text]

-- | The layer attributes.
--   
--   For the <tt>HaproxyStatsPassword</tt>, <tt>MysqlRootPassword</tt>, and
--   <tt>GangliaPassword</tt> attributes, AWS OpsWorks Stacks returns
--   <tt>*****FILTERED*****</tt> instead of the actual value
--   
--   For an ECS Cluster layer, AWS OpsWorks Stacks the
--   <tt>EcsClusterArn</tt> attribute is set to the cluster's ARN.
[$sel:attributes:Layer'] :: Layer -> Maybe (HashMap LayerAttributesKeys (Maybe Text))

-- | The layer name.
[$sel:name:Layer'] :: Layer -> Maybe Text

-- | For stacks that are running in a VPC, whether to automatically assign
--   a public IP address to the layer's instances. For more information,
--   see <a>How to Edit a Layer</a>.
[$sel:autoAssignPublicIps:Layer'] :: Layer -> Maybe Bool

-- | The layer type.
[$sel:type':Layer'] :: Layer -> Maybe LayerType

-- | Whether the layer uses Amazon EBS-optimized instances.
[$sel:useEbsOptimizedInstances:Layer'] :: Layer -> Maybe Bool

-- | The layer stack ID.
[$sel:stackId:Layer'] :: Layer -> Maybe Text

-- | The layer ID.
[$sel:layerId:Layer'] :: Layer -> Maybe Text

-- | An array containing the layer's security group names.
[$sel:defaultSecurityGroupNames:Layer'] :: Layer -> Maybe [Text]

-- | Whether to automatically assign an <a>Elastic IP address</a> to the
--   layer's instances. For more information, see <a>How to Edit a
--   Layer</a>.
[$sel:autoAssignElasticIps:Layer'] :: Layer -> Maybe Bool

-- | Create a value of <a>Layer</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:customInstanceProfileArn:Layer'</a>,
--   <a>layer_customInstanceProfileArn</a> - The ARN of the default IAM
--   profile to be used for the layer's EC2 instances. For more information
--   about IAM ARNs, see <a>Using Identifiers</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:customSecurityGroupIds:Layer'</a>,
--   <a>layer_customSecurityGroupIds</a> - An array containing the layer's
--   custom security group IDs.
--   
--   <a>$sel:installUpdatesOnBoot:Layer'</a>,
--   <a>layer_installUpdatesOnBoot</a> - Whether to install operating
--   system and package updates when the instance boots. The default value
--   is <tt>true</tt>. If this value is set to <tt>false</tt>, you must
--   then update your instances manually by using CreateDeployment to run
--   the <tt>update_dependencies</tt> stack command or manually running
--   <tt>yum</tt> (Amazon Linux) or <tt>apt-get</tt> (Ubuntu) on the
--   instances.
--   
--   We strongly recommend using the default value of <tt>true</tt>, to
--   ensure that your instances have the latest security updates.
--   
--   <a>$sel:cloudWatchLogsConfiguration:Layer'</a>,
--   <a>layer_cloudWatchLogsConfiguration</a> - The Amazon CloudWatch Logs
--   configuration settings for the layer.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lifecycleEventConfiguration:Layer'</a>,
--   <a>layer_lifecycleEventConfiguration</a> - A
--   <tt>LifeCycleEventConfiguration</tt> object that specifies the
--   Shutdown event configuration.
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:Layer'</a>, <a>layer_arn</a> - The Amazon Resource Number
--   (ARN) of a layer.
--   
--   <a>$sel:createdAt:Layer'</a>, <a>layer_createdAt</a> - Date when the
--   layer was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:shortname:Layer'</a>, <a>layer_shortname</a> - The layer short
--   name.
--   
--   <a>$sel:defaultRecipes:Layer'</a>, <a>layer_defaultRecipes</a> - AWS
--   OpsWorks Stacks supports five lifecycle events: <b>setup</b>,
--   <b>configuration</b>, <b>deploy</b>, <b>undeploy</b>, and
--   <b>shutdown</b>. For each layer, AWS OpsWorks Stacks runs a set of
--   standard recipes for each event. You can also provide custom recipes
--   for any or all layers and events. AWS OpsWorks Stacks runs custom
--   event recipes after the standard recipes. <tt>LayerCustomRecipes</tt>
--   specifies the custom recipes for a particular layer to be run in
--   response to each of the five events.
--   
--   To specify a recipe, use the cookbook's directory name in the
--   repository followed by two colons and the recipe name, which is the
--   recipe's file name without the <tt>.rb</tt> extension. For example:
--   <tt>phpapp2::dbsetup</tt> specifies the <tt>dbsetup.rb</tt> recipe in
--   the repository's <tt>phpapp2</tt> folder.
--   
--   <a>$sel:customRecipes:Layer'</a>, <a>layer_customRecipes</a> - A
--   <tt>LayerCustomRecipes</tt> object that specifies the layer's custom
--   recipes.
--   
--   <a>$sel:customJson:Layer'</a>, <a>layer_customJson</a> - A JSON
--   formatted string containing the layer's custom stack configuration and
--   deployment attributes.
--   
--   <a>$sel:volumeConfigurations:Layer'</a>,
--   <a>layer_volumeConfigurations</a> - A <tt>VolumeConfigurations</tt>
--   object that describes the layer's Amazon EBS volumes.
--   
--   <a>$sel:enableAutoHealing:Layer'</a>, <a>layer_enableAutoHealing</a> -
--   Whether auto healing is disabled for the layer.
--   
--   <a>$sel:packages:Layer'</a>, <a>layer_packages</a> - An array of
--   <tt>Package</tt> objects that describe the layer's packages.
--   
--   <a>$sel:attributes:Layer'</a>, <a>layer_attributes</a> - The layer
--   attributes.
--   
--   For the <tt>HaproxyStatsPassword</tt>, <tt>MysqlRootPassword</tt>, and
--   <tt>GangliaPassword</tt> attributes, AWS OpsWorks Stacks returns
--   <tt>*****FILTERED*****</tt> instead of the actual value
--   
--   For an ECS Cluster layer, AWS OpsWorks Stacks the
--   <tt>EcsClusterArn</tt> attribute is set to the cluster's ARN.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:Layer'</a>, <a>layer_name</a> - The layer name.
--   
--   <a>$sel:autoAssignPublicIps:Layer'</a>,
--   <a>layer_autoAssignPublicIps</a> - For stacks that are running in a
--   VPC, whether to automatically assign a public IP address to the
--   layer's instances. For more information, see <a>How to Edit a
--   Layer</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:type':Layer'</a>, <a>layer_type</a> - The layer type.
--   
--   <a>$sel:useEbsOptimizedInstances:Layer'</a>,
--   <a>layer_useEbsOptimizedInstances</a> - Whether the layer uses Amazon
--   EBS-optimized instances.
--   
--   <a>$sel:stackId:Layer'</a>, <a>layer_stackId</a> - The layer stack ID.
--   
--   <a>$sel:layerId:Layer'</a>, <a>layer_layerId</a> - The layer ID.
--   
--   <a>$sel:defaultSecurityGroupNames:Layer'</a>,
--   <a>layer_defaultSecurityGroupNames</a> - An array containing the
--   layer's security group names.
--   
--   <a>$sel:autoAssignElasticIps:Layer'</a>,
--   <a>layer_autoAssignElasticIps</a> - Whether to automatically assign an
--   <a>Elastic IP address</a> to the layer's instances. For more
--   information, see <a>How to Edit a Layer</a>.
newLayer :: Layer

-- | The ARN of the default IAM profile to be used for the layer's EC2
--   instances. For more information about IAM ARNs, see <a>Using
--   Identifiers</a>.
layer_customInstanceProfileArn :: Lens' Layer (Maybe Text)

-- | An array containing the layer's custom security group IDs.
layer_customSecurityGroupIds :: Lens' Layer (Maybe [Text])

-- | Whether to install operating system and package updates when the
--   instance boots. The default value is <tt>true</tt>. If this value is
--   set to <tt>false</tt>, you must then update your instances manually by
--   using CreateDeployment to run the <tt>update_dependencies</tt> stack
--   command or manually running <tt>yum</tt> (Amazon Linux) or
--   <tt>apt-get</tt> (Ubuntu) on the instances.
--   
--   We strongly recommend using the default value of <tt>true</tt>, to
--   ensure that your instances have the latest security updates.
layer_installUpdatesOnBoot :: Lens' Layer (Maybe Bool)

-- | The Amazon CloudWatch Logs configuration settings for the layer.
layer_cloudWatchLogsConfiguration :: Lens' Layer (Maybe CloudWatchLogsConfiguration)

-- | A <tt>LifeCycleEventConfiguration</tt> object that specifies the
--   Shutdown event configuration.
layer_lifecycleEventConfiguration :: Lens' Layer (Maybe LifecycleEventConfiguration)

-- | The Amazon Resource Number (ARN) of a layer.
layer_arn :: Lens' Layer (Maybe Text)

-- | Date when the layer was created.
layer_createdAt :: Lens' Layer (Maybe Text)

-- | The layer short name.
layer_shortname :: Lens' Layer (Maybe Text)

-- | AWS OpsWorks Stacks supports five lifecycle events: <b>setup</b>,
--   <b>configuration</b>, <b>deploy</b>, <b>undeploy</b>, and
--   <b>shutdown</b>. For each layer, AWS OpsWorks Stacks runs a set of
--   standard recipes for each event. You can also provide custom recipes
--   for any or all layers and events. AWS OpsWorks Stacks runs custom
--   event recipes after the standard recipes. <tt>LayerCustomRecipes</tt>
--   specifies the custom recipes for a particular layer to be run in
--   response to each of the five events.
--   
--   To specify a recipe, use the cookbook's directory name in the
--   repository followed by two colons and the recipe name, which is the
--   recipe's file name without the <tt>.rb</tt> extension. For example:
--   <tt>phpapp2::dbsetup</tt> specifies the <tt>dbsetup.rb</tt> recipe in
--   the repository's <tt>phpapp2</tt> folder.
layer_defaultRecipes :: Lens' Layer (Maybe Recipes)

-- | A <tt>LayerCustomRecipes</tt> object that specifies the layer's custom
--   recipes.
layer_customRecipes :: Lens' Layer (Maybe Recipes)

--   configuration and deployment attributes.
layer_customJson :: Lens' Layer (Maybe Text)

-- | A <tt>VolumeConfigurations</tt> object that describes the layer's
--   Amazon EBS volumes.
layer_volumeConfigurations :: Lens' Layer (Maybe [VolumeConfiguration])

-- | Whether auto healing is disabled for the layer.
layer_enableAutoHealing :: Lens' Layer (Maybe Bool)

-- | An array of <tt>Package</tt> objects that describe the layer's
--   packages.
layer_packages :: Lens' Layer (Maybe [Text])

-- | The layer attributes.
--   
--   For the <tt>HaproxyStatsPassword</tt>, <tt>MysqlRootPassword</tt>, and
--   <tt>GangliaPassword</tt> attributes, AWS OpsWorks Stacks returns
--   <tt>*****FILTERED*****</tt> instead of the actual value
--   
--   For an ECS Cluster layer, AWS OpsWorks Stacks the
--   <tt>EcsClusterArn</tt> attribute is set to the cluster's ARN.
layer_attributes :: Lens' Layer (Maybe (HashMap LayerAttributesKeys (Maybe Text)))

-- | The layer name.
layer_name :: Lens' Layer (Maybe Text)

-- | For stacks that are running in a VPC, whether to automatically assign
--   a public IP address to the layer's instances. For more information,
--   see <a>How to Edit a Layer</a>.
layer_autoAssignPublicIps :: Lens' Layer (Maybe Bool)

-- | The layer type.
layer_type :: Lens' Layer (Maybe LayerType)

-- | Whether the layer uses Amazon EBS-optimized instances.
layer_useEbsOptimizedInstances :: Lens' Layer (Maybe Bool)

-- | The layer stack ID.
layer_stackId :: Lens' Layer (Maybe Text)

layer_layerId :: Lens' Layer (Maybe Text)

layer_defaultSecurityGroupNames :: Lens' Layer (Maybe [Text])

--   layer's instances. For more information, see <a>How to Edit a
--   Layer</a>.
layer_autoAssignElasticIps :: Lens' Layer (Maybe Bool)

-- | Specifies the lifecycle event configuration
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newLifecycleEventConfiguration</a> smart constructor.
data LifecycleEventConfiguration
LifecycleEventConfiguration' :: Maybe ShutdownEventConfiguration -> LifecycleEventConfiguration

-- | A <tt>ShutdownEventConfiguration</tt> object that specifies the
--   Shutdown event configuration.
[$sel:shutdown:LifecycleEventConfiguration'] :: LifecycleEventConfiguration -> Maybe ShutdownEventConfiguration

-- | Create a value of <a>LifecycleEventConfiguration</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:shutdown:LifecycleEventConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>lifecycleEventConfiguration_shutdown</a> - A
--   <tt>ShutdownEventConfiguration</tt> object that specifies the Shutdown
--   event configuration.
newLifecycleEventConfiguration :: LifecycleEventConfiguration

-- | A <tt>ShutdownEventConfiguration</tt> object that specifies the
--   Shutdown event configuration.
lifecycleEventConfiguration_shutdown :: Lens' LifecycleEventConfiguration (Maybe ShutdownEventConfiguration)

-- | Describes a layer's load-based auto scaling configuration.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newLoadBasedAutoScalingConfiguration</a> smart
--   constructor.
data LoadBasedAutoScalingConfiguration
LoadBasedAutoScalingConfiguration' :: Maybe AutoScalingThresholds -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe AutoScalingThresholds -> Maybe Text -> LoadBasedAutoScalingConfiguration

-- | An <tt>AutoScalingThresholds</tt> object that describes the upscaling
--   configuration, which defines how and when AWS OpsWorks Stacks
--   increases the number of instances.
[$sel:upScaling:LoadBasedAutoScalingConfiguration'] :: LoadBasedAutoScalingConfiguration -> Maybe AutoScalingThresholds

-- | Whether load-based auto scaling is enabled for the layer.
[$sel:enable:LoadBasedAutoScalingConfiguration'] :: LoadBasedAutoScalingConfiguration -> Maybe Bool

-- | An <tt>AutoScalingThresholds</tt> object that describes the
--   downscaling configuration, which defines how and when AWS OpsWorks
--   Stacks reduces the number of instances.
[$sel:downScaling:LoadBasedAutoScalingConfiguration'] :: LoadBasedAutoScalingConfiguration -> Maybe AutoScalingThresholds

-- | The layer ID.
[$sel:layerId:LoadBasedAutoScalingConfiguration'] :: LoadBasedAutoScalingConfiguration -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>LoadBasedAutoScalingConfiguration</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:upScaling:LoadBasedAutoScalingConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>loadBasedAutoScalingConfiguration_upScaling</a> - An
--   <tt>AutoScalingThresholds</tt> object that describes the upscaling
--   configuration, which defines how and when AWS OpsWorks Stacks
--   increases the number of instances.
--   
--   <a>$sel:enable:LoadBasedAutoScalingConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>loadBasedAutoScalingConfiguration_enable</a> - Whether load-based
--   auto scaling is enabled for the layer.
--   
--   <a>$sel:downScaling:LoadBasedAutoScalingConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>loadBasedAutoScalingConfiguration_downScaling</a> - An
--   <tt>AutoScalingThresholds</tt> object that describes the downscaling
--   configuration, which defines how and when AWS OpsWorks Stacks reduces
--   the number of instances.
--   
--   <a>$sel:layerId:LoadBasedAutoScalingConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>loadBasedAutoScalingConfiguration_layerId</a> - The layer ID.
newLoadBasedAutoScalingConfiguration :: LoadBasedAutoScalingConfiguration

-- | An <tt>AutoScalingThresholds</tt> object that describes the upscaling
--   configuration, which defines how and when AWS OpsWorks Stacks
--   increases the number of instances.
loadBasedAutoScalingConfiguration_upScaling :: Lens' LoadBasedAutoScalingConfiguration (Maybe AutoScalingThresholds)

-- | Whether load-based auto scaling is enabled for the layer.
loadBasedAutoScalingConfiguration_enable :: Lens' LoadBasedAutoScalingConfiguration (Maybe Bool)

-- | An <tt>AutoScalingThresholds</tt> object that describes the
--   downscaling configuration, which defines how and when AWS OpsWorks
--   Stacks reduces the number of instances.
loadBasedAutoScalingConfiguration_downScaling :: Lens' LoadBasedAutoScalingConfiguration (Maybe AutoScalingThresholds)

-- | The layer ID.
loadBasedAutoScalingConfiguration_layerId :: Lens' LoadBasedAutoScalingConfiguration (Maybe Text)

-- | Describes supported operating systems in AWS OpsWorks Stacks.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newOperatingSystem</a> smart constructor.
data OperatingSystem
OperatingSystem' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [OperatingSystemConfigurationManager] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> OperatingSystem

-- | The version of the operating system, including the release and
--   edition, if applicable.
[$sel:reportedVersion:OperatingSystem'] :: OperatingSystem -> Maybe Text

-- | Indicates that an operating system is not supported for new instances.
[$sel:supported:OperatingSystem'] :: OperatingSystem -> Maybe Bool

-- | The name of the operating system, such as <tt>Amazon Linux
--   2018.03</tt>.
[$sel:name:OperatingSystem'] :: OperatingSystem -> Maybe Text

-- | The ID of a supported operating system, such as <tt>Amazon Linux
--   2018.03</tt>.
[$sel:id:OperatingSystem'] :: OperatingSystem -> Maybe Text

-- | Supported configuration manager name and versions for an AWS OpsWorks
--   Stacks operating system.
[$sel:configurationManagers:OperatingSystem'] :: OperatingSystem -> Maybe [OperatingSystemConfigurationManager]

-- | The type of a supported operating system, either <tt>Linux</tt> or
--   <tt>Windows</tt>.
[$sel:type':OperatingSystem'] :: OperatingSystem -> Maybe Text

-- | A short name for the operating system manufacturer.
[$sel:reportedName:OperatingSystem'] :: OperatingSystem -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>OperatingSystem</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:reportedVersion:OperatingSystem'</a>,
--   <a>operatingSystem_reportedVersion</a> - The version of the operating
--   system, including the release and edition, if applicable.
--   
--   <a>$sel:supported:OperatingSystem'</a>,
--   <a>operatingSystem_supported</a> - Indicates that an operating system
--   is not supported for new instances.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:OperatingSystem'</a>, <a>operatingSystem_name</a> - The
--   name of the operating system, such as <tt>Amazon Linux 2018.03</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:id:OperatingSystem'</a>, <a>operatingSystem_id</a> - The ID of
--   a supported operating system, such as <tt>Amazon Linux 2018.03</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:configurationManagers:OperatingSystem'</a>,
--   <a>operatingSystem_configurationManagers</a> - Supported configuration
--   manager name and versions for an AWS OpsWorks Stacks operating system.
--   
--   <a>$sel:type':OperatingSystem'</a>, <a>operatingSystem_type</a> - The
--   type of a supported operating system, either <tt>Linux</tt> or
--   <tt>Windows</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:reportedName:OperatingSystem'</a>,
--   <a>operatingSystem_reportedName</a> - A short name for the operating
--   system manufacturer.
newOperatingSystem :: OperatingSystem

-- | The version of the operating system, including the release and
--   edition, if applicable.
operatingSystem_reportedVersion :: Lens' OperatingSystem (Maybe Text)

-- | Indicates that an operating system is not supported for new instances.
operatingSystem_supported :: Lens' OperatingSystem (Maybe Bool)

-- | The name of the operating system, such as <tt>Amazon Linux
--   2018.03</tt>.
operatingSystem_name :: Lens' OperatingSystem (Maybe Text)

-- | The ID of a supported operating system, such as <tt>Amazon Linux
--   2018.03</tt>.
operatingSystem_id :: Lens' OperatingSystem (Maybe Text)

-- | Supported configuration manager name and versions for an AWS OpsWorks
--   Stacks operating system.
operatingSystem_configurationManagers :: Lens' OperatingSystem (Maybe [OperatingSystemConfigurationManager])

-- | The type of a supported operating system, either <tt>Linux</tt> or
--   <tt>Windows</tt>.
operatingSystem_type :: Lens' OperatingSystem (Maybe Text)

-- | A short name for the operating system manufacturer.
operatingSystem_reportedName :: Lens' OperatingSystem (Maybe Text)

-- | A block that contains information about the configuration manager
--   (Chef) and the versions of the configuration manager that are
--   supported for an operating system.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newOperatingSystemConfigurationManager</a> smart
--   constructor.
data OperatingSystemConfigurationManager
OperatingSystemConfigurationManager' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> OperatingSystemConfigurationManager

-- | The name of the configuration manager, which is Chef.
[$sel:name:OperatingSystemConfigurationManager'] :: OperatingSystemConfigurationManager -> Maybe Text

-- | The versions of the configuration manager that are supported by an
--   operating system.
[$sel:version:OperatingSystemConfigurationManager'] :: OperatingSystemConfigurationManager -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>OperatingSystemConfigurationManager</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:OperatingSystemConfigurationManager'</a>,
--   <a>operatingSystemConfigurationManager_name</a> - The name of the
--   configuration manager, which is Chef.
--   
--   <a>$sel:version:OperatingSystemConfigurationManager'</a>,
--   <a>operatingSystemConfigurationManager_version</a> - The versions of
--   the configuration manager that are supported by an operating system.
newOperatingSystemConfigurationManager :: OperatingSystemConfigurationManager

-- | The name of the configuration manager, which is Chef.
operatingSystemConfigurationManager_name :: Lens' OperatingSystemConfigurationManager (Maybe Text)

-- | The versions of the configuration manager that are supported by an
--   operating system.
operatingSystemConfigurationManager_version :: Lens' OperatingSystemConfigurationManager (Maybe Text)

-- | Describes stack or user permissions.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newPermission</a> smart constructor.
data Permission
Permission' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Permission

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for an AWS Identity and Access
--   Management (IAM) role. For more information about IAM ARNs, see
--   <a>Using Identifiers</a>.
[$sel:iamUserArn:Permission'] :: Permission -> Maybe Text

-- | Whether the user can use <b>sudo</b>.
[$sel:allowSudo:Permission'] :: Permission -> Maybe Bool

-- | A stack ID.
[$sel:stackId:Permission'] :: Permission -> Maybe Text

-- | The user's permission level, which must be the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><pre>deny</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>show</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>deploy</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>manage</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>iam_only</pre></li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   For more information on the permissions associated with these levels,
--   see <a>Managing User Permissions</a>
[$sel:level:Permission'] :: Permission -> Maybe Text

-- | Whether the user can use SSH.
[$sel:allowSsh:Permission'] :: Permission -> Maybe Bool

-- | Create a value of <a>Permission</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:iamUserArn:Permission'</a>, <a>permission_iamUserArn</a> - The
--   Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for an AWS Identity and Access Management
--   (IAM) role. For more information about IAM ARNs, see <a>Using
--   Identifiers</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:allowSudo:Permission'</a>, <a>permission_allowSudo</a> -
--   Whether the user can use <b>sudo</b>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:stackId:Permission'</a>, <a>permission_stackId</a> - A stack
--   ID.
--   
--   <a>$sel:level:Permission'</a>, <a>permission_level</a> - The user's
--   permission level, which must be the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><pre>deny</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>show</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>deploy</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>manage</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>iam_only</pre></li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   For more information on the permissions associated with these levels,
--   see <a>Managing User Permissions</a>
--   
--   <a>$sel:allowSsh:Permission'</a>, <a>permission_allowSsh</a> - Whether
--   the user can use SSH.
newPermission :: Permission

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for an AWS Identity and Access
--   Management (IAM) role. For more information about IAM ARNs, see
--   <a>Using Identifiers</a>.
permission_iamUserArn :: Lens' Permission (Maybe Text)

-- | Whether the user can use <b>sudo</b>.
permission_allowSudo :: Lens' Permission (Maybe Bool)

-- | A stack ID.
permission_stackId :: Lens' Permission (Maybe Text)

-- | The user's permission level, which must be the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><pre>deny</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>show</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>deploy</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>manage</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>iam_only</pre></li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   For more information on the permissions associated with these levels,
--   see <a>Managing User Permissions</a>
permission_level :: Lens' Permission (Maybe Text)

-- | Whether the user can use SSH.
permission_allowSsh :: Lens' Permission (Maybe Bool)

-- | Describes an instance's RAID array.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newRaidArray</a> smart constructor.
data RaidArray
RaidArray' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> RaidArray

-- | The instance ID.
[$sel:instanceId:RaidArray'] :: RaidArray -> Maybe Text

-- | The array's size.
[$sel:size:RaidArray'] :: RaidArray -> Maybe Int

-- | For PIOPS volumes, the IOPS per disk.
[$sel:iops:RaidArray'] :: RaidArray -> Maybe Int

-- | When the RAID array was created.
[$sel:createdAt:RaidArray'] :: RaidArray -> Maybe Text

-- | The <a>RAID level</a>.
[$sel:raidLevel:RaidArray'] :: RaidArray -> Maybe Int

-- | The array's Linux device. For example /dev/mdadm0.
[$sel:device:RaidArray'] :: RaidArray -> Maybe Text

-- | The number of disks in the array.
[$sel:numberOfDisks:RaidArray'] :: RaidArray -> Maybe Int

-- | The array's Availability Zone. For more information, see <a>Regions
--   and Endpoints</a>.
[$sel:availabilityZone:RaidArray'] :: RaidArray -> Maybe Text

-- | The array name.
[$sel:name:RaidArray'] :: RaidArray -> Maybe Text

-- | The array ID.
[$sel:raidArrayId:RaidArray'] :: RaidArray -> Maybe Text

-- | The volume type, standard or PIOPS.
[$sel:volumeType:RaidArray'] :: RaidArray -> Maybe Text

-- | The stack ID.
[$sel:stackId:RaidArray'] :: RaidArray -> Maybe Text

-- | The array's mount point.
[$sel:mountPoint:RaidArray'] :: RaidArray -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>RaidArray</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:instanceId:RaidArray'</a>, <a>raidArray_instanceId</a> - The
--   instance ID.
--   
--   <a>$sel:size:RaidArray'</a>, <a>raidArray_size</a> - The array's size.
--   
--   <a>$sel:iops:RaidArray'</a>, <a>raidArray_iops</a> - For PIOPS
--   volumes, the IOPS per disk.
--   
--   <a>$sel:createdAt:RaidArray'</a>, <a>raidArray_createdAt</a> - When
--   the RAID array was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:raidLevel:RaidArray'</a>, <a>raidArray_raidLevel</a> - The
--   <a>RAID level</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:device:RaidArray'</a>, <a>raidArray_device</a> - The array's
--   Linux device. For example /dev/mdadm0.
--   
--   <a>$sel:numberOfDisks:RaidArray'</a>, <a>raidArray_numberOfDisks</a> -
--   The number of disks in the array.
--   
--   <a>$sel:availabilityZone:RaidArray'</a>,
--   <a>raidArray_availabilityZone</a> - The array's Availability Zone. For
--   more information, see <a>Regions and Endpoints</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:RaidArray'</a>, <a>raidArray_name</a> - The array name.
--   
--   <a>$sel:raidArrayId:RaidArray'</a>, <a>raidArray_raidArrayId</a> - The
--   array ID.
--   
--   <a>$sel:volumeType:RaidArray'</a>, <a>raidArray_volumeType</a> - The
--   volume type, standard or PIOPS.
--   
--   <a>$sel:stackId:RaidArray'</a>, <a>raidArray_stackId</a> - The stack
--   ID.
--   
--   <a>$sel:mountPoint:RaidArray'</a>, <a>raidArray_mountPoint</a> - The
--   array's mount point.
newRaidArray :: RaidArray

-- | The instance ID.
raidArray_instanceId :: Lens' RaidArray (Maybe Text)

-- | The array's size.
raidArray_size :: Lens' RaidArray (Maybe Int)

-- | For PIOPS volumes, the IOPS per disk.
raidArray_iops :: Lens' RaidArray (Maybe Int)

-- | When the RAID array was created.
raidArray_createdAt :: Lens' RaidArray (Maybe Text)

-- | The <a>RAID level</a>.
raidArray_raidLevel :: Lens' RaidArray (Maybe Int)

-- | The array's Linux device. For example /dev/mdadm0.
raidArray_device :: Lens' RaidArray (Maybe Text)

raidArray_numberOfDisks :: Lens' RaidArray (Maybe Int)

--   and Endpoints</a>.
raidArray_availabilityZone :: Lens' RaidArray (Maybe Text)

-- | The array name.
raidArray_name :: Lens' RaidArray (Maybe Text)

-- | The array ID.
raidArray_raidArrayId :: Lens' RaidArray (Maybe Text)

raidArray_volumeType :: Lens' RaidArray (Maybe Text)

-- | Describes an Amazon RDS instance.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newRdsDbInstance</a> smart constructor.
data RdsDbInstance
RdsDbInstance' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> RdsDbInstance

-- | The instance's ARN.
[$sel:rdsDbInstanceArn:RdsDbInstance'] :: RdsDbInstance -> Maybe Text

-- | The master user name.
[$sel:dbUser:RdsDbInstance'] :: RdsDbInstance -> Maybe Text

-- | Set to <tt>true</tt> if AWS OpsWorks Stacks is unable to discover the
--   Amazon RDS instance. AWS OpsWorks Stacks attempts to discover the
--   instance only once. If this value is set to <tt>true</tt>, you must
--   deregister the instance, and then register it again.
[$sel:missingOnRds:RdsDbInstance'] :: RdsDbInstance -> Maybe Bool

-- | The instance's database engine.
[$sel:engine:RdsDbInstance'] :: RdsDbInstance -> Maybe Text

-- | The instance's address.
[$sel:address:RdsDbInstance'] :: RdsDbInstance -> Maybe Text

-- | The DB instance identifier.
[$sel:dbInstanceIdentifier:RdsDbInstance'] :: RdsDbInstance -> Maybe Text

-- | The instance's AWS region.
[$sel:region:RdsDbInstance'] :: RdsDbInstance -> Maybe Text

-- | The ID of the stack with which the instance is registered.
[$sel:stackId:RdsDbInstance'] :: RdsDbInstance -> Maybe Text

-- | AWS OpsWorks Stacks returns <tt>*****FILTERED*****</tt> instead of the
--   actual value.
[$sel:dbPassword:RdsDbInstance'] :: RdsDbInstance -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>RdsDbInstance</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:rdsDbInstanceArn:RdsDbInstance'</a>,
--   <a>rdsDbInstance_rdsDbInstanceArn</a> - The instance's ARN.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dbUser:RdsDbInstance'</a>, <a>rdsDbInstance_dbUser</a> - The
--   master user name.
--   
--   <a>$sel:missingOnRds:RdsDbInstance'</a>,
--   <a>rdsDbInstance_missingOnRds</a> - Set to <tt>true</tt> if AWS
--   OpsWorks Stacks is unable to discover the Amazon RDS instance. AWS
--   OpsWorks Stacks attempts to discover the instance only once. If this
--   value is set to <tt>true</tt>, you must deregister the instance, and
--   then register it again.
--   
--   <a>$sel:engine:RdsDbInstance'</a>, <a>rdsDbInstance_engine</a> - The
--   instance's database engine.
--   
--   <a>$sel:address:RdsDbInstance'</a>, <a>rdsDbInstance_address</a> - The
--   instance's address.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dbInstanceIdentifier:RdsDbInstance'</a>,
--   <a>rdsDbInstance_dbInstanceIdentifier</a> - The DB instance
--   identifier.

--   instance's AWS region.
--   
--   <a>$sel:stackId:RdsDbInstance'</a>, <a>rdsDbInstance_stackId</a> - The
--   ID of the stack with which the instance is registered.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dbPassword:RdsDbInstance'</a>, <a>rdsDbInstance_dbPassword</a>
--   - AWS OpsWorks Stacks returns <tt>*****FILTERED*****</tt> instead of
--   the actual value.
newRdsDbInstance :: RdsDbInstance

-- | The instance's ARN.
rdsDbInstance_rdsDbInstanceArn :: Lens' RdsDbInstance (Maybe Text)

rdsDbInstance_dbUser :: Lens' RdsDbInstance (Maybe Text)

-- | Set to <tt>true</tt> if AWS OpsWorks Stacks is unable to discover the
--   Amazon RDS instance. AWS OpsWorks Stacks attempts to discover the
--   instance only once. If this value is set to <tt>true</tt>, you must
--   deregister the instance, and then register it again.
rdsDbInstance_missingOnRds :: Lens' RdsDbInstance (Maybe Bool)

-- | The instance's database engine.
rdsDbInstance_engine :: Lens' RdsDbInstance (Maybe Text)

-- | The instance's address.
rdsDbInstance_address :: Lens' RdsDbInstance (Maybe Text)

-- | The DB instance identifier.
rdsDbInstance_dbInstanceIdentifier :: Lens' RdsDbInstance (Maybe Text)

-- | The instance's AWS region.
rdsDbInstance_region :: Lens' RdsDbInstance (Maybe Text)

-- | The ID of the stack with which the instance is registered.
rdsDbInstance_stackId :: Lens' RdsDbInstance (Maybe Text)

-- | AWS OpsWorks Stacks returns <tt>*****FILTERED*****</tt> instead of the
--   actual value.
rdsDbInstance_dbPassword :: Lens' RdsDbInstance (Maybe Text)

-- | AWS OpsWorks Stacks supports five lifecycle events: <b>setup</b>,
--   <b>configuration</b>, <b>deploy</b>, <b>undeploy</b>, and
--   <b>shutdown</b>. For each layer, AWS OpsWorks Stacks runs a set of
--   standard recipes for each event. In addition, you can provide custom
--   recipes for any or all layers and events. AWS OpsWorks Stacks runs
--   custom event recipes after the standard recipes.
--   <tt>LayerCustomRecipes</tt> specifies the custom recipes for a
--   particular layer to be run in response to each of the five events.
--   
--   To specify a recipe, use the cookbook's directory name in the
--   repository followed by two colons and the recipe name, which is the
--   recipe's file name without the .rb extension. For example:
--   phpapp2::dbsetup specifies the dbsetup.rb recipe in the repository's
--   phpapp2 folder.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newRecipes</a> smart constructor.
data Recipes
Recipes' :: Maybe [Text] -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe [Text] -> Recipes

-- | An array of custom recipe names to be run following a <tt>setup</tt>
--   event.
[$sel:setup:Recipes'] :: Recipes -> Maybe [Text]

-- | An array of custom recipe names to be run following a
--   <tt>shutdown</tt> event.
[$sel:shutdown:Recipes'] :: Recipes -> Maybe [Text]

-- | An array of custom recipe names to be run following a
--   <tt>undeploy</tt> event.
[$sel:undeploy:Recipes'] :: Recipes -> Maybe [Text]

-- | An array of custom recipe names to be run following a
--   <tt>configure</tt> event.
[$sel:configure:Recipes'] :: Recipes -> Maybe [Text]

-- | An array of custom recipe names to be run following a <tt>deploy</tt>
--   event.
[$sel:deploy:Recipes'] :: Recipes -> Maybe [Text]

-- | Create a value of <a>Recipes</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:setup:Recipes'</a>, <a>recipes_setup</a> - An array of custom
--   recipe names to be run following a <tt>setup</tt> event.
--   
--   <a>$sel:shutdown:Recipes'</a>, <a>recipes_shutdown</a> - An array of
--   custom recipe names to be run following a <tt>shutdown</tt> event.
--   
--   <a>$sel:undeploy:Recipes'</a>, <a>recipes_undeploy</a> - An array of
--   custom recipe names to be run following a <tt>undeploy</tt> event.
--   
--   <a>$sel:configure:Recipes'</a>, <a>recipes_configure</a> - An array of
--   custom recipe names to be run following a <tt>configure</tt> event.
--   
--   <a>$sel:deploy:Recipes'</a>, <a>recipes_deploy</a> - An array of
--   custom recipe names to be run following a <tt>deploy</tt> event.
newRecipes :: Recipes

-- | An array of custom recipe names to be run following a <tt>setup</tt>
--   event.
recipes_setup :: Lens' Recipes (Maybe [Text])

-- | An array of custom recipe names to be run following a
--   <tt>shutdown</tt> event.
recipes_shutdown :: Lens' Recipes (Maybe [Text])

-- | An array of custom recipe names to be run following a
--   <tt>undeploy</tt> event.
recipes_undeploy :: Lens' Recipes (Maybe [Text])

-- | An array of custom recipe names to be run following a
--   <tt>configure</tt> event.
recipes_configure :: Lens' Recipes (Maybe [Text])

-- | An array of custom recipe names to be run following a <tt>deploy</tt>
--   event.
recipes_deploy :: Lens' Recipes (Maybe [Text])
