-- | Describes an AWS OpsWorks Stacks service error.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newServiceError</a> smart constructor.
data ServiceError
ServiceError' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> ServiceError

-- | The instance ID.
[$sel:instanceId:ServiceError'] :: ServiceError -> Maybe Text

-- | When the error occurred.
[$sel:createdAt:ServiceError'] :: ServiceError -> Maybe Text

-- | The error ID.
[$sel:serviceErrorId:ServiceError'] :: ServiceError -> Maybe Text

-- | The error type.
[$sel:type':ServiceError'] :: ServiceError -> Maybe Text

-- | The stack ID.
[$sel:stackId:ServiceError'] :: ServiceError -> Maybe Text

-- | A message that describes the error.
[$sel:message:ServiceError'] :: ServiceError -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ServiceError</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:instanceId:ServiceError'</a>, <a>serviceError_instanceId</a> -
--   The instance ID.
--   
--   <a>$sel:createdAt:ServiceError'</a>, <a>serviceError_createdAt</a> -
--   When the error occurred.
--   
--   <a>$sel:serviceErrorId:ServiceError'</a>,
--   <a>serviceError_serviceErrorId</a> - The error ID.
--   
--   <a>$sel:type':ServiceError'</a>, <a>serviceError_type</a> - The error
--   type.
--   
--   <a>$sel:stackId:ServiceError'</a>, <a>serviceError_stackId</a> - The
--   stack ID.
--   
--   <a>$sel:message:ServiceError'</a>, <a>serviceError_message</a> - A
--   message that describes the error.
newServiceError :: ServiceError

-- | The instance ID.
serviceError_instanceId :: Lens' ServiceError (Maybe Text)

-- | When the error occurred.
serviceError_createdAt :: Lens' ServiceError (Maybe Text)

-- | The error ID.
serviceError_serviceErrorId :: Lens' ServiceError (Maybe Text)

-- | The error type.
serviceError_type :: Lens' ServiceError (Maybe Text)

-- | The stack ID.
serviceError_stackId :: Lens' ServiceError (Maybe Text)

-- | A message that describes the error.
serviceError_message :: Lens' ServiceError (Maybe Text)

-- | The Shutdown event configuration.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newShutdownEventConfiguration</a> smart constructor.
data ShutdownEventConfiguration
ShutdownEventConfiguration' :: Maybe Int -> Maybe Bool -> ShutdownEventConfiguration

-- | The time, in seconds, that AWS OpsWorks Stacks will wait after
--   triggering a Shutdown event before shutting down an instance.
[$sel:executionTimeout:ShutdownEventConfiguration'] :: ShutdownEventConfiguration -> Maybe Int

-- | Whether to enable Elastic Load Balancing connection draining. For more
--   information, see <a>Connection Draining</a>
[$sel:delayUntilElbConnectionsDrained:ShutdownEventConfiguration'] :: ShutdownEventConfiguration -> Maybe Bool

-- | Create a value of <a>ShutdownEventConfiguration</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:executionTimeout:ShutdownEventConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>shutdownEventConfiguration_executionTimeout</a> - The time, in
--   seconds, that AWS OpsWorks Stacks will wait after triggering a
--   Shutdown event before shutting down an instance.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:delayUntilElbConnectionsDrained:ShutdownEventConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>shutdownEventConfiguration_delayUntilElbConnectionsDrained</a> -
--   Whether to enable Elastic Load Balancing connection draining. For more
--   information, see <a>Connection Draining</a>
newShutdownEventConfiguration :: ShutdownEventConfiguration

-- | The time, in seconds, that AWS OpsWorks Stacks will wait after
--   triggering a Shutdown event before shutting down an instance.
shutdownEventConfiguration_executionTimeout :: Lens' ShutdownEventConfiguration (Maybe Int)

-- | Whether to enable Elastic Load Balancing connection draining. For more
--   information, see <a>Connection Draining</a>
shutdownEventConfiguration_delayUntilElbConnectionsDrained :: Lens' ShutdownEventConfiguration (Maybe Bool)

-- | Contains the information required to retrieve an app or cookbook from
--   a repository. For more information, see <a>Creating Apps</a> or
--   <a>Custom Recipes and Cookbooks</a>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSource</a> smart constructor.
data Source
Source' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe SourceType -> Maybe Text -> Source

-- | The source URL. The following is an example of an Amazon S3 source
--   URL:
--   <tt>https://s3.amazonaws.com/opsworks-demo-bucket/opsworks_cookbook_demo.tar.gz</tt>.
[$sel:url:Source'] :: Source -> Maybe Text

-- | This parameter depends on the repository type.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>For Amazon S3 bundles, set <tt>Username</tt> to the appropriate
--   IAM access key ID.</li>
--   <li>For HTTP bundles, Git repositories, and Subversion repositories,
--   set <tt>Username</tt> to the user name.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:username:Source'] :: Source -> Maybe Text

-- | In requests, the repository's SSH key.
--   
--   In responses, AWS OpsWorks Stacks returns <tt>*****FILTERED*****</tt>
--   instead of the actual value.
[$sel:sshKey:Source'] :: Source -> Maybe Text

-- | When included in a request, the parameter depends on the repository
--   type.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>For Amazon S3 bundles, set <tt>Password</tt> to the appropriate
--   IAM secret access key.</li>
--   <li>For HTTP bundles and Subversion repositories, set
--   <tt>Password</tt> to the password.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   For more information on how to safely handle IAM credentials, see
--   <a>https://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/aws-access-keys-best-practices.html</a>.
--   
--   In responses, AWS OpsWorks Stacks returns <tt>*****FILTERED*****</tt>
--   instead of the actual value.
[$sel:password:Source'] :: Source -> Maybe Text

-- | The repository type.
[$sel:type':Source'] :: Source -> Maybe SourceType

-- | The application's version. AWS OpsWorks Stacks enables you to easily
--   deploy new versions of an application. One of the simplest approaches
--   is to have branches or revisions in your repository that represent
--   different versions that can potentially be deployed.
[$sel:revision:Source'] :: Source -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>Source</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:url:Source'</a>, <a>source_url</a> - The source URL. The
--   following is an example of an Amazon S3 source URL:
--   <tt>https://s3.amazonaws.com/opsworks-demo-bucket/opsworks_cookbook_demo.tar.gz</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:username:Source'</a>, <a>source_username</a> - This parameter
--   depends on the repository type.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>For Amazon S3 bundles, set <tt>Username</tt> to the appropriate
--   IAM access key ID.</li>
--   <li>For HTTP bundles, Git repositories, and Subversion repositories,
--   set <tt>Username</tt> to the user name.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:sshKey:Source'</a>, <a>source_sshKey</a> - In requests, the
--   repository's SSH key.
--   
--   In responses, AWS OpsWorks Stacks returns <tt>*****FILTERED*****</tt>
--   instead of the actual value.
--   
--   <a>$sel:password:Source'</a>, <a>source_password</a> - When included
--   in a request, the parameter depends on the repository type.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>For Amazon S3 bundles, set <tt>Password</tt> to the appropriate
--   IAM secret access key.</li>
--   <li>For HTTP bundles and Subversion repositories, set
--   <tt>Password</tt> to the password.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   For more information on how to safely handle IAM credentials, see
--   <a>https://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/aws-access-keys-best-practices.html</a>.
--   
--   In responses, AWS OpsWorks Stacks returns <tt>*****FILTERED*****</tt>
--   instead of the actual value.
--   
--   <a>$sel:type':Source'</a>, <a>source_type</a> - The repository type.
--   
--   <a>$sel:revision:Source'</a>, <a>source_revision</a> - The
--   application's version. AWS OpsWorks Stacks enables you to easily
--   deploy new versions of an application. One of the simplest approaches
--   is to have branches or revisions in your repository that represent
--   different versions that can potentially be deployed.
newSource :: Source

-- | The source URL. The following is an example of an Amazon S3 source
--   URL:
--   <tt>https://s3.amazonaws.com/opsworks-demo-bucket/opsworks_cookbook_demo.tar.gz</tt>.
source_url :: Lens' Source (Maybe Text)

-- | This parameter depends on the repository type.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>For Amazon S3 bundles, set <tt>Username</tt> to the appropriate
--   IAM access key ID.</li>
--   <li>For HTTP bundles, Git repositories, and Subversion repositories,
--   set <tt>Username</tt> to the user name.</li>
--   </ul>
source_username :: Lens' Source (Maybe Text)

-- | In requests, the repository's SSH key.
--   
--   In responses, AWS OpsWorks Stacks returns <tt>*****FILTERED*****</tt>
--   instead of the actual value.
source_sshKey :: Lens' Source (Maybe Text)

-- | When included in a request, the parameter depends on the repository
--   type.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>For Amazon S3 bundles, set <tt>Password</tt> to the appropriate
--   IAM secret access key.</li>
--   <li>For HTTP bundles and Subversion repositories, set
--   <tt>Password</tt> to the password.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   For more information on how to safely handle IAM credentials, see
--   <a>https://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/aws-access-keys-best-practices.html</a>.
--   
--   In responses, AWS OpsWorks Stacks returns <tt>*****FILTERED*****</tt>
--   instead of the actual value.
source_password :: Lens' Source (Maybe Text)

-- | The repository type.
source_type :: Lens' Source (Maybe SourceType)

-- | The application's version. AWS OpsWorks Stacks enables you to easily
--   deploy new versions of an application. One of the simplest approaches
--   is to have branches or revisions in your repository that represent
--   different versions that can potentially be deployed.
source_revision :: Lens' Source (Maybe Text)

-- | Describes an app's SSL configuration.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSslConfiguration</a> smart constructor.
data SslConfiguration
SslConfiguration' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> SslConfiguration

-- | The private key; the contents of the certificate's domain.kex file.
[$sel:privateKey:SslConfiguration'] :: SslConfiguration -> Maybe Text

-- | The contents of the certificate's domain.crt file.
[$sel:certificate:SslConfiguration'] :: SslConfiguration -> Maybe Text

-- | Optional. Can be used to specify an intermediate certificate authority
--   key or client authentication.
[$sel:chain:SslConfiguration'] :: SslConfiguration -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>SslConfiguration</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:privateKey:SslConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>sslConfiguration_privateKey</a> - The private key; the contents of
--   the certificate's domain.kex file.
--   
--   <a>$sel:certificate:SslConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>sslConfiguration_certificate</a> - The contents of the
--   certificate's domain.crt file.
--   
--   <a>$sel:chain:SslConfiguration'</a>, <a>sslConfiguration_chain</a> -
--   Optional. Can be used to specify an intermediate certificate authority
--   key or client authentication.
newSslConfiguration :: SslConfiguration

-- | The private key; the contents of the certificate's domain.kex file.
sslConfiguration_privateKey :: Lens' SslConfiguration (Maybe Text)

-- | The contents of the certificate's domain.crt file.
sslConfiguration_certificate :: Lens' SslConfiguration (Maybe Text)

-- | Optional. Can be used to specify an intermediate certificate authority
--   key or client authentication.
sslConfiguration_chain :: Lens' SslConfiguration (Maybe Text)

-- | Describes a stack.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newStack</a> smart constructor.
data Stack
Stack' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe RootDeviceType -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ChefConfiguration -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Source -> Maybe Text -> Maybe (HashMap StackAttributesKeys (Maybe Text)) -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe StackConfigurationManager -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Stack

-- | The ARN of an IAM profile that is the default profile for all of the
--   stack's EC2 instances. For more information about IAM ARNs, see
--   <a>Using Identifiers</a>.
[$sel:defaultInstanceProfileArn:Stack'] :: Stack -> Maybe Text

-- | The stack AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) role.
[$sel:serviceRoleArn:Stack'] :: Stack -> Maybe Text

-- | The default root device type. This value is used by default for all
--   instances in the stack, but you can override it when you create an
--   instance. For more information, see <a>Storage for the Root
--   Device</a>.
[$sel:defaultRootDeviceType:Stack'] :: Stack -> Maybe RootDeviceType

-- | The stack's ARN.
[$sel:arn:Stack'] :: Stack -> Maybe Text

-- | The date when the stack was created.
[$sel:createdAt:Stack'] :: Stack -> Maybe Text

-- | The VPC ID; applicable only if the stack is running in a VPC.
[$sel:vpcId:Stack'] :: Stack -> Maybe Text

-- | A <tt>ChefConfiguration</tt> object that specifies whether to enable
--   Berkshelf and the Berkshelf version. For more information, see
--   <a>Create a New Stack</a>.
[$sel:chefConfiguration:Stack'] :: Stack -> Maybe ChefConfiguration

-- | The agent version. This parameter is set to <tt>LATEST</tt> for
--   auto-update. or a version number for a fixed agent version.
[$sel:agentVersion:Stack'] :: Stack -> Maybe Text

-- | A default Amazon EC2 key pair for the stack's instances. You can
--   override this value when you create or update an instance.
[$sel:defaultSshKeyName:Stack'] :: Stack -> Maybe Text

-- | A JSON object that contains user-defined attributes to be added to the
--   stack configuration and deployment attributes. You can use custom JSON
--   to override the corresponding default stack configuration attribute
--   values or to pass data to recipes. The string should be in the
--   following format:
--   
--   <pre>
--   "{\"key1\": \"value1\", \"key2\": \"value2\",...}"
--   </pre>
--   
--   For more information on custom JSON, see <a>Use Custom JSON to Modify
--   the Stack Configuration Attributes</a>.
[$sel:customJson:Stack'] :: Stack -> Maybe Text

-- | Contains the information required to retrieve an app or cookbook from
--   a repository. For more information, see <a>Adding Apps</a> or
--   <a>Cookbooks and Recipes</a>.
[$sel:customCookbooksSource:Stack'] :: Stack -> Maybe Source

-- | The stack's default Availability Zone. For more information, see
--   <a>Regions and Endpoints</a>.
[$sel:defaultAvailabilityZone:Stack'] :: Stack -> Maybe Text

-- | The stack's attributes.
[$sel:attributes:Stack'] :: Stack -> Maybe (HashMap StackAttributesKeys (Maybe Text))

-- | The stack name.
[$sel:name:Stack'] :: Stack -> Maybe Text

-- | The stack's default operating system.
[$sel:defaultOs:Stack'] :: Stack -> Maybe Text

-- | Whether the stack automatically associates the AWS OpsWorks Stacks
--   built-in security groups with the stack's layers.
[$sel:useOpsworksSecurityGroups:Stack'] :: Stack -> Maybe Bool

-- | Whether the stack uses custom cookbooks.
[$sel:useCustomCookbooks:Stack'] :: Stack -> Maybe Bool

-- | The default subnet ID; applicable only if the stack is running in a
--   VPC.
[$sel:defaultSubnetId:Stack'] :: Stack -> Maybe Text

-- | The stack AWS region, such as "ap-northeast-2". For more information
--   about AWS regions, see <a>Regions and Endpoints</a>.
[$sel:region:Stack'] :: Stack -> Maybe Text

-- | The configuration manager.
[$sel:configurationManager:Stack'] :: Stack -> Maybe StackConfigurationManager

-- | The stack ID.
[$sel:stackId:Stack'] :: Stack -> Maybe Text

-- | The stack host name theme, with spaces replaced by underscores.
[$sel:hostnameTheme:Stack'] :: Stack -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>Stack</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:defaultInstanceProfileArn:Stack'</a>,
--   <a>stack_defaultInstanceProfileArn</a> - The ARN of an IAM profile
--   that is the default profile for all of the stack's EC2 instances. For
--   more information about IAM ARNs, see <a>Using Identifiers</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:serviceRoleArn:Stack'</a>, <a>stack_serviceRoleArn</a> - The
--   stack AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) role.
--   
--   <a>$sel:defaultRootDeviceType:Stack'</a>,
--   <a>stack_defaultRootDeviceType</a> - The default root device type.
--   This value is used by default for all instances in the stack, but you
--   can override it when you create an instance. For more information, see
--   <a>Storage for the Root Device</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:Stack'</a>, <a>stack_arn</a> - The stack's ARN.
--   
--   <a>$sel:createdAt:Stack'</a>, <a>stack_createdAt</a> - The date when
--   the stack was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:vpcId:Stack'</a>, <a>stack_vpcId</a> - The VPC ID; applicable
--   only if the stack is running in a VPC.
--   
--   <a>$sel:chefConfiguration:Stack'</a>, <a>stack_chefConfiguration</a> -
--   A <tt>ChefConfiguration</tt> object that specifies whether to enable
--   Berkshelf and the Berkshelf version. For more information, see
--   <a>Create a New Stack</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:agentVersion:Stack'</a>, <a>stack_agentVersion</a> - The agent
--   version. This parameter is set to <tt>LATEST</tt> for auto-update. or
--   a version number for a fixed agent version.
--   
--   <a>$sel:defaultSshKeyName:Stack'</a>, <a>stack_defaultSshKeyName</a> -
--   A default Amazon EC2 key pair for the stack's instances. You can
--   override this value when you create or update an instance.
--   
--   <a>$sel:customJson:Stack'</a>, <a>stack_customJson</a> - A JSON object
--   that contains user-defined attributes to be added to the stack
--   configuration and deployment attributes. You can use custom JSON to
--   override the corresponding default stack configuration attribute
--   values or to pass data to recipes. The string should be in the
--   following format:
--   
--   <pre>
--   "{\"key1\": \"value1\", \"key2\": \"value2\",...}"
--   </pre>
--   
--   For more information on custom JSON, see <a>Use Custom JSON to Modify
--   the Stack Configuration Attributes</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:customCookbooksSource:Stack'</a>,
--   <a>stack_customCookbooksSource</a> - Contains the information required
--   to retrieve an app or cookbook from a repository. For more
--   information, see <a>Adding Apps</a> or <a>Cookbooks and Recipes</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:defaultAvailabilityZone:Stack'</a>,
--   <a>stack_defaultAvailabilityZone</a> - The stack's default
--   Availability Zone. For more information, see <a>Regions and
--   Endpoints</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:attributes:Stack'</a>, <a>stack_attributes</a> - The stack's
--   attributes.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:Stack'</a>, <a>stack_name</a> - The stack name.
--   
--   <a>$sel:defaultOs:Stack'</a>, <a>stack_defaultOs</a> - The stack's
--   default operating system.
--   
--   <a>$sel:useOpsworksSecurityGroups:Stack'</a>,
--   <a>stack_useOpsworksSecurityGroups</a> - Whether the stack
--   automatically associates the AWS OpsWorks Stacks built-in security
--   groups with the stack's layers.
--   
--   <a>$sel:useCustomCookbooks:Stack'</a>, <a>stack_useCustomCookbooks</a>
--   - Whether the stack uses custom cookbooks.
--   
--   <a>$sel:defaultSubnetId:Stack'</a>, <a>stack_defaultSubnetId</a> - The
--   default subnet ID; applicable only if the stack is running in a VPC.
--   
--   <a>$sel:region:Stack'</a>, <a>stack_region</a> - The stack AWS region,
--   such as "ap-northeast-2". For more information about AWS regions, see
--   <a>Regions and Endpoints</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:configurationManager:Stack'</a>,
--   <a>stack_configurationManager</a> - The configuration manager.
--   
--   <a>$sel:stackId:Stack'</a>, <a>stack_stackId</a> - The stack ID.
--   
--   <a>$sel:hostnameTheme:Stack'</a>, <a>stack_hostnameTheme</a> - The
--   stack host name theme, with spaces replaced by underscores.
newStack :: Stack

-- | The ARN of an IAM profile that is the default profile for all of the
--   stack's EC2 instances. For more information about IAM ARNs, see
--   <a>Using Identifiers</a>.
stack_defaultInstanceProfileArn :: Lens' Stack (Maybe Text)

-- | The stack AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) role.
stack_serviceRoleArn :: Lens' Stack (Maybe Text)

-- | The default root device type. This value is used by default for all
--   instances in the stack, but you can override it when you create an
--   instance. For more information, see <a>Storage for the Root
--   Device</a>.
stack_defaultRootDeviceType :: Lens' Stack (Maybe RootDeviceType)

-- | The stack's ARN.
stack_arn :: Lens' Stack (Maybe Text)

-- | The date when the stack was created.
stack_createdAt :: Lens' Stack (Maybe Text)

-- | The VPC ID; applicable only if the stack is running in a VPC.
stack_vpcId :: Lens' Stack (Maybe Text)

-- | A <tt>ChefConfiguration</tt> object that specifies whether to enable
--   Berkshelf and the Berkshelf version. For more information, see
--   <a>Create a New Stack</a>.
stack_chefConfiguration :: Lens' Stack (Maybe ChefConfiguration)

-- | The agent version. This parameter is set to <tt>LATEST</tt> for
--   auto-update. or a version number for a fixed agent version.
stack_agentVersion :: Lens' Stack (Maybe Text)

-- | A default Amazon EC2 key pair for the stack's instances. You can
--   override this value when you create or update an instance.
stack_defaultSshKeyName :: Lens' Stack (Maybe Text)

-- | A JSON object that contains user-defined attributes to be added to the
--   stack configuration and deployment attributes. You can use custom JSON
--   to override the corresponding default stack configuration attribute
--   values or to pass data to recipes. The string should be in the
--   following format:
--   
--   <pre>
--   "{\"key1\": \"value1\", \"key2\": \"value2\",...}"
--   </pre>
--   
--   For more information on custom JSON, see <a>Use Custom JSON to Modify
--   the Stack Configuration Attributes</a>.
stack_customJson :: Lens' Stack (Maybe Text)

-- | Contains the information required to retrieve an app or cookbook from
--   a repository. For more information, see <a>Adding Apps</a> or
--   <a>Cookbooks and Recipes</a>.
stack_customCookbooksSource :: Lens' Stack (Maybe Source)

-- | The stack's default Availability Zone. For more information, see
--   <a>Regions and Endpoints</a>.
stack_defaultAvailabilityZone :: Lens' Stack (Maybe Text)

-- | The stack's attributes.
stack_attributes :: Lens' Stack (Maybe (HashMap StackAttributesKeys (Maybe Text)))

-- | The stack name.
stack_name :: Lens' Stack (Maybe Text)

-- | The stack's default operating system.
stack_defaultOs :: Lens' Stack (Maybe Text)

-- | Whether the stack automatically associates the AWS OpsWorks Stacks
--   built-in security groups with the stack's layers.
stack_useOpsworksSecurityGroups :: Lens' Stack (Maybe Bool)

-- | Whether the stack uses custom cookbooks.
stack_useCustomCookbooks :: Lens' Stack (Maybe Bool)

-- | The default subnet ID; applicable only if the stack is running in a
--   VPC.
stack_defaultSubnetId :: Lens' Stack (Maybe Text)

-- | The stack AWS region, such as "ap-northeast-2". For more information
--   about AWS regions, see <a>Regions and Endpoints</a>.
stack_region :: Lens' Stack (Maybe Text)

-- | The configuration manager.
stack_configurationManager :: Lens' Stack (Maybe StackConfigurationManager)

-- | The stack ID.
stack_stackId :: Lens' Stack (Maybe Text)

-- | The stack host name theme, with spaces replaced by underscores.
stack_hostnameTheme :: Lens' Stack (Maybe Text)

-- | Describes the configuration manager.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newStackConfigurationManager</a> smart constructor.
data StackConfigurationManager
StackConfigurationManager' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> StackConfigurationManager

-- | The name. This parameter must be set to "Chef".
[$sel:name:StackConfigurationManager'] :: StackConfigurationManager -> Maybe Text

-- | The Chef version. This parameter must be set to 12, 11.10, or 11.4 for
--   Linux stacks, and to 12.2 for Windows stacks. The default value for
--   Linux stacks is 11.4.
[$sel:version:StackConfigurationManager'] :: StackConfigurationManager -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>StackConfigurationManager</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:StackConfigurationManager'</a>,
--   <a>stackConfigurationManager_name</a> - The name. This parameter must
--   be set to "Chef".
--   
--   <a>$sel:version:StackConfigurationManager'</a>,
--   <a>stackConfigurationManager_version</a> - The Chef version. This
--   parameter must be set to 12, 11.10, or 11.4 for Linux stacks, and to
--   12.2 for Windows stacks. The default value for Linux stacks is 11.4.
newStackConfigurationManager :: StackConfigurationManager

-- | The name. This parameter must be set to "Chef".
stackConfigurationManager_name :: Lens' StackConfigurationManager (Maybe Text)

-- | The Chef version. This parameter must be set to 12, 11.10, or 11.4 for
--   Linux stacks, and to 12.2 for Windows stacks. The default value for
--   Linux stacks is 11.4.
stackConfigurationManager_version :: Lens' StackConfigurationManager (Maybe Text)

-- | Summarizes the number of layers, instances, and apps in a stack.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newStackSummary</a> smart constructor.
data StackSummary
StackSummary' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe InstancesCount -> StackSummary

-- | The stack's ARN.
[$sel:arn:StackSummary'] :: StackSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | The number of apps.
[$sel:appsCount:StackSummary'] :: StackSummary -> Maybe Int

-- | The stack name.
[$sel:name:StackSummary'] :: StackSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | The stack ID.
[$sel:stackId:StackSummary'] :: StackSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | The number of layers.
[$sel:layersCount:StackSummary'] :: StackSummary -> Maybe Int

-- | An <tt>InstancesCount</tt> object with the number of instances in each
--   status.
[$sel:instancesCount:StackSummary'] :: StackSummary -> Maybe InstancesCount

-- | Create a value of <a>StackSummary</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:StackSummary'</a>, <a>stackSummary_arn</a> - The stack's
--   ARN.
--   
--   <a>$sel:appsCount:StackSummary'</a>, <a>stackSummary_appsCount</a> -
--   The number of apps.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:StackSummary'</a>, <a>stackSummary_name</a> - The stack
--   name.
--   
--   <a>$sel:stackId:StackSummary'</a>, <a>stackSummary_stackId</a> - The
--   stack ID.
--   
--   <a>$sel:layersCount:StackSummary'</a>, <a>stackSummary_layersCount</a>
--   - The number of layers.
--   
--   <a>$sel:instancesCount:StackSummary'</a>,
--   <a>stackSummary_instancesCount</a> - An <tt>InstancesCount</tt> object
--   with the number of instances in each status.
newStackSummary :: StackSummary

-- | The stack's ARN.
stackSummary_arn :: Lens' StackSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | The number of apps.
stackSummary_appsCount :: Lens' StackSummary (Maybe Int)

-- | The stack name.
stackSummary_name :: Lens' StackSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | The stack ID.
stackSummary_stackId :: Lens' StackSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | The number of layers.
stackSummary_layersCount :: Lens' StackSummary (Maybe Int)

-- | An <tt>InstancesCount</tt> object with the number of instances in each
--   status.
stackSummary_instancesCount :: Lens' StackSummary (Maybe InstancesCount)

-- | Contains the data needed by RDP clients such as the Microsoft Remote
--   Desktop Connection to log in to the instance.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTemporaryCredential</a> smart constructor.
data TemporaryCredential
TemporaryCredential' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> TemporaryCredential

-- | The instance's AWS OpsWorks Stacks ID.
[$sel:instanceId:TemporaryCredential'] :: TemporaryCredential -> Maybe Text

-- | The user name.
[$sel:username:TemporaryCredential'] :: TemporaryCredential -> Maybe Text

-- | The password.
[$sel:password:TemporaryCredential'] :: TemporaryCredential -> Maybe Text

-- | The length of time (in minutes) that the grant is valid. When the
--   grant expires, at the end of this period, the user will no longer be
--   able to use the credentials to log in. If they are logged in at the
--   time, they will be automatically logged out.
[$sel:validForInMinutes:TemporaryCredential'] :: TemporaryCredential -> Maybe Int

-- | Create a value of <a>TemporaryCredential</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:instanceId:TemporaryCredential'</a>,
--   <a>temporaryCredential_instanceId</a> - The instance's AWS OpsWorks
--   Stacks ID.
--   
--   <a>$sel:username:TemporaryCredential'</a>,
--   <a>temporaryCredential_username</a> - The user name.
--   
--   <a>$sel:password:TemporaryCredential'</a>,
--   <a>temporaryCredential_password</a> - The password.
--   
--   <a>$sel:validForInMinutes:TemporaryCredential'</a>,
--   <a>temporaryCredential_validForInMinutes</a> - The length of time (in
--   minutes) that the grant is valid. When the grant expires, at the end
--   of this period, the user will no longer be able to use the credentials
--   to log in. If they are logged in at the time, they will be
--   automatically logged out.
newTemporaryCredential :: TemporaryCredential

-- | The instance's AWS OpsWorks Stacks ID.
temporaryCredential_instanceId :: Lens' TemporaryCredential (Maybe Text)

-- | The user name.
temporaryCredential_username :: Lens' TemporaryCredential (Maybe Text)

-- | The password.
temporaryCredential_password :: Lens' TemporaryCredential (Maybe Text)

-- | The length of time (in minutes) that the grant is valid. When the
--   grant expires, at the end of this period, the user will no longer be
--   able to use the credentials to log in. If they are logged in at the
--   time, they will be automatically logged out.
temporaryCredential_validForInMinutes :: Lens' TemporaryCredential (Maybe Int)

--   <tt>WeeklyAutoScalingSchedule</tt> object with the instance schedule.

-- | Describes a user's SSH information.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newUserProfile</a> smart constructor.
data UserProfile
UserProfile' :: Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> UserProfile

-- | Whether users can specify their own SSH public key through the My
--   Settings page. For more information, see <a>Managing User
--   Permissions</a>.
[$sel:allowSelfManagement:UserProfile'] :: UserProfile -> Maybe Bool

-- | The user's SSH public key.
[$sel:sshPublicKey:UserProfile'] :: UserProfile -> Maybe Text

-- | The user's SSH user name.
[$sel:sshUsername:UserProfile'] :: UserProfile -> Maybe Text

-- | The user's IAM ARN.
[$sel:iamUserArn:UserProfile'] :: UserProfile -> Maybe Text

--   fields.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   their own SSH public key through the My Settings page. For more
--   information, see <a>Managing User Permissions</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sshPublicKey:UserProfile'</a>, <a>userProfile_sshPublicKey</a>
--   - The user's SSH public key.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sshUsername:UserProfile'</a>, <a>userProfile_sshUsername</a> -
--   The user's SSH user name.
--   
--   <a>$sel:iamUserArn:UserProfile'</a>, <a>userProfile_iamUserArn</a> -
--   The user's IAM ARN.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:UserProfile'</a>, <a>userProfile_name</a> - The user's
--   name.
newUserProfile :: UserProfile

--   Settings page. For more information, see <a>Managing User
--   Permissions</a>.

userProfile_name :: Lens' UserProfile (Maybe Text)

-- | Describes an instance's Amazon EBS volume.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newVolume</a> smart constructor.
data Volume
Volume' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Volume

-- | The instance ID.
[$sel:instanceId:Volume'] :: Volume -> Maybe Text

-- | The value returned by <a>DescribeVolumes</a>.
[$sel:status:Volume'] :: Volume -> Maybe Text

-- | The volume size.
[$sel:size:Volume'] :: Volume -> Maybe Int

-- | For PIOPS volumes, the IOPS per disk.
[$sel:iops:Volume'] :: Volume -> Maybe Int

-- | The device name.
[$sel:device:Volume'] :: Volume -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies whether an Amazon EBS volume is encrypted. For more
--   information, see <a>Amazon EBS Encryption</a>.
[$sel:encrypted:Volume'] :: Volume -> Maybe Bool

-- | The volume Availability Zone. For more information, see <a>Regions and
--   Endpoints</a>.
[$sel:availabilityZone:Volume'] :: Volume -> Maybe Text

-- | The volume name.
[$sel:name:Volume'] :: Volume -> Maybe Text

-- | The RAID array ID.
[$sel:raidArrayId:Volume'] :: Volume -> Maybe Text

-- | The volume ID.
[$sel:volumeId:Volume'] :: Volume -> Maybe Text

-- | The AWS region. For more information about AWS regions, see <a>Regions
--   and Endpoints</a>.
[$sel:region:Volume'] :: Volume -> Maybe Text

-- | The volume type. For more information, see <a>Amazon EBS Volume
--   Types</a>.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>standard</tt> - Magnetic. Magnetic volumes must have a minimum
--   size of 1 GiB and a maximum size of 1024 GiB.</li>
--   <li><tt>io1</tt> - Provisioned IOPS (SSD). PIOPS volumes must have a
--   minimum size of 4 GiB and a maximum size of 16384 GiB.</li>
--   <li><tt>gp2</tt> - General Purpose (SSD). General purpose volumes must
--   have a minimum size of 1 GiB and a maximum size of 16384 GiB.</li>
--   <li><tt>st1</tt> - Throughput Optimized hard disk drive (HDD).
--   Throughput optimized HDD volumes must have a minimum size of 500 GiB
--   and a maximum size of 16384 GiB.</li>
--   <li><tt>sc1</tt> - Cold HDD. Cold HDD volumes must have a minimum size
--   of 500 GiB and a maximum size of 16384 GiB.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:volumeType:Volume'] :: Volume -> Maybe Text

-- | The Amazon EC2 volume ID.
[$sel:ec2VolumeId:Volume'] :: Volume -> Maybe Text

-- | The volume mount point. For example, "/mnt/disk1".
[$sel:mountPoint:Volume'] :: Volume -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>Volume</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:instanceId:Volume'</a>, <a>volume_instanceId</a> - The
--   instance ID.
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:Volume'</a>, <a>volume_status</a> - The value returned
--   by <a>DescribeVolumes</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:size:Volume'</a>, <a>volume_size</a> - The volume size.
--   
--   <a>$sel:iops:Volume'</a>, <a>volume_iops</a> - For PIOPS volumes, the
--   IOPS per disk.
--   
--   <a>$sel:device:Volume'</a>, <a>volume_device</a> - The device name.
--   
--   <a>$sel:encrypted:Volume'</a>, <a>volume_encrypted</a> - Specifies
--   whether an Amazon EBS volume is encrypted. For more information, see
--   <a>Amazon EBS Encryption</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:availabilityZone:Volume'</a>, <a>volume_availabilityZone</a> -
--   The volume Availability Zone. For more information, see <a>Regions and
--   Endpoints</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:Volume'</a>, <a>volume_name</a> - The volume name.
--   
--   <a>$sel:raidArrayId:Volume'</a>, <a>volume_raidArrayId</a> - The RAID
--   array ID.
--   
--   <a>$sel:volumeId:Volume'</a>, <a>volume_volumeId</a> - The volume ID.
--   
--   <a>$sel:region:Volume'</a>, <a>volume_region</a> - The AWS region. For
--   more information about AWS regions, see <a>Regions and Endpoints</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:volumeType:Volume'</a>, <a>volume_volumeType</a> - The volume
--   type. For more information, see <a>Amazon EBS Volume Types</a>.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>standard</tt> - Magnetic. Magnetic volumes must have a minimum
--   size of 1 GiB and a maximum size of 1024 GiB.</li>
--   <li><tt>io1</tt> - Provisioned IOPS (SSD). PIOPS volumes must have a
--   minimum size of 4 GiB and a maximum size of 16384 GiB.</li>
--   <li><tt>gp2</tt> - General Purpose (SSD). General purpose volumes must
--   have a minimum size of 1 GiB and a maximum size of 16384 GiB.</li>
--   <li><tt>st1</tt> - Throughput Optimized hard disk drive (HDD).
--   Throughput optimized HDD volumes must have a minimum size of 500 GiB
--   and a maximum size of 16384 GiB.</li>
--   <li><tt>sc1</tt> - Cold HDD. Cold HDD volumes must have a minimum size
--   of 500 GiB and a maximum size of 16384 GiB.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:ec2VolumeId:Volume'</a>, <a>volume_ec2VolumeId</a> - The
--   Amazon EC2 volume ID.
--   
--   <a>$sel:mountPoint:Volume'</a>, <a>volume_mountPoint</a> - The volume
--   mount point. For example, "/mnt/disk1".
newVolume :: Volume

-- | The instance ID.
volume_instanceId :: Lens' Volume (Maybe Text)

-- | The value returned by <a>DescribeVolumes</a>.
volume_status :: Lens' Volume (Maybe Text)

-- | The volume size.
volume_size :: Lens' Volume (Maybe Int)

-- | For PIOPS volumes, the IOPS per disk.
volume_iops :: Lens' Volume (Maybe Int)

-- | The device name.
volume_device :: Lens' Volume (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies whether an Amazon EBS volume is encrypted. For more
--   information, see <a>Amazon EBS Encryption</a>.
volume_encrypted :: Lens' Volume (Maybe Bool)

-- | The volume Availability Zone. For more information, see <a>Regions and
--   Endpoints</a>.
volume_availabilityZone :: Lens' Volume (Maybe Text)

-- | The volume name.
volume_name :: Lens' Volume (Maybe Text)

-- | The RAID array ID.
volume_raidArrayId :: Lens' Volume (Maybe Text)

-- | The volume ID.
volume_volumeId :: Lens' Volume (Maybe Text)

-- | The AWS region. For more information about AWS regions, see <a>Regions
--   and Endpoints</a>.
volume_region :: Lens' Volume (Maybe Text)

-- | The volume type. For more information, see <a>Amazon EBS Volume
--   Types</a>.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>standard</tt> - Magnetic. Magnetic volumes must have a minimum
--   size of 1 GiB and a maximum size of 1024 GiB.</li>
--   <li><tt>io1</tt> - Provisioned IOPS (SSD). PIOPS volumes must have a
--   minimum size of 4 GiB and a maximum size of 16384 GiB.</li>
--   <li><tt>gp2</tt> - General Purpose (SSD). General purpose volumes must
--   have a minimum size of 1 GiB and a maximum size of 16384 GiB.</li>
--   <li><tt>st1</tt> - Throughput Optimized hard disk drive (HDD).
--   Throughput optimized HDD volumes must have a minimum size of 500 GiB
--   and a maximum size of 16384 GiB.</li>
--   <li><tt>sc1</tt> - Cold HDD. Cold HDD volumes must have a minimum size
--   of 500 GiB and a maximum size of 16384 GiB.</li>
--   </ul>
volume_volumeType :: Lens' Volume (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon EC2 volume ID.
volume_ec2VolumeId :: Lens' Volume (Maybe Text)

-- | The volume mount point. For example, "/mnt/disk1".
volume_mountPoint :: Lens' Volume (Maybe Text)

-- | Describes an Amazon EBS volume configuration.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newVolumeConfiguration</a> smart constructor.
data VolumeConfiguration
VolumeConfiguration' :: Maybe Int -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Text -> Int -> Int -> VolumeConfiguration

-- | For PIOPS volumes, the IOPS per disk.
[$sel:iops:VolumeConfiguration'] :: VolumeConfiguration -> Maybe Int

-- | The volume <a>RAID level</a>.
[$sel:raidLevel:VolumeConfiguration'] :: VolumeConfiguration -> Maybe Int

-- | Specifies whether an Amazon EBS volume is encrypted. For more
--   information, see <a>Amazon EBS Encryption</a>.
[$sel:encrypted:VolumeConfiguration'] :: VolumeConfiguration -> Maybe Bool

-- | The volume type. For more information, see <a>Amazon EBS Volume
--   Types</a>.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>standard</tt> - Magnetic. Magnetic volumes must have a minimum
--   size of 1 GiB and a maximum size of 1024 GiB.</li>
--   <li><tt>io1</tt> - Provisioned IOPS (SSD). PIOPS volumes must have a
--   minimum size of 4 GiB and a maximum size of 16384 GiB.</li>
--   <li><tt>gp2</tt> - General Purpose (SSD). General purpose volumes must
--   have a minimum size of 1 GiB and a maximum size of 16384 GiB.</li>
--   <li><tt>st1</tt> - Throughput Optimized hard disk drive (HDD).
--   Throughput optimized HDD volumes must have a minimum size of 500 GiB
--   and a maximum size of 16384 GiB.</li>
--   <li><tt>sc1</tt> - Cold HDD. Cold HDD volumes must have a minimum size
--   of 500 GiB and a maximum size of 16384 GiB.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:volumeType:VolumeConfiguration'] :: VolumeConfiguration -> Maybe Text

-- | The volume mount point. For example "/dev/sdh".
[$sel:mountPoint:VolumeConfiguration'] :: VolumeConfiguration -> Text

-- | The number of disks in the volume.
[$sel:numberOfDisks:VolumeConfiguration'] :: VolumeConfiguration -> Int

-- | The volume size.
[$sel:size:VolumeConfiguration'] :: VolumeConfiguration -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>VolumeConfiguration</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:iops:VolumeConfiguration'</a>, <a>volumeConfiguration_iops</a>
--   - For PIOPS volumes, the IOPS per disk.
--   
--   <a>$sel:raidLevel:VolumeConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>volumeConfiguration_raidLevel</a> - The volume <a>RAID level</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:encrypted:VolumeConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>volumeConfiguration_encrypted</a> - Specifies whether an Amazon EBS
--   volume is encrypted. For more information, see <a>Amazon EBS
--   Encryption</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:volumeType:VolumeConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>volumeConfiguration_volumeType</a> - The volume type. For more
--   information, see <a>Amazon EBS Volume Types</a>.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>standard</tt> - Magnetic. Magnetic volumes must have a minimum
--   size of 1 GiB and a maximum size of 1024 GiB.</li>
--   <li><tt>io1</tt> - Provisioned IOPS (SSD). PIOPS volumes must have a
--   minimum size of 4 GiB and a maximum size of 16384 GiB.</li>
--   <li><tt>gp2</tt> - General Purpose (SSD). General purpose volumes must
--   have a minimum size of 1 GiB and a maximum size of 16384 GiB.</li>
--   <li><tt>st1</tt> - Throughput Optimized hard disk drive (HDD).
--   Throughput optimized HDD volumes must have a minimum size of 500 GiB
--   and a maximum size of 16384 GiB.</li>
--   <li><tt>sc1</tt> - Cold HDD. Cold HDD volumes must have a minimum size
--   of 500 GiB and a maximum size of 16384 GiB.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:mountPoint:VolumeConfiguration'</a>,

newVolumeConfiguration :: Text -> Int -> Int -> VolumeConfiguration

--   information, see <a>Amazon EBS Encryption</a>.
volumeConfiguration_encrypted :: Lens' VolumeConfiguration (Maybe Bool)

-- | The volume type. For more information, see <a>Amazon EBS Volume
--   Types</a>.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>standard</tt> - Magnetic. Magnetic volumes must have a minimum
--   size of 1 GiB and a maximum size of 1024 GiB.</li>
--   <li><tt>io1</tt> - Provisioned IOPS (SSD). PIOPS volumes must have a
--   minimum size of 4 GiB and a maximum size of 16384 GiB.</li>
--   <li><tt>gp2</tt> - General Purpose (SSD). General purpose volumes must
--   have a minimum size of 1 GiB and a maximum size of 16384 GiB.</li>
--   <li><tt>st1</tt> - Throughput Optimized hard disk drive (HDD).
--   Throughput optimized HDD volumes must have a minimum size of 500 GiB
--   and a maximum size of 16384 GiB.</li>
--   <li><tt>sc1</tt> - Cold HDD. Cold HDD volumes must have a minimum size
--   of 500 GiB and a maximum size of 16384 GiB.</li>
--   </ul>
volumeConfiguration_volumeType :: Lens' VolumeConfiguration (Maybe Text)

-- | The volume mount point. For example "/dev/sdh".
volumeConfiguration_mountPoint :: Lens' VolumeConfiguration Text

-- | The number of disks in the volume.
volumeConfiguration_numberOfDisks :: Lens' VolumeConfiguration Int

-- | The volume size.
volumeConfiguration_size :: Lens' VolumeConfiguration Int

-- | Describes a time-based instance's auto scaling schedule. The schedule
--   consists of a set of key-value pairs.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>The key is the time period (a UTC hour) and must be an integer
--   from 0 - 23.</li>
--   <li>The value indicates whether the instance should be online or
--   offline for the specified period, and must be set to "on" or
--   "off"</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   The default setting for all time periods is off, so you use the
--   following parameters primarily to specify the online periods. You
--   don't have to explicitly specify offline periods unless you want to
--   change an online period to an offline period.
--   
--   The following example specifies that the instance should be online for
--   four hours, from UTC 1200 - 1600. It will be off for the remainder of
--   the day.
--   
--   <pre>
--   { "12":"on", "13":"on", "14":"on", "15":"on" }
--   </pre>
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newWeeklyAutoScalingSchedule</a> smart constructor.
data WeeklyAutoScalingSchedule
WeeklyAutoScalingSchedule' :: Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> WeeklyAutoScalingSchedule

-- | The schedule for Thursday.
[$sel:thursday:WeeklyAutoScalingSchedule'] :: WeeklyAutoScalingSchedule -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text)

-- | The schedule for Wednesday.
[$sel:wednesday:WeeklyAutoScalingSchedule'] :: WeeklyAutoScalingSchedule -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text)

-- | The schedule for Saturday.
[$sel:saturday:WeeklyAutoScalingSchedule'] :: WeeklyAutoScalingSchedule -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text)

-- | The schedule for Monday.
[$sel:monday:WeeklyAutoScalingSchedule'] :: WeeklyAutoScalingSchedule -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text)

-- | The schedule for Friday.
[$sel:friday:WeeklyAutoScalingSchedule'] :: WeeklyAutoScalingSchedule -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text)

-- | The schedule for Sunday.
[$sel:sunday:WeeklyAutoScalingSchedule'] :: WeeklyAutoScalingSchedule -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text)

-- | The schedule for Tuesday.
[$sel:tuesday:WeeklyAutoScalingSchedule'] :: WeeklyAutoScalingSchedule -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text)

-- | Create a value of <a>WeeklyAutoScalingSchedule</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:thursday:WeeklyAutoScalingSchedule'</a>,
--   <a>weeklyAutoScalingSchedule_thursday</a> - The schedule for Thursday.
--   
--   <a>$sel:wednesday:WeeklyAutoScalingSchedule'</a>,
--   <a>weeklyAutoScalingSchedule_wednesday</a> - The schedule for
--   Wednesday.
--   
--   <a>$sel:saturday:WeeklyAutoScalingSchedule'</a>,
--   <a>weeklyAutoScalingSchedule_saturday</a> - The schedule for Saturday.
--   
--   <a>$sel:monday:WeeklyAutoScalingSchedule'</a>,
--   <a>weeklyAutoScalingSchedule_monday</a> - The schedule for Monday.
--   
--   <a>$sel:friday:WeeklyAutoScalingSchedule'</a>,
--   <a>weeklyAutoScalingSchedule_friday</a> - The schedule for Friday.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sunday:WeeklyAutoScalingSchedule'</a>,
--   <a>weeklyAutoScalingSchedule_sunday</a> - The schedule for Sunday.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tuesday:WeeklyAutoScalingSchedule'</a>,
--   <a>weeklyAutoScalingSchedule_tuesday</a> - The schedule for Tuesday.
newWeeklyAutoScalingSchedule :: WeeklyAutoScalingSchedule

-- | The schedule for Thursday.
weeklyAutoScalingSchedule_thursday :: Lens' WeeklyAutoScalingSchedule (Maybe (HashMap Text Text))

-- | The schedule for Wednesday.
weeklyAutoScalingSchedule_wednesday :: Lens' WeeklyAutoScalingSchedule (Maybe (HashMap Text Text))

-- | The schedule for Saturday.
weeklyAutoScalingSchedule_saturday :: Lens' WeeklyAutoScalingSchedule (Maybe (HashMap Text Text))

-- | The schedule for Monday.
weeklyAutoScalingSchedule_monday :: Lens' WeeklyAutoScalingSchedule (Maybe (HashMap Text Text))

-- | The schedule for Friday.
weeklyAutoScalingSchedule_friday :: Lens' WeeklyAutoScalingSchedule (Maybe (HashMap Text Text))

-- | The schedule for Sunday.
weeklyAutoScalingSchedule_sunday :: Lens' WeeklyAutoScalingSchedule (Maybe (HashMap Text Text))

-- | The schedule for Tuesday.
weeklyAutoScalingSchedule_tuesday :: Lens' WeeklyAutoScalingSchedule (Maybe (HashMap Text Text))


-- | Apply cost-allocation tags to a specified stack or layer in AWS
--   OpsWorks Stacks. For more information about how tagging works, see
--   <a>Tags</a> in the AWS OpsWorks User Guide.
module Network.AWS.OpsWorks.TagResource

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newTagResource</a> smart constructor.
data TagResource
TagResource' :: Text -> HashMap Text Text -> TagResource

-- | The stack or layer's Amazon Resource Number (ARN).
[$sel:resourceArn:TagResource'] :: TagResource -> Text

-- | A map that contains tag keys and tag values that are attached to a
--   stack or layer.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>The key cannot be empty.</li>
--   <li>The key can be a maximum of 127 characters, and can contain only
--   Unicode letters, numbers, or separators, or the following special
--   characters: <tt>+ - = . _ : /</tt></li>
--   <li>The value can be a maximum 255 characters, and contain only
--   Unicode letters, numbers, or separators, or the following special
--   characters: <tt>+ - = . _ : /</tt></li>
--   <li>Leading and trailing white spaces are trimmed from both the key
--   and value.</li>
--   <li>A maximum of 40 tags is allowed for any resource.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:tags:TagResource'] :: TagResource -> HashMap Text Text

-- | Create a value of <a>TagResource</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceArn:TagResource'</a>, <a>tagResource_resourceArn</a> -
--   The stack or layer's Amazon Resource Number (ARN).
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:TagResource'</a>, <a>tagResource_tags</a> - A map that
--   contains tag keys and tag values that are attached to a stack or
--   layer.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>The key cannot be empty.</li>
--   <li>The key can be a maximum of 127 characters, and can contain only
--   Unicode letters, numbers, or separators, or the following special
--   characters: <tt>+ - = . _ : /</tt></li>
--   <li>The value can be a maximum 255 characters, and contain only
--   Unicode letters, numbers, or separators, or the following special
--   characters: <tt>+ - = . _ : /</tt></li>
--   <li>Leading and trailing white spaces are trimmed from both the key
--   and value.</li>
--   <li>A maximum of 40 tags is allowed for any resource.</li>
--   </ul>
newTagResource :: Text -> TagResource

-- | The stack or layer's Amazon Resource Number (ARN).
tagResource_resourceArn :: Lens' TagResource Text

-- | A map that contains tag keys and tag values that are attached to a
--   stack or layer.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>The key cannot be empty.</li>
--   <li>The key can be a maximum of 127 characters, and can contain only
--   Unicode letters, numbers, or separators, or the following special
--   characters: <tt>+ - = . _ : /</tt></li>
--   <li>The value can be a maximum 255 characters, and contain only
--   Unicode letters, numbers, or separators, or the following special
--   characters: <tt>+ - = . _ : /</tt></li>
--   <li>Leading and trailing white spaces are trimmed from both the key
--   and value.</li>
--   <li>A maximum of 40 tags is allowed for any resource.</li>
--   </ul>
tagResource_tags :: Lens' TagResource (HashMap Text Text)

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newTagResourceResponse</a> smart constructor.
data TagResourceResponse
TagResourceResponse' :: TagResourceResponse

-- | Create a value of <a>TagResourceResponse</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
newTagResourceResponse :: TagResourceResponse
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.OpsWorks.TagResource.TagResource
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.OpsWorks.TagResource.TagResource
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.OpsWorks.TagResource.TagResource
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.OpsWorks.TagResource.TagResource
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.OpsWorks.TagResource.TagResourceResponse
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.OpsWorks.TagResource.TagResourceResponse
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.OpsWorks.TagResource.TagResourceResponse
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.OpsWorks.TagResource.TagResourceResponse
instance Network.AWS.Types.AWSRequest Network.AWS.OpsWorks.TagResource.TagResource
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.OpsWorks.TagResource.TagResourceResponse
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.OpsWorks.TagResource.TagResource
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.OpsWorks.TagResource.TagResource
instance Network.AWS.Data.Headers.ToHeaders Network.AWS.OpsWorks.TagResource.TagResource

-- | Stops a specified instance. When you stop a standard instance, the
--   data disappears and must be reinstalled when you restart the instance.
--   You can stop an Amazon EBS-backed instance without losing data. For
--   more information, see <a>Starting, Stopping, and Rebooting
--   Instances</a>.
--   
--   <b>Required Permissions</b>: To use this action, an IAM user must have
--   a Manage permissions level for the stack, or an attached policy that
--   explicitly grants permissions. For more information on user
--   permissions, see <a>Managing User Permissions</a>.
module Network.AWS.OpsWorks.StopInstance

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newStopInstance</a> smart constructor.
data StopInstance
StopInstance' :: Maybe Bool -> Text -> StopInstance

-- | Specifies whether to force an instance to stop. If the instance's root
--   device type is <tt>ebs</tt>, or EBS-backed, adding the <tt>Force</tt>
--   parameter to the <tt>StopInstances</tt> API call disassociates the AWS
--   OpsWorks Stacks instance from EC2, and forces deletion of <i>only</i>
--   the OpsWorks Stacks instance. You must also delete the
--   formerly-associated instance in EC2 after troubleshooting and
--   replacing the AWS OpsWorks Stacks instance with a new one.
[$sel:force:StopInstance'] :: StopInstance -> Maybe Bool

-- | The instance ID.
[$sel:instanceId:StopInstance'] :: StopInstance -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>StopInstance</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:force:StopInstance'</a>, <a>stopInstance_force</a> - Specifies
--   whether to force an instance to stop. If the instance's root device
--   type is <tt>ebs</tt>, or EBS-backed, adding the <tt>Force</tt>
--   parameter to the <tt>StopInstances</tt> API call disassociates the AWS
--   OpsWorks Stacks instance from EC2, and forces deletion of <i>only</i>
--   the OpsWorks Stacks instance. You must also delete the
--   formerly-associated instance in EC2 after troubleshooting and
--   replacing the AWS OpsWorks Stacks instance with a new one.
--   
--   <a>$sel:instanceId:StopInstance'</a>, <a>stopInstance_instanceId</a> -
--   The instance ID.
newStopInstance :: Text -> StopInstance

-- | Specifies whether to force an instance to stop. If the instance's root
--   device type is <tt>ebs</tt>, or EBS-backed, adding the <tt>Force</tt>
--   parameter to the <tt>StopInstances</tt> API call disassociates the AWS
--   OpsWorks Stacks instance from EC2, and forces deletion of <i>only</i>
--   the OpsWorks Stacks instance. You must also delete the
--   formerly-associated instance in EC2 after troubleshooting and
--   replacing the AWS OpsWorks Stacks instance with a new one.
stopInstance_force :: Lens' StopInstance (Maybe Bool)

-- | The instance ID.
stopInstance_instanceId :: Lens' StopInstance Text

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newStopInstanceResponse</a> smart constructor.

--   fields.

-- | Specify the time-based auto scaling configuration for a specified
--   instance. For more information, see <a>Managing Load with Time-based

-- | Specifies a user's permissions. For more information, see <a>Security
--   and Permissions</a>.
--   
--   <b>Required Permissions</b>: To use this action, an IAM user must have
--   a Manage permissions level for the stack, or an attached policy that
--   explicitly grants permissions. For more information on user
--   permissions, see <a>Managing User Permissions</a>.
module Network.AWS.OpsWorks.SetPermission

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newSetPermission</a> smart constructor.
data SetPermission
SetPermission' :: Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Text -> Text -> SetPermission

-- | The user is allowed to use <b>sudo</b> to elevate privileges.
[$sel:allowSudo:SetPermission'] :: SetPermission -> Maybe Bool

-- | The user's permission level, which must be set to one of the following
--   strings. You cannot set your own permissions level.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><pre>deny</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>show</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>deploy</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>manage</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>iam_only</pre></li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   For more information about the permissions associated with these
--   levels, see <a>Managing User Permissions</a>.
[$sel:level:SetPermission'] :: SetPermission -> Maybe Text

-- | The user is allowed to use SSH to communicate with the instance.
[$sel:allowSsh:SetPermission'] :: SetPermission -> Maybe Bool

-- | The stack ID.
[$sel:stackId:SetPermission'] :: SetPermission -> Text

-- | The user's IAM ARN. This can also be a federated user's ARN.
[$sel:iamUserArn:SetPermission'] :: SetPermission -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>SetPermission</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:allowSudo:SetPermission'</a>, <a>setPermission_allowSudo</a> -
--   The user is allowed to use <b>sudo</b> to elevate privileges.
--   
--   <a>$sel:level:SetPermission'</a>, <a>setPermission_level</a> - The
--   user's permission level, which must be set to one of the following
--   strings. You cannot set your own permissions level.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><pre>deny</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>show</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>deploy</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>manage</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>iam_only</pre></li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   For more information about the permissions associated with these
--   levels, see <a>Managing User Permissions</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:allowSsh:SetPermission'</a>, <a>setPermission_allowSsh</a> -
--   The user is allowed to use SSH to communicate with the instance.
--   
--   <a>$sel:stackId:SetPermission'</a>, <a>setPermission_stackId</a> - The
--   stack ID.
--   
--   <a>$sel:iamUserArn:SetPermission'</a>, <a>setPermission_iamUserArn</a>
--   - The user's IAM ARN. This can also be a federated user's ARN.
newSetPermission :: Text -> Text -> SetPermission

-- | The user is allowed to use <b>sudo</b> to elevate privileges.
setPermission_allowSudo :: Lens' SetPermission (Maybe Bool)

-- | The user's permission level, which must be set to one of the following
--   strings. You cannot set your own permissions level.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><pre>deny</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>show</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>deploy</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>manage</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>iam_only</pre></li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   For more information about the permissions associated with these
--   levels, see <a>Managing User Permissions</a>.
setPermission_level :: Lens' SetPermission (Maybe Text)

-- | The user is allowed to use SSH to communicate with the instance.
setPermission_allowSsh :: Lens' SetPermission (Maybe Bool)

-- | The stack ID.
setPermission_stackId :: Lens' SetPermission Text

-- | The user's IAM ARN. This can also be a federated user's ARN.
setPermission_iamUserArn :: Lens' SetPermission Text

-- | Specify the load-based auto scaling configuration for a specified
--   layer. For more information, see <a>Managing Load with Time-based and
--   Load-based Instances</a>.
--   
--   To use load-based auto scaling, you must create a set of load-based
--   auto scaling instances. Load-based auto scaling operates only on the
--   instances from that set, so you must ensure that you have created
--   enough instances to handle the maximum anticipated load.
--   
--   <b>Required Permissions</b>: To use this action, an IAM user must have
--   a Manage permissions level for the stack, or an attached policy that
--   explicitly grants permissions. For more information on user
--   permissions, see <a>Managing User Permissions</a>.
module Network.AWS.OpsWorks.SetLoadBasedAutoScaling

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newSetLoadBasedAutoScaling</a> smart constructor.
data SetLoadBasedAutoScaling
SetLoadBasedAutoScaling' :: Maybe AutoScalingThresholds -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe AutoScalingThresholds -> Text -> SetLoadBasedAutoScaling

-- | An <tt>AutoScalingThresholds</tt> object with the upscaling threshold
--   configuration. If the load exceeds these thresholds for a specified
--   amount of time, AWS OpsWorks Stacks starts a specified number of
--   instances.
[$sel:upScaling:SetLoadBasedAutoScaling'] :: SetLoadBasedAutoScaling -> Maybe AutoScalingThresholds

-- | Enables load-based auto scaling for the layer.
[$sel:enable:SetLoadBasedAutoScaling'] :: SetLoadBasedAutoScaling -> Maybe Bool

-- | An <tt>AutoScalingThresholds</tt> object with the downscaling
--   threshold configuration. If the load falls below these thresholds for
--   a specified amount of time, AWS OpsWorks Stacks stops a specified
--   number of instances.
[$sel:downScaling:SetLoadBasedAutoScaling'] :: SetLoadBasedAutoScaling -> Maybe AutoScalingThresholds

-- | The layer ID.
[$sel:layerId:SetLoadBasedAutoScaling'] :: SetLoadBasedAutoScaling -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>SetLoadBasedAutoScaling</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:upScaling:SetLoadBasedAutoScaling'</a>,
--   <a>setLoadBasedAutoScaling_upScaling</a> - An
--   <tt>AutoScalingThresholds</tt> object with the upscaling threshold
--   configuration. If the load exceeds these thresholds for a specified
--   amount of time, AWS OpsWorks Stacks starts a specified number of
--   instances.
--   
--   <a>$sel:enable:SetLoadBasedAutoScaling'</a>,
--   <a>setLoadBasedAutoScaling_enable</a> - Enables load-based auto
--   scaling for the layer.
--   
--   <a>$sel:downScaling:SetLoadBasedAutoScaling'</a>,
--   <a>setLoadBasedAutoScaling_downScaling</a> - An
--   <tt>AutoScalingThresholds</tt> object with the downscaling threshold
--   configuration. If the load falls below these thresholds for a
--   specified amount of time, AWS OpsWorks Stacks stops a specified number
--   of instances.
--   
--   <a>$sel:layerId:SetLoadBasedAutoScaling'</a>,
--   <a>setLoadBasedAutoScaling_layerId</a> - The layer ID.
newSetLoadBasedAutoScaling :: Text -> SetLoadBasedAutoScaling

-- | An <tt>AutoScalingThresholds</tt> object with the upscaling threshold
--   configuration. If the load exceeds these thresholds for a specified
--   amount of time, AWS OpsWorks Stacks starts a specified number of
--   instances.
setLoadBasedAutoScaling_upScaling :: Lens' SetLoadBasedAutoScaling (Maybe AutoScalingThresholds)

-- | Enables load-based auto scaling for the layer.
setLoadBasedAutoScaling_enable :: Lens' SetLoadBasedAutoScaling (Maybe Bool)

-- | An <tt>AutoScalingThresholds</tt> object with the downscaling
--   threshold configuration. If the load falls below these thresholds for
--   a specified amount of time, AWS OpsWorks Stacks stops a specified
--   number of instances.
setLoadBasedAutoScaling_downScaling :: Lens' SetLoadBasedAutoScaling (Maybe AutoScalingThresholds)

-- | The layer ID.
setLoadBasedAutoScaling_layerId :: Lens' SetLoadBasedAutoScaling Text

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newSetLoadBasedAutoScalingResponse</a> smart
--   constructor.
data SetLoadBasedAutoScalingResponse
SetLoadBasedAutoScalingResponse' :: SetLoadBasedAutoScalingResponse

-- | Create a value of <a>SetLoadBasedAutoScalingResponse</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
newSetLoadBasedAutoScalingResponse :: SetLoadBasedAutoScalingResponse

instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.OpsWorks.SetLoadBasedAutoScaling.SetLoadBasedAutoScaling
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.OpsWorks.SetLoadBasedAutoScaling.SetLoadBasedAutoScaling
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.OpsWorks.SetLoadBasedAutoScaling.SetLoadBasedAutoScaling

-- | Registers instances that were created outside of AWS OpsWorks Stacks
--   with a specified stack.
--   
--   We do not recommend using this action to register instances. The
--   complete registration operation includes two tasks: installing the AWS
--   OpsWorks Stacks agent on the instance, and registering the instance
--   with the stack. <tt>RegisterInstance</tt> handles only the second
--   step. You should instead use the AWS CLI <tt>register</tt> command,
--   which performs the entire registration operation. For more
--   information, see <a>Registering an Instance with an AWS OpsWorks
--   Stacks Stack</a>.
--   
--   Registered instances have the same requirements as instances that are
--   created by using the CreateInstance API. For example, registered
--   instances must be running a supported Linux-based operating system,
--   and they must have a supported instance type. For more information
--   about requirements for instances that you want to register, see
--   <a>Preparing the Instance</a>.
--   
--   <b>Required Permissions</b>: To use this action, an IAM user must have
--   a Manage permissions level for the stack or an attached policy that
--   explicitly grants permissions. For more information on user
--   permissions, see <a>Managing User Permissions</a>.
module Network.AWS.OpsWorks.RegisterInstance

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newRegisterInstance</a> smart constructor.
data RegisterInstance
RegisterInstance' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe InstanceIdentity -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Text -> RegisterInstance

-- | The instance's private IP address.
[$sel:privateIp:RegisterInstance'] :: RegisterInstance -> Maybe Text

-- | The instance's hostname.
[$sel:hostname:RegisterInstance'] :: RegisterInstance -> Maybe Text

-- | An InstanceIdentity object that contains the instance's identity.
[$sel:instanceIdentity:RegisterInstance'] :: RegisterInstance -> Maybe InstanceIdentity

-- | The instance's public IP address.
[$sel:publicIp:RegisterInstance'] :: RegisterInstance -> Maybe Text

-- | The instances public RSA key fingerprint.
[$sel:rsaPublicKeyFingerprint:RegisterInstance'] :: RegisterInstance -> Maybe Text

-- | The instances public RSA key. This key is used to encrypt
--   communication between the instance and the service.
[$sel:rsaPublicKey:RegisterInstance'] :: RegisterInstance -> Maybe Text

-- | The ID of the stack that the instance is to be registered with.
[$sel:stackId:RegisterInstance'] :: RegisterInstance -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>RegisterInstance</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:privateIp:RegisterInstance'</a>,
--   <a>registerInstance_privateIp</a> - The instance's private IP address.
--   
--   <a>$sel:hostname:RegisterInstance'</a>,
--   <a>registerInstance_hostname</a> - The instance's hostname.
--   
--   <a>$sel:instanceIdentity:RegisterInstance'</a>,
--   <a>registerInstance_instanceIdentity</a> - An InstanceIdentity object
--   that contains the instance's identity.
--   
--   <a>$sel:publicIp:RegisterInstance'</a>,
--   <a>registerInstance_publicIp</a> - The instance's public IP address.
--   
--   <a>$sel:rsaPublicKeyFingerprint:RegisterInstance'</a>,
--   <a>registerInstance_rsaPublicKeyFingerprint</a> - The instances public
--   RSA key fingerprint.
--   
--   <a>$sel:rsaPublicKey:RegisterInstance'</a>,
--   <a>registerInstance_rsaPublicKey</a> - The instances public RSA key.
--   This key is used to encrypt communication between the instance and the
--   service.
--   
--   <a>$sel:stackId:RegisterInstance'</a>, <a>registerInstance_stackId</a>
--   - The ID of the stack that the instance is to be registered with.
newRegisterInstance :: Text -> RegisterInstance

-- | The instance's private IP address.
registerInstance_privateIp :: Lens' RegisterInstance (Maybe Text)

-- | The instance's hostname.
registerInstance_hostname :: Lens' RegisterInstance (Maybe Text)

-- | An InstanceIdentity object that contains the instance's identity.
registerInstance_instanceIdentity :: Lens' RegisterInstance (Maybe InstanceIdentity)

-- | The instance's public IP address.
registerInstance_publicIp :: Lens' RegisterInstance (Maybe Text)

-- | The instances public RSA key fingerprint.
registerInstance_rsaPublicKeyFingerprint :: Lens' RegisterInstance (Maybe Text)

-- | The instances public RSA key. This key is used to encrypt
--   communication between the instance and the service.
registerInstance_rsaPublicKey :: Lens' RegisterInstance (Maybe Text)

-- | The ID of the stack that the instance is to be registered with.
registerInstance_stackId :: Lens' RegisterInstance Text

-- | Registers a specified Amazon ECS cluster with a stack. You can
--   register only one cluster with a stack. A cluster can be registered
--   with only one stack. For more information, see <a>Resource
--   Management</a>.
--   
--   <b>Required Permissions</b>: To use this action, an IAM user must have
--   a Manage permissions level for the stack or an attached policy that
--   explicitly grants permissions. For more information on user
--   permissions, see <a>Managing User Permissions</a>.
module Network.AWS.OpsWorks.RegisterEcsCluster

-- | Returns a list of tags that are applied to the specified stack or
--   layer.
module Network.AWS.OpsWorks.ListTags

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newListTags</a> smart constructor.
data ListTags
ListTags' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Text -> ListTags

--   <tt>NextToken</tt> parameter to a <tt>ListTagsRequest</tt> call.
[$sel:nextToken:ListTags'] :: ListTags -> Maybe Text

-- | Do not use. A validation exception occurs if you add a
--   <tt>MaxResults</tt> parameter to a <tt>ListTagsRequest</tt> call.
[$sel:maxResults:ListTags'] :: ListTags -> Maybe Int

-- | This action can be used only with Windows stacks.
--   
--   Grants RDP access to a Windows instance for a specified time period.
module Network.AWS.OpsWorks.GrantAccess

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newGrantAccess</a> smart constructor.
data GrantAccess
GrantAccess' :: Maybe Natural -> Text -> GrantAccess

-- | The length of time (in minutes) that the grant is valid. When the
--   grant expires at the end of this period, the user will no longer be
--   able to use the credentials to log in. If the user is logged in at the
--   time, he or she automatically will be logged out.
[$sel:validForInMinutes:GrantAccess'] :: GrantAccess -> Maybe Natural

-- | The instance's AWS OpsWorks Stacks ID.
[$sel:instanceId:GrantAccess'] :: GrantAccess -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>GrantAccess</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:validForInMinutes:GrantAccess'</a>,
--   <a>grantAccess_validForInMinutes</a> - The length of time (in minutes)
--   that the grant is valid. When the grant expires at the end of this
--   period, the user will no longer be able to use the credentials to log
--   in. If the user is logged in at the time, he or she automatically will
--   be logged out.
--   
--   <a>$sel:instanceId:GrantAccess'</a>, <a>grantAccess_instanceId</a> -
--   The instance's AWS OpsWorks Stacks ID.
newGrantAccess :: Text -> GrantAccess

-- | The length of time (in minutes) that the grant is valid. When the
--   grant expires at the end of this period, the user will no longer be
--   able to use the credentials to log in. If the user is logged in at the
--   time, he or she automatically will be logged out.
grantAccess_validForInMinutes :: Lens' GrantAccess (Maybe Natural)

-- | The instance's AWS OpsWorks Stacks ID.
grantAccess_instanceId :: Lens' GrantAccess Text

-- | Contains the response to a <tt>GrantAccess</tt> request.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newGrantAccessResponse</a> smart constructor.
data GrantAccessResponse
GrantAccessResponse' :: Maybe TemporaryCredential -> Int -> GrantAccessResponse

-- | A <tt>TemporaryCredential</tt> object that contains the data needed to
--   log in to the instance by RDP clients, such as the Microsoft Remote
--   Desktop Connection.
[$sel:temporaryCredential:GrantAccessResponse'] :: GrantAccessResponse -> Maybe TemporaryCredential

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:GrantAccessResponse'] :: GrantAccessResponse -> Int

--   omitted.

--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:temporaryCredential:GrantAccessResponse'</a>,
--   <a>grantAccessResponse_temporaryCredential</a> - A
--   <tt>TemporaryCredential</tt> object that contains the data needed to
--   log in to the instance by RDP clients, such as the Microsoft Remote
--   Desktop Connection.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:GrantAccessResponse'</a>,
--   <a>grantAccessResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http status
--   code.
newGrantAccessResponse :: Int -> GrantAccessResponse

-- | A <tt>TemporaryCredential</tt> object that contains the data needed to
--   log in to the instance by RDP clients, such as the Microsoft Remote
--   Desktop Connection.
grantAccessResponse_temporaryCredential :: Lens' GrantAccessResponse (Maybe TemporaryCredential)

grantAccessResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' GrantAccessResponse Int

-- | Disassociates an Elastic IP address from its instance. The address
--   remains registered with the stack. For more information, see
--   <a>Resource Management</a>.
--   
--   <b>Required Permissions</b>: To use this action, an IAM user must have
--   a Manage permissions level for the stack, or an attached policy that
--   explicitly grants permissions. For more information on user
--   permissions, see <a>Managing User Permissions</a>.

-- | Detaches a specified Elastic Load Balancing instance from its layer.
--   
--   <b>Required Permissions</b>: To use this action, an IAM user must have
--   a Manage permissions level for the stack, or an attached policy that
--   explicitly grants permissions. For more information on user
--   permissions, see <a>Managing User Permissions</a>.

[$sel:elasticLoadBalancerName:DetachElasticLoadBalancer'] :: DetachElasticLoadBalancer -> Text

--   fields omitted.

--   Load Balancing instance's name.

--   <a>detachElasticLoadBalancer_layerId</a> - The ID of the layer that
--   the Elastic Load Balancing instance is attached to.
