-- | A user-defined comment.
deployment_comment :: Lens' Deployment (Maybe Text)

-- | The deployment duration.
deployment_duration :: Lens' Deployment (Maybe Int)

-- | The arguments of those commands that take arguments. It should be set
--   to a JSON object with the following format:
--   
--   <pre>
--   {"arg_name1" : ["value1", "value2", ...], "arg_name2" : ["value1", "value2", ...], ...}
--   </pre>
--   
--   The <tt>update_dependencies</tt> command takes two arguments:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>upgrade_os_to</tt> - Specifies the desired Amazon Linux
--   version for instances whose OS you want to upgrade, such as <tt>Amazon
--   Linux 2016.09</tt>. You must also set the <tt>allow_reboot</tt>
--   argument to true.</li>
--   <li><tt>allow_reboot</tt> - Specifies whether to allow AWS OpsWorks
--   Stacks to reboot the instances if necessary, after installing the
--   updates. This argument can be set to either <tt>true</tt> or
--   <tt>false</tt>. The default value is <tt>false</tt>.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   For example, to upgrade an instance to Amazon Linux 2016.09, set
--   <tt>Args</tt> to the following.
--   
--   <pre>
--   { "upgrade_os_to":["Amazon Linux 2016.09"], "allow_reboot":["true"] }
--   </pre>
deploymentCommand_args :: Lens' DeploymentCommand (Maybe (HashMap Text [Text]))

-- | Specifies the operation. You can specify only one command.
--   
--   For stacks, the following commands are available:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>execute_recipes</tt>: Execute one or more recipes. To specify
--   the recipes, set an <tt>Args</tt> parameter named <tt>recipes</tt> to
--   the list of recipes to be executed. For example, to execute
--   <tt>phpapp::appsetup</tt>, set <tt>Args</tt> to
--   <tt>{"recipes":["phpapp::appsetup"]}</tt>.</li>
--   <li><tt>install_dependencies</tt>: Install the stack's
--   dependencies.</li>
--   <li><tt>update_custom_cookbooks</tt>: Update the stack's custom
--   cookbooks.</li>
--   <li><tt>update_dependencies</tt>: Update the stack's
--   dependencies.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   The update_dependencies and install_dependencies commands are
--   supported only for Linux instances. You can run the commands
--   successfully on Windows instances, but they do nothing.
--   
--   For apps, the following commands are available:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>deploy</tt>: Deploy an app. Ruby on Rails apps have an
--   optional <tt>Args</tt> parameter named <tt>migrate</tt>. Set
--   <tt>Args</tt> to {"migrate":["true"]} to migrate the database. The
--   default setting is {"migrate":["false"]}.</li>
--   <li><tt>rollback</tt> Roll the app back to the previous version. When
--   you update an app, AWS OpsWorks Stacks stores the previous version, up
--   to a maximum of five versions. You can use this command to roll an app
--   back as many as four versions.</li>
--   <li><tt>start</tt>: Start the app's web or application server.</li>
--   <li><tt>stop</tt>: Stop the app's web or application server.</li>
--   <li><tt>restart</tt>: Restart the app's web or application
--   server.</li>
--   <li><tt>undeploy</tt>: Undeploy the app.</li>
--   </ul>
deploymentCommand_name :: Lens' DeploymentCommand DeploymentCommandName

-- | Whether the volume is deleted on instance termination.
ebsBlockDevice_deleteOnTermination :: Lens' EbsBlockDevice (Maybe Bool)

-- | The volume size, in GiB. For more information, see
--   <a>EbsBlockDevice</a>.
ebsBlockDevice_volumeSize :: Lens' EbsBlockDevice (Maybe Int)

-- | The number of I/O operations per second (IOPS) that the volume
--   supports. For more information, see <a>EbsBlockDevice</a>.
ebsBlockDevice_iops :: Lens' EbsBlockDevice (Maybe Int)

-- | The volume type. <tt>gp2</tt> for General Purpose (SSD) volumes,
--   <tt>io1</tt> for Provisioned IOPS (SSD) volumes, <tt>st1</tt> for
--   Throughput Optimized hard disk drives (HDD), <tt>sc1</tt> for Cold
--   HDD,and <tt>standard</tt> for Magnetic volumes.
--   
--   If you specify the <tt>io1</tt> volume type, you must also specify a
--   value for the <tt>Iops</tt> attribute. The maximum ratio of
--   provisioned IOPS to requested volume size (in GiB) is 50:1. AWS uses
--   the default volume size (in GiB) specified in the AMI attributes to
--   set IOPS to 50 x (volume size).
ebsBlockDevice_volumeType :: Lens' EbsBlockDevice (Maybe VolumeType)

-- | The snapshot ID.
ebsBlockDevice_snapshotId :: Lens' EbsBlockDevice (Maybe Text)

-- | The cluster's ARN.
ecsCluster_ecsClusterArn :: Lens' EcsCluster (Maybe Text)

-- | The cluster name.
ecsCluster_ecsClusterName :: Lens' EcsCluster (Maybe Text)

-- | The time and date that the cluster was registered with the stack.
ecsCluster_registeredAt :: Lens' EcsCluster (Maybe Text)

-- | The stack ID.
ecsCluster_stackId :: Lens' EcsCluster (Maybe Text)

-- | The ID of the instance that the address is attached to.
elasticIp_instanceId :: Lens' ElasticIp (Maybe Text)

-- | The domain.
elasticIp_domain :: Lens' ElasticIp (Maybe Text)

-- | The IP address.
elasticIp_ip :: Lens' ElasticIp (Maybe Text)

-- | The name.
elasticIp_name :: Lens' ElasticIp (Maybe Text)

-- | The AWS region. For more information, see <a>Regions and
--   Endpoints</a>.
elasticIp_region :: Lens' ElasticIp (Maybe Text)

-- | A list of subnet IDs, if the stack is running in a VPC.
elasticLoadBalancer_subnetIds :: Lens' ElasticLoadBalancer (Maybe [Text])

-- | The VPC ID.
elasticLoadBalancer_vpcId :: Lens' ElasticLoadBalancer (Maybe Text)

-- | A list of Availability Zones.
elasticLoadBalancer_availabilityZones :: Lens' ElasticLoadBalancer (Maybe [Text])

-- | The instance's AWS region.
elasticLoadBalancer_region :: Lens' ElasticLoadBalancer (Maybe Text)

-- | The Elastic Load Balancing instance's name.
elasticLoadBalancer_elasticLoadBalancerName :: Lens' ElasticLoadBalancer (Maybe Text)

-- | The ID of the stack that the instance is associated with.
elasticLoadBalancer_stackId :: Lens' ElasticLoadBalancer (Maybe Text)

-- | A list of the EC2 instances that the Elastic Load Balancing instance
--   is managing traffic for.
elasticLoadBalancer_ec2InstanceIds :: Lens' ElasticLoadBalancer (Maybe [Text])

-- | The ID of the layer that the instance is attached to.
elasticLoadBalancer_layerId :: Lens' ElasticLoadBalancer (Maybe Text)

-- | The instance's public DNS name.
elasticLoadBalancer_dnsName :: Lens' ElasticLoadBalancer (Maybe Text)

-- | (Optional) Whether the variable's value will be returned by the
--   DescribeApps action. To conceal an environment variable's value, set
--   <tt>Secure</tt> to <tt>true</tt>. <tt>DescribeApps</tt> then returns
--   <tt>*****FILTERED*****</tt> instead of the actual value. The default
--   value for <tt>Secure</tt> is <tt>false</tt>.
environmentVariable_secure :: Lens' EnvironmentVariable (Maybe Bool)

-- | (Required) The environment variable's name, which can consist of up to
--   64 characters and must be specified. The name can contain upper- and
--   lowercase letters, numbers, and underscores (_), but it must start
--   with a letter or underscore.
environmentVariable_key :: Lens' EnvironmentVariable Text

-- | (Optional) The environment variable's value, which can be left empty.
--   If you specify a value, it can contain up to 256 characters, which
--   must all be printable.
environmentVariable_value :: Lens' EnvironmentVariable Text

-- | The instance's private DNS name.
instance_privateDns :: Lens' Instance (Maybe Text)

-- | The instance's reported AWS OpsWorks Stacks agent version.
instance_reportedAgentVersion :: Lens' Instance (Maybe Text)

-- | The instance ID.
instance_instanceId :: Lens' Instance (Maybe Text)

-- | The instance status:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><pre>booting</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>connection_lost</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>online</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>pending</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>rebooting</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>requested</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>running_setup</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>setup_failed</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>shutting_down</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>start_failed</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>stop_failed</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>stopped</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>stopping</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>terminated</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>terminating</pre></li>
--   </ul>
instance_status :: Lens' Instance (Maybe Text)

-- | The instance's private IP address.
instance_privateIp :: Lens' Instance (Maybe Text)

-- | Whether to install operating system and package updates when the
--   instance boots. The default value is <tt>true</tt>. If this value is
--   set to <tt>false</tt>, you must then update your instances manually by
--   using CreateDeployment to run the <tt>update_dependencies</tt> stack
--   command or by manually running <tt>yum</tt> (Amazon Linux) or
--   <tt>apt-get</tt> (Ubuntu) on the instances.
--   
--   We strongly recommend using the default value of <tt>true</tt>, to
--   ensure that your instances have the latest security updates.
instance_installUpdatesOnBoot :: Lens' Instance (Maybe Bool)

-- | The instance's virtualization type: <tt>paravirtual</tt> or
--   <tt>hvm</tt>.
instance_virtualizationType :: Lens' Instance (Maybe VirtualizationType)

-- | The ARN of the instance's IAM profile. For more information about IAM
--   ARNs, see <a>Using Identifiers</a>.
instance_instanceProfileArn :: Lens' Instance (Maybe Text)

-- | The instance's platform.
instance_platform :: Lens' Instance (Maybe Text)

-- | The instance host name.
instance_hostname :: Lens' Instance (Maybe Text)

-- | The SSH key's RSA fingerprint.
instance_sshHostRsaKeyFingerprint :: Lens' Instance (Maybe Text)

-- | An array containing the instance security group IDs.
instance_securityGroupIds :: Lens' Instance (Maybe [Text])

-- | For container instances, the Amazon ECS cluster's ARN.
instance_ecsClusterArn :: Lens' Instance (Maybe Text)

-- | The instance's Amazon Resource Number (ARN).
instance_arn :: Lens' Instance (Maybe Text)

-- | The time that the instance was created.
instance_createdAt :: Lens' Instance (Maybe Text)

-- | The ID of the associated Amazon EC2 instance.
instance_ec2InstanceId :: Lens' Instance (Maybe Text)

-- | The instance's Amazon EC2 key-pair name.
instance_sshKeyName :: Lens' Instance (Maybe Text)

-- | The agent version. This parameter is set to <tt>INHERIT</tt> if the
--   instance inherits the default stack setting or to a a version number
--   for a fixed agent version.
instance_agentVersion :: Lens' Instance (Maybe Text)

-- | The root device volume ID.
instance_rootDeviceVolumeId :: Lens' Instance (Maybe Text)

-- | The instance's subnet ID; applicable only if the stack is running in a
--   VPC.
instance_subnetId :: Lens' Instance (Maybe Text)

-- | For registered instances, the infrastructure class: <tt>ec2</tt> or
--   <tt>on-premises</tt>.
instance_infrastructureClass :: Lens' Instance (Maybe Text)

-- | The SSH key's Deep Security Agent (DSA) fingerprint.
instance_sshHostDsaKeyFingerprint :: Lens' Instance (Maybe Text)

-- | The instance type, such as <tt>t2.micro</tt>.
instance_instanceType :: Lens' Instance (Maybe Text)

-- | Whether this is an Amazon EBS-optimized instance.
instance_ebsOptimized :: Lens' Instance (Maybe Bool)

-- | The instance <a>Elastic IP address</a> .
instance_elasticIp :: Lens' Instance (Maybe Text)

-- | The instance's operating system.
instance_os :: Lens' Instance (Maybe Text)

-- | The instance Availability Zone. For more information, see <a>Regions
--   and Endpoints</a>.
instance_availabilityZone :: Lens' Instance (Maybe Text)

-- | The ID of the last service error. For more information, call
--   DescribeServiceErrors.
instance_lastServiceErrorId :: Lens' Instance (Maybe Text)

-- | The instance's tenancy option, such as <tt>dedicated</tt> or
--   <tt>host</tt>.
instance_tenancy :: Lens' Instance (Maybe Text)

-- | For load-based or time-based instances, the type.
instance_autoScalingType :: Lens' Instance (Maybe AutoScalingType)

-- | An array containing the instance layer IDs.
instance_layerIds :: Lens' Instance (Maybe [Text])

-- | The instance architecture: "i386" or "x86_64".
instance_architecture :: Lens' Instance (Maybe Architecture)

-- | The instance public DNS name.
instance_publicDns :: Lens' Instance (Maybe Text)

--   information, see <a>Instances</a>
instance_amiId :: Lens' Instance (Maybe Text)

-- | The instance public IP address.
instance_publicIp :: Lens' Instance (Maybe Text)

-- | For registered instances, the reported operating system.
instance_reportedOs :: Lens' Instance (Maybe ReportedOs)

-- | For registered instances, who performed the registration.
instance_registeredBy :: Lens' Instance (Maybe Text)

-- | The stack ID.
instance_stackId :: Lens' Instance (Maybe Text)

-- | The instance's root device type. For more information, see <a>Storage
--   for the Root Device</a>.
instance_rootDeviceType :: Lens' Instance (Maybe RootDeviceType)

-- | For container instances, the instance's ARN.
instance_ecsContainerInstanceArn :: Lens' Instance (Maybe Text)

-- | An array of <tt>BlockDeviceMapping</tt> objects that specify the
--   instance's block device mappings.
instance_blockDeviceMappings :: Lens' Instance (Maybe [BlockDeviceMapping])

-- | A signature that can be used to verify the document's accuracy and
--   authenticity.
instanceIdentity_signature :: Lens' InstanceIdentity (Maybe Text)

-- | A JSON document that contains the metadata.
instanceIdentity_document :: Lens' InstanceIdentity (Maybe Text)

-- | The number of instances with <tt>terminating</tt> status.
instancesCount_terminating :: Lens' InstancesCount (Maybe Int)

instancesCount_pending :: Lens' InstancesCount (Maybe Int)

instancesCount_runningSetup :: Lens' InstancesCount (Maybe Int)

instancesCount_requested :: Lens' InstancesCount (Maybe Int)

instancesCount_stopFailed :: Lens' InstancesCount (Maybe Int)

instancesCount_booting :: Lens' InstancesCount (Maybe Int)

-- | The number of instances with <tt>stopped</tt> status.
instancesCount_stopped :: Lens' InstancesCount (Maybe Int)

-- | The number of instances with <tt>rebooting</tt> status.
instancesCount_rebooting :: Lens' InstancesCount (Maybe Int)

-- | The number of instances in the Assigning state.
instancesCount_assigning :: Lens' InstancesCount (Maybe Int)

-- | The number of instances with <tt>shutting_down</tt> status.
instancesCount_shuttingDown :: Lens' InstancesCount (Maybe Int)

-- | The number of instances with <tt>setup_failed</tt> status.
instancesCount_setupFailed :: Lens' InstancesCount (Maybe Int)

-- | The number of instances with <tt>connection_lost</tt> status.
instancesCount_connectionLost :: Lens' InstancesCount (Maybe Int)

instancesCount_terminated :: Lens' InstancesCount (Maybe Int)

instancesCount_registering :: Lens' InstancesCount (Maybe Int)

-- | The ARN of the default IAM profile to be used for the layer's EC2
--   instances. For more information about IAM ARNs, see <a>Using
--   Identifiers</a>.
layer_customInstanceProfileArn :: Lens' Layer (Maybe Text)

-- | An array containing the layer's custom security group IDs.
layer_customSecurityGroupIds :: Lens' Layer (Maybe [Text])

-- | Whether to install operating system and package updates when the
--   instance boots. The default value is <tt>true</tt>. If this value is
--   set to <tt>false</tt>, you must then update your instances manually by
--   using CreateDeployment to run the <tt>update_dependencies</tt> stack
--   command or manually running <tt>yum</tt> (Amazon Linux) or
--   <tt>apt-get</tt> (Ubuntu) on the instances.
--   
--   We strongly recommend using the default value of <tt>true</tt>, to
--   ensure that your instances have the latest security updates.
layer_installUpdatesOnBoot :: Lens' Layer (Maybe Bool)

-- | The Amazon CloudWatch Logs configuration settings for the layer.
layer_cloudWatchLogsConfiguration :: Lens' Layer (Maybe CloudWatchLogsConfiguration)

-- | A <tt>LifeCycleEventConfiguration</tt> object that specifies the
--   Shutdown event configuration.
layer_lifecycleEventConfiguration :: Lens' Layer (Maybe LifecycleEventConfiguration)

-- | The Amazon Resource Number (ARN) of a layer.
layer_arn :: Lens' Layer (Maybe Text)

-- | Date when the layer was created.
layer_createdAt :: Lens' Layer (Maybe Text)

-- | The layer short name.
layer_shortname :: Lens' Layer (Maybe Text)

-- | AWS OpsWorks Stacks supports five lifecycle events: <b>setup</b>,
--   <b>configuration</b>, <b>deploy</b>, <b>undeploy</b>, and
--   <b>shutdown</b>. For each layer, AWS OpsWorks Stacks runs a set of
--   standard recipes for each event. You can also provide custom recipes
--   for any or all layers and events. AWS OpsWorks Stacks runs custom
--   event recipes after the standard recipes. <tt>LayerCustomRecipes</tt>
--   specifies the custom recipes for a particular layer to be run in
--   response to each of the five events.
--   
--   To specify a recipe, use the cookbook's directory name in the
--   repository followed by two colons and the recipe name, which is the
--   recipe's file name without the <tt>.rb</tt> extension. For example:
--   <tt>phpapp2::dbsetup</tt> specifies the <tt>dbsetup.rb</tt> recipe in
--   the repository's <tt>phpapp2</tt> folder.
layer_defaultRecipes :: Lens' Layer (Maybe Recipes)

-- | A <tt>LayerCustomRecipes</tt> object that specifies the layer's custom
--   recipes.
layer_customRecipes :: Lens' Layer (Maybe Recipes)

-- | A JSON formatted string containing the layer's custom stack
--   configuration and deployment attributes.
layer_customJson :: Lens' Layer (Maybe Text)

-- | A <tt>VolumeConfigurations</tt> object that describes the layer's
--   Amazon EBS volumes.
layer_volumeConfigurations :: Lens' Layer (Maybe [VolumeConfiguration])

-- | Whether auto healing is disabled for the layer.
layer_enableAutoHealing :: Lens' Layer (Maybe Bool)

-- | An array of <tt>Package</tt> objects that describe the layer's
--   packages.
layer_packages :: Lens' Layer (Maybe [Text])

-- | The layer attributes.
--   
--   For the <tt>HaproxyStatsPassword</tt>, <tt>MysqlRootPassword</tt>, and
--   <tt>GangliaPassword</tt> attributes, AWS OpsWorks Stacks returns
--   <tt>*****FILTERED*****</tt> instead of the actual value
--   
--   For an ECS Cluster layer, AWS OpsWorks Stacks the
--   <tt>EcsClusterArn</tt> attribute is set to the cluster's ARN.
layer_attributes :: Lens' Layer (Maybe (HashMap LayerAttributesKeys (Maybe Text)))

-- | The layer name.
layer_name :: Lens' Layer (Maybe Text)

-- | For stacks that are running in a VPC, whether to automatically assign
--   a public IP address to the layer's instances. For more information,
--   see <a>How to Edit a Layer</a>.
layer_autoAssignPublicIps :: Lens' Layer (Maybe Bool)

-- | The layer type.
layer_type :: Lens' Layer (Maybe LayerType)

-- | Whether the layer uses Amazon EBS-optimized instances.
layer_useEbsOptimizedInstances :: Lens' Layer (Maybe Bool)

-- | The layer stack ID.
layer_stackId :: Lens' Layer (Maybe Text)

-- | The layer ID.
layer_layerId :: Lens' Layer (Maybe Text)

-- | An array containing the layer's security group names.
layer_defaultSecurityGroupNames :: Lens' Layer (Maybe [Text])

-- | Whether to automatically assign an <a>Elastic IP address</a> to the
--   layer's instances. For more information, see <a>How to Edit a
--   Layer</a>.
layer_autoAssignElasticIps :: Lens' Layer (Maybe Bool)

-- | A <tt>ShutdownEventConfiguration</tt> object that specifies the
--   Shutdown event configuration.
lifecycleEventConfiguration_shutdown :: Lens' LifecycleEventConfiguration (Maybe ShutdownEventConfiguration)

-- | An <tt>AutoScalingThresholds</tt> object that describes the upscaling
--   configuration, which defines how and when AWS OpsWorks Stacks
--   increases the number of instances.
loadBasedAutoScalingConfiguration_upScaling :: Lens' LoadBasedAutoScalingConfiguration (Maybe AutoScalingThresholds)

-- | Whether load-based auto scaling is enabled for the layer.
loadBasedAutoScalingConfiguration_enable :: Lens' LoadBasedAutoScalingConfiguration (Maybe Bool)

-- | An <tt>AutoScalingThresholds</tt> object that describes the
--   downscaling configuration, which defines how and when AWS OpsWorks
--   Stacks reduces the number of instances.
loadBasedAutoScalingConfiguration_downScaling :: Lens' LoadBasedAutoScalingConfiguration (Maybe AutoScalingThresholds)

-- | The layer ID.
loadBasedAutoScalingConfiguration_layerId :: Lens' LoadBasedAutoScalingConfiguration (Maybe Text)

-- | The version of the operating system, including the release and
--   edition, if applicable.
operatingSystem_reportedVersion :: Lens' OperatingSystem (Maybe Text)

-- | Indicates that an operating system is not supported for new instances.
operatingSystem_supported :: Lens' OperatingSystem (Maybe Bool)

-- | The name of the operating system, such as <tt>Amazon Linux
--   2018.03</tt>.
operatingSystem_name :: Lens' OperatingSystem (Maybe Text)

-- | The ID of a supported operating system, such as <tt>Amazon Linux
--   2018.03</tt>.
operatingSystem_id :: Lens' OperatingSystem (Maybe Text)

-- | Supported configuration manager name and versions for an AWS OpsWorks
--   Stacks operating system.
operatingSystem_configurationManagers :: Lens' OperatingSystem (Maybe [OperatingSystemConfigurationManager])

-- | The type of a supported operating system, either <tt>Linux</tt> or
--   <tt>Windows</tt>.
operatingSystem_type :: Lens' OperatingSystem (Maybe Text)

-- | A short name for the operating system manufacturer.
operatingSystem_reportedName :: Lens' OperatingSystem (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the configuration manager, which is Chef.
operatingSystemConfigurationManager_name :: Lens' OperatingSystemConfigurationManager (Maybe Text)

-- | The versions of the configuration manager that are supported by an
--   operating system.
operatingSystemConfigurationManager_version :: Lens' OperatingSystemConfigurationManager (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for an AWS Identity and Access
--   Management (IAM) role. For more information about IAM ARNs, see
--   <a>Using Identifiers</a>.
permission_iamUserArn :: Lens' Permission (Maybe Text)

-- | Whether the user can use <b>sudo</b>.
permission_allowSudo :: Lens' Permission (Maybe Bool)

permission_stackId :: Lens' Permission (Maybe Text)

-- | The user's permission level, which must be the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><pre>deny</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>show</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>deploy</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>manage</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>iam_only</pre></li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   For more information on the permissions associated with these levels,
--   see <a>Managing User Permissions</a>
permission_level :: Lens' Permission (Maybe Text)

permission_allowSsh :: Lens' Permission (Maybe Bool)

raidArray_instanceId :: Lens' RaidArray (Maybe Text)

--   Amazon RDS instance. AWS OpsWorks Stacks attempts to discover the
--   instance only once. If this value is set to <tt>true</tt>, you must

--   actual value.
rdsDbInstance_dbPassword :: Lens' RdsDbInstance (Maybe Text)

--   event.
recipes_setup :: Lens' Recipes (Maybe [Text])

-- | The user's SSH public key.
selfUserProfile_sshPublicKey :: Lens' SelfUserProfile (Maybe Text)

-- | The user's SSH user name.
selfUserProfile_sshUsername :: Lens' SelfUserProfile (Maybe Text)

-- | The user's IAM ARN.
selfUserProfile_iamUserArn :: Lens' SelfUserProfile (Maybe Text)

-- | The user's name.
selfUserProfile_name :: Lens' SelfUserProfile (Maybe Text)

-- | The instance ID.
serviceError_instanceId :: Lens' ServiceError (Maybe Text)

-- | When the error occurred.
serviceError_createdAt :: Lens' ServiceError (Maybe Text)

-- | The error ID.
serviceError_serviceErrorId :: Lens' ServiceError (Maybe Text)

-- | The error type.
serviceError_type :: Lens' ServiceError (Maybe Text)

-- | The stack ID.
serviceError_stackId :: Lens' ServiceError (Maybe Text)

-- | A message that describes the error.
serviceError_message :: Lens' ServiceError (Maybe Text)

-- | The time, in seconds, that AWS OpsWorks Stacks will wait after
--   triggering a Shutdown event before shutting down an instance.
shutdownEventConfiguration_executionTimeout :: Lens' ShutdownEventConfiguration (Maybe Int)

-- | Whether to enable Elastic Load Balancing connection draining. For more
--   information, see <a>Connection Draining</a>
shutdownEventConfiguration_delayUntilElbConnectionsDrained :: Lens' ShutdownEventConfiguration (Maybe Bool)

-- | The source URL. The following is an example of an Amazon S3 source
--   URL:
--   <tt>https://s3.amazonaws.com/opsworks-demo-bucket/opsworks_cookbook_demo.tar.gz</tt>.
source_url :: Lens' Source (Maybe Text)

-- | This parameter depends on the repository type.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>For Amazon S3 bundles, set <tt>Username</tt> to the appropriate
--   IAM access key ID.</li>
--   <li>For HTTP bundles, Git repositories, and Subversion repositories,
--   set <tt>Username</tt> to the user name.</li>
--   </ul>
source_username :: Lens' Source (Maybe Text)

-- | In requests, the repository's SSH key.
--   
--   In responses, AWS OpsWorks Stacks returns <tt>*****FILTERED*****</tt>
--   instead of the actual value.
source_sshKey :: Lens' Source (Maybe Text)

-- | When included in a request, the parameter depends on the repository
--   type.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>For Amazon S3 bundles, set <tt>Password</tt> to the appropriate
--   IAM secret access key.</li>
--   <li>For HTTP bundles and Subversion repositories, set
--   <tt>Password</tt> to the password.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   For more information on how to safely handle IAM credentials, see
--   <a>https://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/aws-access-keys-best-practices.html</a>.
--   
--   In responses, AWS OpsWorks Stacks returns <tt>*****FILTERED*****</tt>
--   instead of the actual value.
source_password :: Lens' Source (Maybe Text)

-- | The repository type.
source_type :: Lens' Source (Maybe SourceType)

-- | The application's version. AWS OpsWorks Stacks enables you to easily
--   deploy new versions of an application. One of the simplest approaches
--   is to have branches or revisions in your repository that represent
--   different versions that can potentially be deployed.
source_revision :: Lens' Source (Maybe Text)

-- | The private key; the contents of the certificate's domain.kex file.
sslConfiguration_privateKey :: Lens' SslConfiguration (Maybe Text)

-- | The contents of the certificate's domain.crt file.
sslConfiguration_certificate :: Lens' SslConfiguration (Maybe Text)

-- | Optional. Can be used to specify an intermediate certificate authority
--   key or client authentication.
sslConfiguration_chain :: Lens' SslConfiguration (Maybe Text)

-- | The ARN of an IAM profile that is the default profile for all of the
--   stack's EC2 instances. For more information about IAM ARNs, see
--   <a>Using Identifiers</a>.
stack_defaultInstanceProfileArn :: Lens' Stack (Maybe Text)

-- | The stack AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) role.
stack_serviceRoleArn :: Lens' Stack (Maybe Text)

-- | The default root device type. This value is used by default for all
--   instances in the stack, but you can override it when you create an
--   instance. For more information, see <a>Storage for the Root
--   Device</a>.
stack_defaultRootDeviceType :: Lens' Stack (Maybe RootDeviceType)

-- | The stack's ARN.
stack_arn :: Lens' Stack (Maybe Text)

-- | The date when the stack was created.
stack_createdAt :: Lens' Stack (Maybe Text)

-- | The VPC ID; applicable only if the stack is running in a VPC.
stack_vpcId :: Lens' Stack (Maybe Text)

-- | A <tt>ChefConfiguration</tt> object that specifies whether to enable
--   Berkshelf and the Berkshelf version. For more information, see
--   <a>Create a New Stack</a>.
stack_chefConfiguration :: Lens' Stack (Maybe ChefConfiguration)

-- | The agent version. This parameter is set to <tt>LATEST</tt> for
--   auto-update. or a version number for a fixed agent version.
stack_agentVersion :: Lens' Stack (Maybe Text)

-- | A default Amazon EC2 key pair for the stack's instances. You can
--   override this value when you create or update an instance.
stack_defaultSshKeyName :: Lens' Stack (Maybe Text)

-- | A JSON object that contains user-defined attributes to be added to the
--   stack configuration and deployment attributes. You can use custom JSON
--   to override the corresponding default stack configuration attribute
--   values or to pass data to recipes. The string should be in the
--   following format:
--   
--   <pre>
--   "{\"key1\": \"value1\", \"key2\": \"value2\",...}"
--   </pre>
--   
--   For more information on custom JSON, see <a>Use Custom JSON to Modify
--   the Stack Configuration Attributes</a>.
stack_customJson :: Lens' Stack (Maybe Text)

-- | Contains the information required to retrieve an app or cookbook from
--   a repository. For more information, see <a>Adding Apps</a> or
--   <a>Cookbooks and Recipes</a>.

--   <a>Regions and Endpoints</a>.

stack_name :: Lens' Stack (Maybe Text)

-- | The stack's default operating system.
stack_defaultOs :: Lens' Stack (Maybe Text)

-- | Whether the stack automatically associates the AWS OpsWorks Stacks
--   built-in security groups with the stack's layers.
stack_useOpsworksSecurityGroups :: Lens' Stack (Maybe Bool)

-- | Whether the stack uses custom cookbooks.
stack_useCustomCookbooks :: Lens' Stack (Maybe Bool)

-- | The default subnet ID; applicable only if the stack is running in a
--   VPC.
stack_defaultSubnetId :: Lens' Stack (Maybe Text)

-- | The stack AWS region, such as "ap-northeast-2". For more information
--   about AWS regions, see <a>Regions and Endpoints</a>.
stack_region :: Lens' Stack (Maybe Text)

-- | The configuration manager.
stack_configurationManager :: Lens' Stack (Maybe StackConfigurationManager)

-- | The stack ID.
stack_stackId :: Lens' Stack (Maybe Text)

-- | The stack host name theme, with spaces replaced by underscores.
stack_hostnameTheme :: Lens' Stack (Maybe Text)

-- | The name. This parameter must be set to "Chef".
stackConfigurationManager_name :: Lens' StackConfigurationManager (Maybe Text)

-- | The Chef version. This parameter must be set to 12, 11.10, or 11.4 for
--   Linux stacks, and to 12.2 for Windows stacks. The default value for
--   Linux stacks is 11.4.
stackConfigurationManager_version :: Lens' StackConfigurationManager (Maybe Text)

-- | An <tt>InstancesCount</tt> object with the number of instances in each

-- | The length of time (in minutes) that the grant is valid. When the
--   grant expires, at the end of this period, the user will no longer be
--   able to use the credentials to log in. If they are logged in at the
--   time, they will be automatically logged out.
temporaryCredential_validForInMinutes :: Lens' TemporaryCredential (Maybe Int)

--   information, see <a>Amazon EBS Encryption</a>.

--   Endpoints</a>.

-- | The volume name.
volume_name :: Lens' Volume (Maybe Text)

-- | The RAID array ID.
volume_raidArrayId :: Lens' Volume (Maybe Text)

-- | The volume ID.
volume_volumeId :: Lens' Volume (Maybe Text)

-- | The AWS region. For more information about AWS regions, see <a>Regions
--   and Endpoints</a>.
volume_region :: Lens' Volume (Maybe Text)

-- | The volume type. For more information, see <a>Amazon EBS Volume
--   Types</a>.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>standard</tt> - Magnetic. Magnetic volumes must have a minimum
--   size of 1 GiB and a maximum size of 1024 GiB.</li>
--   <li><tt>io1</tt> - Provisioned IOPS (SSD). PIOPS volumes must have a
--   minimum size of 4 GiB and a maximum size of 16384 GiB.</li>
--   <li><tt>gp2</tt> - General Purpose (SSD). General purpose volumes must
--   have a minimum size of 1 GiB and a maximum size of 16384 GiB.</li>
--   <li><tt>st1</tt> - Throughput Optimized hard disk drive (HDD).
--   Throughput optimized HDD volumes must have a minimum size of 500 GiB
--   and a maximum size of 16384 GiB.</li>
--   <li><tt>sc1</tt> - Cold HDD. Cold HDD volumes must have a minimum size
--   of 500 GiB and a maximum size of 16384 GiB.</li>
--   </ul>
volume_volumeType :: Lens' Volume (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon EC2 volume ID.
volume_ec2VolumeId :: Lens' Volume (Maybe Text)

-- | The volume mount point. For example, "/mnt/disk1".
volume_mountPoint :: Lens' Volume (Maybe Text)

-- | For PIOPS volumes, the IOPS per disk.
volumeConfiguration_iops :: Lens' VolumeConfiguration (Maybe Int)

-- | The volume <a>RAID level</a>.
volumeConfiguration_raidLevel :: Lens' VolumeConfiguration (Maybe Int)

-- | Specifies whether an Amazon EBS volume is encrypted. For more
--   information, see <a>Amazon EBS Encryption</a>.
volumeConfiguration_encrypted :: Lens' VolumeConfiguration (Maybe Bool)

-- | The volume type. For more information, see <a>Amazon EBS Volume
--   Types</a>.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>standard</tt> - Magnetic. Magnetic volumes must have a minimum
--   size of 1 GiB and a maximum size of 1024 GiB.</li>
--   <li><tt>io1</tt> - Provisioned IOPS (SSD). PIOPS volumes must have a
--   minimum size of 4 GiB and a maximum size of 16384 GiB.</li>
--   <li><tt>gp2</tt> - General Purpose (SSD). General purpose volumes must
--   have a minimum size of 1 GiB and a maximum size of 16384 GiB.</li>
--   <li><tt>st1</tt> - Throughput Optimized hard disk drive (HDD).
--   Throughput optimized HDD volumes must have a minimum size of 500 GiB
--   and a maximum size of 16384 GiB.</li>
--   <li><tt>sc1</tt> - Cold HDD. Cold HDD volumes must have a minimum size
--   of 500 GiB and a maximum size of 16384 GiB.</li>
--   </ul>
volumeConfiguration_volumeType :: Lens' VolumeConfiguration (Maybe Text)

-- | The volume mount point. For example "/dev/sdh".
volumeConfiguration_mountPoint :: Lens' VolumeConfiguration Text

-- | The number of disks in the volume.
volumeConfiguration_numberOfDisks :: Lens' VolumeConfiguration Int

-- | The volume size.
volumeConfiguration_size :: Lens' VolumeConfiguration Int

weeklyAutoScalingSchedule_thursday :: Lens' WeeklyAutoScalingSchedule (Maybe (HashMap Text Text))

weeklyAutoScalingSchedule_wednesday :: Lens' WeeklyAutoScalingSchedule (Maybe (HashMap Text Text))

weeklyAutoScalingSchedule_tuesday :: Lens' WeeklyAutoScalingSchedule (Maybe (HashMap Text Text))


module Network.AWS.OpsWorks.Waiters

-- | Polls <a>DescribeInstances</a> every 15 seconds until a successful
--   state is reached. An error is returned after 40 failed checks.
newInstanceTerminated :: Wait DescribeInstances

-- | Polls <a>DescribeDeployments</a> every 15 seconds until a successful
--   state is reached. An error is returned after 40 failed checks.
newDeploymentSuccessful :: Wait DescribeDeployments

-- | Polls <a>DescribeInstances</a> every 15 seconds until a successful
--   state is reached. An error is returned after 40 failed checks.
newInstanceStopped :: Wait DescribeInstances

-- | Polls <a>DescribeInstances</a> every 15 seconds until a successful
--   state is reached. An error is returned after 40 failed checks.
newInstanceOnline :: Wait DescribeInstances

-- | Polls <a>DescribeApps</a> every 1 seconds until a successful state is
--   reached. An error is returned after 40 failed checks.
newAppExists :: Wait DescribeApps

-- | Polls <a>DescribeInstances</a> every 15 seconds until a successful
--   state is reached. An error is returned after 40 failed checks.
newInstanceRegistered :: Wait DescribeInstances


-- | Derived from API version <tt>2013-02-18</tt> of the AWS service
--   descriptions, licensed under Apache 2.0.
--   
--   AWS OpsWorks
--   
--   Welcome to the <i>AWS OpsWorks Stacks API Reference</i>. This guide
--   provides descriptions, syntax, and usage examples for AWS OpsWorks
--   Stacks actions and data types, including common parameters and error
--   codes.
--   
--   AWS OpsWorks Stacks is an application management service that provides
--   an integrated experience for overseeing the complete application
--   lifecycle. For information about this product, go to the <a>AWS
--   OpsWorks</a> details page.
--   
--   <b>SDKs and CLI</b>
--   
--   The most common way to use the AWS OpsWorks Stacks API is by using the
--   AWS Command Line Interface (CLI) or by using one of the AWS SDKs to
--   implement applications in your preferred language. For more
--   information, see:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>AWS CLI</a></li>
--   <li><a>AWS SDK for Java</a></li>
--   <li><a>AWS SDK for .NET</a></li>
--   <li><a>AWS SDK for PHP 2</a></li>
--   <li><a>AWS SDK for Ruby</a></li>
--   <li><a>AWS SDK for Node.js</a></li>
--   <li><a>AWS SDK for Python(Boto)</a></li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <b>Endpoints</b>
--   
--   AWS OpsWorks Stacks supports the following endpoints, all HTTPS. You
--   must connect to one of the following endpoints. Stacks can only be
--   accessed or managed within the endpoint in which they are created.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>opsworks.us-east-1.amazonaws.com</li>
--   <li>opsworks.us-east-2.amazonaws.com</li>
--   <li>opsworks.us-west-1.amazonaws.com</li>
--   <li>opsworks.us-west-2.amazonaws.com</li>
--   <li>opsworks.ca-central-1.amazonaws.com (API only; not available in
--   the AWS console)</li>
--   <li>opsworks.eu-west-1.amazonaws.com</li>
--   <li>opsworks.eu-west-2.amazonaws.com</li>
--   <li>opsworks.eu-west-3.amazonaws.com</li>
--   <li>opsworks.eu-central-1.amazonaws.com</li>
--   <li>opsworks.ap-northeast-1.amazonaws.com</li>
--   <li>opsworks.ap-northeast-2.amazonaws.com</li>
--   <li>opsworks.ap-south-1.amazonaws.com</li>
--   <li>opsworks.ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com</li>
--   <li>opsworks.ap-southeast-2.amazonaws.com</li>
--   <li>opsworks.sa-east-1.amazonaws.com</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <b>Chef Versions</b>
--   
--   When you call CreateStack, CloneStack, or UpdateStack we recommend you
--   use the <tt>ConfigurationManager</tt> parameter to specify the Chef
--   version. The recommended and default value for Linux stacks is
--   currently 12. Windows stacks use Chef 12.2. For more information, see
--   <a>Chef Versions</a>.
--   
--   You can specify Chef 12, 11.10, or 11.4 for your Linux stack. We
--   recommend migrating your existing Linux stacks to Chef 12 as soon as
--   possible.
module Network.AWS.OpsWorks

-- | API version <tt>2013-02-18</tt> of the Amazon OpsWorks SDK
--   configuration.
defaultService :: Service

-- | Indicates that a request was not valid.

-- | Indicates that a resource was not found.
_ResourceNotFoundException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateStack</a> smart constructor.
data UpdateStack
UpdateStack' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe RootDeviceType -> Maybe ChefConfiguration -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Source -> Maybe Text -> Maybe (HashMap StackAttributesKeys (Maybe Text)) -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe StackConfigurationManager -> Maybe Text -> Text -> UpdateStack

-- | Create a value of <a>UpdateStack</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:defaultInstanceProfileArn:UpdateStack'</a>,
--   <a>updateStack_defaultInstanceProfileArn</a> - The ARN of an IAM
--   profile that is the default profile for all of the stack's EC2
--   instances. For more information about IAM ARNs, see <a>Using
--   Identifiers</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:serviceRoleArn:UpdateStack'</a>,
--   <a>updateStack_serviceRoleArn</a> - Do not use this parameter. You
--   cannot update a stack's service role.
--   
--   <a>$sel:defaultRootDeviceType:UpdateStack'</a>,
--   <a>updateStack_defaultRootDeviceType</a> - The default root device
--   type. This value is used by default for all instances in the stack,
--   but you can override it when you create an instance. For more
--   information, see <a>Storage for the Root Device</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:chefConfiguration:UpdateStack'</a>,
--   <a>updateStack_chefConfiguration</a> - A <tt>ChefConfiguration</tt>
--   object that specifies whether to enable Berkshelf and the Berkshelf
--   version on Chef 11.10 stacks. For more information, see <a>Create a
--   New Stack</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:agentVersion:UpdateStack'</a>, <a>updateStack_agentVersion</a>
--   - The default AWS OpsWorks Stacks agent version. You have the
--   following options:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Auto-update - Set this parameter to <tt>LATEST</tt>. AWS OpsWorks
--   Stacks automatically installs new agent versions on the stack's
--   instances as soon as they are available.</li>
--   <li>Fixed version - Set this parameter to your preferred agent
--   version. To update the agent version, you must edit the stack
--   configuration and specify a new version. AWS OpsWorks Stacks then
--   automatically installs that version on the stack's instances.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   The default setting is <tt>LATEST</tt>. To specify an agent version,
--   you must use the complete version number, not the abbreviated number
--   shown on the console. For a list of available agent version numbers,
--   call DescribeAgentVersions. AgentVersion cannot be set to Chef 12.2.
--   
--   You can also specify an agent version when you create or update an
--   instance, which overrides the stack's default setting.
--   
--   <a>$sel:defaultSshKeyName:UpdateStack'</a>,
--   <a>updateStack_defaultSshKeyName</a> - A default Amazon EC2 key-pair
--   name. The default value is <tt>none</tt>. If you specify a key-pair
--   name, AWS OpsWorks Stacks installs the public key on the instance and
--   you can use the private key with an SSH client to log in to the
--   instance. For more information, see <a>Using SSH to Communicate with
--   an Instance</a> and <a>Managing SSH Access</a>. You can override this
--   setting by specifying a different key pair, or no key pair, when you
--   <a>create an instance</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:customJson:UpdateStack'</a>, <a>updateStack_customJson</a> - A
--   string that contains user-defined, custom JSON. It can be used to
--   override the corresponding default stack configuration JSON values or
--   to pass data to recipes. The string should be in the following format:
--   
--   <pre>
--   "{\"key1\": \"value1\", \"key2\": \"value2\",...}"
--   </pre>
--   
--   For more information about custom JSON, see <a>Use Custom JSON to
--   Modify the Stack Configuration Attributes</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:customCookbooksSource:UpdateStack'</a>,
--   <a>updateStack_customCookbooksSource</a> - Contains the information
--   required to retrieve an app or cookbook from a repository. For more
--   information, see <a>Adding Apps</a> or <a>Cookbooks and Recipes</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:defaultAvailabilityZone:UpdateStack'</a>,
--   <a>updateStack_defaultAvailabilityZone</a> - The stack's default
--   Availability Zone, which must be in the stack's region. For more
--   information, see <a>Regions and Endpoints</a>. If you also specify a
--   value for <tt>DefaultSubnetId</tt>, the subnet must be in the same
--   zone. For more information, see CreateStack.
--   
--   <a>$sel:attributes:UpdateStack'</a>, <a>updateStack_attributes</a> -
--   One or more user-defined key-value pairs to be added to the stack
--   attributes.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:UpdateStack'</a>, <a>updateStack_name</a> - The stack's
--   new name.
--   
--   <a>$sel:defaultOs:UpdateStack'</a>, <a>updateStack_defaultOs</a> - The
--   stack's operating system, which must be set to one of the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>A supported Linux operating system: An Amazon Linux version, such
--   as <tt>Amazon Linux 2018.03</tt>, <tt>Amazon Linux 2017.09</tt>,
--   <tt>Amazon Linux 2017.03</tt>, <tt>Amazon Linux 2016.09</tt>,
--   <tt>Amazon Linux 2016.03</tt>, <tt>Amazon Linux 2015.09</tt>, or
--   <tt>Amazon Linux 2015.03</tt>.</li>
--   <li>A supported Ubuntu operating system, such as <tt>Ubuntu 16.04
--   LTS</tt>, <tt>Ubuntu 14.04 LTS</tt>, or <tt>Ubuntu 12.04
--   LTS</tt>.</li>
--   <li><pre>CentOS Linux 7</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7</pre></li>
--   <li>A supported Windows operating system, such as <tt>Microsoft
--   Windows Server 2012 R2 Base</tt>, <tt>Microsoft Windows Server 2012 R2
--   with SQL Server Express</tt>, <tt>Microsoft Windows Server 2012 R2
--   with SQL Server Standard</tt>, or <tt>Microsoft Windows Server 2012 R2
--   with SQL Server Web</tt>.</li>
--   <li>A custom AMI: <tt>Custom</tt>. You specify the custom AMI you want
--   to use when you create instances. For more information about how to
--   use custom AMIs with OpsWorks, see <a>Using Custom AMIs</a>.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   The default option is the stack's current operating system. For more
--   information about supported operating systems, see <a>AWS OpsWorks
--   Stacks Operating Systems</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:useOpsworksSecurityGroups:UpdateStack'</a>,
--   <a>updateStack_useOpsworksSecurityGroups</a> - Whether to associate
--   the AWS OpsWorks Stacks built-in security groups with the stack's
--   layers.
--   
--   AWS OpsWorks Stacks provides a standard set of built-in security
--   groups, one for each layer, which are associated with layers by
--   default. <tt>UseOpsworksSecurityGroups</tt> allows you to provide your
--   own custom security groups instead of using the built-in groups.
--   <tt>UseOpsworksSecurityGroups</tt> has the following settings:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>True - AWS OpsWorks Stacks automatically associates the
--   appropriate built-in security group with each layer (default setting).
--   You can associate additional security groups with a layer after you
--   create it, but you cannot delete the built-in security group.</li>
--   <li>False - AWS OpsWorks Stacks does not associate built-in security
--   groups with layers. You must create appropriate EC2 security groups
--   and associate a security group with each layer that you create.
--   However, you can still manually associate a built-in security group
--   with a layer on. Custom security groups are required only for those
--   layers that need custom settings.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Create a New Stack</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:useCustomCookbooks:UpdateStack'</a>,
--   <a>updateStack_useCustomCookbooks</a> - Whether the stack uses custom
--   cookbooks.
--   
--   <a>$sel:defaultSubnetId:UpdateStack'</a>,
--   <a>updateStack_defaultSubnetId</a> - The stack's default VPC subnet
--   ID. This parameter is required if you specify a value for the
--   <tt>VpcId</tt> parameter. All instances are launched into this subnet
--   unless you specify otherwise when you create the instance. If you also
--   specify a value for <tt>DefaultAvailabilityZone</tt>, the subnet must
--   be in that zone. For information on default values and when this
--   parameter is required, see the <tt>VpcId</tt> parameter description.
--   
--   <a>$sel:configurationManager:UpdateStack'</a>,
--   <a>updateStack_configurationManager</a> - The configuration manager.
--   When you update a stack, we recommend that you use the configuration
--   manager to specify the Chef version: 12, 11.10, or 11.4 for Linux
--   stacks, or 12.2 for Windows stacks. The default value for Linux stacks
--   is currently 12.
--   
--   <a>$sel:hostnameTheme:UpdateStack'</a>,
--   <a>updateStack_hostnameTheme</a> - The stack's new host name theme,
--   with spaces replaced by underscores. The theme is used to generate
--   host names for the stack's instances. By default,
--   <tt>HostnameTheme</tt> is set to <tt>Layer_Dependent</tt>, which
--   creates host names by appending integers to the layer's short name.
--   The other themes are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><pre>Baked_Goods</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>Clouds</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>Europe_Cities</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>Fruits</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>Greek_Deities_and_Titans</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>Legendary_creatures_from_Japan</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>Planets_and_Moons</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>Roman_Deities</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>Scottish_Islands</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>US_Cities</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>Wild_Cats</pre></li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   To obtain a generated host name, call <tt>GetHostNameSuggestion</tt>,
--   which returns a host name based on the current theme.
--   
--   <a>$sel:stackId:UpdateStack'</a>, <a>updateStack_stackId</a> - The
--   stack ID.
newUpdateStack :: Text -> UpdateStack

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateStackResponse</a> smart constructor.
data UpdateStackResponse
UpdateStackResponse' :: UpdateStackResponse

-- | Create a value of <a>UpdateStackResponse</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
newUpdateStackResponse :: UpdateStackResponse

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateLayer</a> smart constructor.
data CreateLayer
CreateLayer' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe CloudWatchLogsConfiguration -> Maybe LifecycleEventConfiguration -> Maybe Recipes -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [VolumeConfiguration] -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe (HashMap LayerAttributesKeys (Maybe Text)) -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Bool -> Text -> LayerType -> Text -> Text -> CreateLayer

-- | Create a value of <a>CreateLayer</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:customInstanceProfileArn:CreateLayer'</a>,
--   <a>createLayer_customInstanceProfileArn</a> - The ARN of an IAM
--   profile to be used for the layer's EC2 instances. For more information
--   about IAM ARNs, see <a>Using Identifiers</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:customSecurityGroupIds:CreateLayer'</a>,
--   <a>createLayer_customSecurityGroupIds</a> - An array containing the
--   layer custom security group IDs.
--   
--   <a>$sel:installUpdatesOnBoot:CreateLayer'</a>,
--   <a>createLayer_installUpdatesOnBoot</a> - Whether to install operating
--   system and package updates when the instance boots. The default value
--   is <tt>true</tt>. To control when updates are installed, set this
--   value to <tt>false</tt>. You must then update your instances manually
--   by using CreateDeployment to run the <tt>update_dependencies</tt>
--   stack command or by manually running <tt>yum</tt> (Amazon Linux) or
--   <tt>apt-get</tt> (Ubuntu) on the instances.
--   
--   To ensure that your instances have the latest security updates, we
--   strongly recommend using the default value of <tt>true</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:cloudWatchLogsConfiguration:CreateLayer'</a>,
--   <a>createLayer_cloudWatchLogsConfiguration</a> - Specifies CloudWatch
--   Logs configuration options for the layer. For more information, see
--   CloudWatchLogsLogStream.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lifecycleEventConfiguration:CreateLayer'</a>,
--   <a>createLayer_lifecycleEventConfiguration</a> - A
--   <tt>LifeCycleEventConfiguration</tt> object that you can use to
--   configure the Shutdown event to specify an execution timeout and
--   enable or disable Elastic Load Balancer connection draining.
--   
--   <a>$sel:customRecipes:CreateLayer'</a>,
--   <a>createLayer_customRecipes</a> - A <tt>LayerCustomRecipes</tt>
--   object that specifies the layer custom recipes.
--   
--   <a>$sel:customJson:CreateLayer'</a>, <a>createLayer_customJson</a> - A
--   JSON-formatted string containing custom stack configuration and
--   deployment attributes to be installed on the layer's instances. For
--   more information, see <a>Using Custom JSON</a>. This feature is
--   supported as of version 1.7.42 of the AWS CLI.
--   
--   <a>$sel:volumeConfigurations:CreateLayer'</a>,
--   <a>createLayer_volumeConfigurations</a> - A
--   <tt>VolumeConfigurations</tt> object that describes the layer's Amazon
--   EBS volumes.
--   
--   <a>$sel:enableAutoHealing:CreateLayer'</a>,
--   <a>createLayer_enableAutoHealing</a> - Whether to disable auto healing
--   for the layer.
--   
--   <a>$sel:packages:CreateLayer'</a>, <a>createLayer_packages</a> - An
--   array of <tt>Package</tt> objects that describes the layer packages.
--   
--   <a>$sel:attributes:CreateLayer'</a>, <a>createLayer_attributes</a> -
--   One or more user-defined key-value pairs to be added to the stack
--   attributes.
--   
--   To create a cluster layer, set the <tt>EcsClusterArn</tt> attribute to
--   the cluster's ARN.
--   
--   <a>$sel:autoAssignPublicIps:CreateLayer'</a>,
--   <a>createLayer_autoAssignPublicIps</a> - For stacks that are running
--   in a VPC, whether to automatically assign a public IP address to the
--   layer's instances. For more information, see <a>How to Edit a
--   Layer</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:useEbsOptimizedInstances:CreateLayer'</a>,
--   <a>createLayer_useEbsOptimizedInstances</a> - Whether to use Amazon
--   EBS-optimized instances.
--   
--   <a>$sel:autoAssignElasticIps:CreateLayer'</a>,
--   <a>createLayer_autoAssignElasticIps</a> - Whether to automatically
--   assign an <a>Elastic IP address</a> to the layer's instances. For more
--   information, see <a>How to Edit a Layer</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:stackId:CreateLayer'</a>, <a>createLayer_stackId</a> - The
--   layer stack ID.
--   
--   <a>$sel:type':CreateLayer'</a>, <a>createLayer_type</a> - The layer
--   type. A stack cannot have more than one built-in layer of the same
--   type. It can have any number of custom layers. Built-in layers are not
--   available in Chef 12 stacks.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:CreateLayer'</a>, <a>createLayer_name</a> - The layer
--   name, which is used by the console.
--   
--   <a>$sel:shortname:CreateLayer'</a>, <a>createLayer_shortname</a> - For
--   custom layers only, use this parameter to specify the layer's short
--   name, which is used internally by AWS OpsWorks Stacks and by Chef
--   recipes. The short name is also used as the name for the directory
--   where your app files are installed. It can have a maximum of 200
--   characters, which are limited to the alphanumeric characters, '-',
--   '_', and '.'.
--   
--   The built-in layers' short names are defined by AWS OpsWorks Stacks.
--   For more information, see the <a>Layer Reference</a>.
newCreateLayer :: Text -> LayerType -> Text -> Text -> CreateLayer

--   <tt>AutoScalingThresholds</tt> object with the upscaling threshold

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateInstance</a> smart constructor.
data CreateInstance
CreateInstance' :: Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe AutoScalingType -> Maybe Architecture -> Maybe Text -> Maybe RootDeviceType -> Maybe [BlockDeviceMapping] -> Text -> [Text] -> Text -> CreateInstance

-- | Create a value of <a>CreateInstance</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:installUpdatesOnBoot:CreateInstance'</a>,
--   <a>createInstance_installUpdatesOnBoot</a> - Whether to install
--   operating system and package updates when the instance boots. The
--   default value is <tt>true</tt>. To control when updates are installed,
--   set this value to <tt>false</tt>. You must then update your instances
--   manually by using CreateDeployment to run the
--   <tt>update_dependencies</tt> stack command or by manually running
--   <tt>yum</tt> (Amazon Linux) or <tt>apt-get</tt> (Ubuntu) on the
--   instances.
--   
--   We strongly recommend using the default value of <tt>true</tt> to
--   ensure that your instances have the latest security updates.
--   
--   <a>$sel:virtualizationType:CreateInstance'</a>,
--   <a>createInstance_virtualizationType</a> - The instance's
--   virtualization type, <tt>paravirtual</tt> or <tt>hvm</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:hostname:CreateInstance'</a>, <a>createInstance_hostname</a> -
--   The instance host name.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sshKeyName:CreateInstance'</a>,
--   <a>createInstance_sshKeyName</a> - The instance's Amazon EC2 key-pair
--   name.
--   
--   <a>$sel:agentVersion:CreateInstance'</a>,
--   <a>createInstance_agentVersion</a> - The default AWS OpsWorks Stacks
--   agent version. You have the following options:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>INHERIT</tt> - Use the stack's default agent version
--   setting.</li>
--   <li><i>version_number</i> - Use the specified agent version. This
--   value overrides the stack's default setting. To update the agent
--   version, edit the instance configuration and specify a new version.
--   AWS OpsWorks Stacks then automatically installs that version on the
--   instance.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   The default setting is <tt>INHERIT</tt>. To specify an agent version,
--   you must use the complete version number, not the abbreviated number
--   shown on the console. For a list of available agent version numbers,
--   call DescribeAgentVersions. AgentVersion cannot be set to Chef 12.2.
--   
--   <a>$sel:subnetId:CreateInstance'</a>, <a>createInstance_subnetId</a> -
--   The ID of the instance's subnet. If the stack is running in a VPC, you
--   can use this parameter to override the stack's default subnet ID value
--   and direct AWS OpsWorks Stacks to launch the instance in a different
--   subnet.
--   
--   <a>$sel:ebsOptimized:CreateInstance'</a>,
--   <a>createInstance_ebsOptimized</a> - Whether to create an Amazon
--   EBS-optimized instance.
--   
--   <a>$sel:os:CreateInstance'</a>, <a>createInstance_os</a> - The
--   instance's operating system, which must be set to one of the
--   following.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>A supported Linux operating system: An Amazon Linux version, such
--   as <tt>Amazon Linux 2018.03</tt>, <tt>Amazon Linux 2017.09</tt>,
--   <tt>Amazon Linux 2017.03</tt>, <tt>Amazon Linux 2016.09</tt>,
--   <tt>Amazon Linux 2016.03</tt>, <tt>Amazon Linux 2015.09</tt>, or
--   <tt>Amazon Linux 2015.03</tt>.</li>
--   <li>A supported Ubuntu operating system, such as <tt>Ubuntu 16.04
--   LTS</tt>, <tt>Ubuntu 14.04 LTS</tt>, or <tt>Ubuntu 12.04
--   LTS</tt>.</li>
--   <li><pre>CentOS Linux 7</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7</pre></li>
--   <li>A supported Windows operating system, such as <tt>Microsoft
--   Windows Server 2012 R2 Base</tt>, <tt>Microsoft Windows Server 2012 R2
--   with SQL Server Express</tt>, <tt>Microsoft Windows Server 2012 R2
--   with SQL Server Standard</tt>, or <tt>Microsoft Windows Server 2012 R2
--   with SQL Server Web</tt>.</li>
--   <li>A custom AMI: <tt>Custom</tt>.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   For more information about the supported operating systems, see <a>AWS
--   OpsWorks Stacks Operating Systems</a>.
--   
--   The default option is the current Amazon Linux version. If you set
--   this parameter to <tt>Custom</tt>, you must use the CreateInstance
--   action's AmiId parameter to specify the custom AMI that you want to
--   use. Block device mappings are not supported if the value is
--   <tt>Custom</tt>. For more information about supported operating
--   systems, see <a>Operating Systems</a>For more information about how to
--   use custom AMIs with AWS OpsWorks Stacks, see <a>Using Custom
--   AMIs</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:availabilityZone:CreateInstance'</a>,
--   <a>createInstance_availabilityZone</a> - The instance Availability
--   Zone. For more information, see <a>Regions and Endpoints</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tenancy:CreateInstance'</a>, <a>createInstance_tenancy</a> -
--   The instance's tenancy option. The default option is no tenancy, or if
--   the instance is running in a VPC, inherit tenancy settings from the
--   VPC. The following are valid values for this parameter:
--   <tt>dedicated</tt>, <tt>default</tt>, or <tt>host</tt>. Because there
--   are costs associated with changes in tenancy options, we recommend
--   that you research tenancy options before choosing them for your
--   instances. For more information about dedicated hosts, see
--   <a>Dedicated Hosts Overview</a> and <a>Amazon EC2 Dedicated Hosts</a>.
--   For more information about dedicated instances, see <a>Dedicated
--   Instances</a> and <a>Amazon EC2 Dedicated Instances</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:autoScalingType:CreateInstance'</a>,
--   <a>createInstance_autoScalingType</a> - For load-based or time-based
--   instances, the type. Windows stacks can use only time-based instances.
--   
--   <a>$sel:architecture:CreateInstance'</a>,
--   <a>createInstance_architecture</a> - The instance architecture. The
--   default option is <tt>x86_64</tt>. Instance types do not necessarily
--   support both architectures. For a list of the architectures that are
--   supported by the different instance types, see <a>Instance Families
--   and Types</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:amiId:CreateInstance'</a>, <a>createInstance_amiId</a> - A
--   custom AMI ID to be used to create the instance. The AMI should be
--   based on one of the supported operating systems. For more information,
--   see <a>Using Custom AMIs</a>.
--   
--   If you specify a custom AMI, you must set <tt>Os</tt> to
--   <tt>Custom</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:rootDeviceType:CreateInstance'</a>,
--   <a>createInstance_rootDeviceType</a> - The instance root device type.
--   For more information, see <a>Storage for the Root Device</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:blockDeviceMappings:CreateInstance'</a>,
--   <a>createInstance_blockDeviceMappings</a> - An array of
--   <tt>BlockDeviceMapping</tt> objects that specify the instance's block
--   devices. For more information, see <a>Block Device Mapping</a>. Note
--   that block device mappings are not supported for custom AMIs.
--   
--   <a>$sel:stackId:CreateInstance'</a>, <a>createInstance_stackId</a> -
--   The stack ID.
--   
--   <a>$sel:layerIds:CreateInstance'</a>, <a>createInstance_layerIds</a> -
--   An array that contains the instance's layer IDs.
--   
--   <a>$sel:instanceType:CreateInstance'</a>,
--   <a>createInstance_instanceType</a> - The instance type, such as
--   <tt>t2.micro</tt>. For a list of supported instance types, open the
--   stack in the console, choose <b>Instances</b>, and choose <b>+
--   Instance</b>. The <b>Size</b> list contains the currently supported
--   types. For more information, see <a>Instance Families and Types</a>.
--   The parameter values that you use to specify the various types are in
--   the <b>API Name</b> column of the <b>Available Instance Types</b>
--   table.
newCreateInstance :: Text -> Text -> CreateInstance

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateInstance</a> smart constructor.
data UpdateInstance
UpdateInstance' :: Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe AutoScalingType -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Architecture -> Maybe Text -> Text -> UpdateInstance

-- | Create a value of <a>UpdateInstance</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:installUpdatesOnBoot:UpdateInstance'</a>,
--   <a>updateInstance_installUpdatesOnBoot</a> - Whether to install
--   operating system and package updates when the instance boots. The
--   default value is <tt>true</tt>. To control when updates are installed,
--   set this value to <tt>false</tt>. You must then update your instances
--   manually by using CreateDeployment to run the
--   <tt>update_dependencies</tt> stack command or by manually running
--   <tt>yum</tt> (Amazon Linux) or <tt>apt-get</tt> (Ubuntu) on the
--   instances.
--   
--   We strongly recommend using the default value of <tt>true</tt>, to
--   ensure that your instances have the latest security updates.
--   
--   <a>$sel:hostname:UpdateInstance'</a>, <a>updateInstance_hostname</a> -
--   The instance host name.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sshKeyName:UpdateInstance'</a>,
--   <a>updateInstance_sshKeyName</a> - The instance's Amazon EC2 key name.
--   
--   <a>$sel:agentVersion:UpdateInstance'</a>,
--   <a>updateInstance_agentVersion</a> - The default AWS OpsWorks Stacks
--   agent version. You have the following options:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>INHERIT</tt> - Use the stack's default agent version
--   setting.</li>
--   <li><i>version_number</i> - Use the specified agent version. This
--   value overrides the stack's default setting. To update the agent
--   version, you must edit the instance configuration and specify a new
--   version. AWS OpsWorks Stacks then automatically installs that version
--   on the instance.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   The default setting is <tt>INHERIT</tt>. To specify an agent version,
--   you must use the complete version number, not the abbreviated number
--   shown on the console. For a list of available agent version numbers,
--   call DescribeAgentVersions.
--   
--   AgentVersion cannot be set to Chef 12.2.
--   
--   <a>$sel:instanceType:UpdateInstance'</a>,
--   <a>updateInstance_instanceType</a> - The instance type, such as
--   <tt>t2.micro</tt>. For a list of supported instance types, open the
--   stack in the console, choose <b>Instances</b>, and choose <b>+
--   Instance</b>. The <b>Size</b> list contains the currently supported
--   types. For more information, see <a>Instance Families and Types</a>.
--   The parameter values that you use to specify the various types are in
--   the <b>API Name</b> column of the <b>Available Instance Types</b>
--   table.
--   
--   <a>$sel:ebsOptimized:UpdateInstance'</a>,
--   <a>updateInstance_ebsOptimized</a> - This property cannot be updated.
--   
--   <a>$sel:os:UpdateInstance'</a>, <a>updateInstance_os</a> - The
--   instance's operating system, which must be set to one of the
--   following. You cannot update an instance that is using a custom AMI.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>A supported Linux operating system: An Amazon Linux version, such
--   as <tt>Amazon Linux 2018.03</tt>, <tt>Amazon Linux 2017.09</tt>,
--   <tt>Amazon Linux 2017.03</tt>, <tt>Amazon Linux 2016.09</tt>,
--   <tt>Amazon Linux 2016.03</tt>, <tt>Amazon Linux 2015.09</tt>, or
--   <tt>Amazon Linux 2015.03</tt>.</li>
--   <li>A supported Ubuntu operating system, such as <tt>Ubuntu 16.04
--   LTS</tt>, <tt>Ubuntu 14.04 LTS</tt>, or <tt>Ubuntu 12.04
--   LTS</tt>.</li>
--   <li><pre>CentOS Linux 7</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7</pre></li>
--   <li>A supported Windows operating system, such as <tt>Microsoft
--   Windows Server 2012 R2 Base</tt>, <tt>Microsoft Windows Server 2012 R2
--   with SQL Server Express</tt>, <tt>Microsoft Windows Server 2012 R2
--   with SQL Server Standard</tt>, or <tt>Microsoft Windows Server 2012 R2
--   with SQL Server Web</tt>.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   For more information about supported operating systems, see <a>AWS
--   OpsWorks Stacks Operating Systems</a>.
--   
--   The default option is the current Amazon Linux version. If you set
--   this parameter to <tt>Custom</tt>, you must use the AmiId parameter to
--   specify the custom AMI that you want to use. For more information
--   about supported operating systems, see <a>Operating Systems</a>. For
--   more information about how to use custom AMIs with OpsWorks, see
--   <a>Using Custom AMIs</a>.
--   
--   You can specify a different Linux operating system for the updated
--   stack, but you cannot change from Linux to Windows or Windows to
--   Linux.
--   
--   <a>$sel:autoScalingType:UpdateInstance'</a>,
--   <a>updateInstance_autoScalingType</a> - For load-based or time-based
--   instances, the type. Windows stacks can use only time-based instances.
--   
--   <a>$sel:layerIds:UpdateInstance'</a>, <a>updateInstance_layerIds</a> -
--   The instance's layer IDs.
--   
--   <a>$sel:architecture:UpdateInstance'</a>,
--   <a>updateInstance_architecture</a> - The instance architecture.
--   Instance types do not necessarily support both architectures. For a
--   list of the architectures that are supported by the different instance
--   types, see <a>Instance Families and Types</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:amiId:UpdateInstance'</a>, <a>updateInstance_amiId</a> - The
--   ID of the AMI that was used to create the instance. The value of this
--   parameter must be the same AMI ID that the instance is already using.
--   You cannot apply a new AMI to an instance by running UpdateInstance.
--   UpdateInstance does not work on instances that are using custom AMIs.
--   
--   <a>$sel:instanceId:UpdateInstance'</a>,
--   <a>updateInstance_instanceId</a> - The instance ID.
newUpdateInstance :: Text -> UpdateInstance

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateInstanceResponse</a> smart constructor.
data UpdateInstanceResponse
UpdateInstanceResponse' :: UpdateInstanceResponse

-- | Create a value of <a>UpdateInstanceResponse</a> with all optional

newUpdateInstanceResponse :: UpdateInstanceResponse

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateApp</a> smart constructor.
data UpdateApp
UpdateApp' :: Maybe SslConfiguration -> Maybe [EnvironmentVariable] -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe [DataSource] -> Maybe Source -> Maybe (HashMap AppAttributesKeys Text) -> Maybe Text -> Maybe AppType -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Text -> Text -> UpdateApp

-- | Create a value of <a>UpdateApp</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:sslConfiguration:UpdateApp'</a>,
--   <a>updateApp_sslConfiguration</a> - An <tt>SslConfiguration</tt>
--   object with the SSL configuration.
--   
--   <a>$sel:environment:UpdateApp'</a>, <a>updateApp_environment</a> - An
--   array of <tt>EnvironmentVariable</tt> objects that specify environment
--   variables to be associated with the app. After you deploy the app,
--   these variables are defined on the associated app server instances.For
--   more information, see <a>Environment Variables</a>.
--   
--   There is no specific limit on the number of environment variables.
--   However, the size of the associated data structure - which includes
--   the variables' names, values, and protected flag values - cannot
--   exceed 20 KB. This limit should accommodate most if not all use cases.
--   Exceeding it will cause an exception with the message, "Environment:
--   is too large (maximum is 20 KB)."
--   
--   If you have specified one or more environment variables, you cannot
--   modify the stack's Chef version.
--   
--   <a>$sel:enableSsl:UpdateApp'</a>, <a>updateApp_enableSsl</a> - Whether
--   SSL is enabled for the app.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dataSources:UpdateApp'</a>, <a>updateApp_dataSources</a> - The
--   app's data sources.
--   
--   <a>$sel:appSource:UpdateApp'</a>, <a>updateApp_appSource</a> - A
--   <tt>Source</tt> object that specifies the app repository.
--   
--   <a>$sel:attributes:UpdateApp'</a>, <a>updateApp_attributes</a> - One
--   or more user-defined key/value pairs to be added to the stack
--   attributes.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:UpdateApp'</a>, <a>updateApp_name</a> - The app name.
--   
--   <a>$sel:type':UpdateApp'</a>, <a>updateApp_type</a> - The app type.
--   
--   <a>$sel:domains:UpdateApp'</a>, <a>updateApp_domains</a> - The app's
--   virtual host settings, with multiple domains separated by commas. For
--   example: <tt>'www.example.com, example.com'</tt>
--   
--   <a>$sel:description:UpdateApp'</a>, <a>updateApp_description</a> - A
--   description of the app.
--   
--   <a>$sel:appId:UpdateApp'</a>, <a>updateApp_appId</a> - The app ID.
newUpdateApp :: Text -> UpdateApp

--   parameter, <tt>DescribeInstances</tt> returns descriptions of the

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateLayer</a> smart constructor.
data UpdateLayer
UpdateLayer' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe CloudWatchLogsConfiguration -> Maybe LifecycleEventConfiguration -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Recipes -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [VolumeConfiguration] -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe (HashMap LayerAttributesKeys (Maybe Text)) -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Bool -> Text -> UpdateLayer

-- | Create a value of <a>UpdateLayer</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:customInstanceProfileArn:UpdateLayer'</a>,
--   <a>updateLayer_customInstanceProfileArn</a> - The ARN of an IAM
--   profile to be used for all of the layer's EC2 instances. For more
--   information about IAM ARNs, see <a>Using Identifiers</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:customSecurityGroupIds:UpdateLayer'</a>,
--   <a>updateLayer_customSecurityGroupIds</a> - An array containing the
--   layer's custom security group IDs.
--   
--   <a>$sel:installUpdatesOnBoot:UpdateLayer'</a>,
--   <a>updateLayer_installUpdatesOnBoot</a> - Whether to install operating
--   system and package updates when the instance boots. The default value
--   is <tt>true</tt>. To control when updates are installed, set this
--   value to <tt>false</tt>. You must then update your instances manually
--   by using CreateDeployment to run the <tt>update_dependencies</tt>
--   stack command or manually running <tt>yum</tt> (Amazon Linux) or
--   <tt>apt-get</tt> (Ubuntu) on the instances.
--   
--   We strongly recommend using the default value of <tt>true</tt>, to
--   ensure that your instances have the latest security updates.
--   
--   <a>$sel:cloudWatchLogsConfiguration:UpdateLayer'</a>,
--   <a>updateLayer_cloudWatchLogsConfiguration</a> - Specifies CloudWatch
--   Logs configuration options for the layer. For more information, see
--   CloudWatchLogsLogStream.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lifecycleEventConfiguration:UpdateLayer'</a>,
--   <a>updateLayer_lifecycleEventConfiguration</a> -
--   
--   <a>$sel:shortname:UpdateLayer'</a>, <a>updateLayer_shortname</a> - For
--   custom layers only, use this parameter to specify the layer's short
--   name, which is used internally by AWS OpsWorks Stacks and by Chef. The
--   short name is also used as the name for the directory where your app
--   files are installed. It can have a maximum of 200 characters and must
--   be in the following format: /\A[a-z0-9\-\_\.]+\Z/.
--   
--   The built-in layers' short names are defined by AWS OpsWorks Stacks.
--   For more information, see the <a>Layer Reference</a>
--   
--   <a>$sel:customRecipes:UpdateLayer'</a>,
--   <a>updateLayer_customRecipes</a> - A <tt>LayerCustomRecipes</tt>
--   object that specifies the layer's custom recipes.
--   
--   <a>$sel:customJson:UpdateLayer'</a>, <a>updateLayer_customJson</a> - A
--   JSON-formatted string containing custom stack configuration and
--   deployment attributes to be installed on the layer's instances. For
--   more information, see <a>Using Custom JSON</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:volumeConfigurations:UpdateLayer'</a>,
--   <a>updateLayer_volumeConfigurations</a> - A
--   <tt>VolumeConfigurations</tt> object that describes the layer's Amazon
--   EBS volumes.
--   
--   <a>$sel:enableAutoHealing:UpdateLayer'</a>,
--   <a>updateLayer_enableAutoHealing</a> - Whether to disable auto healing
--   for the layer.
--   
--   <a>$sel:packages:UpdateLayer'</a>, <a>updateLayer_packages</a> - An
--   array of <tt>Package</tt> objects that describe the layer's packages.
--   
--   <a>$sel:attributes:UpdateLayer'</a>, <a>updateLayer_attributes</a> -
--   One or more user-defined key/value pairs to be added to the stack
--   attributes.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:UpdateLayer'</a>, <a>updateLayer_name</a> - The layer
--   name, which is used by the console.
--   
--   <a>$sel:autoAssignPublicIps:UpdateLayer'</a>,
--   <a>updateLayer_autoAssignPublicIps</a> - For stacks that are running
--   in a VPC, whether to automatically assign a public IP address to the
--   layer's instances. For more information, see <a>How to Edit a
--   Layer</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:useEbsOptimizedInstances:UpdateLayer'</a>,
--   <a>updateLayer_useEbsOptimizedInstances</a> - Whether to use Amazon
--   EBS-optimized instances.
--   
--   <a>$sel:autoAssignElasticIps:UpdateLayer'</a>,
--   <a>updateLayer_autoAssignElasticIps</a> - Whether to automatically
--   assign an <a>Elastic IP address</a> to the layer's instances. For more
--   information, see <a>How to Edit a Layer</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:layerId:UpdateLayer'</a>, <a>updateLayer_layerId</a> - The
--   layer ID.
newUpdateLayer :: Text -> UpdateLayer
