-- | Describes how many instances a stack has for each status.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newInstancesCount</a> smart constructor.
data InstancesCount
InstancesCount' :: Maybe Int -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Int -> InstancesCount

-- | Create a value of <a>InstancesCount</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:terminating:InstancesCount'</a>,
--   <a>instancesCount_terminating</a> - The number of instances with
--   <tt>terminating</tt> status.
--   
--   <a>$sel:pending:InstancesCount'</a>, <a>instancesCount_pending</a> -
--   The number of instances with <tt>pending</tt> status.
--   
--   <a>$sel:online:InstancesCount'</a>, <a>instancesCount_online</a> - The
--   number of instances with <tt>online</tt> status.
--   
--   <a>$sel:unassigning:InstancesCount'</a>,
--   <a>instancesCount_unassigning</a> - The number of instances in the
--   Unassigning state.
--   
--   <a>$sel:deregistering:InstancesCount'</a>,
--   <a>instancesCount_deregistering</a> - The number of instances in the
--   Deregistering state.
--   
--   <a>$sel:runningSetup:InstancesCount'</a>,
--   <a>instancesCount_runningSetup</a> - The number of instances with
--   <tt>running_setup</tt> status.
--   
--   <a>$sel:requested:InstancesCount'</a>, <a>instancesCount_requested</a>
--   - The number of instances with <tt>requested</tt> status.
--   
--   <a>$sel:stopFailed:InstancesCount'</a>,
--   <a>instancesCount_stopFailed</a> - The number of instances with
--   <tt>stop_failed</tt> status.
--   
--   <a>$sel:booting:InstancesCount'</a>, <a>instancesCount_booting</a> -
--   The number of instances with <tt>booting</tt> status.
--   
--   <a>$sel:stopped:InstancesCount'</a>, <a>instancesCount_stopped</a> -
--   The number of instances with <tt>stopped</tt> status.
--   
--   <a>$sel:rebooting:InstancesCount'</a>, <a>instancesCount_rebooting</a>
--   - The number of instances with <tt>rebooting</tt> status.
--   
--   <a>$sel:assigning:InstancesCount'</a>, <a>instancesCount_assigning</a>
--   - The number of instances in the Assigning state.
--   
--   <a>$sel:shuttingDown:InstancesCount'</a>,
--   <a>instancesCount_shuttingDown</a> - The number of instances with
--   <tt>shutting_down</tt> status.
--   
--   <a>$sel:setupFailed:InstancesCount'</a>,
--   <a>instancesCount_setupFailed</a> - The number of instances with
--   <tt>setup_failed</tt> status.
--   
--   <a>$sel:connectionLost:InstancesCount'</a>,
--   <a>instancesCount_connectionLost</a> - The number of instances with
--   <tt>connection_lost</tt> status.
--   
--   <a>$sel:terminated:InstancesCount'</a>,
--   <a>instancesCount_terminated</a> - The number of instances with
--   <tt>terminated</tt> status.
--   
--   <a>$sel:stopping:InstancesCount'</a>, <a>instancesCount_stopping</a> -
--   The number of instances with <tt>stopping</tt> status.
--   
--   <a>$sel:registered:InstancesCount'</a>,
--   <a>instancesCount_registered</a> - The number of instances in the
--   Registered state.
--   
--   <a>$sel:startFailed:InstancesCount'</a>,
--   <a>instancesCount_startFailed</a> - The number of instances with
--   <tt>start_failed</tt> status.
--   
--   <a>$sel:registering:InstancesCount'</a>,
--   <a>instancesCount_registering</a> - The number of instances in the
--   Registering state.
newInstancesCount :: InstancesCount

-- | Describes a layer.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newLayer</a> smart constructor.
data Layer
Layer' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe CloudWatchLogsConfiguration -> Maybe LifecycleEventConfiguration -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Recipes -> Maybe Recipes -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [VolumeConfiguration] -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe (HashMap LayerAttributesKeys (Maybe Text)) -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe LayerType -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Bool -> Layer

-- | Create a value of <a>Layer</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:customInstanceProfileArn:Layer'</a>,
--   <a>layer_customInstanceProfileArn</a> - The ARN of the default IAM
--   profile to be used for the layer's EC2 instances. For more information
--   about IAM ARNs, see <a>Using Identifiers</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:customSecurityGroupIds:Layer'</a>,
--   <a>layer_customSecurityGroupIds</a> - An array containing the layer's
--   custom security group IDs.
--   
--   <a>$sel:installUpdatesOnBoot:Layer'</a>,
--   <a>layer_installUpdatesOnBoot</a> - Whether to install operating
--   system and package updates when the instance boots. The default value
--   is <tt>true</tt>. If this value is set to <tt>false</tt>, you must
--   then update your instances manually by using CreateDeployment to run
--   the <tt>update_dependencies</tt> stack command or manually running
--   <tt>yum</tt> (Amazon Linux) or <tt>apt-get</tt> (Ubuntu) on the
--   instances.
--   
--   We strongly recommend using the default value of <tt>true</tt>, to
--   ensure that your instances have the latest security updates.
--   
--   <a>$sel:cloudWatchLogsConfiguration:Layer'</a>,
--   <a>layer_cloudWatchLogsConfiguration</a> - The Amazon CloudWatch Logs
--   configuration settings for the layer.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lifecycleEventConfiguration:Layer'</a>,
--   <a>layer_lifecycleEventConfiguration</a> - A
--   <tt>LifeCycleEventConfiguration</tt> object that specifies the
--   Shutdown event configuration.
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:Layer'</a>, <a>layer_arn</a> - The Amazon Resource Number
--   (ARN) of a layer.
--   
--   <a>$sel:createdAt:Layer'</a>, <a>layer_createdAt</a> - Date when the
--   layer was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:shortname:Layer'</a>, <a>layer_shortname</a> - The layer short
--   name.
--   
--   <a>$sel:defaultRecipes:Layer'</a>, <a>layer_defaultRecipes</a> - AWS
--   OpsWorks Stacks supports five lifecycle events: <b>setup</b>,
--   <b>configuration</b>, <b>deploy</b>, <b>undeploy</b>, and
--   <b>shutdown</b>. For each layer, AWS OpsWorks Stacks runs a set of
--   standard recipes for each event. You can also provide custom recipes
--   for any or all layers and events. AWS OpsWorks Stacks runs custom
--   event recipes after the standard recipes. <tt>LayerCustomRecipes</tt>
--   specifies the custom recipes for a particular layer to be run in
--   response to each of the five events.
--   
--   To specify a recipe, use the cookbook's directory name in the
--   repository followed by two colons and the recipe name, which is the
--   recipe's file name without the <tt>.rb</tt> extension. For example:
--   <tt>phpapp2::dbsetup</tt> specifies the <tt>dbsetup.rb</tt> recipe in
--   the repository's <tt>phpapp2</tt> folder.
--   
--   <a>$sel:customRecipes:Layer'</a>, <a>layer_customRecipes</a> - A
--   <tt>LayerCustomRecipes</tt> object that specifies the layer's custom
--   recipes.
--   
--   <a>$sel:customJson:Layer'</a>, <a>layer_customJson</a> - A JSON
--   formatted string containing the layer's custom stack configuration and
--   deployment attributes.
--   
--   <a>$sel:volumeConfigurations:Layer'</a>,
--   <a>layer_volumeConfigurations</a> - A <tt>VolumeConfigurations</tt>
--   object that describes the layer's Amazon EBS volumes.
--   
--   <a>$sel:enableAutoHealing:Layer'</a>, <a>layer_enableAutoHealing</a> -
--   Whether auto healing is disabled for the layer.
--   
--   <a>$sel:packages:Layer'</a>, <a>layer_packages</a> - An array of
--   <tt>Package</tt> objects that describe the layer's packages.
--   
--   <a>$sel:attributes:Layer'</a>, <a>layer_attributes</a> - The layer
--   attributes.
--   
--   For the <tt>HaproxyStatsPassword</tt>, <tt>MysqlRootPassword</tt>, and
--   <tt>GangliaPassword</tt> attributes, AWS OpsWorks Stacks returns
--   <tt>*****FILTERED*****</tt> instead of the actual value
--   
--   For an ECS Cluster layer, AWS OpsWorks Stacks the
--   <tt>EcsClusterArn</tt> attribute is set to the cluster's ARN.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:Layer'</a>, <a>layer_name</a> - The layer name.
--   
--   <a>$sel:autoAssignPublicIps:Layer'</a>,
--   <a>layer_autoAssignPublicIps</a> - For stacks that are running in a
--   VPC, whether to automatically assign a public IP address to the
--   layer's instances. For more information, see <a>How to Edit a
--   Layer</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:type':Layer'</a>, <a>layer_type</a> - The layer type.
--   
--   <a>$sel:useEbsOptimizedInstances:Layer'</a>,
--   <a>layer_useEbsOptimizedInstances</a> - Whether the layer uses Amazon
--   EBS-optimized instances.
--   
--   <a>$sel:stackId:Layer'</a>, <a>layer_stackId</a> - The layer stack ID.
--   
--   <a>$sel:layerId:Layer'</a>, <a>layer_layerId</a> - The layer ID.
--   
--   <a>$sel:defaultSecurityGroupNames:Layer'</a>,
--   <a>layer_defaultSecurityGroupNames</a> - An array containing the
--   layer's security group names.
--   
--   <a>$sel:autoAssignElasticIps:Layer'</a>,
--   <a>layer_autoAssignElasticIps</a> - Whether to automatically assign an
--   <a>Elastic IP address</a> to the layer's instances. For more
--   information, see <a>How to Edit a Layer</a>.
newLayer :: Layer

--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newOperatingSystem</a> smart constructor.
data OperatingSystem
OperatingSystem' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [OperatingSystemConfigurationManager] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> OperatingSystem

-- | Create a value of <a>OperatingSystem</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   system, including the release and edition, if applicable.
--   
--   <a>$sel:supported:OperatingSystem'</a>,
--   <a>operatingSystem_supported</a> - Indicates that an operating system
--   is not supported for new instances.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:OperatingSystem'</a>, <a>operatingSystem_name</a> - The
--   name of the operating system, such as <tt>Amazon Linux 2018.03</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:id:OperatingSystem'</a>, <a>operatingSystem_id</a> - The ID of
--   a supported operating system, such as <tt>Amazon Linux 2018.03</tt>.
--

--   manager name and versions for an AWS OpsWorks Stacks operating system.
--

--   type of a supported operating system, either <tt>Linux</tt> or
--   <tt>Windows</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:reportedName:OperatingSystem'</a>,
--   <a>operatingSystem_reportedName</a> - A short name for the operating
--   system manufacturer.
newOperatingSystem :: OperatingSystem

-- | Describes stack or user permissions.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newPermission</a> smart constructor.
data Permission
Permission' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Permission

-- | Create a value of <a>Permission</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:iamUserArn:Permission'</a>, <a>permission_iamUserArn</a> - The
--   Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for an AWS Identity and Access Management
--   (IAM) role. For more information about IAM ARNs, see <a>Using
--   Identifiers</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:allowSudo:Permission'</a>, <a>permission_allowSudo</a> -
--   Whether the user can use <b>sudo</b>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:stackId:Permission'</a>, <a>permission_stackId</a> - A stack
--   ID.
--   
--   <a>$sel:level:Permission'</a>, <a>permission_level</a> - The user's
--   permission level, which must be the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><pre>deny</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>show</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>deploy</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>manage</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>iam_only</pre></li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   For more information on the permissions associated with these levels,
--   see <a>Managing User Permissions</a>
--   
--   <a>$sel:allowSsh:Permission'</a>, <a>permission_allowSsh</a> - Whether
--   the user can use SSH.
newPermission :: Permission

--   ID.
--

--   array's mount point.
newRaidArray :: RaidArray

-- | Describes an Amazon RDS instance.
--

data RdsDbInstance

-- | Create a value of <a>RdsDbInstance</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:rdsDbInstanceArn:RdsDbInstance'</a>,
--   <a>rdsDbInstance_rdsDbInstanceArn</a> - The instance's ARN.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dbUser:RdsDbInstance'</a>, <a>rdsDbInstance_dbUser</a> - The
--   master user name.
--   
--   <a>$sel:missingOnRds:RdsDbInstance'</a>,
--   <a>rdsDbInstance_missingOnRds</a> - Set to <tt>true</tt> if AWS
--   OpsWorks Stacks is unable to discover the Amazon RDS instance. AWS
--   OpsWorks Stacks attempts to discover the instance only once. If this
--   value is set to <tt>true</tt>, you must deregister the instance, and
--   then register it again.
--   
--   <a>$sel:engine:RdsDbInstance'</a>, <a>rdsDbInstance_engine</a> - The
--   instance's database engine.
--   
--   <a>$sel:address:RdsDbInstance'</a>, <a>rdsDbInstance_address</a> - The
--   instance's address.
--

--   <a>rdsDbInstance_dbInstanceIdentifier</a> - The DB instance
--   identifier.
--   
--   <a>$sel:region:RdsDbInstance'</a>, <a>rdsDbInstance_region</a> - The
--   instance's AWS region.
--   
--   <a>$sel:stackId:RdsDbInstance'</a>, <a>rdsDbInstance_stackId</a> - The
--   ID of the stack with which the instance is registered.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dbPassword:RdsDbInstance'</a>, <a>rdsDbInstance_dbPassword</a>
--   - AWS OpsWorks Stacks returns <tt>*****FILTERED*****</tt> instead of
--   the actual value.
newRdsDbInstance :: RdsDbInstance

-- | AWS OpsWorks Stacks supports five lifecycle events: <b>setup</b>,
--   <b>configuration</b>, <b>deploy</b>, <b>undeploy</b>, and
--   <b>shutdown</b>. For each layer, AWS OpsWorks Stacks runs a set of
--   standard recipes for each event. In addition, you can provide custom
--   recipes for any or all layers and events. AWS OpsWorks Stacks runs
--   custom event recipes after the standard recipes.
--   <tt>LayerCustomRecipes</tt> specifies the custom recipes for a
--   particular layer to be run in response to each of the five events.
--   
--   To specify a recipe, use the cookbook's directory name in the
--   repository followed by two colons and the recipe name, which is the
--   recipe's file name without the .rb extension. For example:
--   phpapp2::dbsetup specifies the dbsetup.rb recipe in the repository's
--   phpapp2 folder.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newRecipes</a> smart constructor.
data Recipes
Recipes' :: Maybe [Text] -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe [Text] -> Recipes

-- | Create a value of <a>Recipes</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:setup:Recipes'</a>, <a>recipes_setup</a> - An array of custom
--   recipe names to be run following a <tt>setup</tt> event.
--   
--   <a>$sel:shutdown:Recipes'</a>, <a>recipes_shutdown</a> - An array of
--   custom recipe names to be run following a <tt>shutdown</tt> event.
--   
--   <a>$sel:undeploy:Recipes'</a>, <a>recipes_undeploy</a> - An array of
--   custom recipe names to be run following a <tt>undeploy</tt> event.
--   
--   <a>$sel:configure:Recipes'</a>, <a>recipes_configure</a> - An array of
--   custom recipe names to be run following a <tt>configure</tt> event.
--   
--   <a>$sel:deploy:Recipes'</a>, <a>recipes_deploy</a> - An array of
--   custom recipe names to be run following a <tt>deploy</tt> event.
newRecipes :: Recipes

-- | A registered instance's reported operating system.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newReportedOs</a> smart constructor.
data ReportedOs
ReportedOs' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> ReportedOs

-- | Contains the information required to retrieve an app or cookbook from
--   a repository. For more information, see <a>Creating Apps</a> or
--   <a>Custom Recipes and Cookbooks</a>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSource</a> smart constructor.
data Source
Source' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe SourceType -> Maybe Text -> Source

-- | Create a value of <a>Source</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:url:Source'</a>, <a>source_url</a> - The source URL. The
--   following is an example of an Amazon S3 source URL:
--   <tt>https://s3.amazonaws.com/opsworks-demo-bucket/opsworks_cookbook_demo.tar.gz</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:username:Source'</a>, <a>source_username</a> - This parameter
--   depends on the repository type.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>For Amazon S3 bundles, set <tt>Username</tt> to the appropriate
--   IAM access key ID.</li>
--   <li>For HTTP bundles, Git repositories, and Subversion repositories,
--   set <tt>Username</tt> to the user name.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:sshKey:Source'</a>, <a>source_sshKey</a> - In requests, the
--   repository's SSH key.
--   
--   In responses, AWS OpsWorks Stacks returns <tt>*****FILTERED*****</tt>
--   instead of the actual value.
--   
--   <a>$sel:password:Source'</a>, <a>source_password</a> - When included
--   in a request, the parameter depends on the repository type.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>For Amazon S3 bundles, set <tt>Password</tt> to the appropriate
--   IAM secret access key.</li>
--   <li>For HTTP bundles and Subversion repositories, set
--   <tt>Password</tt> to the password.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   For more information on how to safely handle IAM credentials, see
--   <a>https://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/aws-access-keys-best-practices.html</a>.
--   
--   In responses, AWS OpsWorks Stacks returns <tt>*****FILTERED*****</tt>
--   instead of the actual value.
--   
--   <a>$sel:type':Source'</a>, <a>source_type</a> - The repository type.
--   
--   <a>$sel:revision:Source'</a>, <a>source_revision</a> - The
--   application's version. AWS OpsWorks Stacks enables you to easily
--   deploy new versions of an application. One of the simplest approaches
--   is to have branches or revisions in your repository that represent
--   different versions that can potentially be deployed.
newSource :: Source

--   fields.

--   <a>$sel:certificate:SslConfiguration'</a>,

-- | Describes a stack.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newStack</a> smart constructor.
data Stack
Stack' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe RootDeviceType -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ChefConfiguration -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Source -> Maybe Text -> Maybe (HashMap StackAttributesKeys (Maybe Text)) -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe StackConfigurationManager -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Stack

-- | Create a value of <a>Stack</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:defaultInstanceProfileArn:Stack'</a>,
--   <a>stack_defaultInstanceProfileArn</a> - The ARN of an IAM profile
--   that is the default profile for all of the stack's EC2 instances. For
--   more information about IAM ARNs, see <a>Using Identifiers</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:serviceRoleArn:Stack'</a>, <a>stack_serviceRoleArn</a> - The
--   stack AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) role.
--   
--   <a>$sel:defaultRootDeviceType:Stack'</a>,
--   <a>stack_defaultRootDeviceType</a> - The default root device type.
--   This value is used by default for all instances in the stack, but you
--   can override it when you create an instance. For more information, see
--   <a>Storage for the Root Device</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:Stack'</a>, <a>stack_arn</a> - The stack's ARN.
--   
--   <a>$sel:createdAt:Stack'</a>, <a>stack_createdAt</a> - The date when
--   the stack was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:vpcId:Stack'</a>, <a>stack_vpcId</a> - The VPC ID; applicable
--   only if the stack is running in a VPC.
--   
--   <a>$sel:chefConfiguration:Stack'</a>, <a>stack_chefConfiguration</a> -
--   A <tt>ChefConfiguration</tt> object that specifies whether to enable
--   Berkshelf and the Berkshelf version. For more information, see
--   <a>Create a New Stack</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:agentVersion:Stack'</a>, <a>stack_agentVersion</a> - The agent
--   version. This parameter is set to <tt>LATEST</tt> for auto-update. or
--   a version number for a fixed agent version.
--   
--   <a>$sel:defaultSshKeyName:Stack'</a>, <a>stack_defaultSshKeyName</a> -
--   A default Amazon EC2 key pair for the stack's instances. You can
--   override this value when you create or update an instance.
--   
--   <a>$sel:customJson:Stack'</a>, <a>stack_customJson</a> - A JSON object
--   that contains user-defined attributes to be added to the stack
--   configuration and deployment attributes. You can use custom JSON to
--   override the corresponding default stack configuration attribute
--   values or to pass data to recipes. The string should be in the
--   following format:
--   
--   <pre>
--   "{\"key1\": \"value1\", \"key2\": \"value2\",...}"
--   </pre>
--   
--   For more information on custom JSON, see <a>Use Custom JSON to Modify
--   the Stack Configuration Attributes</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:customCookbooksSource:Stack'</a>,
--   <a>stack_customCookbooksSource</a> - Contains the information required
--   to retrieve an app or cookbook from a repository. For more
--   information, see <a>Adding Apps</a> or <a>Cookbooks and Recipes</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:defaultAvailabilityZone:Stack'</a>,
--   <a>stack_defaultAvailabilityZone</a> - The stack's default
--   Availability Zone. For more information, see <a>Regions and
--   Endpoints</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:attributes:Stack'</a>, <a>stack_attributes</a> - The stack's
--   attributes.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:Stack'</a>, <a>stack_name</a> - The stack name.
--   
--   <a>$sel:defaultOs:Stack'</a>, <a>stack_defaultOs</a> - The stack's
--   default operating system.
--   
--   <a>$sel:useOpsworksSecurityGroups:Stack'</a>,
--   <a>stack_useOpsworksSecurityGroups</a> - Whether the stack
--   automatically associates the AWS OpsWorks Stacks built-in security
--   groups with the stack's layers.
--   
--   <a>$sel:useCustomCookbooks:Stack'</a>, <a>stack_useCustomCookbooks</a>
--   - Whether the stack uses custom cookbooks.
--   
--   <a>$sel:defaultSubnetId:Stack'</a>, <a>stack_defaultSubnetId</a> - The
--   default subnet ID; applicable only if the stack is running in a VPC.
--   
--   <a>$sel:region:Stack'</a>, <a>stack_region</a> - The stack AWS region,
--   such as "ap-northeast-2". For more information about AWS regions, see
--   <a>Regions and Endpoints</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:configurationManager:Stack'</a>,
--   <a>stack_configurationManager</a> - The configuration manager.
--   
--   <a>$sel:stackId:Stack'</a>, <a>stack_stackId</a> - The stack ID.
--   
--   <a>$sel:hostnameTheme:Stack'</a>, <a>stack_hostnameTheme</a> - The
--   stack host name theme, with spaces replaced by underscores.
newStack :: Stack

-- | Describes the configuration manager.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newStackConfigurationManager</a> smart constructor.
data StackConfigurationManager
StackConfigurationManager' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> StackConfigurationManager

-- | Create a value of <a>StackConfigurationManager</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:StackConfigurationManager'</a>,
--   <a>stackConfigurationManager_name</a> - The name. This parameter must
--   be set to "Chef".
--   
--   <a>$sel:version:StackConfigurationManager'</a>,
--   <a>stackConfigurationManager_version</a> - The Chef version. This
--   parameter must be set to 12, 11.10, or 11.4 for Linux stacks, and to
--   12.2 for Windows stacks. The default value for Linux stacks is 11.4.
newStackConfigurationManager :: StackConfigurationManager

--   minutes) that the grant is valid. When the grant expires, at the end
--   of this period, the user will no longer be able to use the credentials
--   to log in. If they are logged in at the time, they will be
--   automatically logged out.
newTemporaryCredential :: TemporaryCredential

-- | Describes an instance's Amazon EBS volume.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newVolume</a> smart constructor.
data Volume
Volume' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Volume

-- | Create a value of <a>Volume</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:instanceId:Volume'</a>, <a>volume_instanceId</a> - The
--   instance ID.
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:Volume'</a>, <a>volume_status</a> - The value returned
--   by <a>DescribeVolumes</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:size:Volume'</a>, <a>volume_size</a> - The volume size.
--   
--   <a>$sel:iops:Volume'</a>, <a>volume_iops</a> - For PIOPS volumes, the
--   IOPS per disk.
--   
--   <a>$sel:device:Volume'</a>, <a>volume_device</a> - The device name.
--   
--   <a>$sel:encrypted:Volume'</a>, <a>volume_encrypted</a> - Specifies
--   whether an Amazon EBS volume is encrypted. For more information, see
--   <a>Amazon EBS Encryption</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:availabilityZone:Volume'</a>, <a>volume_availabilityZone</a> -
--   The volume Availability Zone. For more information, see <a>Regions and
--   Endpoints</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:Volume'</a>, <a>volume_name</a> - The volume name.
--   
--   <a>$sel:raidArrayId:Volume'</a>, <a>volume_raidArrayId</a> - The RAID
--   array ID.
--   
--   <a>$sel:volumeId:Volume'</a>, <a>volume_volumeId</a> - The volume ID.
--   
--   <a>$sel:region:Volume'</a>, <a>volume_region</a> - The AWS region. For
--   more information about AWS regions, see <a>Regions and Endpoints</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:volumeType:Volume'</a>, <a>volume_volumeType</a> - The volume
--   type. For more information, see <a>Amazon EBS Volume Types</a>.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>standard</tt> - Magnetic. Magnetic volumes must have a minimum
--   size of 1 GiB and a maximum size of 1024 GiB.</li>
--   <li><tt>io1</tt> - Provisioned IOPS (SSD). PIOPS volumes must have a
--   minimum size of 4 GiB and a maximum size of 16384 GiB.</li>
--   <li><tt>gp2</tt> - General Purpose (SSD). General purpose volumes must
--   have a minimum size of 1 GiB and a maximum size of 16384 GiB.</li>
--   <li><tt>st1</tt> - Throughput Optimized hard disk drive (HDD).
--   Throughput optimized HDD volumes must have a minimum size of 500 GiB
--   and a maximum size of 16384 GiB.</li>
--   <li><tt>sc1</tt> - Cold HDD. Cold HDD volumes must have a minimum size
--   of 500 GiB and a maximum size of 16384 GiB.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:ec2VolumeId:Volume'</a>, <a>volume_ec2VolumeId</a> - The
--   Amazon EC2 volume ID.
--   
--   <a>$sel:mountPoint:Volume'</a>, <a>volume_mountPoint</a> - The volume
--   mount point. For example, "/mnt/disk1".
newVolume :: Volume

-- | Describes an Amazon EBS volume configuration.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newVolumeConfiguration</a> smart constructor.
data VolumeConfiguration
VolumeConfiguration' :: Maybe Int -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Text -> Int -> Int -> VolumeConfiguration

-- | Create a value of <a>VolumeConfiguration</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:iops:VolumeConfiguration'</a>, <a>volumeConfiguration_iops</a>
--   - For PIOPS volumes, the IOPS per disk.
--   
--   <a>$sel:raidLevel:VolumeConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>volumeConfiguration_raidLevel</a> - The volume <a>RAID level</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:encrypted:VolumeConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>volumeConfiguration_encrypted</a> - Specifies whether an Amazon EBS
--   volume is encrypted. For more information, see <a>Amazon EBS
--   Encryption</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:volumeType:VolumeConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>volumeConfiguration_volumeType</a> - The volume type. For more
--   information, see <a>Amazon EBS Volume Types</a>.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>standard</tt> - Magnetic. Magnetic volumes must have a minimum
--   size of 1 GiB and a maximum size of 1024 GiB.</li>
--   <li><tt>io1</tt> - Provisioned IOPS (SSD). PIOPS volumes must have a
--   minimum size of 4 GiB and a maximum size of 16384 GiB.</li>
--   <li><tt>gp2</tt> - General Purpose (SSD). General purpose volumes must
--   have a minimum size of 1 GiB and a maximum size of 16384 GiB.</li>
--   <li><tt>st1</tt> - Throughput Optimized hard disk drive (HDD).
--   Throughput optimized HDD volumes must have a minimum size of 500 GiB
--   and a maximum size of 16384 GiB.</li>
--   <li><tt>sc1</tt> - Cold HDD. Cold HDD volumes must have a minimum size
--   of 500 GiB and a maximum size of 16384 GiB.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:mountPoint:VolumeConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>volumeConfiguration_mountPoint</a> - The volume mount point. For
--   example "/dev/sdh".
--   
--   <a>$sel:numberOfDisks:VolumeConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>volumeConfiguration_numberOfDisks</a> - The number of disks in the
--   volume.
--   
--   <a>$sel:size:VolumeConfiguration'</a>, <a>volumeConfiguration_size</a>
--   - The volume size.
newVolumeConfiguration :: Text -> Int -> Int -> VolumeConfiguration

-- | Describes a time-based instance's auto scaling schedule. The schedule
--   consists of a set of key-value pairs.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>The key is the time period (a UTC hour) and must be an integer
--   from 0 - 23.</li>
--   <li>The value indicates whether the instance should be online or
--   offline for the specified period, and must be set to "on" or
--   "off"</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   The default setting for all time periods is off, so you use the
--   following parameters primarily to specify the online periods. You
--   don't have to explicitly specify offline periods unless you want to
--   change an online period to an offline period.
--   
--   The following example specifies that the instance should be online for
--   four hours, from UTC 1200 - 1600. It will be off for the remainder of
--   the day.
--   
--   <pre>
--   { "12":"on", "13":"on", "14":"on", "15":"on" }
--   </pre>
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newWeeklyAutoScalingSchedule</a> smart constructor.
data WeeklyAutoScalingSchedule
WeeklyAutoScalingSchedule' :: Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> WeeklyAutoScalingSchedule

-- | Create a value of <a>WeeklyAutoScalingSchedule</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:thursday:WeeklyAutoScalingSchedule'</a>,
--   <a>weeklyAutoScalingSchedule_thursday</a> - The schedule for Thursday.
--   
--   <a>$sel:wednesday:WeeklyAutoScalingSchedule'</a>,
--   <a>weeklyAutoScalingSchedule_wednesday</a> - The schedule for
--   Wednesday.
--   
--   <a>$sel:saturday:WeeklyAutoScalingSchedule'</a>,
--   <a>weeklyAutoScalingSchedule_saturday</a> - The schedule for Saturday.
--   
--   <a>$sel:monday:WeeklyAutoScalingSchedule'</a>,
--   <a>weeklyAutoScalingSchedule_monday</a> - The schedule for Monday.
--   
--   <a>$sel:friday:WeeklyAutoScalingSchedule'</a>,
--   <a>weeklyAutoScalingSchedule_friday</a> - The schedule for Friday.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sunday:WeeklyAutoScalingSchedule'</a>,
--   <a>weeklyAutoScalingSchedule_sunday</a> - The schedule for Sunday.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tuesday:WeeklyAutoScalingSchedule'</a>,
--   <a>weeklyAutoScalingSchedule_tuesday</a> - The schedule for Tuesday.
newWeeklyAutoScalingSchedule :: WeeklyAutoScalingSchedule
